Staff are friendly and helpful, even though they didn't really believe us when we called down to reception to tell them we had no TV remote (?!) and one of them came up to look in the drawers (as if we hadn't already) - a new remote was brought to the room within a quarter of an hour. The beds are comfy - we stayed in a twin room, so space was at a premium, but it didn't feel too cramped. The bathroom had a frosted window on the inside - unusual and I'm not sure I really liked that, despite the bonus of natural light in the bathroom. Best not to look too closely when sitting on the loo either, since the shower configuration meant it basically pointed out of the glass half-wall, and the tiles stopped after 3 inches, meaning the wallpaper had started to peel. My dad and I enjoyed peering down out of the window at the junction of Bowery and Hester to figure out why everyone was beeping their horns all the time. This was fine during the day and early evening, but it did disturb his sleep when there was a traffic jam at 11.30pm (I wore ear plugs, so missed the excitement). The in-room air con was also noisy, but effective. Strange bubbling noises seemed to emenate from a service room opposite ours, possibly linked to common areas air con or the elevators? Sometimes this was quite loud, but not at night.The hotel is well situated, on the edge of Chinatown and close to Little Italy, with two subway stops within easy walking distance (2-3 blocks at most), which was very useful as we used the subway almost exclusively to get around. It benefits from being the tallest building in the area, with excellent views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings if you're facing North. Sadly, by the time we decided to go to the rooftop bar to have a drink and a look around up there, it was shut for a 'menu revamp', and we couldn't even go to just take a few photos. Would I stay here again? Possibly - the free wifi was a massive plus, and always worked, with full signal in the room - but Brooklyn might be a cheaper, quiter option next time.

I loved the view of the city! Absolutely gorgeous floor to ceiling windows with the skyline made it just perfect. No problems with the room. Relatively close to subway, but not so close when toting a 4 year old. Great for exploring though. Our daughter LOVED the park up the street. We had to drag her out of there over an hour later. Dare I say, better than Central Park, in her opinon. My only reservation was that we arrived about half hour early at the hotel. Front desk waited until EXACTLY check-in time to allow us to get our keys to our room even though we were clearly exhausted and the place was super empty.

I've stayed in quite a few hotels over the last several years in Manhattan and this one was a good choice. I usually stay in the midtown area but wanted to try something closer to Soho this time. The location is convenient for walking around and there is a subway a few minutes away. The street this hotel is on (Bowery) doesn't have a lot happening at night (mainly lighting stores) so if you're looking for lots of nightlife, there isn't much in this area (not that I found anyways...and especially compared to Times Square). I had a room on the corner of the 12th floor facing north and it had the most beautiful view of the city at night. The room itself was a decent size (I've stayed in smaller and bigger) so I think it's pretty average. Everything was very clean and new so I think you can't go wrong for the price. My only complaint is I could still hear noise from traffic on Bowery so go higher if you can.

I would like to know who comes up with the rating system (3 stars, 4 stars etc) and ask them to revisit this hotel and explain how it got the 4*!!This was not a bad experience at all, but not remotely a 4* experience either. The room was comfortable, clean, tidy, cleaned properly every day. The bed was good, the TV worked, there was consistent hot water, even when you flushed the toilet. And the views were amazing, both from the room (12th floor) and from the rooftop. So, from that perspective you will not be disappointed.However, in a 4* hotel, the staff do not wander around slurping on Starbucks, there is no room service (admittedly the restaurant is closed for a refurb - (amazing as the hotel is only 2.5 years old) but when we asked for orange juice this couldn't even be served on a tray), in the room you get one bottle of water to share, one tea bag to share etc. The amenities really need to be improved upon dramatically for this to be taken seriously as a proper 4*.

A huge disappointment. After taking time to check severs hotels we opted for the gardens and as the rate looked promising upgraded to Queen rooms with balcony which led you to believe you would get a Manhattan skyline view. Instead you get second floor rooms over looking the street and airconditioning units. On checking with reception we only have a coupl of rooms with balcony views the rest are on the second floor. On asking to be downgraded and moved to a higher floor this was not possible. To add insult to injury the door to the balcony did not open!! Will not be back.

I stayed here for a funeral service in town, and I was pleasantly surprised. Booked online and got a AAA discount. I did a look of hotel shopping, and this was the best deal for a decent hotel. Check in was easy, although getting there by car was a bit of an ordeal. Suggest you use their valet service for $50 rather than fighting the insanity of NYC parking. The front desk staff were very friendly, and the process was a breeze. The room was larger than I expected (for NYC anyway). The view was great, with large windows. The bed was super comfy, and the pillows were top notch.I didn't get to try to roof bar because it wasn't open (slightly annoying). I didn't use any of the hotel facilities, so I can't comment on them. The area immediately around the hotel is a little dumpy in my opinion, but I didn't feel unsafe. Use this as a base for a NYC and you'll have a good time - just go elsewhere for your fun.

Disappointed with 1 bed suite meant to have a separate room with sofa bed, it's not it's a room with the most horrible mattress and springs and lumps on the sofa bed, think they should be more honest about rooms. If I had known I would have book the 2 x double with balcony which would have been much more comfortable with 2 proper beds, I am there now, went to query room at front desk but they don't want to know, also no bedding for sofa bed still waiting, shame because hotel is nice

Our 16th Floor room was outstanding. It was spacious, extremely well appointed and spotlessly clean. The two windows provided great views of NY. The daily servicing of the room was very well done and staff were extremely helpful and obliging. We were disappointed that the restaurant was not operational. We were planning to use it for breakfast. The bar breakfast menu was limited and we missed the provision of fruit etc. We can understand that it is possibly not viable for dinner, given the huge number of surrounding restaurants, however a breakfast and snacks type of set up would be excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in your hotel and highly recommend it.
My room was cool I had a corner with a great view from the 10th floor. The front desk staff was courteous and helpful.

The bath towels smelled musty and bad as if they were rolled before they were comletely dry. The toilet sink is way TOO small.The bathroom lacked hooks. There was only one just for the towels. None for pajamas or other things we wanted to hang.The chair was too big and bulky for the size of the room.The closet is in a very tight space WITHOUT light overhead. We could not see our clothes in the dark. The corridor is good only for one person.

First time in this hotel and I would return for sure.The hotel was just 3.5 years old (i was told) and clean and fresh. Check in was smoothly and friendly. My room was not very big but all looked very new and clean.This hotel is just a block away from a subway station.I am not sure if breakfast area was under decoration but when I checked there was just breakfast available by sitting at the bar . This was the only bit negative experience of my stay. Breakfast menu was very limited and I could hardly read the copied menu page. The waiter was extremely uninterested in his job and had his full focus on his phone with earplugs. Sitting down behind the bar with his feet up. I could hardly believe this attitude .So I just had a coffee and declined for breakfast to prevent disaster.Despite of this breakfast experience was my stay a very nice stay and I can recommend this hotel to any one.

Let me start off with my disappointment. I booked a balcony room thinking this was a private balcony and from photos on Hotels.com had stunning views of the city. It was however a shared balcony among, I think 7 rooms, and on the 2nd floor with no views of the city at all. I'm not sure if I didn't do my research properly but suggest anyone thinking as I did, checks exactly what type of room you are getting. The room itself was a reasonable size and the bathroom was good, but as previous reviewers mentioned the glass walls are a bit too modern for me.Staff on reception were very helpful and informative.We found the location to be excellent, Chinatown on your doorstep and Little Italy a short walk. The Grand St metro stop is also just round the corner. We would probably stay again but would research room more thoroughly.

nice, clean, rather expensive hotel. clean, comfortable room. rooms appear much larger on the website. filthy windows!good access to lower manhattan, easy to public transportation, and DUNKIN' DONUTS just around the corner!

The room had a decent size, taking into account NY standards. It was clean and had a comfortable bed. I really liked that it was a light room, with a big window and a good working desk. The wifi was free and quite good. I was on the 15th floor, so the view was quite nice. On warmer days one could even sit outside there.I like the lower east of Manhattan a lot, so location was good. Chinatown has many good, cheap restaurants and it is nice to stroll around.There was a very noisy ice machine right outside my room, which could have been a major downside. The staff was great though, when I complained about it, they agreed to turn it off at night during my stay.The only thing I did not like was the carpet! I know it is pretty standard in US hotels, but wooden floors are so much more hygienic.

We were so impressed with this hotel. Staff so friendly and informative. Our room was small but meticulous and the view was to die for. We couldn't have asked for more. Close to subway etc and great eating places. Only negative was the terrace bar which was extremely expensive...but then again our choice. Just saying. Would thoroughly recommend.
China Town, near subway station. Clean, tide, but single bed room is small. Anyway, the Asia recptionist has an excellent service, feel nice.

Fabulous property--clean contemporary. Fabulous staff.A special thank you to Meyin Chan, Reservation Supervisor extraordinaire as well as Ling, Vanessa, Janice and pretty much the whole staff for their professionalism and attentiveness. Also, thank you Daniel Mecca for scanning my paperwork.Look forward to visiting again.

The frosted glass is model touch, but my husband hates it; no privacy when he's sitting on the toilet...know what I mean? if the glass was heighten n' have the size it would still be bright in the bathroom.

This hotel was very reasonably priced on the dates I stayed. I stayed in a room with shared balcony access which was a really nice feature. Room and bathroom were both decorated well with ample amenities. Rooftop bar was also pretty good!Only downside is the location. Chinatown is a bit rougher around the edges and a bit rough at night. However if you can get over this, the good transport links and 'real New York' feel is a way to turn the location into a positive.

Great view! Smallest room I've ever stayed in, but it was all the space we needed.Weird that both bars are closed between 12 and five.My parents had an issue with checking in and then their room was 93 degrees because heater broken. They gave them 50 off a night. I think they should've done more.Restaurant being renovated, have to sit at bar to eat. Maybe five dishes on menu. I just went out to eat.Friendly staff, beautiful hotel and great view. I would come back.

Nice hotel, situated between 2 subway stations in decent walking distance. Rooms are ver modern & nice with floor to ceiling Windows. Shower is new with nice tile, but only half glass which allows water all over the floor. Staff was nice & helpful. Location seems safe, but not really close to any major attractions.

Stayed here for a couple of nights at the beginning of a 5 night trip to NYC - which I hated (starting with the 2.5 hr queue to get through border security at JFK, memo to the airport- MAN UP for the number of people arriving - 4 clerks is NOT ENOUGH for a couple of planeloads). Anyway, my dislike of the city, which is dirty, noisy, overpriced and way too pleased with itself just for being there does not extend to the Wyndham, which was by far the best of the 3 hotels we used. Located in Chinatown, which is a longish walk from mid-town and the best known 'attractions', but there is a subway - best of luck trying to use it, it is ultra confusing. The hotel itself looks pretty new and is nicely finished. We had a room on the 15th floor, and this floor has a balcony (the rest don't, except possibly up in the penthouse area, we didn't check) and faced directly at the Empire State Building. Please note that the balcony is communal, i.e. it runs all the way round the building and is really just for viewing from, there is no furniture of any kind out there.Room itself was spotless and equipped with the usual water, tea and coffee making facilities and a very nice bathroom. I would like to particularly mention the front desk staff, both the ladies and the gentlemen who were ultra helpful with arranging cars, calling taxis and just generally answering our queries. Also a mention to Jimmy behind the bar who looked after us very well. It was all downhill from the Wyndham as regards the NYC 'experience', but if you're determined to go, we really did like this hotel very much and would recommend.

Stayed 4 enjoyable nights in August. Room smallish but clean and comfortable and had nice view especially at night as we were in upper floor room. Love the chinese restaurants, markets, shops of chinatown just outside the hotel. Cafe across the street had good coffee and the best 'wife's' cake - if you are chinese, you know what this is! Walking distance to subway station and a good half hour walk to Katz's deli. Convenient location to true rest of Manhattan and access to great chinese food - yum. Was told by receptionist when I called that I can get better rates by going to other online travel sites then their website- true!

I think that the staff here goes out of their way. We were early and they did their best to get us checked in. We did get stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes and I thought maybe that some kind of recognition of that would have been nice? A free drink? but otherwise, great room, housekeeping was wonderful. Room service was shut down for lunch and dinner for some reason. Thank you!

For those Scared of Chinatown, don't stay here! For those looking for adventure, makeThis your base! Somewhat close to the subway and lots of great dim sum restaurants nearby, small rooms but very clean!! The elevators are not quick and there is a wait during busy times

This was our 8th visit to New York; we have tried to stay in different neighborhoods each time. This was our first time in Chinatown. The hotel is very conveniently located at the corner of Bowery and Hester, and is great for walking, eating, shopping, and nightlife. It is close to the Grand Street metro stop. Staff was friendly, and the roof-top bar is amazing. Beds and bedding were comfortable. We wish we could have gotten an upgrade to a room on a higher floor, but none were available. We had a wall of windows, but being on the 4th floor, we just saw the building across the street. It was more expensive than we wanted, but hotels seemed to cost significantly more this trip than in our past visits. Great experience anyway.

This is a first-choice option for me in NY. Room is clean, modern and decent-sized, with a good desk, outlets and wifi if you need to work. Bed and bath were great. Walls are a bit thin for sound - could hear an alarm clock from another room. Location is close to major subway lines. Chinatown has a life of its own, and Little Italy, Soho and the East Village are all right there. Mgmt was very nice.

All the hotels seem to have jumped in price since my last visit to New York in 2013, maybe by as much as 25%. Maybe this was due to the Pope's visit and the UN General Assembly.As I was showing my parents round my favourite city, I wanted a good hotel and good location. I got just that, significantly better value than some of the more upscale options in midtown.The views are fantastic, staff friendly and attentive, and being on the Lower East Side, it's in a great spot for cool night spots, great restaurants and close enough to be convenient for our excursions. The rooftop bar is another plus, though sadly the restaurant was being refurbished. The only thing I could really quibble about was the quality of the ironing board. A minor thing really.Highly recommended.

It's a modern, relatively new hotel. Rooms are large for NY and offers comfortable facilities. The staff is friendly. It is near subways, although it is worth noting it is not the mainlines for going up and down Manhatten. But it is still a good choice for Manhattan and Brooklyn exploration

First of all, I was very disappointed that there were no room services or restaurants. I had a hard time finding a good quality food place to eat from and I felt like it would have been so much better if there was room service offered at this hotel. Overall, I had a great stay, the room was small but it was so clean, very comfortable with a magnificent view. We had a great time and the bar on 18 floor was also great. We would totally do this experience again.

I got a corner room with a king and sofa bed. First off, if anyone reserve this hotel with the intent to use the sofa bed, DON'T. The cushion was thin and you can feel every spring when you lay down. That's what my 9 year old said, so imagine being worst if a full size 120+ lbs adult were to sleep on it. Bathroom. It's one of those looks great, but not practical bathroom. The standing shower is the half glass half open design. It's great...if it's a large enough shower, but we're talking about NYC and it's tiny. We're talking splash damage everywhere.....or a mini flood in the bathroom when you're done. By the way, they didn't clean the shower properly. There was quite a bit of hair left in the shower drain and under the drain, black slime buildup. I was grossed out big time!!!! Pictures are worth a thousand words. I uploaded pictures of the drain so you can come to your opinions on that. Other than the issue with the shower and sofa bed, the hotel is pretty decent overall. Nonetheless, these are problems that is unacceptable to the brand of Wyndham. Hope they improve on that area.
Overall my one night stay was nice but my bathroom had a strong odor of mildew. The shower curtains smelled really bad.

Returned to the room at 5:00 PM on a Sunday afternoon and housekeeping had not been there. Housekeeping Manager gave some excuse of their logistics, room was finally cleaned before 6:00Morning (6:30 AM) management does not have the courtesy to acknowledge guests when you walk past them. They apparently have not received the memo that guests have choices.Fourth stay at this hotel and will explore other options in the future.

We were very pleased with this hotel. The location was the best for us as we preferlower Manhattan with Little Italy, Soho, Greenwich Village over the overly crowded Mid Town and Times Square. The hotel room was a bit small but not a problem for us. They also have a roof-top bar with a great view of the city. The hotel staff were very helpfu, the room was very nicel and the price was so reasonable for NYC. We would definitely stay here again!

Excellent newer property on The Bowery in Chinatown. Prices are generally lower than elsewhere in Manhattan and the location is only a few blocks from the trendier area of the Bowery and other downtown locations. Rooms vary in size but are all perfectly fine.

Was more impressed than I expected. Expensive, but nice. I would have loved a second chair in the room, maybe they could offer one? Even a folding chair would have been good. That said, nice bed, nice bath, nice desk, nice single chair. Great service. Great advice on where to eat in Chinatown. If we can afford it, we'd definitely stay again. We stayed four nights on this visit.

We booked at this hotel because we were planning to visit NYC for our Anniversary and planned to attend the annual Feast of San Gennaro. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from Mulberry St(where the festival is). We were happy with the location and the front desk clerk was super nice. A bit put off by the size of the room and the fact we had to share a balcony since we chose to get a room with a balcony. Also unless you get a high balcony room,which we didn't , you are on the 2nd floor with essentially no view.

If you are looking for a good price but comfortable stay in NYC, this hotel might be for you. The rooms are not big but a way better than other options with a similar price scale in NYC. We stayed for 2 nights and did not have any problem; the only drawback was staying in Chinatown, where traffic is hectic during most of the day! They have affordable airport transfer service as well; we had a lot of luggage which would not fit in a cab and we used their transfer service. The vehicle provided was very nice and the price was reasonable. Overall, recommended if you have a limited budget, want to stay in a good hotel and don't mind staying in Chinatown.

The Garden Chinatown Wyndham was centrally located to many attractions that kept us on the move. The hotel was clean and quiet. The staff was awesome (particularly Charlie) who had answers about everything we needed to know. What a fantastic time in New York!

Hotel 19th floor there rooftop93 Bar. I don't normally go to a bar for a drink...but this place definitely made me not want to leave. The view of Nyc skyline from the rooftop is priceless!!!! Such a great place to chillax with friends while enjoying the fresh summer breeze.. I had their signature drink (tipsy lemonade).. It is strong yet it has a really good balance..I will definitely come back to try out their other drinks- being able to enjoy the picture perfect evening of nyc is just icing on the cake!!!

Great location in Manhattan, close to Canal St and all the local shopping spots. The hotel is a newer hotel with clean modern rooms. The rooms are average size for NYC but the full views of the skyline are the best. Great workout room on the lower level

Instead of listing pros and cons, I noted observations of our stay from 9-12 to 9-16-15Stayed in Executive Queen room 1605 - great view of city, room very clean but very tiny - a little too small for 2 peopleSmoke alarm went off not once but twice at 11pmRoom doesn't cool wellFree wi-fi but keeps asking you to enter password1st bottled water in room free, each additional is only $1Elevators kept breakIng down - room key needed for 16th floor didn't always work Room keys kept not workingStaff not very friendlyOnly blocks away from Little ItalyVery surprised not better places to eat closebyMultiple subways within walking distanceFrig and coffeemaker in roomThere is a dual level roof top bar.  The roof was closed due to rain although there wasn't any.  The lounge underneath was staffed by young women who were put off by being asked questions about happy hour.All in all it did not live up to the 4.5 star rating it has. Would have been a better choice at a lower price than what we paid.

This hotel has such good reviews I was expecting a good experience. However, when we got to our room it wasn't what we were told we would be getting. Unfortunately the hotel was booked so we didn't have another option. When we turned the bedding down I noticed hairs with skin attached on the pillow case. Housekeeping brought up new pillow cases. The next morning at 7am we were suddenly woken up by hammering and power tools drilling above our heads. We have a 1 1/2 year old trying to get in some precious sleep before the day. We were later told that the restaurant was doing some renovations. We thought this was a bit early to begin work. Finally, the bathroom doesn't have a fan but there is a vent for the air conditioning just after you walk into the bathroom. Every time we stepped into the bathroom we were dripped on with cold water.

Had a great stay here made perfect by the view from our floor to ceiling windows on the 12th floor.Rooms perfect and good size for new York nice decor and everything you need.Location ideal for subway and walking to midtown or downtown and nice to have Chinatown and Little Italy on the doorstep.Would recommend to friends and would stay here again.Only disappointment after a great stay was being asked to pay to leave our bags in reception after checkout. Never had to pay for this service before and it seems quite penny pinching after paying around $150 per night for a stay.

We enjoyed this hotel very much. Close to 2 subway stops and a bus stop, it was easy to get around from here. The room was attractive, sunlit, and comfortable but there wasn't much of a view. The restaurant is under renovation but you can eat at the lounge/bar. You are in the heart of Chinatown and on the edge of Little Italy so you can be sure to get good eats within easy walking distance. This is not a swanky neighbourhood so you will see shopkeepers putting their wares on the sidewalk, smell the spices and the fish, and be offered knock off handbags on nearby street corners. You will rub shoulders with workers hurrying to their jobs and you may not find an American style grocery store nearby - but you will find lots of Asian grocery stores, noodle shops, dim sum, jewellery stores and other shopping. We found it a bit far from the uptown sites we wanted to visit but we had not yet learned about switching to an express subway (get a subway map from the front desk). The staff was cheerful and helpful and gave us all the Earl Grey tea we wanted. I would stay here again, particularly if you want to enjoy Italian and Chinese meals at affordable prices.

Very nice and affordable NYC property. Close to Little Italy, Chinatown and other nearby neighborhoods. Room is small but nicely equipped. View was outstanding and if possible get one of the rooms with an outside patio, cool feature.

Walking distance to all the great restaurants in little Italy, Chinatown and other shops. Nice, comfortable and clean rooms. A bit small but you'll be too busy exploring NYC anyway. Excellent location!! Definitely recommend this hotel!

I stayed here for 3 nights and I loved this hotel. The location was very convenient, only 5-10 mins walk to subways. It was also in the heart of Chinatown in Manhattan, 5 minutes walk from little Italy and 15 minutes walk from Soho. It was very easy to get around in this busy city. They also have a rooftop lounge. You can have a good view of the New York skyline on the 18th floor. The staffs are very friendly and helpful, especially Massy. He helped us booked a flat rate car to the airport instead of regular taxi/uber would charge more when there's traffic jam (welcome to NYC). I was very happy that I stayed here.

The hotel is in a great location - pretty much across the street from Little Italy and just a couple easy blocks from SoHo. The subway was also accessible but it was just too easy to walk. The Front Desk checked me in quickly and efficiently and gave me a great room with a balcony and the most stunning views of the Empire State Building. I wish I could have stayed longer - I will not stay ANYWHERE else in NYC again. This place was perfect.

Couldn't review this hotel more highly - stayed here for 6 nights on a bit of a whim whilst looking for somewhere in NY. First of all the staff were exceptional, probably the politest staff I've met in any hotel I've ever stayed in. The service was fantastic. (Roshika was just lovely and so caring, along with Massy and Hamza). Secondly the rooms were cleaned to a very high standard - what you would expect in a 5*. The rooms were spacious and the tall windows made it feel like you had a glass wall. The facilities are also great. There was a small but ample gym for customers along with a fantastic roof top bar. The views were incredible over the city. The location was good. We were a bit dubious at first as we thought we'd be a bit far out from the centre. If anyone is feeling like this then there is no need to worry as there is a subway station one block away. Not only this but staying in Chinatown also worked out in our favour.. The abundance of restaurants on our doorstep was great - not just Chinese.. Little Italy was also one block away.After previously staying in the Waldorf Astoria whilst in New York, I would even go to the lengths of recommending Wyndham Garden over it. Incredible value for money with first class service. I would 100% go back if in New York again.
the overall experience was great! The rooftop bar was so much fun and had great views of the city. the people were really very nice and everything was super clean
Clean, responsive service, front desk and management staff outstanding and very knowledgable, and location great for exploring all of the CITY

Location of this hotel is perfect. The Bowery and Chinatown are places where people actually live, and it is a decent subway ride to all attractions. Staff at this hotel were outstanding for the most part, and we received great advice and comic relief from Manny. He made sure that our stored bag filled with breakables was kept safe in the office while we enjoyed our last day before our flight, and made us sad that we did not see him when we left to leave him a sizeable tip. We hope that this personal thank-you reaches him and his boss; he is a true credit to your business.
Worst showers I have ever ben in. There was no door so when you showered the entire bathroom got soaked

Lovely hotel, very modern and all the staff were very helpful. Good location with 2 subway stations within walking distance. We did walk downtown but it was about good 50 minute walk so got taxis back at night. Make sure you visit the rooftop bar, amazing views over New York!

Overall great hotel for the money. The room and entire hotel was very clean, and our room was decent size. The staff was great! Everyone was very nice and helpful. The location was good, very close to the subway, although I hate the fact it is right in the middle of a fish market, whew stinky! The rooftop bar at the hotel had just recently re-opened, however the first night we stayed there it was closed for a private party. The second night we had a pre-show drink up in the lounge, it was very nice, very reasonable during happy hour. The prices to get on the rooftop were ridiculous! If we are paying guests at the hotel we should be able to enjoy the rooftop without the hefty entry fee, the drink prices should be enough of a cost to be up there. I had read there was a drink minimum, but I guess that recently changed to an entry fee + 1 drink. But to be clear you can go to the bar inside and there is a great view, the fee is only to be on the rooftop.The only problem we had with the room was when we arrived. We had been assured we had rooms next to each other (we had 2 rooms for 4 friends), one room with 1 bed and one with 2 beds, and that we had a balcony. In fact we were told back in April/May when this was arranged that our rooms had already been assigned. I called once before we arrived to check this arrangement, and I was assured it was still booked that way. When we arrived we were told only one of the rooms was on the 2nd floor (therefore had a balcony) and not only was the room with 2 beds not next door, it wasn’t on the same floor. Further, we were told there were no doubles on the second floor, period. I must have misheard him, because we found out the next day that there were in fact doubles on the second floor (we could see in the window), and in fact there was one next door to our friends. That was infuriating. If you accidentally gave out “our” room that is one thing, but to tell us there are no doubles on that floor was a bit far. The balcony on the 2nd floor was nothing to write home about, it is a shared space between all the rooms with no chairs or furniture on it, but it did allow fresh air into the room, and we would have been next door to our friends, which was our entire purpose of this trip to NYC, to spend time catching up. All of these other reviews are correct, there are huge windows (although we did not have a floor with a view), the shower water can be messy (but we liked the nice water pressure!), it could be loud if you are on one end of the hotel (corner of Bowery & Hester, so ask for a room away from that corner if that is a concern)....For the right price I would certainly stay here again. It was clean, well located, and overall a nice stay. I did not give them a lower rating because of the room mis-hap, but just be forewarned it happened to us, so if rooms are important to you, call an confirm again and get names.
Nice boutique style rooms, north side of building has great unobstructed views of mid town. Close to sudway.

If you book the Wyndham Garden Hotel, you will take no risk!The rooms are big enough for Manhattan standards: new, clean & fully equipped.Everything is working (very good wifi-connection) and although it is a rather unpersonal hotel (typically chinese) it does not bother at all.But, if you are a big fan of the New York Skyline, this will become your favorite spot. With the ESB right in the center, you will have a room with a spectacular view. The higher you book, the more spectacular it becomes.Yes, it was rather expensive (what isn't in NYC!) but it was worth the money!Go there!

The location on the Bowery and the reasonable prices for Manhattan led me to expect a dark, cramped room in an old building. We were surprised with a good sized modern room, very well laid out by NY standards, clean, and comfortable, with up to date fixtures. Best of all was the floor to ceiling windows with a spectacular view including the Empire State Building. In the evening, I hated going to sleep to take my eyes off of Manhattan's evening lights. The location was convenient to a subway stop and steps away from Chinatown and Little Italy. Also within walking distance to the Tenement Museum and Manhattan Bridge. The neighborhood is a bit grungy, but there is so much character. We watched the Chinese residents doing tai chi in a nearby park each morning.The hotel staff to a person were cheerful and friendly and welcoming. They did not have the harried, distracted look often experienced in NYC hotels. We stayed four days and loved every minute.

The service was great. we were treated warmly by the friendly staff, great location its trendy. Low key, but has a luxury feel to it... I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks, for everything..

The staff members of this hotel are so friendly, informative, and helpful. I got a room with a gorgeous view to Empire State, Chrysler Tower and the whole mid town. The hotel and our room are clean and modern designed, and close to restaurants, grocery and subway station. What do you want in downtown NYC within <$200/night? I found tripadvisor scored it at 8.4 on their front desk, but for me, I think it's worth more.

I spent four days at this excellent hotel at a discounted rate. Fantastic value and great location; it is an easy walk to several underground stops, including Canal Street's No 6 train. Free high speed wi-fi, spacious rooms, quiet location on Bowery, and a great rooftop bar with impressive views of lower Manhattan. Highly recommended!

Super well located - smack in the middle of Chinatown. Hotel is clean and looks great. Room was in great shape. Visited NY with my family and the kids loved the energy Chinatown provided. Close to a couple of subway stations. Great view with Lounge on top of building, but has a cover charge.

WE LOVE THIS HOTEL. LOCATION is insanely good - on the Bowery at the crossroads of Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho and the LES. Subway entrances nearby. Taxis abundant. MODERN & ULTRA CLEAN ROOMS with chic design & floor to ceiling windows. COMFY BEDS and good black out curtains. BEST STAFF in NYC - so friendly & professional. We love Vanessa, Massy & Dianne... everybody was great but these folks remembered us from a previous visit & were so welcoming & helpful. This was our second stay & we are already planning to go back next year! and then... THERE IS A ROOFTOP BAR with views STRAIGHT UPTOWN.

Love this hotel. Spanking clean spacious rooms, floor to ceiling windows, great views, friendly accommodating staff in a great location. Located on in Chinatown on the Bowery just north of Canal Street. Easy waking distance to Little Italy, Soho and Tribeca. Fine restaurants everywhere. Easy subway ride to mid-town, uptown and Brooklyn. Absolutely my go-to hotel in Manhattan. Very reasonably priced.

On the plus side, the hotel is clean, the staff very friendly and responsive, and the views from rooms above the 5th floor are enough to have you sleeping sideways in bed just so you can keep looking out the window at the skyline at night. The rooms aren't large, but they're well designed and efficient. I wish there had been hooks for towels in the bathroom, and we ran up huge cab bills getting to and from the hotel from other areas of the city because the traffic in chinatown during rush hours can be impossibly slow. But if business or pleasure keeps you downtown this is a great location. One serious criticism is the in-hotel restaurant called "Elevate." Avoid this at all costs. The first morning we tried to have breakfast there, the waiter informed us that the only beverages available for our kids was soda. We went back the next morning having been told that the full breakfast menu was now available, but it was a huge disappointment. For the cost I didn't expect cold coffee, little diner-style paper napkins, and gum stuck underneath the tables. Gross. It was not an "elevating" experience.

My wife and I stayed here for one night. We had asked to get a room high up when we booked and we were not disappointed! With a corner room on the 12th floor for a rate that beats most of the other hotels we chose from, this was a done deal! We didn't have any issues - staff was nice, room was nice and clean, the bed was comfortable. The only thing I can think to "complain" about was that we stayed up a little later than we had planned because we lost track of time just staring out the window... I will definitely come back to this hotel for my next visit to New York!

Overall the hotel was clean and quiet. I tried calling the hotel directly on several occasions but had no ability to speak with anyone. I also called Wyndham's main reservation line but was told they could not help me reach anyone at the property. This was very disappointing. I would not stay at this location in the future.

We booked this hotel through a travelzoo offer. The price couldn't be beat, so we were expecting a tiny room on the lowest floor with no view. However, we were so surprised upon arrival- our room had an amazing view, and it was probably the most spacious we have had over our several trips to NYC. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The location couldn't be beat-we were able to walk to several shops and restaurants that we'd hoped to visit. It was also a short walk to several subway lines. We would stay here again.

I was pleasantly surprised - from the moment my husband and I arrived at the steps of the Wyndham Garden Chinatown a gentleman rushed out the door to help us with our luggage and greeted us. Our room was large (biggest and cleanest room I've had in NYC). The rooms seem like new - our housekeeper Kumarie was very friendly and made sure we had enough toiletries during our stay. We will definitely stay here again, great price, great service, very clean, free wifi and near the subway.

The location was great! The employees at the hotel was very pleasant and the service was great. I do however have a problem with the booking of this hotel. I booked 2 rooms months in advance and my sister also booked her room at the same time through trip advisor. We have stayed at this location before and know that the double beds are very limited. This trip was a family get together with adults. At the time of booking we requested the option of double beds. The day before our trip another confirmation was sent to us, stated superior queen? When we checked in all 3 rooms had one bed. Two adult males had to share a bed. I feel the switch and bate was pulled on us.

This is our 3rd stay at the Wyndham Chinatown and as usual - we loved it!The staff went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible - as always beyond the call of duty service and attitude.Meyin, Massy and Ling have become staples to our visit - make sure to introduce yourselves and get to know this wonderful team - they do really care about making your visit the best it can be.J

From check-in to check-out the hotel and staff was great. Rooms have fantastic views and walking distance to Chinatown, little Italy and Soho. The rooms are on the small size, but hey this is NY, who spends that much time in the room. The happy hour in the hotel is one of the best in the city. Two blocks to the subway going uptown to the west side and five blocks to the subway going down to the 9/11 memorial. As a former New Yorker I found this hotel to be quite the find.

My wife and I had a wonderful visit to NYC and it was due in large part to our stay at Wyndham Garden The hotel is very close to a subway and Little Italy is within walking distance. The hotel was very quiet as well. Will definitely stay here again. The staff was very friendly.

Hotel was very good. The staff were excellent. But the air conditioning in our room was vastly underpowered. One small vent at one end of this long narrow room just didn't cut it. Especially when it was 96 degrees outside. Slept every night with either no covers or maybe a sheet after 3:00 AM.The hide-a-bed was kind of lumpy and made for a rough sleep.

Wonderful hotel on the Bowery. Super helpful staff--who refused tips(!!!). Room was small but perfectly acceptable. The view from the floor to ceiling window was breathtaking. I am looking forward to my next visit

The hotel is well situated within Chinatown. Not far from subway. Very nice room. Very good value for money. Friendly reception staff. You could explore Little Italy nearby as well as roaming around lively Chinatown easily.

I stayed here while my apartment was being re-done and it was a nice spot. It is very close to TriBeca and other hot spots which made it very convenient. The view from my room was nice, as were the prompt hotel staff.

Try and get a room as high in the building as you can some rooms have a very good view. For the price and good location this hotel was a great find! Room that we stayed in was recently refurbished and a nice place to be in. Good A/C system to overcome the NYC summer heat. There is a bar near the top floor but it looks quite shabby, didn't try the breakfast, but then why would you when so many good eateries are within a short walking distance
Nice newer hotel in Chinatown near Subway and 9/11 sites. Price is hard to beat for such a nice albeit small, room. AC couldn't keep up with mid-Summer heat especially in our west facing room.

Since I was traveling alone, I was trying to score a last-minute mystery deal on Hotwire. And boy was I happy with the result. The staff was friendly and very accommodating; they allowed me to check in a few hours early since I had a wedding at 4 p.m. in Soho. I was given an accessible room on the 12th floor and the views were spectacular--One World Trade Center all the way to a tiny Empire State Building in the distance. Seriously, one of the best hotel views I've ever had in NYC. The hotel is on a busy street so you will hear plenty of truck noise and honking. The room also comes with a coffee maker, which is always a bonus. The hotel is in a great location, just around the corner from the Grand Street subway station, and within walking distance to Soho.

Pros:1. All members of the hotel staff that we encountered were very friendly. Vanessa was awesome and upgraded us to a room with a balcony facing the city skyline since our room wasn't ready at the time. AMAZING view. Janice was great at providing us with directions on how to navigate the city.2. Although small, the room and bathroom were very clean. Eulaila, our housekeeper, did an awesome job and she was very accommodating when we were struggling to leave the room:)3. Checkout was simple and it was not an issue at all for them to split the bill on two separate credit cards. Thanks, Janice!4. The location was perfect! Although right in the heart of Chinatown, the other great neighborhoods of NY were only 10 minute walks away. The subway station was only 1 block away on Grand St (serving B & D trains).Minor cons:-The bathroom didn't have a vent-so those lovely hot showers made the room extremely steamy-no complimentary breakfast, lol

Great stay. Staff was helpful without being obtrusive. I asked for extra hangers, towels, and the room to be left just so and was accommodated enthusiastically. Kumarie you're a doll. Location is convenient to both Little Italy and Chinatown. I usually stay on the UES close to the Park but had an event downtown.
Very friendly staff from my check in...beautiful room....bed was comfy...view was amazing...bar on the top floor was amazing...I would stay there again...worth every penny

New, clean, excellent rooms (small but it's NY try and find huge), very cool part of town. Staff were excellent. changed room due to a AC problem. I was given new room ASAP. Leaving hotel I realized on way to airport I forgot my glasses in room. Within 2 hours I was called to be told my glasses were found, secure and they were UPS'd back to me with a tracking number. Willie Brito in Housekeeping - you'r the best man!

The location is very convenient with several train stations close by. The room is not so big (but you are in NYC) and most important is clean and has everything you need. In bonus : the incredible view on the Empire.

Rented a room for my brothers wedding. We arrived at 3:30pm and our room was not ready. We had to wait until 4:30pm for our room. It cause me and my parents much stress because we need to get ready for my brothers wedding that day. Also when I booked the room I made it clear it was for 3 people so we had to get a room with a pull out couch. For whatever reason this was the only option available. This was fine except that the pull out couch was not prepared for someone to sleep on it. No bed sheets. Unfortunately I came in later then my parents who were asleep when I got in so it was not a good time to call down to ask for bed sheets so I ended up sleeping on a bare bed.

A Filipina receptionist greeted me upon check-in. It was a flawless check-in and got a tiny yet spot clean room. I found the rate quite high at 300USD++ for a night's stay. Well, hotels in Manhattan can really be costly. I asked for a special favor if I can leave my luggage while I would be out for a Niagaraga-Philadelphia tour but that Filipina receptionist turned down my request.What turned my experience quite dismal were the presence of 2 little crawling creatures playing around the walls. I am a cockroach-phobic (whatever you call it) and it just scared the crap out of me.The prompt attention of the duty manager helped a lot as we were transferred to a much better accommodation with the best view of the city.

Great location for our use. Walked to 9/11 memorial (about 1+ mile), took a taxi back. A few blocks to some great restaurants in Little Italy. It was the 4th of July and we got to see the Macy's fireworks on the East River from the balcony in our room (708). The room was small but sufficient.This hotel is right in Chinatown, so you have to be ready for the quirky atmosphere. Personally, I really enjoyed being back in a real NY neighborhood . (I was born and raised in the Bronx.)The staff was very friendly and the hotel was new and spotlessly clean. We got a great price through Travelzoo.I prepaid for parking around the corner at Chrystie Garage through Spot Hero for $30/day.

The hotel was nice and the staff were curteous and friendly. It was frustrating however because we were given a handicap room and there was no door to the shower. Then the drain was clogged and the entire bathroom flooded. The staff responded quickly and fixed the issue at midnight. It would have been better if this didn't take place at all. Also the coffee maker was broken.

Got this hotel by a chance from hotwire.I don't know how it got 4 stars .The hotel is very basic .The room we got was small with double full size beds . My recommendation if u need to be in China town area this one is ideal. If u are just visiting nyc this hotel is located in a busy Chinatown area where to find parking is impossible I would look somewhere else .

We were given a corner room on the 16th floor with floor to ceiling windows- views to Empire State and One World Trade from bed!! . Lovely, lovely staff - helpful and kind. Very accessible to Chinatown, Little Italy by foot, and the rest of Manhattan by a very convenient station - Grand. Very, very clean - modern - and sleek. Can't wait to come back with my husband.

I booked this hotel on 6/8/2015 for a ONE BEDROOM SUITE, checked in on 6/27/2015 at 5PM. 1. At the time of arrival, they told me the room was not ready (SERIOUSLY check in time was at 3PM). Anyways, then I was led up to my room by the bell man, and 2. realized they gave me a EX QUEEN Terrance room (room 1504). It's ridiculous during check-in, the front desk staff told me I have the best view of the room and I was pretty excited about it, but then it turned out to be the wrong freaking room. Called the front desk, told them their mistake, and they told me there is nothing they can do because the room I reserved for is occupied! WHAT THE HELL? What is the point of me making prepaid deposit for a room that was NOT reserved for me? I had a baby with me and hence I reserved the bigger room for my family. 3. The front desk did not offer me any solution, not another hotel room, not another room in a nearby hotel, then offered me only 20% off the first night. Then promise to move us back to the room we ORIGINALLY booked for the second day. Did not offer extra help. It's creating alot of work for us because we have to re-pack and unpack and they show no sign of remorse. Anyways, I am most pissed about them not mentioning it on the day I checked in, that the room I reserved for was not the room that was assigned to me. And the front desk person - Sean was not friendly or trying to be helpful in any way. Anyways, the one star goes for the outlook and design of the hotel but I will not be staying at this hotel EVER again since they are very deceiving and do not admit their fault, and trying to trick me into a room that was not what I reserved for.

I want to compliment the staff at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Everyone was pleasant and helpful during my recent stay there. Vanessa, Ling and Danielle at reception/guest services were absolutely amazing! Vanessa has even gone over and above helping me when I needed some NYC information even after my stay.This was one of my most pleasant hotel stays in recent memory and it is wholly due to the hospitality of the guest services staff.

We booked the Wyndam Garden Chinatown Hotel on a travelzoo deal ($219/nt) and at that price it was a great value. The hotel room is typically small, which we are used to getting in NYC. It was very clean and had good amenities: free wifi and refrigerators in every room was a huge plus for us. We particularly liked being on the 7th floor, because it came with a balcony. (Room 705 looks out at the Empire State Bldg). Only 2 blocks to the B & D subway - very convenient. One complaint: we had booked a superior room "with a balcony" (which by necessity requires that we be on a higher level) and they tried to give us a room on the second floor. Thanks to the advice here that the lower floors would be noisy due to the street noise, we stuck to our guns and got the 7th floor. Yes, we heard the sirens and horns, but no way to avoid that on Bowery. Two small downsides: the bed was too hard, and there are no towel bars in the bathroom (what's with that?). Regardless - we'd come back in a heartbeat if the price stays so affordable!!

The Wyndham Garden Chinatown is a pleasant, well-kept hotel. I was on the 15th floor in a corner room with great views. The hotel is conveniently located to the subway system, Chinatown (right outside the front door), Little Italy, SoHo, the 911 Memorial and other interesting places in lower Manhatten. On the 15th floor I didn't hear street noise and there is lots of it. The hotel room was attractive and clean. The decor is soothing. The staff is pleasant. The fitness center and the equipment were excellent. The air conditioning did not work as well as I would have liked. Even though the room was never hot, I don't think the thermostat really controlled the temperature. The air conditioning never once cycled. Further, I had the fan on auto and it never turned off, even when the thermostat showed the temperature in the room was where I wanted it to be. Finally, in the afternoon the room would be warm and it seemed like the air conditioning couldn't handle it, then mysteriously in the early evening the air conditioning would cool the room nicely. In the early morning the temperature in the room would begin to rise. (In an earlier review it is mentioned that the sun caused this. I'm not so sure, because the temperature in the room would start to rise at 6:30 a.m. and go down around 6:30 p.m. - there hasn't been enough time for the warm up or the quick cool down.

My room stayed hot ! Sent engineer up several times who didn't fix the problem and wasn't offered another room for my entire stay .... Left food by garbage to be thrown out and maid didn't throw out .... But when I leave my personal soap in washroom she threw that out

Midwest friendliness and caring at this excellent hotel! The cleanliness was exceeded only their friendliness and helpfulness! Walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy and subways! The views from our rooms breathtaking and balconies perfect place to wind down after a crazy day of shopping, eating and drinking . Planning next trip with girlfriends and will be booking the Wyndham Garden Chinatown! Thank you to the management and staff for a wonderful place to stay!

What a great hotel!!! The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I was surprised by the size of the rooms, which are quite large for a NYC hotel but also all glass, leading to spectacular views! Every encounter with staff members was positive...everyone was so friendly. You will be pleasantly surprised at how close you are to the subway and within walking distance to Canal Street, Little Italy and SOHO. Cab rides to NOHO, West Village and Times Square were approximately $20-$35 depending on where you were going. The subway is about a block and a half away. The hotel has a restaurant and bar, which we didn't use but nice to know how convenient it is if you need it. Beds were comfortable, rooms were spacious and clean and the price was great. You will get more for your money in room space than you would staying in Times Square or most NYC hotels. I can't say enough about how nice this hotel and their staff were during our stay! I would definitely go back!

My experience at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was entirely positive. The service was friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the surrounding area interesting, with plenty of shopping, restaurants, and transportation. The one peculiarity was a lack of towel racks in the bathroom. It was suggested to hang towels on towel racks for reuse to save water, but there was only a small hook to hang them on.

I chose this hotel as I wanted to stay near Chinatown and Little Italy. And they accept pets. After being assured that there was a park very close I thought it would be fine. The park is filthy. Three days of overflowing trash cans and all kinds of litter. I did find a couple of patches of mulch for her but it was full of broken glass, We did have a very nice room. It was a corner king suite with a sofabed and small fridge. The room was very hot and humid so I called for service to fix it. A repair man came and said that he took care of it. During the night it did go down a couple of degrees but by the next morning it was a sauna again. They did move us to a one bedroom suite that was much better. I was told that all of the corner suites are hot when the weather is sunny. I only had takeout from the restaurant but it was very good. Parking was $60 a night but worth it as all of the self parks were $50 for a minivan and it was worth the extra $10 not to have to do it ourselves. I was hoping that I could find a 7 Eleven or similar but there was nothing of that at all. I wanted Asian culture and I got it. The first night I wanted some cans of Pepsi but they had removed all of the soda vending machines so a very rude man walked me down to their breakroom to use that vending mach. I think that he hated me as he then had to walk rather than sit to do his texting from two phones. Ling was the best. The hotel should be all Lings. Guests in rooms on the second floor have access to a large balcony but I didn't see any chairs or tables. The lounge area is very nice and you can get food there also. I saw some awesome plates of Sushi there. Works of art.

the hotel is very new and clean,Excellent location closed to subway stations and excellent service especially the hotel manager Massi.He gave us a late check out and help us stored our luggage before our later afternoon ride to the airport.

The hotel was okay. Clean and nice employees. Got hotwired this hotel, was supposed to receive a four star hotel in soho but instead ended up with a 3 star ( in my opinion) hotel in chinatown. Stayed in Sofitel New York before Wyndham which felt like quite the downgrade in terms of quality and location. Very hard to rate this hotel since it is a good hotel for a three star hotel, but poor for a four star hotel which hotwire claims it is.

I especially like coming to this hotel because of Vanessa M -she was incredible and the hotel is so lucky to have her. She was so attentive and even told me the best place to get my hair done. This employee is outstanding for the hotel. Check in was a breeze and she really wanted to make us happy. We loved our room. She was very patient and helpful so we would be in the right place.

Often found this hotel coming to my rescue with reasonable rates, especially in summer when other hotels in the area go for super inflated prices. What I liked:Overall clean and well maintainedI certainly like the fact that the mattress is not super squishy and wobbly like several other hotels. The mattress here is slightly firm and it certainly helped me get a better nights sleep. What I didnt like:Getting a taxi from this location is sometimes a challenge. Since it is in Chinatown, it is hard to find a starbucks or good breakfast place nearby (compared to New York standards) where you find good coffee and sandwich shops almost every street.

Nice, clean, modern room, although a little on the small size. Fairly quiet, but, even on 11th floor, still a lot of outside noise intrusion. Staff was very friendly and helpful! On-site restuaurant was marginal in both service and food.

The Wyndham Garden Chinatown is exactly as advertised - Friendly and helpful staff, spacious & modern rooms, a superb location and an awesome view if you get the right room. And it's relatively cheap. If you will be spending most of your time roaming around the lower east and west sides, you could hardly do better!

My wife and I stayed here for a week. First night we had a room 301 pointing to the Bowery street and it was really noisy, even though we used earplugs we had problem sleeping. Next morning we switched the room to 808 and that one was something else; calm and with stunning view on the empire state building. I would recommend to ask for a room on north side (Hester street) because of the noise from the main street. You can walk to all the main attractions and there are plenty cool restaurants and bars close by. The rooms were nice and the internet was good. The staff was friendly, especially the cleaning ladies. The hotel made our NY stay even better.
No doors on shower was awkward. Staff was accommodating, changing rooms from a single to double bed on check-in.

I've stayed here several times on business and I find the hotel extremely comfortable and clean. The neighborhood is very busy - full of Chinatown hustle - and I've always had good luck with the staff, room service, everything. Walking distance from Canal Street and Soho shopping. Often one of the best deals in the city for business travelers.

This is a very nice, modern, clean and safe hotel located in NYC's China Town. The staff is particular made a wonderful impression on me. One afternoon, when rain poured down on NYC, guests (like me) came in soaked. Once staff member had extra towels to give the guests as they came in. When a few straggler off the streets also tried to come into the lobby, the staff quickly identified them and ushered them back out, but offered them to stand under the awning (as a single woman traveling alone, I appreciate this sort of security). Great environment, clean ample rooms, free internet, good bar/lounge area and restaurant that serves tasty Asian fusion dishes. I'd go back again. :)
Everything was good except the shower wall. Water was ending up on the floor while i was taking shower. Shower glass wall is too small.

Great service, very clean, and surprisingly spacious considering it is located in Chinatown, NYC. One downside is that parking costs $50 for 24 hours; it is advertized as valet parking, but they charge you $50 every time you take the car out and park with the hotel again. Conveniently located, lots of restaurants, cafes and shops around. It is a bit noisy because of the location, but it did not bother me at all.

Stayed here overnight, very glad I did. The room had plenty of space, modern, clean and very comfortable. Had a corner room with two large ceiling to floor windows, excellent to view the crazy, busy Chinatown below! Perfect if you want to explore China town, Little Italy, the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges and 9/11 memorial.
The rooms are small but very well appointed. We always stay here when we're in NY visiting our family.

The hotel is extremely clean and the staff was helpful. It is located very close to a subway station, Little Italy, and SOHO isn't far either. The rooftop bar/restaurant was closed due to renovations, the bar on the main floor is nothing special.We were able to book this for a very good rate when compared to the other hotels in the area.

This hotel stands out as fairly priced, offering decent sized, clean and modern rooms in a great location for anyone who enjoys the activity of Chinatown and the Lower East Side. I have now stayed 5 times in a year and haven't been disappointed. Compared to the tired, shabby and very tiny rooms that some other national chains offer in the city, the Wyndham Chinatown is a very good choice. The floor to ceiling windows, some with great views of the Manhattan bridge, granite counters in the bathroom and real glasses instead of plastic, add an elegant touch to a modestly priced room.
Near Chinatown and Little Italy. Only drawback is the Bar in the Basement. Rooms had phenomenal views

This Hotel was a lot better than i anticipated. The rooms were a good size, the view of the city was spectacular. The hotel is super clean and trendy. Shon our first person of contact at the front desk was more than helpful and very informative on the city and the transit system.. He was super helpful and very pleasant. We had an amazing time and would definately return to this hotel when we come back to New York.

We really enjoyed our five-night stay here as a less-expensive alternative to more touristy areas. However, there were a few oddities I feel the need to comment on. 1) The bathroom had a frosted glass door and frosted wall between the shower and bed. Not a problem for us, but could be for those needing a little privacy. 2) Like most hotels, this one encourages you to hang up towels to use again, but there is no towel rack. Just a two-sided hook where the hair dryer is stored. 3) The restaurant is nice, but automatically adds on gratuity. This might be a New York thing. I noticed comedy clubs did it too.Still, this is a clean, modern building, with comfortable beds, attractive decor, in a culturally interesting neighborhood close to the subway. I recommend it.

As Wyndham Rewards members we’d booked this hotel also due to the chance to earn bonus points. We’ve stayed at other hotels on Manhattan and expected small rooms, older furnishing, limited service – all in exchange for location.We made our way through the exotic streets of Chinatown to our hotel and experienced our first surprise: the building looked brand new and smaller than we’d imagined with an interesting glass façade. After a friendly check-in, we used the elevator to get to our room on th 12th floor, hardly a high floor by Manhattan standards. And opened the door to the second big surprise: the room appeared large through smart design, the bathroom was cool modern with neat lighting, and the view was jaw-dropping. After tearing ourselves away from the window, we noticed the neat little touches, space to hang up clothes next to a convenient practical desk area, the luggage stand fitting exactly in the space between closet area and wall.We slept wonderfully that night not just because we’d done our sports by crossing the Brooklyn Bridge twice on foot but because of the great mattress.But before we went to bed, we enjoyed the ***** fantastic view from the City View Lounge on the 18th floor for chilling on our last night in Manhattan and the US. The view was as good as that from our room, the server friendly, the drinks cold, and the music perfect. We’d return anytime and maybe enjoy service on the fantastic open-roof top above the lounge too. Just a pity TripAdvisor doesn’t have a separate listing for the City View Lounge since it’s open to non-hotel guests too. (We couldn’t charge our drinks to our rooms since the proprietor is separate from the hotel.)And as the last pleasant surprise next morning: no normal breakfast buffet but breakfast a la carte with fine ingredients – and the somewhat slow service slowed us down before our last day of touring Manhattan.My Spanish husband made friends with the Dominican assistant and we easily clarified the problem with breakfast – it should've been included in the room rate but was listed extra – with the manager. Wyndham Garden Chinatown is an excellent value and for us adds luster to the brand name Wyndham.

Very good hotel with friendly staff. A few things with the room bothered us though -- for example, the safe was only two inches from the floor at the bottom of the closet -- very difficult to read the numbers and directions; the closet was small and was not tall enough to hang men's trousers; getting room service to resupply washcloths required special requests; and the half/glass shower door was handsome, but allowed water to splatter on the floor.

Walking through Chinatown we saw this modern restaurant and after seeing the clean lobby and being greeted warmly, we decided to stay for a night. Loved our room w floor to ceiling windows and unbelievable views! The bathroom design was strange - the bathroom door is quite thin and not the most sound-proof privacy, and the shower doesn't have a full door and water goes on the floor (maybe it works better for shorter people). I didn't think the water was hot enough but I like really hot showers. I loved the location. Hotel feels safe - need a key to use the elevator. I would recommend this hotel!

Lots of positive points- would stay there again. Close to subway, good dining options within walking distance, clean comfortable space, normal small NY room but seemed larger due to all the windows, fast WiFi. The view of downtown was excatly as advertised. If possible opt for higher floor if your budget permits. My only complaint is that I would have loved a second chair in the room so that in the evening we could have enjoyed the view without someone having to sit on the bed.

What a find the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was!Friendly, knowledgeable staff, beautiful room and terrific views of Midtown Manhattan; all this and some of the finest oriental dining on the doorstep. Great value ****

We enjoyed our 4 night stay. The hotel was an island of calm after battling the noisy crowded streets of New York. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was modern and spotless, also quite large by NYC standards. Best of all for us was the location, in easy walking distance of great restaurants in Chinatown. We had a room on the 16th floor, which meant that little street noise could be heard. The higher level floors also have great views. From our room we could see the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges, the World Trade Tower and new construction going up everywhere downtown.

A very nice hotel in Chinatown.Small but nice and clean lobby. Not too many people.Our Room was clean and relaxing. We stated in the fourth floor and our view are the shops nearby but I would assume higher floors have better views.The staff wwe've met (Mr Ling and Ms Janice) were both friendly and always smiling. We've booked our Woodbury tour bus and car to airport with them. Very smoith. No problem at all.even when we changed our pickup time to airport to an earlier time in two hours notice

To start, it is difficult to be further away from anything "happening" in NYC. We called ahead about parking and were told it is "Valet" parking only. However, when we arrived, it turns out there is no valet out front and you can't even unload there because that is where tour buses begin there trips. For $50/night someone will park your car, and there's no in/out service.With the exception of the receptionist who checked us in, the staff could not muster a smile or a kind word. The best I can say is the room is clean and one elevator worked.

I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown in May and had a very nice experience. The room was a nice size for New York and had a shared balcony that provided great views of the city. It was my first stay in Chinatown and I was thrilled with the restaurant choices in the area. There were numerous interesting and eclectic restaurants in the area all within walking distance. It's only a short walk to the subway station, so getting around the city is easy from the hotel as well, which is one of my top factors in choosing a hotel in NYC.

I travel often for work and for pleasure, and this is the only hotel I stay in when I visit Manhattan. The staff is polite and helpful. Every room I've stayed in has been impeccably clean. Rooms have great city views, and the property is conveniently located near subways stops- also easy to get to Brooklyn. I would highly recommend this property to anyone, and look forward to my next stay.

This hotel is beautiful, clean and steps from the Subway. Little Italy is two blocks away. SoHo is just a few blocks farther. Our room had pristene Empire State Building views. The staff is eager to please. The gym is adequate. Breakfast was okay, but you can get to a LI cafe with sidewalk seating in two minutes. This is a Manhattan gem!

This is a hidden little gem right in the heart of Chinatown. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Massy and Vanessa who were beyond hospitable. We enjoyed speaking to them on our way out of the hotel every morning. They took care of us from start to finish.The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to get away from the large crowds and city noise. We will definitely be back!

bathroom door semitranslucent. no shower door water goes everwhere. dirty tray of food sat in hallway for three days. all vending machines empty except one and it had pepsi that was actually hot. when i tried to tell the front desk lady about the issues she said to go to tripadviser instead of just listening to what i had to say.

If you are valet parking your vehicle with the hotel there is no clear designated spot however given NYC I guess this is the norm. Hotel itself is pretty clean and staff was friendly and as the title states great location. No real need to drive anywhere as everything is out that front door. The bathroom shower didnt make much sense without a door water was leaking out on the floor everywhere and you can tell where it was starting to ruin the wall. It was a very warm spring day upon our arrival and the hotel was not very cool and the hallway to the room was even warmer. Temperature settings within the room werent much better and took all night to get down to 67-68ish. The restaurant had terrific food and would highly recommend trying.

The hotel is small but it's in a great location. Next to a big park, walking distance to everything. in the heart of Chinatown. Friendly staff. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom has a big frosted glass adjoining the bedroom, so when the light is on in the bathroom, it lights up the bedroom too.

Hotel rooms in Manhattan are notoriously small. This room was small, but very efficiently arranged. We had two excellent views of New York, one to the North, another to the east and south (we were on the 12th floor of 16, corner room). The small closet easily hung ten items easily and included ironing board, iron and safe. Bed was very comfortable queen. Desk was adequate and included small fridge. Bathroom was sufficiently large with walk-in shower, commode and sink (too few places to hang things).

I was nervous to book on canal st given how busy and the noise of NYC. i had an event just near the hotel and wanted to be close. the hotel is spotless and the staff was awesome, the room was as quiet as could be.!!! food prices at the bar were crazy, one dollar blue point oysters. all in all it was totally worth the money

I stayed at Room 608 and it looked nice. But at the night the traffic sound outside was so loud and I couldn't sleep. The shower design was open and thus I felt cold while I did the shower. My experience was very poor.

Your current website quotes an average cost of $130 per night. If this were true, I'd stay there more often, since I plan to be in NYC's Chinatown about 4x per year. My actual average cost turned out to be more than $190 per nite. When I said something about it as I paid my bill, I was informed I had to stay there in February to get that rate. It's misleading.

We stayed in 1505 a queen terrace room. The good news first. The room was well equipped with coffee maker and refrigerator. The bed was great - very comfortable and TV worked. The view is amazing and the bathroom is a decent size and very clean. Water pressure was okay but not super strong.Service was excellent and housekeeping great too.No complaints over staff what so ever - all friendly and helpful :) Wifi worked great too. The terrace room does feature a large shared balcony with 5-6 other rooms so it is not very private - a few flowerpots to divide the space and a couple of chairs would have been a great improvement. The view is fabulous though. The room is extremely small for two people. Only room for one suitcase and does look a lot smaller than the rooms shown on website but it might only be this room? There is an ice-maker right outside this room which is quite noisy at night so if you are a light sleeper avoid it. The room was very cold even though I turned the heat up but it was unusually cold in the end of April. I paid an average of 220 US per night which is probably too much for what you get. Had I paid 180 US I would have been happy.(no breakfast included).Location: It is a few blocks to the subway on Bowery street but that is only brown and orange line which does not take you uptown. For uptown you need to walk over to Canal street which takes about 10 min. Restaurant and shopping starts in little Italy and Chinatown a few blocks away so not a bad location. It is easy access from the airport -20-30 min at nighttime at roughly 60 US incl. tips. If I could get it a bit cheaper I would stay again.

nice hotel. got a hotwire deal, about 300- a night. right in chinatown, walking distance to grand st. subway, little italy, lower east side, soho, etc. quiet, nice bathroom, okay amenities, but you get a fridge, which is always handy. the only problems i had were 1) terrible TV channel selection; about 10 sports channels, yuck; 2) only one little hook on the bathroom wall (weird!) so nowhere to hang towels; and 3) i wasn't crazy about the location right in chinatown--my opinion only. while it's walkable to lots of places there aren't a lot of useful amenities nearby, e.g. a drugstore, coffee shop, places to eat, bodegas.
Staff were tops, rooms were clean, subway was close. I really couldn't ask for more. Will be back in future

Hotel was conveniently located in the heart of China Town and a short walk to what's left of Little Italy. Excellent location and close to subway. Checked in an hour early with no problem. Room was small but clean. Shower set up a little unusual and needed towels on floor to keep dry. View on 7th floor was outstanding!!

Came for a quick visit to NYC and chose to stay here because of proximity to J line to Brooklyn. Upon check in, Vanessa was so sweet and gave us a room on the 12th floor with spectacular evening views of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings. We took advantage of our location and had dim sum for lunch in Chinatown and dinner al frescoin Little Italy, all an easy walk from the hotel. Our room was well laid out, clean and comfortable. Will definitely be back!

Yes, you are a few blocks from SoHo, but you are in Chinatown. So don't count on finding an espresso around the corner. And don't expect a complementary cup of coffee from the hotel in the morning. Instead they'll charge you 3.50 for a regular. Stayed at a regular room which was quite claustrophobic with a tiny closet not tall enough to hang pants. Then switched to a 15 floor room with a shared balcony, which was beautiful and with amazing view of Manhattan. Fitness facility is small and limited. Overall not a bad hotel but I would wait until the neighborhood develops a little more before coming back.
