Apart from that, we found a very clean room, nice public spaces, and a ground floor bar and street level restaurant which we did not use.Happily, we were given a ninth floor room with a large bathroom and a nice sized bedroom. Our room faced Bowery and we had great views of the downtown skyline and far below Canal Street and Bowery.Price- what can I say? it's New York.

From the moment we walked in we were pleased...Vanessa was just amazing and moved us to the 12th floor and gave us one of the best views of the city (including being on the observation deck of the Empire State Building). Everyone was always friendly and helpful...Only criticism was the roof top lounge was NEVER open and both the restaurant and bar closed too early. We asked several times and while we were told one was open it wasn't, so we did not get to enjoy those parts of the hotel. But we were so happy with everything over all.

Love everything about this hotel - great location (I like being walking distance to the Lower East Side and Soho/Greenwich), rooms are reasonable size, beds are comfy, it still smells 'new', there's a roof top deck and bar with great views, free-reliable wifi, BATHROBES, and the service was friendly. For this price range you can't beat it.The best part was the floor to ceiling windows and the spectacular view we had on the 16th floor looking uptown.

It's interesting to come to this hotel. Made of aluminum and glass in the middle of Chinatown in NYC. Hotel itself is very nice, with nice view of the Manhatan (from the upper floors). Rooms are quite big (as for NY). Easy access to buses and subway. Unfortunately if you book room with breakfast you will get just vouchers and lazy waiter in the restaurant will be unpleasant if you don't inform him about this fact in advance. The staff is the biggest disadvantage of this hotel. Both reception and restaurant (especially one guy) don't look as helpful and friendly people. The best are cleaning ladies and one chinese waitress. Open and willing to help you with all your needs.Anyway, quite good relation of the price and location and easy access to most of the interesting places make this hotel worth to stay in NYC.

We spent 6 days here at the beginning of November and we recommend it as a place to stay. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, although I would have liked a bigger wardrobe. The staff were absolutely lovely and really helpful.The bar on the 18th floor is one of best kept secrets in New York, with the terrace on 19th floor having amazing views of both the World Trade Centre and the Empire State Buildings.
Very well appointed hotel, quiet, comfortable, and well situated for downtown exploration.We enjoyed our stay.

Fantastic place to stay in New York. Away from the mayhem of Midtown, it is close to shopping in SOHO, food in Little Italy and Chinatown, Trendy bars in Nolita and East Village and one block from the Subway. The bed and pillows here are so luxe I actually tried to buy them myself online! The rooftop bar is amazing for sunset drinks and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. According to our friends, the hotel is great value, it is hard to find something this nice for the same price on Manhattan. Short story - I will stay here again!

We visited this hotel for 4 nights early nov, it was a surprise treat I had booked for my hubby's 40th birthday. The hotel is very new, lovely clean smart rooms. All staff we had contact with were pleasant and very polite. On check out we booked a car to the airport with reception which was great value and cleaner than the typical NYC taxi. The view from the roof/ bar was great, tallest building in the area and nice to see the city from another angle. The china town area was perfect location to explore the city from, all be it a little bit grubby around the local streets but this did not spoil our visit. A walk across the near manhattan bridge first thing on our first morning was one of our holiday highlights, we had woke up very early due to the time difference from back home and crossed the bridge to Brooklyn, then came back to manhattan via the Brooklyn bridge, lovely views with perfect weather and very quiet as to early for crowds. My only disappointment was being on the second floor, I had made the booking via booking.com and paid a little bit extra for a room with balcony, assuming that would mean a high room ... Possibly my own fault but photos of rooms lead me to believe I'd booked a room with a view. I now feel that If I had paid the lesser charge I would have been higher with a better view but no balcony, which to be honest we didn't use. I had also put on booking that it was for his 40th and could we have a high room, I'm guessing they were all taken. However I must say I did not complain as i did have a room with balcony as booked, I just think it's something to mention in case others make the same mistake. My hubby was over the moon with the room and his surprise I think it was just maybe my expectations, as I wanted it to be something super special. We were in room 202, the door to balcony was a little on the drafty side, however this did not bother us as it saved the use of air conditioning. The room however was ample in size and well equipped, nice wet room style shower room, fridge, tv, wifi and ample storage. One last thing as a note to hotel, in bathrooms there is a note about being green and reusing towels by putting then on the rail provided etc etc. However there was no rail, just a hook! 2 bath towels and a hand towel can not possibly hang to dry on one hook, you should possibly think about some towel rails.

If you're looking for a good value modern hotel with amazing views, you won't do much better than here. Some great food options in Chinatown, and easy walking to Soho and Little Italy. Subway only a small walk to the rest of Manhattan. Room small, but clean, modern, and had everything needed. The views from the executive room were amazing, worth the extra money.

OK, let's start with the good stuff:Hotel's location can be perfect for people who want to visit SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown. Getting to the subway is also not a big deal but you have to take a short walk to the station. If you get a room at the top you can enjoy really nice city view which is a very nice addition to the whole experience. The same goes for the bar at the top floor.Also, the hotel was really clean and there's nothing bad I can say about the room service.The bad things? Nothing serious but...The room was very small but I guess it's a standard in NYC. The biggest issue was the credit card charge. There were some problems with computer connection during our check-in which resulted in three separate charges on two different credit cards. Two of them were only authorization holds but it took two weeks for them to be released.

Hotel was nice and the view from the room and balcony was amazing of the NYC Skyline.Rooms are small as others have mentioned, but you're paying for the view. The staff is exceptional with assistance in all facets of what you need. That most impressed me.

We stayed at this hotel the weekend of Nov 14-16, 2014. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The location was great for our group of 6 - we could easily walk to Little Italy, Soho, Greenwich Village, etc. It was also close to the subway. Like most rooms in NYC, the room was small, but very well appointed and the layout really maximized the space. We were on the 8th floor and on a corner, so we had floor to ceiling views in two different directions. The bed was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

We stay in the premier room with Balcony. Here is a pet friendly hotel and it is so perfect for my little cavalier. I could fetch the ball for him at the big balcony on the second floor. Though it is not a private balcony on this floor but it is good for me and my cavalier. The room is nicely decorated. There is a nice park for me to walk with my little cavalier. The view is great. In the morning if you walk to the park, you will see different groups of Chinese women and men exercise. It is so nice and peaceful to see that view. You see how people enjoy their live such as play basket ball, chess----etc. Also if you have children, the playground for the kids are there. It is amazing place and view and you all can definitely enjoy.The hotel is right in Chinatown across from Jewelry Center. I can find a lot of food around here. One of my night I had Scandinavian food on laight Street. It is within walking distance, the restaurant is called "Copenhagen". The food and atmosphere is absolutely great. The hotel staffs are nice. Shawn (Asian Gentlemen) the evening receptionist is great. He help me taking care of my paper for my dog. So I feel good from the minute that I walked in. Janice (Front Staff) is my favorite. She is very helpful and taking care of me well. Vanessa is also very friendly and helpful. I decided to stay one more night and made a reservation for a lower category of room but Janice is kind enough to let me stay in the same room. The house keeper , Kumaine, is great as well. She is very friendly and make you feel comfortable to stay there.Love this place and I absolutely will come back to stay again.

I assumed this hotel would be like most other hotels in the area; unwelcoming, tightly spaced, rude staff. Once I arrived I was very satisfied with not only the exceptional service from the front desk but also the decor of the hotel as well as arrangement of rooms. The 7th floor has a general terrace for all people on that floor so to me that was the best part. I would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel in Chinatown. Reception staff extremely helpful and first class rooms. Plenty of good eating places nearby or a short taxi ride to either south Strreet area (20 min walk( or to central manhatton. Ask for higher room as the views are fabulous. Bar on 18th floor also gives fab views at night.

Chinatown is Chinatown. Very dirty, very smelly, but surrounded by very very cheap, delicious food. If you want great train access at a great value, this is a perfect place to stop. The only negative thing I could say is that the heater was not turned on when I got in, and the temperature dropped suddenly at night. They did give us free blankets, though.

Me and my parents were visiting USA on holiday and we stayed for 2 nights at Wyndham garden inn at 93 bowery. The hotel is located in Chinatown and has easy access to Brooklyn and Manhattan and even subway station. The subway station was like 5 mins walk away and even Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan bridge is very close. One can stroll down to chinatown and experience chinese culture in NewYork. The room size was not too big but it was manageable. wifi was working fine and room was clean and tidy. The hotel was a bit congested overall but still I would recommend it. The only bad thing was the breakfast , it was very pathetic on account of english breakfast , service was quite slow and one of the worst that we had during our travel , that needs to be improved upon . Otherwise i wont mind staying there on my next visit
nice hotel and great service, although surrounding(Chinatown) is messy and dirty.
We were very disappointed about the welcoming and your staff never smile a never greet us. Otherwise we have to highlight tha the cleaning persons were very friendly and cooperative

I was visiting New York to see my son who moved to Brooklyn; therefore I was looking for a newer hotel with easy access to Manhattan and Brooklyn. This hotel was just perfect. The hotel is located in Chinatown at Bowery and Canal Streets. The hotel is relatively new by New York standards. The room size was not big, but larger than typical, and very functional. We booked a deluxe room that was on the 10th floor with a spectacular view. The room did have some issues that some people would not like. There is a big frosted glass wall and door to the bathroom, so if you need perfect privacy, this may not work. On the upside, the bathroom is lighter than normal and you really need to stare or peek through cracks to see in. The bed and TV were nice. Good Wifi. Refrigerator and Ice Machine close by. Room 1005 was right off the elevator. Did not hear any elevator noise. The was some level a street noise, but did not interfere with sleep or rest. Employees were nice and helpful. The arranged for car service back to JFK for $60. Several subways are close by. Short walk to Chinatown, Nolita, Soho and Tribecca.

I frequently travel to NYC on business and occasionally for pleasure - of course there are fantastic hotels in the city if you have good expense account; otherwise, it's hit or miss on a budget. I needed a room just for a Tuesday night while on a low budget business trip and booked the Wyndham on hotwire as it was near the office. I wasn't expecting much at all and I was really surprised by how nice it really was! Great location, nice boutique-y hotel feel even though it's a chain, clean and efficient lobby/service with a sushi restaurant. The room was amazing - really nicely decorated in a hip, chic manner - everything new and clean and modern - nice bathroom with lots of glass and mosaic. I was on 14th floor and had a huge window overlooking the city, I felt like I was at a super expensive boutiquey hotel for about 1/3 of the price. Definitely recommend!

We spent a week in this great hotel. Staff were very friendly, courteous and eager to please including making some much appreciated modification to our booking, understanding that room sizes in NY are relatively small.Once we worked out the metro system, a 7 day unlimited use Metro Card made exploring New York a breeze from this venue as it is also a short subway ride to Ground Zero, the South Ferry Statue of Liberty,Brooklyn Bridge as well of course as the City Centre itself, Times Square and Central Park. There are a number of subway stations in close proximity to this hotel, though I would have to say the larger subway stations can be a tad confusing. Whilst we initially found Chinatown somewhat unattractive, we came to appreciate it for what it was. If you are into street photography, you could do worse than walking the local streets. The hotel is between Chinatown and Little Italy so there was no shortage of top quality restaurants to walk to. Napoli Café was our favourite - the seafood/lobster spaghetti was bellissimo and the service first class. The hotel also boasts a more than nice Japanese restaurant.As an amateur photographer I was also delighted at the brilliant views from the 19th storey roof top. Some of the sunsets I experienced were truly amazing.Other strong points were the clean, modern rooms and good wifi access.The only downside MAY be noise, but hey, NY has police, ambulance and other sirens going 24/7 so its really a NY issue not a hotel one.We would definitely stay here again. And if we did it would be in October again - weather was generally great and the fall foliage - esp in Central Park - were a real kaleidoscope of colours.

Very nice rooms, clean, good size and amazing views towards Empire State Building/Uptown Manhattan. The location of this hotel is really good if you like exploring a town on your own: easy access to several subway lines, and often we just walked down to Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge area (you do see more than by talking the subway). Chelsea and Tribeca areas are in easy walking distance as well. Due to the main road it can get noisy in the night time – but that's the price you pay for being in the middle if town.The big negative point is the breakfast quality and downright unfriendly breakfast staff. First the receptionist didn't believe us that we had (what they called) continental breakfast included in our rate and then didn't bother explaining how it would work, which led to some confusing the next morning. Continental breakfast then was exactly 3 pieces of tiny pastry with some butter and an assortment of 2 jams. The second breakfast had half of the staff aggressively reacting to other guest's request and comments while we had to ask the obviously overwhelmed other half for almost every single item of our complicated continental. The third breakfast we didn't even get our 'pastry basket' but where seemingly graciously offered the hot buffet of sausages, eggs and bacon – which all turned out to be cold (except for the tea in plastic cups) ... after that we ate out, there's more than enough places around the hotel area to do that just fine.

The hotel is new and clean,but I experienced a problem with the balcony door it got ripped off the hinges in a windstorm. The clerk at the desk actually asked me if I wanted to keep the room....15th floor with a balcony door hanging on by one hinge and do I want to keep the room...really? I was given another room but for my troubles I was given a breakfast voucher, I gave it back aft all the trouble I was insulted by that. I've had problems in hotels and have been comped more for less, so I have to say I doubt I'll stay at this hotel again.

The hotel room was immaculate. The staff was wonderful, they bumped us to the executive room on the 15th floor for my husband's birthday and they put our friends in the room right next to us which was fabulous. since we had an adjoining balcony and were able to be out there together. The view was the best we have ever had in NY, we thoroughly enjoyed the balcony. The location was excellent as we had plans to eat in Little Italy which is within walking distance. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was quiet nice.

This hotel conveniently located downtown close to shopping, dinning, and 5 min from the Barclays Center offers excellent service , extremely clean and comfortable accommodation. And the price and view are pretty awesome. Thanks to all the staff.

Your Review Our stay was very nice. However it would've been better if the shower would've been hotter. The water was only Luke warm at best. It was also odd that the shower had no door with it. Not that it made any difference to us but it would've prevented the water from splashing out onto the bathroom floor. For a hotel of this stature one would expect a free breakfast to be included. Overall it was a great location, friendly staff and we had a fantastic time during our stay.

We spend 7 days on this hotel and we are more than happy with the whole experience. Since the beginning, the staff of the hotel was very helpful and friendly. It was nice when they helped us with the luggage and when we ask them for advices during the days.The room was surprisingly bigger as we thought (specilly after checking how big the rooms are in NY). All was in good quality and clean. Only the shower was making some noise.On last day even the staff helped by arranging the car to the airport.
Clean, modern, and comfortable. A beautiful room with everything you need. Stayed just for the night but will be back again
Very Nice Hotel. Clean up to date. Nice Rooms very clean. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Great location for getting around NYC.

We spent a few days at this rather modern and perfectly located hotel in Chinatown, NYC.Location is great with easy access to subway. Free WiFi and friendly service. The rooms very exceptionally clean!!!We had to change rooms because of constantly drunken and loud neighbours (which, of course, was not the hotels fault) but it took several serious enquiries with the staff until we finally got a quieter room higher up in the hotel.The roof coctail bar is advertised by the hotel but we were not able to enjoy it because it was either closed or not accessible.We did not use the restaurant but went to several local Chinese restaurants which were all great and authentic.The rooms are not big but efficient and clean. There is a coffee machine (which is often missing in Europe) and they have free WiFi but the fridge is empty (which saves money). Room cleaning is perfect.Altogether a very pleasant experience although I would have wishes the reception staff would be a bit more "on the ball" making it right for the guests.Use a Yellow cab to go to JFK airport if you need to. It's 52 USD flat!

This is a lovely hotel in a great location between Chinatown and SoHo and only 15mins by subway to Times Square. We were lucky enough to have a balcony room on the 15th floor with views from the Manhattan Bridge through the new World Trade Center and up to Manhattan - absolutely breathtaking!The staff were helpful and courteous, and we'd like in particular to mention Janice who was so professional and kind.The only disappointment was the basement restaurant which we tried for breakfast. Luke-warm coffee and no pancakes or french toast because they'd run out of eggs!

Our group of 6 loved the location for being close to SOHO, near Canal subway stations, and in an area that has great Chinese restaurants and bakeries. Hotel rooms are modern, clean, with great beds. All hotel staff we encountered were delightful and very accommodating. Roof top bar on 18th floor has amazing views, the bar is just ok but fine for a beer or glass of wine. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
Great location, easy access to subways. Affordable. Very nice rooms with space for our 4 day weekend. We will return.
Had an especially helpful bellman, Mr. Lin, who went well beyond what was expected to help us.

Took a mother daughter trip to the big apple. Our hotel room had a leak in the AC and the front desk immediately moved us to another room. The next day they even went the extra mile to upgrade us to a higher floor and room. Hotel is in a central location close to everything and the staff goes out of their way to ensure you enjoy your stay. Best bang for your buck when leaving for the airport at 4AM is the hotel car service. We booked this through hotwire for the lowest rate.

The hotel is located for a good visit to Chinatown and other parts of the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The view from our room was great. The beds are very comfortable and we slept well. Parking is very difficult It is a little expensive. The restaurant does not come up to the quality of the hotel. I suggest you eat someplace else as there are very good restaurant's within walking distant.

Another great business visit. Fabulous room and view. A special thank you to Janice for securing a room for me when availability was near impossible.Also, thank you Hermin and Leona--housekeeping extraordinaire.
The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was kind and helpful. The housekeeper who took care of my room, Kumarie, was careful, thorough and friendly.

I am giving this hotel five stars for many reasons. To begin with, Danielle at the front desk was incredible. She was very helpful in so many ways. All of the staff seemed ready to help in any way needed. The room was spotless. It is the city and the room was small, as expected in New York, but very cozy and comfortable. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was also spotless and stocked with everything I needed. My view of the city was stunning. It was the perfect place to rest before a busy day in the city.

Our hotel room was great, everything new, wonderful view of Manhatten. Great lobby bar - staff was so friendly and helpful. Subway station only one block away, easy to get to all areas of NYC. Will definitely stay here again.

This hotel was perfect. It is a little pricey but it was worth it. We had a balcony and a view of the entire city. The rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms very nice and spacious- especially for NYC. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful- especially Massy at the front desk. The location was fun- first time we had stayed in Chinatown and it was such a short walk to Soho and easy access to Brooklyn. We will be back soon I hope!!!!

Second time staying here but I was not as happy as with the first stay. I like room service and last year it was great! But this time it was horrible! I was told there is now an outside vendor handling it. Much costlier and very limited offerings at breakfast. Yuck. But it's very clean and close to Chinatown and Little Italy as well as NYU Broome St housing.

Me and my wife stayed here for 4 nights and we are both very happy with this hotel.The view was great from our room, facing north on 12th floor.Close to the subway, Grand Street, 1 block away.Clean, fresh room with great service from the staff as well, makes this a favourite hotel.

I have been to NYC many times but haven't stayed in hotels that often. This time my husband and I decided to book a hotel near the office in Chinatown for convenience. The location is very good with plenty of restaurants around (especially Asian and Italian since it's in Chinatown/ Little Italy). The people are nice and helpful. I just can't get over how small the rooms are though... for over $250 a night, I would expect something a bit bigger, but then I guess this is NYC! I would give it a 4.5 star.

room was well appointed, modern, everything worked, small but very efficient.front desk staff was accommodating. location of hotel is excellent, close to subway. we walked to Brooklyn Bridge. The view from our 9th floor room facing the Empire State Building was amazing at night. The fitness center was more than adequate.

We stayed here end of August 2014 for three nights. The hotel is relatively new and the rooms are just great with gorgeous views (at least in the upper floors).The location is also great for exploring NYC, especialy Chinatown and Little Italy where you can find lots of great restaurants as well.I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a hotel in NYC and we will definietly come back again. It's good value for the money as well!

First the positives; the hotel is in a great location for exploring Chinatown, Greenwich Village and walking across to Brooklyn. There are great subway links to the rest of Manhattan. The room was very comfortable and clean. However, our corner room on the 6th floor was very noisy during the day and all through the night. Also, either side of our bed were two big structural pillars which you had to remember to avoid if you got up in the dark. The bathroom was small, with hardly any convenient space to lay out your toiletries.We would recommend this hotel though and were pleased we stayed here. One highlight of our stay was a visit to the Tenement Museum on Orchard St. which is near to the hotel.

Stayed at Wyndham Chinatown overnight and was pleasantly surprised! Hotel was very clean and looked new. The view from the room was amazing!! Roof views were also great!! Room was kind of small, but it is what you would expect from a Manhattan hotel. It was right in the heart of Chinatown, but only two blocks from Little Italy, so there are great restaurants and also good shopping.

Stayed at the Wyndham Chinatown for 10 nights in September. Hotel was basic but new clean and well appointed. The front desk staff at all hours were standout and very helpful. Location wise, the Grand Street station was 5mins away and quite ideal if you intend to make trips across the bridge to explore Brooklyn.

I hate staying in Midtown and prices elsewhere were outrageous. I was pleasantly surprised to find this property in the LES with prices that didn't hurt as much as other nice hotels. The staff at the desk was very pleasant and helpful. Very clean room. Ask for a room on Hestor St. I would hate to have a room facing noisy Bowery. Chinatown is so fun to walk around in. Feels like I was IN China! Subway couple blocks away. Two issues: 1. The shower has only a stationary short door so the water floods the bathroom. 2. The business center in the lobby is not user friendly. A front desk clerk has to sign you on which means they have to leave their desk and either inconvenience the people waiting for them, or you wait forever. Once they sign you in, then you can use your internet code. Why the first step? People off the street can't use the computers since they don't have a room internet code. Then, trying to print tickets or boarding passes was fruitless because a flash player was needed and couldn't be downloaded. The front desk clerk had to sign into my personal airline account to check me in and get my boarding pass. This means she had access to very personal information. That shouldn't happen. Then when she finally got my boarding pass I needed to settle my bill. She asked for me to step aside so she could help someone else first. As a business owner, bad customer service bothers me the most. Please, fix the computer issue so your staff is not removed from their primary jobs and they aren't forced to awkwardly act on a guest's behalf online where sensitive information should not be seen. And fix the showers. Your laundry bill from all those wet towels must be enormous! Would I stay here again? If the price is right - absolutely.

By all means, this hotel has it --- IT.Janice is the front of the house--- check-in, gatekeeper, rooms GM.By all means, dress clean and sharp, politeness goes a long way, smile, and before you know it,your in a room that will have you getting up on the RIGHT side of the bed the next morning!You will be able to dive into what ever your business, vaca, or visit, to the Big Apple demands.The in-hotel restaurant is superb. Location of this property is near Soho, Noho, Lower East Side, Chelsea, Tribeca, and of course, Chinatown.My entire stay at this property was simply sublime. I will become a frequent hotel guest of this outstandingly managed hotel property. Modern, au currant, scrupulously clean, with attention to your own personal needs. Need I say more......?

Yes, the view of Manhattan was the best of the tens of hotels we have stayed at while visiting NYC....beautiful, BUT, the real pleasure of this hotel came from every staff member we met. Engaging, friendly and so helpful.Thank you Janice at the front desk, the employee we met in the gym, Hiriam on the 11th floor and all those who we did not get your name. 5 star hotels in the city take note of these employees!!

Great stay. Good location for where I needed to be. Modern hotel with modern rooms. Great views of the city. Front desk staff even stood out in the rain to ensure I got a taxi the morning I left. Would definitely stay here again. My only note of constructive criticism was that it was not clear that you could order from the entire dinner menu for evening room service. Would have been nice to know and I likely would have spent more money doing so!

I reserved this hotel through Priceline. The hotel was clean the accomodations were very nice with friendly staff!! The only thing to be aware of is parking is $43 for cars $53 for suvs. Parked on St.

Loved our stay at the Wyndham Garden. The room was spacious and comfortable with free wifi and fabulous views from our 12th floor room. The bathroom was huge but could have done with more shelving for toiletries as everything had to be put on the floor which was got quite wet after a shower - that said the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bonus for us was the 18th floor bar which served happy hour drinks and the roof top area where you could take in the night views of the business district and uptown - truly wonderful as the hotel is the only highrise in the area. Chinatown was great - just like being in Asia and Little Italy was buzzing and interesting with so many restaurants to choose from. We chose poorly and had two mediocre Italian meals, but there are so many great places around. Very convenient hotel for a trip to the financial district and across town to the Greenwich & West Village, Soho & Chelsea. Mind you we love to walk everywhere so made the most of the location. Would definitely stay there again.

The hotel staff is friendly but the amenities are few. The restaurant on site has 2 menus - one available in your guest room with a variety of items that you will find are not available at all because that menu is outdated and instead you can go downstairs to find the other menu, consisting of mostly sushi or other dishes that do not offer much variety. Your best bet is to head a few blocks away to little Italy. The other detraction - the shower. Unfortunately they aren't the first hotel to go with the stationary 1/2 glass door. Water gets everywhere on the bathroom floor but if you befriend the sincerely wonderful and friendly housekeeper Kumarie, she will give you extra towels to mop up the floor. This also makes for a semi cold shower as although the water is hot, you can't close yourself in with a full door or shower curtain. This may look modern but its not convenient. Hotel was ok, with all of the other options, won't stay there again.

Visiting NY lot of times we decided not to stay in 'traditional' places and choose Chinatown. Close to Little Italy and in a heart of Chinatown, this hotel is really good place to explore lower Manhattan but stay in convenient good living conditions. Clean, friendly, cozy hotel. Close to underground (2 blocks), lot of Chinese and Vietnamese restaurants and fast foods one to five minutes walk, wonderful street market (fruits, fish, seafood, etc.), $1 oysters during happy hour in restaurant, tea/coffee machine, free WiFi, even free AC adapter ("Just don't forget to bring it back...") - a lot of plusses. We wasn't lucky to get upper floor room, thus saw only peak of Empire State building...The only thing - air con is blowing right to the bed, and turning it off brings the feeling of lack of fresh air, because windows are not opening at all (glass is from floor to ceiling).

Very convinient location. A modern very clean and attractive hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful.The rooms had very large picture type windows with a great view of the city,specially in higher floors. Very nice to have a coffee maker with all the acoutrements.Excellent bed,tv,desk,lots pf electric plugs,WIFI,modern bathroom,etc. Made for a very pleasant stay.

I've been to NYC numerous times but never to Chinatown so was unsure of this hotel and the area but I was pleasantly surprised! Chinatown itself is such a vibrant (and affordable!) part of the city and the hotel was lovely. I have to say the customer service at the hotel was outstanding - we had travel issues and didn't make it for the first night of our reservation and we were not charged - that was a huge surprise but very much appreciated. The hotel itself is well maintained and the rooms were very modern and updated, we had an outstanding view of the Empire State Building. The bed was very comfortable too. However, the room was small, I'd describe it as "European sized" - there isn't even a real closet where you can hang a full length dress or pants, so if you have a lot of luggage or clothes to hang, that could be a problem.

I appreciate it's taken a while to write this review but I'd just like to note how great this hotel was. I stayed here for four nights at the end of March, having shopped around for a while, this hotel continued to come out on top. I was a little worried about being in Chinatown having spoken with friends who had visited New York before but I have to say I never once felt uneasy in the neighbourhood. It's within about 20 mins walk of the Empire State building and about 30mins of the financial district in the south and there are a couple of subway stations within easy walking distance on different lines, one connecting to JFK and another to Brooklyn (for the Barclays Centre, which I would also recommend if the Nets are at home!)I specifically asked for a room with a bath tub and was told upon arrival they'd had to upgrade us to accommodate this, not complaining at all! The room was on the 16th floor and the views from the floor to ceiling windows were incredible!!! There is a bar on the 18th floor (meeting rooms on 17th) but we didn't at any point have any issues with noise and we stayed over a weekend. The room was great, spacious and the bed was amazing, huge and really comfortable!!! The only downside being that the windows couldn't open, but that was it!The staff were all really friendly, advising us on the weather before we got outside, recommending I might need a scarf and Katy (I think was her name, sorry if that's wrong) on the front desk was really friendly and helpful, could not fault her at all!All in all, for what we paid, the hotel was brilliant and I would definitely stay there again. We didn't have breakfast included in the room rate as there are so many options! The only downside was we couldn't stay longer!
HOTEL ROOM WAS FINE ,STAFF SEEMED VERY BUSY. This was a Special occasion but could have been made better if acknowledged by hotel in some way ,disappointed.

We arrived early before check in and had no problems checking in as they had our room ready. The young lady (Janice) at the reception desk was very nice and helpful. I thought it was a nice touch when she offered a chocolate gift to my kids. They had the crib, extra blankets and pillows already in the room for us by the time we emptied the minivan and headed upstairs to our room. The room had an awesome view looking over most of the buildings and a nice view of the city. I've stayed in a few hotels in the downtown area and would prefer to stay here again for my next family event.

I checked out of my room, walked down the street to get on the subway and realized that I had left my sunglasses in the room. I immediately called the hotel front desk and was told that I would have to talk to the housekeeping manager. He didn't answer, so I left a message. I went on my way, because I knew I would be back in the area later. I finally received a return phone call from the housekeeping manager 5 hours later, and they did not have my sunglasses....very irritating

Awesome room with breathtaking view to Midtown and lower Manhattan Chrysler Building, Empire State and Freedom Tower Included. Nice service in front desk. But breakfast is poor, Continental Breakfast just included a bowl of fruit an american coffee (latte not included) and pastry basket with 2 little croissants and a little cinnamon roll or hot oatmeal (something that tastes horrible) with two little toast. I expect to this great hotel breakfast included something like bacon, eggs, french toasts, pancakes, sausages. Last did I quit breakfast and we go to an Ihop.
It was a clean and decent place to stay, but it wasn't worth the price, and I don't think it was a 3.5 star quality hotel.

We had a great time here. The location was really helpful for my wife and I, who mainly wanted to explore Little Italy and Soho. The staff were really knowledgable of the area and helpful. My wife had a really bad muscle spasm during our stay and couldn't make it out to the pharmacy. A member of the lobby staff popped out and picked up some medication for her, which was very helpful. Also when it worsened they called for a doctor. It really made a stressful situation a lot easier.
Nice and clean! Located in Chinatown near to a lot of visit points at Manhattan and Brooklyn as Liberty Island and Ellis Island. Friendly and helpful staff.

While many people like to stay mid-town or in Times Square, after about 5 minutes, the crowds and over-stimulation start to get old. A quick trip downtown to Chinatown provides a visitor with easy access to some of the city's more interesting neighborhoods (SoHo, Lower East Side, Nolita, Little Italy as well as Chinatown). After spending a week there we can say that this hotel is a wonderful place to stay with easy subway access, and all the other amenities one could want. We chose to upgrade our room for an additional $10 per night to an upper floor which provided us with a drop dead beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline. The rooms are typically sized for New York, but are efficiently designed. The only shortcoming is the lack of an additional hook or towel rod in the bathroom.The rooftop bar, which is under separate management, has an upper level with a deck and killer views. Definitely worth a visit. The bar on the first floor offers a very reasonably priced happy hour.The staff was attentive and extremely helpful. The only other shortcoming was the fact that there was no Starbucks around the corner. That is more than made up for with all the other choices nearby. We look forward to our return to New York and (hopefully) to this hotel.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel. I only needed a hotel for 3 nights before moving into an apartment, so chose this place based on the location and the great rate. The location is ideal, it's nestled perfectly between Soho and the Lower East Side which are 2 of NYC's best areas for eating and drinking in my opinion. The room was compact but modern, well maintained and spotlessly clean, and I was lucky to get a view looking uptown over the rooftops of Chinatown with the Manhattan skyline in the distance.

I sometimes need to stay in a local hotel and have tried several on the uws and in TriBeCa. My stay at Wyndham Chinatown was the best so far. Impeccably clean, very fresh and clean, amazingly comfortable bed, hushed, nice carpet, I LOVED my upgrade to a king. LOVED the floor to ceiling windows. Just loved it. I also had room service for sushi dinner which was good although the miso soup was a bit salty. I'm moving in!

Our stay at WGC was overall really good. Hotel lobby and bedroom were really clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Location was also really conveenient, close to subway station and amenities. I will definitely reccomend WGC to friends

Pros: Location - Ideal for those wanting to be near the awesome restaurants, shops and bars of the bustling Bowery/LES/Chinatown areas. Two different subway lines nearby.Clean/Safe - Spotless! Elevator access only via room card.Bathroom - Spacious with plenty of counter space. Powerful and roomy shower.View - Best I've ever encountered in NYC! Floor to ceiling windows allow a phenomenal view of the Empire State Bldg, Bowery street, and lower Manhattan.Bed - Comfy with equally comfy pillowsToiletries - Plentiful and of good qualityCons:Shower - Framed by a half-wall versus a full door or curtain. Water gets everywhere! Floor becomes a lake. Felt horrible for housekeeping who had to sop up mess.Closet/dressers - No dresser drawers outside of nightstand storage. Closet is a narrow, standalone wardrobe. Smallest closet space I've experienced in NYC. Had to stack three garments on a single hanger.
Prompt polite courteous staffHotel in excellent condition- clean, modern and nice proximity to lower manhattan

Great hotel! I would definitely stay again here!!! Great staff! The location was good, walking distance to soho, noho, little Italy, subways. Super clean and big rooms, mini fridge in room. Janice at front desk was always with a big smile and very helpful! Loved my stay in this hotel!

We have stayed at a couple hotels in Chinatown and found this one to be the best value. The staff is very friendly and will upgrade the room if they can. The rooms are clean and nice size for NYC.The only drawback is no food available after 11:00pm and not much open in the area-a problem for us since we often fly in late at night but are on pacific hungry time. Highly recommend

I got a discount on this hotel and I would say this price is good for a downtown location closer to the action (small walking distance to soho, nolita, right in the middle of chinatown).Good - nice front desk staff (upgraded us to a king on a higher floor, and also got us early check in, taking pity on us on our early flight!), toiletries from Bed Bath & Bodyworks, good location, comfy bed (sheets well laid out, with multiple layers of mattress protectors, sheets etc) good hairdryer, mini fridge, great view looking midtown, quiet room (even if ours was near the lift, we never heard a thing), free wifi, good front desk staff, good gym, big room.Not so good - the shower screen definitely doesn't prevent water from coming out, the shower rack was rusty, there were no adequate towel racks in the bathroom save for 1 hook (towels never dried) - defeats the purpose of the green towel program, decor was a bit questionable (very 'Chinese' and a bit unstylish at times - there was a 'faux wood panel wall' in our room), there is no ramp for lugging luggage down the stairs. If they can fix the bathroom towel racks and screens, this would be an even better hotel.

This was my third time to NYC and decided to stay away from Midtown for something different. I got a reasonable rate through Priceline and was happy with what I got. Room size was standard size for New York and it was clean and everything worked.If eating at Chinatown and Little Italy are your thing you cannot get any closer. twin towers museum is about a 30 minute walk.I had a few drinks at the bar and the staff could not have been friendlier.All in all I cannot complain at all

Newly built hotel so everything is modern. Fantastic view from top floor terrace across the city. In the centre of china town and close to little italy, so good base for the tourist. Close to the subway. Wifi included. Cleaning staff friendly.

I was at the wyndham garden chinatown 2 weeks in august, i attend NY for over 25 years and every time i changed my accomodation. But this time the Wyndham garden satisfied me full.The hotel is perfect. It is in a great location as it close to the most beautiful areas, Soho, Nolita, Noho, lower east side. The rooms are very, very clean, have the celling windows with a wonderful view and everything you need.I was in an amazing corner room from which i could see the freedom tower, Manhattan and brooklyn bridge and other spectacular skyscrapers.But what helps more pleasent is the staff at the reception always very friendly and helpful.I abdolutely have to remember two people of the front Desk staff, Mrs. Rushika Perez ( Bell person) and Mrs. Vanessa Morel (front Desk), both were there when i arrived at the hotel to make check-in early in the morning and both were extremely available, very kind, very nice and always very kind and helpful to me throughout my stay.The nex Time will be in NY i will definitely stay at this hotel and i hope to have the same wonderful room.Thanks again to Rushika and VanessaSusanna A.Roma Italy

I was at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown 2 weeks in august, i attend New York for over 25 years and every time i changed my accomodation. But this time the Wyndham garden satisfied me full.The hotel is perfect. It is in a great location as it is close to the most beautiful areas, Soho, Nolita Noho, Lower east side. The room are very, very clean, have the celling windows with a wonderful view and everything you need.Iwas in an amazing corner room from which i could see the freedom tower, manhattan and brooklyn bridge and other spectacular skyscrapers.But what helps more pleasent is the staff at the reception always very fiendly and helpful. I absolutely have to remember two people of the front desk staff, mrs. Rushika Perez (Bell person) and mrs. Vanessa Morel (front desk), both were there when i arrived at the hotel to make check-in early in the morning and both were extremely available, very kind, veri nice and always very kind and helpful to me throughout my stay.The next time i will be in NY i will definitely stay at this hotel and i hope to have the same wonderful room.Thanks again to Rushika and VanessSusanna A.RomaItaly
Chinatown and Little Italy are beautiful. This hotel however ... Service is terrible. Fitness, breakfast and rooftop???? Don't go for that.

For the most part, I really enjoyed my stay. Room was relatively quiet and modern. Just a couple of minor issues: (1) the glass divider door for the shower just doesn't extend far enough, which caused water to get all over the bathroom floor (2) the frosted glass door of the bathroom was almost certainly installed backwards, which meant you could sort of see in if you were standing outside in the room, but couldn't see out at all if you were standing inside the bathroom. It didn't affect my stay at all, just an observation.

I stayed at this hotel the week of Aug 18th, and it was a really nice stay. The room was very clean and new, and the bathroom was really nice as well. The views uptown are AMAZING. Rooftop bar is very cool. I would definitely stay here again.

Great staff, friendly and helpful. Interesting location.Someone said don't pick a room on level seven with the balcony, or a room by the lift. We had two rooms, right by the lifts and on the balcony level seven and we were more than happy! Views were spectacular over towards the Empire State building..... but the make sure you wear shoes when nipping out on to the balcony, as the black flooring burns your feet in hot weather!

The Hotel was great, room was great and the view from 11th floor was awesome, facing Bowery street. Breakfast at the restaurant on the groundfloor not so good, I would go somewhere else for that. Very close to Little Italy where there are plenty of nice restaurants. I would stay here again, for sure.

My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel from August 17th to 20th. We had previously stayed last summer near Times Square but we wanted to stay closer to SOHO this time around for a different NYC vibe. We picked the perfect hotel with this one and were very happy with our choice. When we checked in we had slight hiccup with our online booking but the on-duty Manager Vanessa addressed our issue and cleared everything up right away! Our room was just perfect - great view from the 15th floor and it was a nice spacious room. Some of the rooms have a shared balcony view which is an added bonus. The hotel is within walking distance to SOHO, the East Village, the Brooklyn Bridge and Downtown. Subway stations are nearby that can take you everywhere else you need to go. Canal street is steps away as well. We will be staying here again for sure!

The location was great for visiting Chinatown, Little Italy and the Soho area on foot. The staff was super friendly and helpful. And the rooftop had a great view - a great place to wind down with a glass of wine after a busy day of shopping!

You can't go wrong here if you just need a place to stay that's kind of near downtown. As others have noted, the place is new and it shows. No real restaurant or bar action to be had in the hotel itself (though both exist), but there's plenty nearby. At least for quick business trips, I would stay here again without a doubt.

We stayed in Wyndham Garden Chinatown for four nights this May. As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms were small but everything a guest would need was provided for. The staff at the check-in was very efficient and friendly. The bar at the lobby level had great happy hour prices. One advice: ask that your room is as far away as possible from the elevator as possible, as we heard elevator traffic having been right opposite the elevator doors. Also, the balcony attached to our room was not very good as they have one balcony running along the entire side of the floor so your neighbor can be chatting right outside your bedroom, which was often the case for us as our room's balcony "space" had the water drainage which the smokers amongst the guests on that floor seemed to use as their ashtray. So make sure you ask for a room without a balcony. For their reasonable price, great location and cleanliness, we would stay there again for sure.

Stayed at this hotel on 8/16. Had a great stay beautiful hotel. Great location, great room we couldn't have asked for a better stay. The hotel lost and found went above and beyond by sending me something I forgot in the room ups. I will only stay at this hotel when coming to the city.
The hotel is in a very good location. It is close to the Chinatown shopping district and more. The fitness room, however, can only be accessed by one elevator.

Stayed here in June and booked using a coupon. The expectation was to try bidding and find something closer to Times Square or possible more uptown. This location is very good for access to Little Italy (getting littler and littler) and also to Chinatown (obviously). Subway access is excellent. Walking distance to Katz's Deli as well. For the price paid in Manhattan this was a very good value. I would prefer being further midtown but that is just a personal preference. Staff was friendly. Room was the expected smaller size but with modern bathroom, AC, and wifi. I would not hesitate to stay here again nor recommend it.

This is our 4th stay at this relatively new new hotel right in Chinatown. We love it with walking distance to all the great restaurants and also easy wall to the Grand subway station or a bit longer walk to the Canal station. That makes it easy to get anywhere. Despite all those restaurants we love the Elevate restaurant in the hotel for fresh sushi. I hesitate reviewing this because it will lead to more people staying and higher rates but they deserve it!

As an annual traveler to New York City, the thing that always gets you about the place is that great accommodations cost an arm and a leg, and good accommodations aren't that much cheaper than great ones. Cheap accommodations are cheap for good reasons. With this hotel, we got great accommodations for cheap prices (by Manhattan standards).I booked here primarily because of the great reviews on this website, coupled with a fantastic rate that was offered through Travelzoo. The double/double room we stayed in was very large for Manhattan, and offered us a reasonably sized desk, a night stand, and a small bar fridge. The bathroom was large enough with a shower stall, sink, and toilet. The only complaint I can make about the bathroom (and this is a constant complaint among the reviewers here) is that there is no shower door, just a piece of glass that covers half the stall. It makes for a lot of splashing water on the floor. This forces you to basically take one of the towels and use that as a bath mat. People have mentioned the Chinatown location. Yes, Chinatown and the LES is not the greatest part of NYC. However, I had no issues whatsoever. As far as commuting around the city goes, there are several options to get onto the subway. The closest station was about two blocks away at Grand and Chrystie Streets, where you could get onto the B and D lines. Taking those lines afforded you a very quick way to get into midtown. The Bowery station was only 3 blocks away, while the Canal Street stations for the 6, N, R, and Q lines were about a 10 minute walk away. I think the location scares people who aren't familiar with NYC away, and that plays into the advantage of more knowledgeable people. Walking home from the subway is perfectly safe. This Chinatown offers the best Asian food I've ever eaten outside of Asia, and Little Italy's food is pretty darn good too. Eating in Chinatown also stretches your tourist dollar, as meals can be very reasonably priced there.I would not hesitate to stay here again.

This is my second stay at this hotel. The first time was shortly after the hotel opened in 2013. This hotel is an exceptional value. I have traveled to NYC over the last 15 years to visit family. Given that they have a small apartment, so it is necessary to stay in a hotel. Compared to most hotels in this price range, the rooms are large, the bathroom is fairly large and there is ample closet space for 2 people. Although the hotel is not located in the most touristy area (which is good from my point of view), it is convenient to the train. Between the stations at Canal and Lafayette and Grand and Chrystie, it is possible to get just about anywhere. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. My only complaint is the shower door or lack thereof. The floor gets a little wet. However, since I don't have to clean the bathroom, it is not a big deal. I am hoping Wyndham continues to offer the reasonable pricing. It is a place I will definitely stay as long as it is affordable. Also appreciate free WiFi.

The hotel is only 2 years old, and that shows: everything is working in fine order and looks fresh and new and is very clean. Our room was at the 11th floor and had floor to ceiling window (full room width, so a 4 x 3 meters window), giving spectacular views of Manhatten and especially the Empire State and the Chrysler Building, day and night. The staff were very accommodating, changed our room at the spot from king to two singles. Special thanks to Rushika for being so kind to take me personally to the deli and Cup and Caucer (excellent breakfast!). The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Grand Street Metro station and Mulberry Street (Little Italy).I booked this hotel based upon reviews on Internet, and I have seen lots of hotelrooms, but the Wyndham Garden lived up to my expectations - and more. A true gem.

Booked hotel through Travelzoo promo, but not before checking the reviews on Tripadvisor, The experience all around was even better than the reviews that I read. Conveniently located on the edge of China Town it is barely 1 block to the subway and a short walk to Little Italy and/or the East Village. The hotel and room was modern,clean,included wifi and surprisingly quiet inside for The City. We stayed in a queen room that was spacious by NYC standards w/ good size bathroom. The bed was comfy and we had a nice view of the Midtown Manhattan. The restaurant in the hotel serves excellent sushi, and a good breakfast, and the rooftop lounge allowed a great view of the lights of New York spectacular (especially at night) and there is plenty to do and see nearby. Hands down the top of my list for this hotel would be the Staff and the excellent treatment we received throughout our stay. We were always greeted when coming and going from the hotel. I have to single out Janice and Ling at the front desk very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the area, they truly went above and beyond the call of duty for me. I definitely found a favorite hotel in NYC. Thank you Wyndham Garden Chinatown!

We rented bicycles for a week and because the hotel does not have a very big luggage room they kept our bicycles in the hotel office rooms overnight so that they would be safe. Excellent management and service. If you are lucky you will be checked in by Rushika Perez, who is a welcoming and super professional staff member of the lobby team. Good location in the middle of Chinatown - oh yes - BEST.SUSHI.EVER.

Excellent hotel in a vibrant section of Chinatown very close to LES and Soho. The rooms are bright and well designed and the beds very comfortable. The view uptown is stunning. The hotel staff are efficient and personable and accommodating. I arrived around 10 am and was able to check-in by 11, four hours before official check-in time. Housekeeping and maintenance staff are excellent. The only flaw has been pointed out in many other reviews and that is the design of the bathrooms -- very easy to splash water from the shower and the sink, and no no hooks or rods to keep things off the floor. Despite that, we were able to spend four days in the space with no trouble at all.
great staff and interiors. Room service food is good but served with plastic cutlery and paper cups---ugghhh!

I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms. HUGE for New York. New hotel so very clearn as well. Great location - close to LES, Soho, and in China town. If you don't like crowds then a Chinatown location may not be for you. My room was very quiet and had a great unobstructed view of the Empire State & Chrysler buildings. The rooftop lounge was completely empty which was great for us. We had the roof to ourselves with a 270 view of the city. Drinks were relatively inexpensive too. I didn't hang out in the lounge itself but the roof was great. The only negative was that when my room wasn't ready at 2:45, and I complained b/c I really needed to make a call over wifi in a quiet place, they said "we only guarantee the room for 3pm". I had to make the call in the corner of the bar with poor wifi. Not a big deal I guess, but then the room wasn't ready at 3pm for my husband to check in. So they shouldnt use the word "guarantee" when it isn't. Oh yeah, and I'd booked a King room through travelzoo and I got an email two weeks earlier saying they had a scheduling error and it's actually a queen. But given the price and how close to the trip it was, I couldn't really do anything about it. I'd stay here again if able to get a mid-week deal again.

I was visiting New York because my daughter recently relocated there. We were interested in having a cocktail with a view and found Elevate at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. It was the icing on the cake to a fabulous day in Manhattan. We were there at sunset and stayed until the lights of the city started to twinkle everywhere around us. It was magical!
Chose this hotel for location but will come back for cleanliness, comfort and view. Best deal in Manhattan!

First let me say that the hotel was clean and the staff very pleasant. For what I paid through Expedia, I can not really complain too much. I feel that there were some design flaws that should be taken care of by Wyndham. The bathroom is nice looking, but there are no towel racks for the hand towels or washcloths. The only place to hang towels is a tiny hook next to the shower. This does not work especially if 2 people are sharing the room. Face and hand towels had to sit on the counter. The modern glass wall shower also did not work with my daughter, The entire bathroom floor was soaked after she took a shower. I could see someone slipping due to water on the floor. The entry way to our room had a light, but it was still dark and the safety box is located on the bottom shelf of an armoire in the entry. You have to get down on your hand and knees to use the safety box and the area was dark at least in our room. This was not are real problem for me, but if I had been older it would not work. The first day, we stopped back at our room at 2 and the room was not clean. Then next day, the room was not cleaned at all. However, when the room was cleaned, they did a nice job. The overall cleanliness of the hotel was very good. The hotel is located in Chinatown which worked for me for this particular trip, but I did not find it a desirable area, rather dirty. But, it is a short walk to more desirable Little Italy and Nolita, Soho. The hotel is a short 5-10 minute walk to the subway which serviced almost all lines.

Stayed for 5 days in Queens room, great size, comfy beds, friendly staff! Consider of the location, I couldn't hear the traffic or noise from outside which I'm very happy with! Lots of restaurant around n 2 mins walk to subway. Only one thing I didn't like was the shower, just walk in cubical but with no doors so water is every where after one shower n shower head is not attach to the ceiling n was on the side which makes it a bit difficult to wash my hair! Not sure if it's just my room or not.

Great couples place. The staff accommodated luggage storage and car valet prior to check in so we could take off into the city. This is a new hotel and the views from the rooms are great. The rooftop lounge is also very cool. Your right in Chinatown, but just a couple blocks from Little Italy. Also only a block or so from a subway stop. The bed was super comfortable and the room size was fine. It didn't need to be big since we were out on the town most of the time. The price for all of this is very good and if this hotel was near Times Square it would be 3 times more.Even though this is a brand new hotel, it feels like your part of the neighborhood. Had a couple of drinks and appetizers at the outside seating for the hotel restaurant, and felt like half of the people were business folk from the local businesses.I would go back in a heartbeat. Oh yeah...Soho and Broadway shopping were just a couple of blocks past Little Italy.

This hotel was the perfect combination of reasonably priced, newly opened and well-reviewed and it didn't disappoint. Staff were absolutely lovely and would bend over backwards for us.Location is good, it's in Chinatown so it can get a bit chaotic but it's right on Bowery which is a funky street with loads of cafés, diners, bars and good nightlife. Walk to subway not too bad (couple of blocks), walk to financial district about 20 mins, a good 45-60 mins to midtown but worth doing at least once to see some bits of the city tourists miss.Hotel itself meticulously clean and we requested a city view and we were not disappointed, we were on a high floor, I think 12th, and could see the Empire State Building day and night. So beautiful, we slept with the curtains open so we could gaze out of the floor-to-ceiling windows.Just lovely

I don't even know where to begin...from the moment we arrived many hours before check-in time, the staff at the Wyndham Gardens was more than accomodating. From treating us so nicely to doing little extras, such as explaining a subway map, this hotel is top notch. The room we had boasted a fabulous view with the floor to ceiling windows, clean, clean, clean! Happy Hour was fun, watching the staff interact with other staff and guests should be used as an example to others on how to treat people. Negative reviews? Baahh! Some people are just miserable and wish to spread that icky stuff. I utilized the workout room three mornings, and we also took advantage of the dramatic views from the rooftop lounge! I felt this was an absolutely wonderful place to stay, and am already planning my next visit....I would highly recommend this place to anybody who wishes to see the city. Midst of Chinatown, 2 blocks from Little Italy, down the street and around the corner to the subway where you can get to pretty much anywhere in the city, and a bus stop less than a half block away. Thank you Wyndham, and all your staff, for giving us the BEST NY vacation resting place anybody could ask for!

My Samsonite luggage lock was tampered with. Thank goodness that it stayed locked and no one was able to get into my luggage, which contained a laptop and sensitive information. But I had to have the lock cut off by maintenance. Throughout the episode, the staff at the front desk conveniently played dumb, pretending not to understand that someone had tampered with lock while I was out of the room. This is very disconcerting and poor service. I do not recommend this location because of the lack of security and tolerance for people's belongings. I'm very disappointed Wyndham would franchise to such a low standard of hotel manager.
The staff is probably the most accommodating group I've ever encountered! The location is perfect, a very clean and well run facility!!

We spent 7 nights here earlier this year and enjoyed our stay. Staff were extremely accommodating to our last minute change in plans and allowed for a rollaway bed to be added to our room for a reasonable price. The room itself was smaller than I expected but I can understand why it would be the norm for Manhattan - very little space once the extra bed was put in but this was our fault for changing plans when it was too late to book a twin. It was clean and well maintained. As others have mentioned, the shower sprays out into the bathroom which is a little frustrating but housekeeping happily provided extra towels. Staff were all lovely and friendly throughout our stay. Our room was on the 2nd floor and I was initially worried that traffic would disturb us throughout the night but the sound insulation is actually pretty good. Main negative is the terrace outside the room - it is communal so have to keep curtains closed the entire time for privacy.Location wise, it was really convenient. The nearest Subway is less than 5 mins walk and Little Italy and SoHo are both on your doorstep. Saying that, Chinatown is not the best location as it is not clean and the smell of raw meat and fish is really off-putting. Did not use hotel bar or restaurant so can't comment on this - so many wonderful places in Little Italy at a fraction of the price!Overall, I would recommend the nice rooms, friendly staff and convenient location.

Located in the heart of Chinatown. Easy to locate and close to everything. I had a reservation and the check-in and check-out was quick and easy. The room was big and bright. VERY CLEAN and appears new. Very comfortable bed. Nice bathroom with soaps and plenty of towels. Quiet/soundproof room with no disturbances. Would definitely return and recommend.

Upon arriving at the hotel I was unsure what to expect. Thankfully, it was as several of the reviews had said. I was pleasantly and happily surprised. The room was very nice. The floor to ceiling windows was awesome! Also we got some beautiful pictures of the nighttime skyline from the rooftop bar. Absolutely beautiful! The bellhop, Ling, was a great help and very polite. The bar staff also greeted us on the elevator earlier in the day and when we went up to take photo's. I Do Not recommend the hotel restaurant for breakfast. It took 30 minutes for 4 of us to get scrambled eggs, which were close to raw, some sort of potatoes and raw bacon. All of which were cold! Everyone's! You Can mess up breakfast and they did, badly. I would def recommend this location to anyone! Just no breakfast!Be prepared for the overflowing shower and you'll be ok. We did fairly well since we were ready for it! Lol.

This hotel is in a decent location with access to everything. Chinatown is not my favorite location (not very clean) but the hotel is! Also, very close to Little Italy which has great restaurants! The hotel staff is great; the restaurant staff not so much. Had breakfast in their basement restaurant and we were the only people in there and I had to constantly approach the wait staff for menus, coffee, bill, etc. The rooms are small but very well thought out. I would definitely visit this hotel again when in NYC.
Nice clean hotel. Comfortable bed. "Big" room. Great service. Good location. Flawless check-in and check-out.

Although technically in Chinatown, this hotel is a short walk to Little Italy and SoHo. This presents many ethnic dining opportunities for foodies. It's also a great location for proximity to the 9/11 Museum & Memorial, and ferries to the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Is. It definitely met our needs for a 5-day tourist blitz of NYC.

We thoroughly enjoyed our overnight stay at the Wyndham Chinatown. This hotel is in the heart of New York City's Chinatown with hundreds of restaurants and shops nearby. Only a block from subway access to the rest the the city. Our room was clean and very comfortable, with a great city view.

We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was clean and comfortable. The only issue was the shower...its' attempt at. European styling let water all over the floor , which made for an uncomfortable walk whenever we were in the bathroom.

We were unsure as to what we would find having chosen an unknown hotel from the Internet for a reasonable price ( under $200/ night) and thus were thrilled to discover a newer hotel with all the amenities including a restaurant, parking (for an additional fee), a safe in the room, toiletries from Bath and Bodyworks, an iron and ironing board, hairdryer, fluffy duvets, extremely helpful and obliging staff and most importantly wonderfully clean rooms!! I initially wondered if the street noise might keep me awake at night but it was a non-issue- the neighbourhood is very quiet at night. The location on the border of Chinatown and Little Italy and close to subway stations make this hotel a fantastic place for the price! I can't recommend it highly enough!

It has a great view, was spotlessly clean and the décor was classy without being over the top. It had pleasant toiletries, plenty of power sockets and fast, free Wi-Fi. It’s in an interesting location in Chinatown, and close to Little Italy, which might be a bit out of the way for some, but suited us fine and we enjoyed the quirkiness of the area and the vibe in places like Orchard Street. Good access to the subway made it easy to get to tourist sites in Manhattan. Because of its location on Bowery the rooms can get a little noisy with emergency vehicle sirens, but expecting rural quiet in the heart of Manhattan is asking way too much.The only glitch was an out of date room service menu in the guest folder, but a current menu from the hotel restaurant was quickly brought to the room and the breakfast that was ordered arrived promptly, but wasn’t very exciting. I’d suggest exploring many of the quirky cafes in the area for much better dining. The legendary Katz’s deli is only a 15 minute walk away.The room’s balcony gave great views of Manhattan, but only the floor that I was on has rooms with balconies. Be warned that the balcony is shared with all of the other rooms on the same floor, so you can walk the length of the building, past other people’s rooms and see into them. And they can see into yours. Private people might need to keep the curtains closed, and you need to be sure to lock the balcony door after returning inside.

Although this is a nice hotel in an interesting location (near Chinatown and Little Italy), the design of the room was very odd. The bathroom had a pane of frosted glass facing the bedroom resulting in lack of privacy in the bathroom. In addition, any light that's on in the bathroom during the night lights up the entire room. Although, as noted, the hotel location is interesting, it is far from mid-town Manhattan and inconvenient for attending cultural events in mid-town.

My daughter and I stayed here for 4-days and it was amazing. Got a great deal on Travelzoo. The hotel is in close proximity to just about everything without all the noise that you would get from Midtown. Subway station is just around the corner, in the heart of Chinatown and close to SOHO, Little Italy and more. We were just a subway ride away from Midtown and Chelsea and two to Central Park. Our room was very clean and modern with a view of the Empire State Building. Love the floor to ceiling windows. Bathrooms were spacious. The staff and conceirage were very helpful everytime we need directions or information. Would definitely recommend and we are definitely planning on staying there again.

What a great hotel for really experiencing NYC! Away from the horrible congestion of midtown, the hotel is officially in Chinatown (fantastic food and shopping) and on the border of Little Italy (fantastic food and shopping!). Short walk to downtown, East Village, and Soho, convenient to subway. Clean, very European, helpful friendly staff. Rooftop bar has lovely view of midtown -- enjoyed watching the colors of the Empire State Bldg. change according to World Cup wins. Thoroughly enjoyable--great value and lodging!

Needing one extra night in NYC after three nights on the upper westside near Central Park, I booked a night at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown from a Travelzoo special. In theory, I liked the idea of it being in Chinatown, on the edge of Little Italy not far from the World Trade Center and harbor. In reality, it was perfect. We arrived four hours early for check-in but the front desk manager put us in a room right away. We walked into our hotel room (on the 10th floor) and our hearts opened up--the room had a city view that included the Empire State Building. Compact but very clean and modern with fridge, good tv, coffee maker, etc. Really comfortable bed. We dropped our luggage and took off. Walked and walked--every street was interesting and took us to amazing places. Souvenirs, interesting food stores and foot massages in Chinatown; amazing restaurants in Little Italy; the World Trade Center memorial and the new building were profound. We stopped for a delicious lunch at an Italian outdoor cafe on the esplanade over-looking the Statue of Liberty and spent a few hours in the Jewish Heritage Museum. Took a taxi back to the Wyndham and went up to the 18th floor for a drink. The bartender told us to go up one more floor and see the view. It was incredible. Next day, we walked through the old lower eastside to Greenwich Village and back to the hotel. I have been to New York several times but have never had this much fun or learned so much. I credit my adventurous husband who nudged me on but he was definitely inspired by the hotel and its location. I highly recommend the Wyndham Garden Chinatown and will put it at the top of my list for my next visit.

Our room had floor to ceiling windows and, at night, we could see the Empire State Building lit up in red, white and blue. The room was large by NYC standards and had a desk/chair plus a sofa. Wifi was free and worked consistently well (not always the case in other hotels). Staff was courteous and helpful and the room was immaculate. This was our first stay in the neighborhood (I grew up in NYC and we've stayed in many parts of the city), and I loved being near the restaurants of Chinatown and Little Italy...a couple of blocks from Ferrara's and Black Seed Bagels...how bad can that be? We used the valet parking which was not much different in price from garages nearby and made for much less schlepping. Subway was nearby and convenient for getting to sights further uptown, although we did take the car out one day to go to the New York Botanical Gardens.
The hotell is nic and comfortable and very well situated in China Town close to Little Italy. The room was good and everything worked. Good cleaning and good service. Can realy recommend this hotel.
This hotel is right in the heart of busy Chinatown - but is quiet, modern, clean, and welcoming. You can walk to several landmarks or easily find subway stops within a few blocks.

This hotel was simple, but perfect (and perfectly clean!) for downtown activities. Just moments from Chinatown, Soho, The New Museum and the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant as there are plenty of good spots in the neighborhood and great spots in Little Italy are literally steps away. The staff could not have been more helpful - very kind and aimed to please.

Despite all the positive feedback for this new hotel, here is some factual experience:1) the rooms are tiny. 2) The wall between bathroom and bedroom is semi c-thru. Sanitary duties become a shared experience. 3) Drinks at the bar are expensive.4) the location is Chinatown, fun fr 1/2 days but not the New York experience that you'll get more up town5) Rooms are clean6) the hotel is new, everything works well.My judgement; I will never go there again.

Newish hotel in Chinatown with good service and staff. The rooms are spacious for New York by any standard. The rooms have multiple outlets for charging and the toiletries are good and plentiful. The biggest issues are in the shower design with no way to close the space so water gets over everything and the noise of the roof top bar. If you can stay on an upper floor but below the 16th floor you should be in good shape noise-wise. The views from the upper floors are amazing. If you get caught on a lower floor - make sure you go to the roof top bar at night! The drinks at the bar are average but nice when you are sitting there.
Great views. Very nice room/bathroom. Very modern. Highly recommend the balcony room. It wraps around and you have great views of uptown and downtown. Would book again for sure.

I visit NYC on a regular basis and try to stay in different areas of the city whenever I can. This time the Wyndham Garden Hotel caught my eye with a decent price and a very high Tripadvisor ranking.
