I had high expectations and for the most part the hotel lived up to these expectations. It's very clean, well located and the rooms have a good floor plan, but there are a few annoyances that keep me from giving this hotel the full five stars. Some of these annoyances maybe nitpicking, but that's why we're talking 4 vs 5 stars.First of all the bed's duvet is too short. I'm 6'4" and either my shoulders or your feet go under, which is annoying because the airco draft is noticeable at night. Also the duvet cover fits badly and your feet get stuck in it. Both of these issues can be remedied somewhat by turning the duvet 90 degrees, but that's not an option if you're not staying there alone.Secondly the bathroom is not very well though out considering this is a newly and purpose built hotel. There is no shower curtain or door. There is only a glass panel covering the first part of the shower area. This is not enough and water splashes out soaking not only the floor, but also wetting the only clothes hook in the bathroom (see photo). Secondly it's hard to live up to the reuse of towels policy, because there is no decent rack to hang your towel to dry. There is only the aforementioned hook, which is too small for the large (but good) towels (There is enough place to retrofit a rack). The use of wallpaper in a bathroom, especially next to an open shower is not smart and the results of this decision were already visible (see photo).Generally the furniture is good (I especially like the desk and it's well places outlets), but the comfortable chair in the room is not comfortable at all, it's basically an odd sized clothes rack (see photo). Like many hotel rooms also this room didn't have a simple coat hook near the door. Why don't hotels understand how easy a simple hook would be to hang your coat or bag.Finally I want to mention the most subjective annoyance, which is the fact that you cannot open any window. You are fully reliable on air conditioning and you cannot feel the outside air before you actually go down and exit the hotel. To some this may not be an issue, but I prefer (sleeping with) an open window over airco whenever possible.All in all this is a good hotel which I would recommend to others.
The best service. Hotel was clean and updated, but the keys seemed to b a problem all weekend. Location of course is fabulous...Food in main restaurant is marginal, but the outside bar was great!
Nice hotel, excellent service. Friendly staff and helpful. Location is near to subway stations however the area is not beautiful at all.

Staff was entirely helpful. Whether I called for travel supplies, had questions about the cost of the room, or even to stow my luggage after checkout, they took great care of me. The room was just right, having a fridge and an extra chair to sit on. I wish the closet had been in a spot with better lighting, but that's a small thing. The music in the 18th floor could stand to be a bit lower during the week, as I was trying to meet with some associates there and it was like a Saturday nightclub. Would definitely recommend and go back again. Lower Manhattan doesn't get nearly enough exposure I feel and this place is right in the heart of it.

My sister's, nieces & daughter booked this hotel for one night because we were able to book -2 suites that slept 3 each for our group reasonable priced. We headed down via metro short walk to hotel early to drop bags. Unfortunately only had 1 suite available, don't know why, as I had confirmed prior. BUT Vanassa worked diligently ' and patiently with us , and we were able to check in early to available suite, drop bags & take a breath before heading out for our adventure. She gave us discount on second room and free roll away, so we each had own bed which was nice . Very convenient to metro on canal & grand st., Dunkin donut around corner. We walked to 911 museum and memorial. Great view from top floor cafe, clean, modern ( ac did work wonderfully) and yes poor design on shower door but no big deal, water pressure was great and nice bath / shampoo line, nice beds and staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even providing band aids for my blisters ! We would stay there again, we had a great girls NYC adventure.

Nice new hotel. The location is good to get around and see the sights. We had a great view from our window. The only complaint was the night club on the 18th floor. On Saturday night they crank up the music until after 3am. Not much sleep and we had a flight to catch in the morning.

We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for 3 nights during our mini-vacation in New York City . The staff were fantastic , very helpful and always pleasant and engaging. The rooms were a good size for downtown Manhattan and nicely finished , the hotel is a short walk from Wall Street , the 9/11 Memorial and Museum , Battery Park , the Staten and Brooklyn Ferries , a short walk from subway access . The restaurant in the hotel serves excellent sushi , and a good breakfast , and the rooftop lounge allowed a great view of the lights of New York while you relaxed with a nitecap .

Very friendly staff in a clean comfortable hotel near downtown manhattan. Thoroughly impressed with hotel features and service. Hotel had all comfort features one would expect without any of the typical worries of a hotel in a good price range near Chinatown. Highly recommend.

We stayed at the Wyndham Garden in the beginning of June. Beware! We threw away the garbage of a buddy's pack of cigarettes remaining from a night out. Just the garbage. From this they claimed that we smoked in the hotel and dinged us with a spurious $200 charge after the fact. From some garbage in the trash. We aren't even smokers! Super unhelpful staff and very rude employees over all. Save your money and stay elsewhere!

Don't be scared off by the neighborhood! There's not much going on in the immediate surroundings, but a few blocks away, you're in Chinatown or Little Italy. They gave me a room on the 16th floor that had an incredible view of uptown - totally "Bright Lights, Big City." You walk into the room and the view is right there! The window not much further than the end of the bed! Anyway, the room was very clean and nice, ditto for the bathroom. No magnifying mirror, but all else ok, including complementary coffee and water. I would totally go back.

This hotel in the heart of Chinatown NY. I love the view to Manhattan from this hotel. Staff is very friendly from check in to check out. The rooms are very small, but this is normal in NYC, they are very clean. However, they need to be a little more efficient and utilize all the sources available to make the customer happy... seems they dont do this sometimes, specially when it comes to getting your car from valet... other than that, if you don't have a car, this hotel is very good!

Fantastic location! We easily walked to the Brooklyn Bridge and Little Italy. It is also within walking distance of the well-known Whiskey Tavern. I personally could not stand the odors from the Chinese fish markets in this neighborhood but other than that, the location is perfect. This hotel is very attractive and modern, both inside and out. We had an executive queen room with balcony on the 15th floor. The decor was nice, the room was clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. The size of the room was quite small but it used the space wisely. The bathroom had a slight smell of mildew from the shower curtain. Otherwise, it was clean with quality materials.The views from this room are absolutely fabulous! We could see the Freedom Tower, both the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges, the Empire State Building, and the Chrysler Building. Simply stunning, The balcony was huge. I was disappointed that there were no chairs or tables on the balcony, however. It would have been a perfect place to drink coffee in the morning. We did take some wine up to the 18th floor rooftop lounge and there was nice furniture up there. FYI, there is no bar open up there unless a private event is going on. Service was friendly and attentive. We were able to check-in a little early with no problem. A warning that the valet parking is not fast! We waited almost an hour for our car on our check-out day. Overall, a very pleasant place to stay in Lower Manhattan that I would return to.

very modern, comfortable hotel, great view of the empire state building from our 16th floor room. floor to ceiling windows in the room and washroom. good price when we purchased through travelzoo. we were within walking distance to the ny license office (for marriage certificates etc.) close to subways and ground zero etc.

We chose this hotel because of its location (7 mins walk to Grand St station, very convenient) and also because of the great reviews I've read before deciding.On the whole was a very pleasant stay (7 day stay in Jun 2014) for me, my wife and my 9-year old son. The hotel is new and everything looks great! The safe is bigger than most I've seen and was able to fit 15" laptop and several other tablets. The free wifi was great, no complaints, stable and reasonably fast!The staff were generally helpful and friendly and we pretty much got what we needed during the stay.The room is rather small and with the luggages we had, it was quite a struggle not to trip over during the night. On hindsight, we should have booked a bigger room, though I think the rooms were fully booked that week.The design of the bath area was bad in my opinion. The glass wall enclosing the bath area covered only half the length. I have to to be very careful when showering not to splash the water all over outside the bath area. it was not a good experience, especially after a long day out where you just want to enjoy a good shower and not worry about water splashing all over.Other than that no other concerns and would look forward to staying here the next time I visit NYC :)

For a high school reunion in the lower East Side, this was a perfect location. In Chinatown, close to Little Italy, Soho, and the train station. Nice rooftop bar and service was friendly and professional.My only negative was that the temperature control for the air conditioning made it too cold at night.. That system needs to be changed.

Very nice restaurant, excellent service. Room was very neat and clean.Well positioned for lower Manhattan (Chinatown, Little Italy and SOHO).View was great.Stay as high as you can to ensure the best possible views.Everyone, and I mean everyone there on the staff was terrific. Any request was immediately met.

stayed here for 3 nights in NYC and had a pleasant vacation here. hotels in nyc are quite expensive so my rate of $216/night seemed like a steal! the hotel is clean. the staff was friendly and helpful. housekeeping was great and loved the free wi-fi and bottled watter in the room. speaking of the room - while it is small, it looks recently remodeled and is comfortable enough for 2. there's also a mini-fridge for any leftovers you have haha. oh and definitely request a room on a higher floor to drown out some street noise. the shower is quite awkward with no real door so it is hard to position the shower head not to get the overflow and get the bathroom floor wet. no biggie but just weird hahathe location is in chinatown so it took some getting used to walking amongst all the old chinese ladies and food markets and the smells haha...but other than that the location here is pretty great for downtown. easily walkable to little italy and soho. easy subway & bus access to east village, lower east side, and brooklyn too. made it uptown a few times on the subway and that wasnt too bad either. this is definitely a great spot if you're in NYC to explore lower manhattan and dont need to be near all the traditional touristy spots
Good location in Chinatown. Walking distance to Brooklyn bridge and lot of local restaurants near by.

Stayed for 4 nights, the hotel is lovely. Great area and only a few blocks walk to little Italy and Soho. Staff were friendly and so helpful! The room was perfect, what a view of the empire state and Chrysler buildings! The bed was so comfy I wish I could have brought it home. By far the best hotel I have stayed in, just perfect!

The staff at the restaurant staff was fantastic. On arrival to our room the bathroom floor and tub had long dark hair all over it. We are blondes! The room was beyond small not what we were expecting!

Nice and clean hotel in the heart of chinatown.Conveniently located, lots of nice eateries and bubble tea cafeEasy to go anywhere. Wall Street is not far awayStaff are also very friendly and helpful. One can book a limo to the airport at the front desk at reasonable rates.

Travelling with a senior and another adult, we were really impressed with the hotel. A very comfortable roll away bed allowed all 3 of us a good night's sleep. Veiws from the rooftop are spectacular (expecially at night) and there is plenty to do and see nearby.

Overall my gfriend and I had a great time, we enjoyed the room and location which was different for us. Being a new hotel we expected hiccups, the first morning the maid quickly knocked, yelled room service and opened the door....at 8am...while my gfriend was still sleeping! On our second night, a tuesday evening, a loud private party was booked right above our room! (1604)...despite two calls to the front desk to remind them that it was a week night.....the noise went past midnite.....we did receive many apologies and 20% off our bill for the one night. we used travel zoo btw and got a great price....

We stayed for 3 nights and chose it as we wanted to be based in lower Manhattan. You are smack in the middle of Chinatown on Bowery - about a 10 min walk from Bowery station and 15/20 to Canal/Spring. Good if you like a bit of a walk. We didn't get breakfast, but so not necessary as you're in NYC! The rooms were smalls, but very clean. The bathroom shower was excellent, but annoying as no place to hang towels to dry after use. I'm all for re-using my towels, but hard to because of this! The only other thing that may irk is that the bathroom has a frosted glass door and floor to ceiling windows, which is great during the day. But at night keeps the whole room bright even though you have blackout curtains - so if you're sensitive to light suggest you sleep with an eye mask! And if you are going to Newark - they offer a car service for $75 which is about the same as a cab so could be worth taking up their offer.

We stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for three nights in June. We found the accommodations to be clean, comfortable and in a great location. We were on the fourth floor and were not bothered by road or club noises, as previous reviewers had mentioned. The rooms were spacious enough for two and our luggage while still allowing space to move, and at this price point, that's more than you can say for other NYC hotels. The room was tastefully decorated. The linens and towels were clean, soft and in great shape, and the bed was firm but comfortable. The bathroom provides little space for toiletries and would benefit from a shelf or two. The shower pressure was great and the provided soaps are of a high quality. Others have commented on the design of the shower leading to water on the floor, but it was a minor issue for us and was nothing a bath mat couldn't correct. Our issues with this hotel mainly revolve around customer service. On the first day, we attempted to order something from room service after reading the in-room menu which listed a variety of foods at reasonable prices. Upon inquiring, we found that almost all of the prices were outdated and that the actual price was much higher. We ended up eating off-site as a result. On our second day, we called the front desk for additional towels as we had opted out of daily housekeeping. We had requested the towels be left on the floor outside of our room as one of us was asleep. The gentleman who brought the towels knocked on our door, which went unanswered to avoid waking the sleeping party. The desk called and mentioned our Do Not Disturb sign and asked us to open the door, to which we again asked that the towels just be left on the floor. The gentleman with towels then knocked AGAIN, waited a moment, and left without ever leaving us our towels. We ended up borrowing some from our traveling companions' room. We both work in hotels, and rule number one of Do Not Disturb signs is that you never knock unless there is a crisis. On our third day, we asked for a recommendation for local restaurants from a woman at the front desk. She gave us three options and, when we asked for directions, her attitude changed to one of "figure it out yourself". She pointed vaguely down one street and mumbled the name again. My boyfriend asked her to repeat the route, and she again pointed. We ended up going to a small cafe that we found ourselves. All in all, we did enjoy our stay. We found the staff to be less than helpful (again, by the standards of two individuals who are employees at well-respected Vermont resorts), but the accommodations left little to be desired. We would consider a second visit on our next NYC trip, but we would recommend to management to address these service issues before it becomes a pattern.
Fix showers so water does not end up on floor and have to use all the towels to soak it up. Since the hotel is green

Rooms very very nice and clean. Couldn't not have surviced withour air-co.Two blocks to Little Italy and appr. 3 blocks to closest Canal St. subway station.If you are a light sleeper, take earplugs with you as Bowery is a very busy street all day/night long.

Perfect hotel to stay downtown. The rooms are clean and the service is good. Easy walk to a lot of interesting places. We stayed at 10th floor, the view was amazing! I would highly recommend this hotel. Compared to other hotels in New York City this room isn't small at all.
16th floor room had a window wall with great vistas. Everything was great (except the oatmeal- skip that)- comfy bed, nice design, well-organized bathroom. And lovely staff.

The location of the hotel is wonderful, central and easy accessible. The employees for most part do not speak well English and it was a bit difficult to communicate with them . The ones I dealt with are from Chinese origin. Rooms are small, but I have to say the maid service was excellent. The shower floor kept cracking when I stepped into the shower, it was a bit scary. It felt like the floor will "fall apart", kind of. Amenities in the room were of a very good quality. The food in Elevate was average, the breakfast service was OK, friendly wait staff. WiFi is one of the best I've experienced in NYC. Excellent view of the NYC skyline from the roof top.
For sure the best option for my trip.brand new hotel, great service and good location (walk distance from a lot of places).

Overall we had a great experience at the hotel. The service was great, the rooms were clean, the location was not bad, and the hotel rooftop bar was A+. I would definitely recommend to anyone if you do not mind being in Chinatown.

After reading so many great reviews on Tripadvisor, we were actually almost disappointed. For the price the hotel is great: it is in a very central location, and our room was clean.However: my husband had called ahead to say that it was my birthday, and because I arrived several hours before him it would have been nice if the staff had recognized my birthday, but they did not. So that was a little disappointing.It was a bit of a back and forth to get a quiet room, but the room we ended up in was very nice with a great view of midtown.The staff was very friendly and helpful (except for the guy I checked in with who I never saw again after that first night).We would probably stay here again. The bed was very comfy!As other users have noted, the rooms are kind of small (for the US), and the shower doors are constructed so that a lot of water splashes onto the bathroom floor (only 1/3 of the shower is covered by the door).It is nice that the hotel provides shower gel and body lotion.

Very comfortable and modern hotel with a hidden gem sushi restaurant in the lower level. Great views of the NY skyline from our room on the 16th floor. Very good local restaurants include Cafe Kati and Sorella nearby. Enjoy!

We stayed at Wyndham Garden Chinatown for several nights. The hotel is located on Bowery, a busy street. If you are easily disturbed by traffic, ask for a room located on a higher floor. The rooms are nice, but can be a bit small. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. We tried the breakfast one morning, but I cannot recommend it. There are much better breakfast places in the vicinity. The staff is nice and service minded. The rooftop bar was like a regular night club, I had expected it to be a bit more cozy.

Hotel was very nicely kept and the staff was very pleasant. We felt secure in the area and it was nice to know that you couldn't use the elevator without a room key. The only complaint I would have is the shower doesn't have full doors so water gets all over the bathroom floor.

Thank you very much for the great stay we had in New York! The hotel is very well located and has 2 subway stations just a stone-throw away. Thus you can catch trains to almost anywhere in Manhattan, Brooklyn etc.The rooms are nice, modern and spacious (for New York Standards). The aircon is quiet and the doors new (thus they shut well and keep any noise out).The staff at the front desk are very helpful in organizing shuttles, taxis etc.
I only stayed 1 night but enough to enjoy the hotel rooftop bar with with great city view and great stuff with so much fun!

This was our first stay in a Wyndham hotel and to our delight we were very satisfied with the service and the value we received. The location was another thing we really like, it's very convenient to stay in a hotel near the places where we did all our shopping and site seeing.

Better late then never, right! Booked a room through Hotwire in August 2013 and ended up getting a room from Wyndham Garden. The hotel was very new so everything was spotless clean and shiny. The service at the hotel was superb from the moment we arrived to the time we had to leave. We got a room from one of the highest floors with a gorgeous view of the city (even though we probably paid the lowest rate), which was really nice. We just loved the location, since it is on the edge of Chinatown and little Italy, Soho etc are in a walking distance. We are travelling to NYC again this august, but this time i will not be booking through Hotwire because i want to be sure that we'll end up staying in the Wyndham Garden.

Spent 4 nights here mid May. Had a room on 12th floor and the view was superb. Room not huge but very clean. Bed comfy and hotel not noisy. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Didn't eat at hotel but did go for a drink on the top floor at night and again the views were amazing.

The rooms are nice (at least the one I had, on the 8th floor), very small but extremely clean and with a comfortable bed, coffee maker and a fridge. The bathroom was big and confortable with nice amenities. Also the service was good. But the location is terrible. Unless you need or want to be in Chinatown, I would avoid the ugly smells, the rude crowd and the litter all over. I couldn't wait to take the subway to go somewhere else in order to feel like, indeed, I was in New York.

Really happy with my four night stay at this hotel. The rooms are small but all hotels in NYC are small unless you pay a kings ransom. The hotel is close to Grand Street station plus Canal Street is close with three subway stations. The actual area the hotel is in is full of Chinese shops mostly selling tat or restaurants hence the area dies come late evening. Not to worry walk north to Delancy of Springs where you will find bars etc with the closest bat that I find was the One Mile pub on Delancy that is a nice friendly place right next door to the famous Bowery Ballroom. All other main area of entertainment in the East & Greenwich village are walkable or one or two stops on the subway or USD 8,00 dollars in a taxis.

Quite a few points make this hotel a very good choice.1. Location to the Lower East Side, Chinatown, Little Italy and more.2. Its a new hotel (few years old), so everything is in very good condition.3. Cool lobby bar.4. Location (what can I say, we got tired of Times Square and love the LES).5. Depending on floor, great views.6. Price. You're not going to get better for the price in Manhattan.7. The room has a small fridge.Cons: Rooms are somewhat small, but hey, its Manhattan. Plus we're here to hit the bars, restos, pizza joints, juke joints, dives, theater. Not entertain in the room. Beds are only queen. Being away, I like to luxuriate in a king, but alas, not here.
This glass and steel hotel is located in the heart historic Chinatown. The building is a harsh contrast in the midst this old neighborhood. It is clean, efficient and soulless.

Wow! I've never been treated so great in NYC until I stayed at Wyndham Garden Chinatown. The hotel staff are Wonderful!! They are friendly and professional, and offer very clean comfortable rooms in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The front desk people were very engaging with their customers - it was good to come "home" to smiling faces after a long exhausting day in the city. In fact, when I was departing, the Bell Person hailed a cab for me in no time. However, the trunk of the cab was extremely disgusting and the Bell Person said "this is not acceptable" shook his head and loaded my luggage in the front at the cab drivers dismay. The hotel staff exude quality customer service. I definitely found a favorite hotel in NYC. Thank you Wyndham Garden Chinatown!

I was able to view the Freedom Tower while laying in my bed on the 16th floor. The hotel is fairly new and modern and the staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant in the basement of the hotel which has both Asian and American food on the menu. The hotel is close to the Freedom Tower and Battery Park/Statue of Liberty and Elias Island. If you travel to midtown, it's about a $20 taxi ride from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC

We spent one night at the Wyndham Garden and we were very impressed! Great location, very accommodating staff, immaculate rooms / bathrooms & excellent value for money! We were given a room on the 11th floor so it was lovely & quiet and we had a great view of the city. Thanks again!

Great property. Room and bath good size for NY, VERY clean and in great condition, amazing view with balcony, friendly staff. In all my years of visits to NY I had not stayed in Chinatown, this location is in heart of Chinatown (along with all the noise and chaos that any chinatown has, if you are not use to it it could be an adjustment....from San Francisco it was just like our chinatown) and is a block from Little Italy, close to SOHO, lower east side, financial district, subway in a couple blocks, Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges close. Also like almost anywhere in Manhattan its close enough to shopping and restaurants. Hotel seems to attract a younger crowd (LES) and has a popular bar is in the hotel. Recommend based on the excellent condition and value of the hotel, if you want to be in this neighborhood its an excellent choice.

I stayed for 8 nights in Wyndham Garden, which is a big surprise for me during this time's visit of China Town, New York. The hotel is extremely clean. Rooms are cozy. In this city, in such a special area, it is really beyond my expectation. I remember one saying: the purity of lotus comes out from deep mud. I like it!
Great experience at the hotel. Beautiful room with a great view of the city. Very comfortable bed and nice decor in room and bathroom.

Located walking distance from Soho shopping or trendy LES and a few subway options. The room was spacious, excellent bed, very clean, and with all the usuals (HD TV, AC, bathroom products refreshed every day..)Chek-in was quick and easy, even at 2AM, and Hamza was very helpful with ordering a car during check-out , he even speaks french!Only point is the breakfast at the restaurant, which is disappointing, and there is not much around except chinese places, so you have to go a few blocks to find a real coffee shop.

This hotel is ok, not great? Bathroom is terrible setup. No door on shower so all the water gets all over the floor. No vent in bathroom for air conditioning, so terribly hot in there while trying to apply makeup and do hair.

As we love chinese food, the location of the Wyndham Garden was just perfect in the middle of Chinatown. It is also very easy to reach other parts of the city with the subway. Katie and the rest of the staff was also very nice and helpful from the moment we arrived late at night untill we walked out the front door a week later. We enjoyed our stay very much!

if you want to easily explore soho and it's enviorens and you want to pay upper 200's in a clean, friendly hotel with above average room service, then stay here. moderate noise from sirens. very nice beds. strong A/C, but it seemed to power down a little before sunrise each night like it was on a timer-odd. powerful but messy shower. solid staff. little italy and it's faded glory right there. Brooklyn is real close too. easy access from holland tunnel into crowed old school narrow streets of yore.

We came to NYC to get married and chose to stay at Wyndham Chinatown. All we can say is WOW! The whole party experienced fantastic service from all the staff, they couldn't have helped more. They even helped with aspects of the wedding. We were made to feel so welcome.The view from our room 1502 I think it was, was just spectacular. The roof top bar is just brilliant, what a view, lovely bar.The food was tasty. The bar was well stocked, loved happy hour.I just can't express how helpful reception, bar staff, management, sales team were. Miss the place alot! I love Chinatown too, great atmosphere.

Have just spent 10 nights at this hotel and was most impressed by the consistency in service standards throughout the hotel. The location is an automatic winner but the warmth and care of the personnel added to the experience. At last a hotel that still cares that the guest has a great experience. The rooms are designed in a functional way to make good use of limited space and the floor to ceiling windows give the occupier unsurpassed views of the NY skyline and plenty of natural light. All the sights and sounds of Little Italy, Chinatown, Lower East side, Downtown, Tribeca, Soho & the Brooklyn Bridge are within easy walking distance. The housekeeping was exceptional and the team at the front desk were a pleasure to deal with.Nothing was too much trouble. Thanks Wyndham Garden Chinatown.

Very stylish hotel in an area outside of the main tourist areas but with easy access to them via subway 2-3 mins walk away. Little Italy is the same distance away with excellent choice of restaurants. Hotel facilities are good with happy hour in the afternoon at the bar (good cocktails!) and decent food at their basement restaurant. As the weather was not so good we didn't visit the rooftop bar. Our room on the 9th floor had a great view of Manhattan. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because the shower whilst powerful sprayed water all over the floor! Silly thing but annoying all the same.
We enjoyed our stay very much. The rooms were very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.

We were pleased with the Wyndham Garden and thought it was a good value. The staff were very friendly and our room had a terrific floor to ceiling view from the 9th floor - you cannot find that at this price!! True the location is in Chinatown which for those that don't know NYC might be difficult or a little too cultural, but as I am from the city I love it and consider this location excellent as it is culturally unique, close to the LES, Nolita, Ground Zero / Wall St area. Plus, we can recommend some great trendy restaurants and bars a few blocks directly east on Orchard St such as the The Fat Radish and The Lead Belly Bar. For awesome tacos and every flavor of margarita try Barrio Chino in LES. Also, for breakfast we recommend the Grey Dog on Mulberry or the Donut Factory (best donuts in NYC!).
location, cleanliness, staffs. I often stay at this hotel which I like very much and the area too.
Place was surprisingly Clean. The place is also very new. All types of food whether is cheap, expensive, Chinese or wastern is all around here.

Near metro station and bars/restaurants in Little Italy & Greenwich. Good and comfortable rooms for good value. We had problems with the heating system not resolved during our stay. All the rest was working with good appearence. We recommend a drink at the roof top lounge (nice view and good service).

Great location in lower east side. This is my favorite part of the city right now because of the excellent speakeasy type bars and great restaurants. Everything is in walking distance. The hotel is very clean and has floor to ceiling windows that have a view of the empire state building. The staff is so nice and helpful, all smiles and they make you feel like your an important guest. What more could you want? Excellent! Only negative was the shower (bathrooms are very nice and clean). It was a little slow to drain but no flooding or anything. We would definitely choose here again.

We chose to stay in a mini suite and couldn't have been happier. Our room faced out onto Bowery St. and Hester st. intersection with giant floor to ceiling windows on both sides. The opportunity for people watching was wonderful. The room was very clean and spacious (for NYC). The hotel staff was fantastic, very helpful and very quick. The location has a wealth of great restaurants all within a short walk. Chinese, Japanese Fusion, Vietnamese, and Thai. We were pleased to be so close to a lot of restaurants in Little Italy as well. The subway was a very short walk, and having a son who lives in Manhattan helps. We had a built in guide. New York is great with public transportation (subway and buses) all accessible with one pass for both.

The rooms are very good - spicy and good beds. Very well isolated and no noises. The rooms are enjoyable and well sized to be hotel rooms in NY. We booked by hotwire and pais USD 175 per night included all taxes and thats low for this quality - 3.5 stars at hotwire,The bar is not good and have a lousy selection of wine and the restaurant has a lousy and bad serviced breakfast - eat and drink outside the hotel.

lovely, although small rooms in a great chinatown location. friendly and helpful staff. easy access to public transpo, and good places to eat in chinatown and little italy. a nice bar in the hotel itself with good sushi.

Thank you so much Mr. Massy for our most enjoyable vacation in New York. Your professional and personable attentiveness to our needs with the subway system and our stay in this big overwhelming city were greatly appreciated. The suite we stayed in were very well appointed and clean. My husband and I will always remember your exceptional hospitality and our highest recommendations for your beautiful hotel.

Stayed here for 4 nights over a long weekend.The hotel has a great location on Bowery between Chinatown and Little Italy. The subway station is only a 5 minute walk.The staff are extremely friendly and the rooms are well equipped and spotlessly clean, with comfortable beds, coffee makers, mp3 players and a nice big HD TV.Although the rooms look impressive, their are a few design issues to the room. There is very little draw space (only 2 small bedside draws), and only one side of the bed had a bedside light on it. Another issue is the location of the in room safe, which is at the bottom of the wardrobe so you have to lie on the floor to gain access to it, not an issue for me but for some could be a major issue.The marble bathrooms are big and well equipped, although the shower heads are fitted at a very strange angle. Toiletries are plentiful and of good quality, however there is no shelf in the bathroom to put your own stuff on.The rooftop lounge has the potential to be amazing, but falls down on two points. Firstly as a resident in a hotel, I would expect to be able to charge drinks to my room, but this was not allowed. Secondly, the DJ needs to be more aware of the occupants of the bar. When we first walked in, the place was empty and the music was very heavy trance style music, which obviously the DJ was enjoying. Approximately 10 minutes after we arrived, a party of 5 women in their 30's walked in (bringing the total number of people in the bar to 7), but still the DJ insisted on playing the same music, despite the visible distaste on everyone's faces. This resulted in everybody leaving the bar pretty sharpish, and obviously the bar returning to it's previously empty status.Despite these ( small ) issues, I would recommend this hotel and the surrounding neighbourhoods as a valid alternative to overpriced and plastic Times Square.

I stayed here with my mom over Easter weekend last month for 5 nights. We normally stay more uptown but found a great deal online for the Wyndham. The location was excellent and allowed us to explore a new neighborhood, which we ended up loving and didn't really venture past 14th street in the end, except to shop. The rooms were very clean and the staff were incredibly accommodating. We asked to change rooms as we had previously been given one queen bed and the staff made sure we were given a room with an even better view than the one we had originally been assigned. The subway was around the corner and there was a whole foods about a 7 minute walk away. Would definitely stay there again!

Great stay at Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Room designs are modern and clever (glass partitions as part of bathroom wall -- cool). Views uptown are spectacular. Fantastic location for lots of things. Omar skillfully directs a wonderful staff. We're definitely going to return.

I stayed at this hotel for 12 nights on a recent business trip. My room was fantastic- unobstructed view of the Empire State Building, spacious (for a NYC hotel), and super-clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. The location is in walking distance to many great neighborhoods, bars & restaurants. My room was also incredibly quiet compared with most NYC hotel rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Wyndham Garden Chinatown is a modern (under two years old) and professionally run hotel close to Chinatown, Soho and L.E.S. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel seems safe (staff who were alert, elevator use requires key, quality doors in rooms, fire detection and sprinkler systems, etc.)Our room was not particularly large, but perfectly OK (most rooms are small in NYC), and it was clean and tidy when we arrived (and the cleaning staff did a great job during our stay, too). We found the room very comfortable and it had a magnificent view of the Empire State Building/Midtown. There is also a large roof terrace on the 19th floor with a breathtaking 360 degrees view (we skipped the entire trip to the Empire State Building because of this)!Top Queen Size bed with quality linens, refrigerator, spacious safe for laptop and passports etc, coffee/tea machine, sufficient electrical outlets (important!), iron/ironing board. The water pressure was good, and the bathroom had lots of thick towels and a hairdryer.Many hotels have free, but poorly functioning Wi-Fi. That is not an issue at Wyndham Garden! We used the web extensively and without any problems. In the lobby there is also a PC for free use, not to mention a connected printer that made it easy to print our boarding passes before going home. We ordered Room service/used the hotel restaurant a couple of times, and the food was yummy.Nearest subway station (Grand Street, B/D train) is about a 5 minutes walk and we had no problems getting quickly to Central Park, Times Square and other popular sites. We recommend purchasing a 7 day unlimited MTA-pass for $30. The hotel booked a taxi for us to Newark Airport, it worked great with their regular contacts - and a flat rate was arranged.Heartfelt thanks to the Director of Rooms Omar Bouchaar, Katie, Hermin, and all the other members of the hotel staff who made our 10-days stay to such a nice experience, we would love to come back to this hotel!

Hotel is in a good location for exploring Chinatown and Little Italy and the rest of the downtown area. When booking see if you can book a room on the north side of the hotel looking uptown and the view of the empire state building at night is magnificent.

Our stay at Wyndham Garden Chinatown was faboulous! All of the staff were great. Especially the Director of Rooms, Omar Bouchaar, was really friendly, professional and helpful, and made our stay very pleasant. We were lucky to get a room on the 11th floor with a magnificent view uptown! Omar made sure that we got a room on the same floor as our parents (travelling with us), and we also got a baby crib for our little 9 month year old baby (was in our room when we arrived). Everything was just in place.The hotel is modern, clean and tidy, and the beds were nice. All in all, a great experience!Thanks to Omar and the staff for a great stay! We will definitely come back.

Got a great deal on this hotel, so even though we wouldn't have stayed in Chinatown normally, it worked out. Convenient to the subway, two different lines 2 and 5 blocks away, felt safe, very clean, and brand new. Free high speed internet was a great plus. Bathrooms were new, but glass partition instead of door made for a very wet bathroom post-shower - but that was the only issue.

it's definitely not a five star hotel. However, Wyndham Chinatown exceeded my expectations in all aspects. While the room was not very spacious, it was more than appropriate. It was always clean and functional. Unlike in many other similar hotels in town, I have never found any filthy stains or corners in Wyndham China. The cleanning staff have done a great job. Meanwhile, I found all staff in Wyndham friendly and attentive. They responded to calls and requests promptly. Staff at reception were able to reconigze me after my second stay here and always made me feel welcome. I will definitely come back again!

I recently returned to NYC, and stayed at the Wyndham in Chinatown. This was was my second time staying at this location. I can't say enough about this Hotel and Staff. Omar and his Staff treat you like family and greet you like you've just returned home for the Holidays. Their hospitality is not a job, it's truly the spirit of their Staff. The Hotel itself is beautiful with amazing views of the City skyline.

Very appropriate choice for a stay in New York. Friendly and attentive staff with clean rooms and an excellent if hidden restaurant. Superb choice for accessing the City and surrounding areas with a wide choice of restaurants and bars. Visit the 18th floor bar and expect comparatively high prices for drinks but very good service. Access the 19th floor for night time views of the City. The best rooms seem to be those on the corner which can also be a bit noisy so try to book on a higher floor. The Whole Foods Market on the corner of Bowery and East Houston is an excellent place for breakfast and immediate access to the subway.

This was a very nice hotel with a pleasant and helpful staff. I stayed on the second floor after initially having requested a room on one of the upper floors to get the nice view of the city. But the room on the 2nd floor was quiet and comfortable so I was happy with it. Maybe the area in Chinatown, as I found out, wasn't really my cup of tea, and that's really the only reason I would not choose to stay at this hotel if I were to return to New York again. But if you like the Chinatown area then I would most definitely recommend the Wyndham Garden hotel to any traveller.
Close to subway and bus with Chinese food all around and Little Italy a short walk away. Nice room but I wouldn't recommend their restaurant; clearly under staffed.

The rooms were clean, the personnel at the reception always friendly, neighborhood is fantastic, location of the hotel is awesome. We had an excellent view on the Empire state building. So near the Brooklyn bridge, and we didn't even know! :) So many restaurants to go to in the evening...

Last minute booking on Hotwire for 2 nights. The positive reviews are all accurate. Newer hotel in the heart of the Chinatown and next to Little Italy and close to the East Village. Nice room, great beds. Easy access to Subway (1 block or so). Nice rooms, good bar in lobby and bar on rootop with amazing view of the city. Recommend! I'll be back.

We loved the hotel. Location. Staff. Room size was a bit small although the bathroom was a good size. Room size not such a big issue as most rooms have amazing Manhattan views. Restaurant, lobby bar and Fitness room were depressing though. Restaurant was several levels underground and did not excite.

Fantastic views over midtown from the 7th floor room, even had a balcony, could see Empire State Building and Chrysler building while in bed! Staff friendly, well equipped and everything worked. Staff helpful and made the welcome genuine after a long journey.

Great price in a location within walking distance of Soho, the Lower East Side, Chinatown, and Lower Manhattan. Also, there are several subway stops within walking distance as well. The hotel was clean; the staff was beyond friendly. We were given a free upgrad to a room with a balcony that included a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and the new Freedom Tower. We would definitely stay here again.

I choose this hotel because the price was right. I originally did not want to stay in Chinatown but further north. I enjoyed seeing a new part of the city. Location was great, near the subway and good restaurants. Room was nice. Breakfast was not included but offered at the restaurant in the basement. Breakfast offerings were minimal. Overall, a nice place to stay

This is my first visit to NYC, I was worried about choosing the perfect hotel for a reasonable price and I was not disapointed, the hotel is in a busy popular area, surrounded by great attractions and close to the subway station, the rooms are clean and have nice view, I love the panoramic window, the staff is very professional and helpful, they take care of you like in a luxury hotel - this guy sabri bouchaar is so friendly he showed a lot of patience explaining to me how to access the attractions around NYC.I definitely would like to repeat this experience.

Easy access, great neighborhood, modern, clean, quiet, and charming. As others have said, ask for a view. The room was large enough. Good use of space. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the skyline. Single woman traveling for business, and I felt perfectly safe. I love that they will hold your bags all day. I walked to Lombardi's for one of the BEST pizza's I have ever had so did not eat or drink at the hotel. Plenty of towels for one person. Bed VERY comfortable. Lots of plugs for all of our electronics. Also, I already had reservations at a neighboring hotel that charged my credit card as soon as the reservation was made, over a month ahead of my trip. That other hotel also charged me $70 for "fees & taxes." I phoned to find out exactly what those fees were, and what they were for…and kept looking online for better prices. This hotel was less expensive so I changed my reservations. THEY charged me $15 for taxes (no "fees.") That is quite a difference. I prefer boutique hotels, not chains, and this hotel definitely has that feeling. You will not be sorry if you stay here. Put on good walking shoes and walk to the WTC, Brooklyn Bridge, and up to Katz's, too. If you do not have the time or shoes for all of that walking, there are plenty of subway stops along the way. It was hard for me to walk by all of the fresh fruits and vegetables in many of the local shops.

I recently stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for four nights. The group I was traveling with arrived a little before check-in, but all of our (8) rooms were ready! My friend and I stayed on the 6th floor in a spacious room with two queen beds. Although there was hardly a view from the room, we could clearly see down to Bowery Street and Hester Street. The hotel was incredibly clean and well-maintained. The staff was nice and responded to our requests for various things (razors, more coffee cups, more towels) immediately. Despite the number of people staying at the hotel, we never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was nice too, but I have to agree with what a lot of people said about the shower door. Although the shower had nice pressure, the half-door allowed water to get on the floor. This wasn't a huge issue, though. The only other complaint I have is that there wasn't enough room to store/hang clothes. All in all, the Wyndham Garden Chinatown is a great hotel in a good location (close to two subway stops) and is reasonably priced for New York!

One of my GO TO place for quick trips to NYC. COnveniente, nicely located in Chinatown, 2 minutes from the subway. Very easy. Nice people. Nice restaurant open until late. If you need any kind of items, all the area is full of shops, supermarkets... really convenient. A colorful area in Manhattan :)
overall experience was average, place was clean but staff was not impressive and location is very busy

Nice place to rest after a long day in the city. The view is excellent with big windows. Our bathroom's wall was a big window which was nice but if you kept the curtain open all the neighbors could see you. The room price was a quite expensive but all the hotels in Manhattan are.

I was extremely pleased with my stay at the Wyndham and would recommend to anyone looking to be in downtown Manhattan. You are a quick walk from LES, East Village, Soho, etc. The rooms are clean and the service is very professional. You are in the middle of Chinatown but use that to your advantage and enjoy dim sum, asian markets, and other adventures in the area. This is not a high end hotel, but it's certainly better than average and great for the price/location.

I stayed here for two nights on business. I was basically only in the hotel to sleep. Very clean room, great shower. A little noisy from the street, but it's Manhattan, what do you expect? I put in earplugs to sleep. The room was a little stuffy and hot for my liking, and never really did cool down to my desired setting as input on the thermostat. Always felt very safe in the surrounding streets and neighborhoods, and even safer once in the hotel. (elevator access only with your room keycard)Great location for access to the surrounding Chinatown and Little Italy eateries and Lower Manhattan. I wasn't in town to access the super-touristy part of Manhattan (Times Square, Central Park, The Met, Broadway etc), so I can't speak to whether or not it's convenient for access to these areas.

This hotel is clean and modern, and some rooms have nice views. These are its only positives. As others have mentioned, the shower is terrible. Besides not having a properly designed partition to keep the rest of the bathroom dry, the water came from a tiny handheld and the pressure was a trickle. Despite not having much water for the shower, plenty got on the floor and we had to use all of the towels to mop it up. On the shower alone this hotel cannot be recommended.Ordered room service for breakfast; at 10am on a Saturday they had no bagels. After placing the order, they called back to say that the price list in our room was "outdated" and the prices were actually higher. We refused to accept this and after an argument they backed off. Then they called back to say they were out of yogurt. Food arrived cold and the order was incomplete, as they forgot the orange juice. I'm writing this after only one night on the chance that it might dissuade even a few more people from booking here. We're not going to move because it's too much of a hassle for just one more night. I'll update with any additional observations.

Bathroom a joke. The shower flooded the floor - always. There were no hooks. The shower made an endless screeching sound. The room was small. I reserved and paid for a king size bed, and was given a queen bed, which they called king. It wasn't. The bed was much too soft; it was uncomfortable sleeping in it. Overall, a poorly designed hotel.

Pros-Clean-New/modern-Pretty cheap (through hotels.com)-Good view/big window/glass outer wall-StylishThe only con was that the shower didn't have a door (modern design) and water accumulated on the bathroom floor.

My husband and I stayed for 15 days in this hotel but evething was very good that we decided to stay 35 days and we felt like we stayed in our house. All staff was very amazing, especially ours today dear friend Janice. Great location and service.

The first thing for us was to find the best location and this hotel has a very good location and it is located in China Towns and very close to Soho location (Soho is very good for shopping and restaurants). We think it much better than other locations as it has everything we wanted. Breakfast is downstairs and it is really nice breakfast. The room is very clean and comfortable and the cleaning people are exceptional. hotel employees are all with a mission to help and that is very good when you come from a country and you do not know the city. thank you and see you again.

The hotel was very clean. For a New York hotel, I expected a much smaller room. However, due to the layout of the room, it had beautiful asthetics and did not feel small at all. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and accomodating. They have a small computer center where you can print things on the first floor. Although my view of manhatten was a bit far, you could clearly make out the empire state building among other buildings. I loved my stay. The only weird thing I found was that there was no shower door in the bathroom; Just a portion of a dividing glass was meant to keep the water inside the shower area.

Good spot, close to two important subway stations (Bowery and Grand street) and a lot of Chinatowns true hotspots. Very kind and attentative staff. Rooms are of a good size for NY. Clean. Breakfast wasn't very popular and in the basement. Try that outside of the hotel. We paid a little more then €120 per night, which we found quite a bargain for NY-standards
user_location: Ouderkerk aan de Amstel, The Netherlands

review_body: Great hotel with fantastic access to Manhattan and Brooklyn. Service was excellent, overall good value.

I've been here a couple times with my girlfriend and a couple of friends. Everytime I've come here, all the staff members have been accommodative and make you feel like your at home. Kim, one of the front desk members was nice enough to upgrade my room for a great rate during Super Bowl weekend. My first time at this hotel, I was also upgraded to a more premium room as well. I didn't ask for it, but it was nice to be appreciated and given good customer service. This hotel is located in Chinatown, and within walking distances of some shopping shops and plenty of restaurants. Few things about the hotel; its very clean, with good spacing between rooms. The bathrooms were taken care of nicely and of course mentioned before the staff is very attentive wherever you go. They have a bar in the lobby and is a great little spot to relax a bit after a day strolling around New York. All in all, everything you expect when staying at a hotel. Staff showing much appreciation to their customers and making everyone's stay as comfortable and relaxing as can be. My friends and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone touring and I look forward to coming back in the future. Go check it out!
I had a very good stay.The location was great, the room was clean and comfortable, and the service, efficient and polite.

This was an amazing experience in a magical place. I mean, the view!! WOW!! I could the Empire State building and the Chrysler building from my room. It is only block aways from Little Italy. The service was AMAZING!!! The person who cleaned the room (Eulalia) was kind, professional and a really nice person. And Kim in the lobby was always a smiling face welcomong me whenever I came back from my long walks in NYC. Highly reccomended!!

We stayed here for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff here are lovely, always service with a smile. As everyone here keeps mentioning, the views over the city are fantastic. I can't fault the location either, I loved being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Chinatown and little italy is just footsteps away...If your a foodie you could spend days eating your away around these two areas. The rooms are nice, clean, modern & comfortable,. There are toiletries, coffee maker, movies(at extra cost) and a good selection of tv channels (including sports).. The hotel has two subway stations within 5 min walk so this made sightseeing convenient and easy, while helping to keep transport costs to a minimum. I thought this hotel was great value in comparison to similarly rated hotels in Manhattan, the rooms were an average size but were always kept immaculately clean by the housekeeping staff, I don't think I could have picked a better hotel for location, staff and value....I look forward to another visit :)

The hotel is located in an adequate part of Chinatown, but it can be awfully quiet going back there at night -- even just walking from the subway station. Soho is within walking distance, and that is pleasant when the weather is rightStaff is extremely friendly but the facilities are just adequate.My room on the second floor had no view whatsoever except for the A/C across the street. It was noisy when my neighbor was playing TV, and since it was across from the cleaning room, it was also noisy early in the morning when the cleaner took her shift.What I disliked the most was the shower, with very low water pressure and to boot designed so that you flood the bathroom every time.I chose this hotel because I was part of a conference but it is not my hotel of choice in NYC.
Great stay. The location was wonderful and the staff very professional. Highly recommend the Chinese bakery on Mott Street for breakfast/

The staff, specifically Vanessa, was very accommodating to our specific need. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The views from our upper room were spectacular. The hotel is in a good location, it is modern and very clean. We will stay here again!

The rooms are not sound-proof. The staff is very nice, as are the bar areas. The balcony is only open seasonally. There is optional on-site dining and food/drinks can be ordered to the room. Rooms are nice, though they need more lighting.

Perfectly situated at the corner of Chinatown, the Lower Eastside and Little Italy, the hotel is comfortable, convenient and quiet. The staff is welcoming and knowledgeable. The room is comfortable, stylishly modern, quiet, compact and clean. We had a lovely view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. The hotel is convenient to the Grand Street subway stop (B&D) which provides a direct and quick shot to Times square and good connections though out the city. It was nice to be in the middle of an actual neighborhood with abundant non tourist street life. Only negatives are the need for a few more towel hooks in the bathroom. The hotel felt more boutiquey than chain like. We will return.

My friend and I just got back from a two night stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. We were looking for a clean, quiet, reasonably priced place to stay close to Little Italy, China Town and the Village. We found it. The staff could not have been more professional and friendly. Every staff member we encountered greeted us in a genuinely friendly manner and asked us if they could be of any assistance. The room was spotless and despite what has been said on here was not too small. I wouldn't try squeezing two adults and two children into a room but for two adults, our queen deluxe room was more than adequate. Our room was located on the eight floor and we never heard a sound from the street. Our view of northern Manhattan via the floor to ceiling windows was awesome, especially at night. Canal Street shopping was just steps away, Little Italy dining about a five minute walk away, SOHO/NOHO shopping 5 to 10 minutes and Greenwich Village nightlife just a 15 to 20 minute walk away. If you are looking for a nice, clean place to stay that is centrally located, it would be hard to beat this place on price unless you choose one of those places with shared bathroom facilities. We are planning a trip back to New York in early May and will happily stay here again.

Stayed here 4 nights for a short visit to NYC. Hotel is new, great condition and rooms are nice for rate paid. However the hotel is very small with no drive way available for taxis which does cause a problem. I didn't really like the location as there were only Chinese shops and restaurants nearby, but I should have realised this with name! Had to walk 20-30mins to find Western food. There is a metro 10 min walk so transport into the centre is easily accessible. I would probably not stay in Chinatown on my next visit, prefer somewhere more mixed in terms of restaurant choice and avoid smell of local cuisine/cooking.

My wife and I just spent 3 nights at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. We are ex-New Yorkers and well...we're fussy about where to stay having been back and forth for the past 30 years. This hotel is clean, affordable, convenient for travel in and around both Manhattan and Brooklyn and great for restaurants. (Hint: do focus the shower nozzle on the wall to avoid splashing on the floor.) We did take the advice of other reviewers and stayed on the 8th floor. Great view and quiet from street noise and the party hall on the 18th floor. Comfy sheets, towels and bed and a well designed room making the most of a compact NYC hotel space. This is our first best choice from now on. Far better than many rooms we've stayed in that cost twice as much.

My wife and I have just returned today from 4 great nights at the Wyndam Garden Chinatown.The hotel is a little gem in the heart of Chinatown. Every part of the hotel was spotless and the service from all the staff was excellent. As previously mentioned the standard rooms are on the small side, but I would rather have a small, clean and well equipped room than a large dirty room any day. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from the floor to ceiling windows and the air con went from hot to cold whenever we wanted it too. Our only complaints concerning the room was that there was no extractor fan in the bathroom (which meant that the wallpaper (why?) is starting to peel away from the walls already) and that the double glazed windows could be a little thicker to cut down on the noise which could be heard from the surrounding roads despite being on the 12th floor. Every member of staff we had contact with were both friendly and efficient, which can often be a rarity in this city. The 18th floor also has a great bar where you can sit and enjoy the NYC skyline while sipping a cocktail, what more could you ask for in a hotel?All in all My wife and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and if we ever return to the city we would definitely consider staying here again.

We were impressed with the presentation & cleanliness of the hotel. The staff were friendly & obliging & always had a smile. The room was small but comfortable & had all necessities. Even a great view of the Empire State. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was cheap & cheerful & quick. Perfect start to a day exploring this Amazing city! Handy location to eateries & not to far to walk to the subway stations. Would definitely stay her again!

My husband and I were in town to see a favorite band play two nights at the Bowery Ballroom. The Wyndham Garden Chinatown was 3 blocks from the club and the price was right, so we booked it. We were very pleasantly surprised! Our room was not huge, but it was very, very nice and the view was great. The staff was very nice and helpful. We would certainly stay there again! The only down side was the fact that we couldn't find any restaurants in the neighborhood that were open around midnight.

This hotel is just SUPER!!!. The rooms are clean, spacious, there is even a coffeemaker, so you don't have to go out for your morning coffee or tea. The bed is comfortable, the staff is so helpful and friendly. The subway is in walking distance, so are, little Italy, Soho, Noho, Chinatown, Wallstreet, ....And do take a cocktail in the lounge in the evening, you'll have a nice view over the city.Enjoy your stay!

Great place to stay! Great location in Chinatown. Friendly staff.Our 10th floor room had amazing view of skyline. This was our annual birthdays stay in Manhattan and have stayed at a variety of different places over the years. However, we will be staying here from now on. Simply the best.

Probably the best hotel I've ever been to! It is extremely clean, has the best view from the room, and has a very comfortable bed. The location is also very convenient. Everything about this hotel is just fantastic! Definitely recommend!
Modern, clean, great location on Bowery between Chinatown and Little Italy. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. This has to be THE bargain of NYC.

Located in Chinatown we were very happy with this hotel. Subway was nearby, staff friendly, rooms small but with a great view to Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and all the others. We would stay there again definitely on our next trip to New York.

I'd recommend this place with an expiration date. I got the sense that this new modern marvel will age fast. If you don't know NYC Chinatown can be hectic. It's a great base for seeing everything in NYC. The hotel is close to subways and you can walk to: financial district, battery park, Brooklyn bridge, east village, Chinatown, little Italy, nolita, soho. The balconies are NOT private but the views are great and it's nice to have dome outdoor space in compact NYC. Overall I got the sense that the hotel/bar/restaurant were mis-managed, but it was still pretty new when I stayed here.

Third time around for business travel. Great property, location and staff.A special thank you to a fabulous staff--Ling, Kim, Janice, Jennifer, Matthew and Lindsay--who redefine the height of customer service.

The rooms at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown are tastefully appointed with a contemporary flair. The bed is fantastic, very comfortable. I had a slight issue with the shower as the glass door doesn't close and water always collects on the floor right outside the shower. It's a bit of a design flaw. Still, overall I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was excellent and when a pipe broke and we didn't have running water in our sink for a night, they brought us water bottles and accommodated our inconvenience by providing a limo to the airport. The surrounding neighborhood was great - exactly where we like to be in NYC.

Very good hotel with an attractive price in the heart of Manhattan. Clean, clear and comfortable. Just the breakfast downstairs not very welcoming, Too dark place ! Why not to use somewhere else in the hotel ?
Great, nice location, room was perfect, people was very frendly, my visit was really to this hotel was a really good experencie.

I decided to book a room in WGC after reading positive reviews on Trip Advisor and finding a good deal on hotels.com. The reviews did not deceive: our room was spacious for NY hotel standars, very clean, and had a modern feel. Despite Bowery being a busy street we were never bothered by noise during the night. We liked the floor-to-ceiling view from the window and the room was quite pleasant. We also appreciated the coffee/tea maker and complimentary sachets - and the free WiFi, of course! We once had breakfast in the hotel restaurant but I would not recommend it. It wasn't included in the room price and it was not any good. We're seasoned NYC visitors, so we didn't need much help from the staff, but they were always very polite. We had never stayed in Chinatown before. As a neighborhood, it's a little too 'specific' as far as things to do and see, but it was definitely interesting and colorful. We love Asian food, so it was fun exploring the restaurants nearby. Soho and Little Italy are really close, so it's easy to see other areas in lower Manhattan. Definitely better than staying in super-touristy and overwhelmingly busy Times Sq. Grand St is the closest subway station, and there are more stations in walking distance. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay and the value for money was unbeatable.
Great value, modern hotel in the heart of Chinatown. Fantastic cocktail bar on top floor with amazing view of Chrysler Tower, Empire State etc.Extremely helpful staff.

eOk, the hotel was neat and we had a beutiful wiew at a decent price. House keeping great but my overall impression was poor since the assistance at the front desk was negligible and unfriendly. I have not been compensated for a piece of clothing that was (mistakenly, I'm sure) removed from my room (and probably sent to laundry) and the conversation by @ has been sad.

We absolutely loved the location if this hotel. The best of NY is very accessible whilst the nightlife of Lower East Side is on your doorstep. The staff are pretty helpful (especially the very friendly man that frequents the lobby) and took our bags for the afternoon.The rooms are pretty small but reasonable and very clean with superb views of Midtown. However, we went to this hotel to sleep, and this was totally impossible on Friday and Saturday due to the club on 18th. It plays very loud base till around 4am. We were actually right under it in 1605 and it was appalling. The phone to reception wouldn't pick up and when it eventually did they couldn't help. Considering we paid extra to be that high (for the view) I actually think it's underhand of the hotel to sell us this room that they knew we couldn't sleep in. We were moved to 1602 for the Saturday and it was slightly better but the fixtures still vibrated. So, a pretty good hotel but you can't sleep at the weekends - which rather misses the point.

I loved almost everything abotu this hotel! The location is superb. It's an easy walk to the subway, Little Italy, Soho and you're in the middle of Chinatown. We arrived at 11am on our scheduled day of check in and they were able to accomodate us. The room is a little small, but that's not unusual for Manhattan. Everything was extremely clean and well maintained. I wasn't a huge fan of the shower, I was a little cold using it and one night the hot water was a bit iffy, but not a big deal in the grand scheme of things.All of the employees at this hotel appear to be well trained, we never met a person who didn't look us in the eye and say hello. Additionally, I twice called down to the front desk and asked for items to be brought up to the room. Each time the item was delivered in under 5 minutes.I didn't try the hotel restaurant because there are so many options in the immediate area. I strongly recommend going into one of the many Chinese bakeries int he vicintiy and getting a snack or breakfast there. The buns are delicious and each one is enormous and $.85. This hotel is so much more interesting than most of the hotel in homogenous Times Square. Break away and try something different, you'll be glad you did! I will absolutely stay here the next time I am in town.

The hotel is located in the middle of china town, close to 3 metro lines. The hotel is new and the staff is very friendly. Near the hotel there are many restaurants and shops.The rooms are comfortable and very well equipped, there is a kettle with coffee and tea. Recommended.

Stayed two nights and enjoyed every moment. We had to take the subway if we were headed north, but for the price this fairly new hotel was excellent. The staff members we're very helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again for the same price.

My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown and were very happy with our stay. In the past we've stayed in Midtown but we were thrilled to stay on the LES: MUCH better value and zero tourists.THE HOTEL:Modern, recently built, immaculately clean. WIFI is fast, reliable and FREE. Service was courteous and prompt if not overly friendly. We parked our car for the week & were satisfied with the nightly rate offered through the hotel. We skipped the lobby bar and hotel restaurant (so many other options in NYC) but the lobby bar always had a few people enjoying a drink. On a Thursday night we tried the 18th floor rooftop bar because we were too tired to go elsewhere. Great view but strong odour of stale cigarettes, terrible music (One Direction & other teeny bop pop) that staff kept changing mid-song, sickly sweet drinks at prices that rivaled seriously good cocktail lounges ($14ea), and the place was EMPTY. Don't go.THE ROOM: We reserved a 16th floor queen and had jaw-dropping views of the Freedom Tower, financial district, Manhattan bridge & Brooklyn bridge. Room was quite small but totally acceptable for NYC (this isn't Vegas!) and we had enough room for our small/med suitcases and all our shopping bags. Room was stylish and well laid-out, bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable. Nice bathroom with tub/shower combo; believe all other floors are shower only. On weekends I could hear a bit of bass coming from the rooftop bar two floors above, but it didn't prevent us from getting to sleep.THE NEIGHBOURHOOD:On the Lower East Side in Chinatown/The Bowery near the border of Little Italy. Since NYC's LIttle Italy keeps shrinking you'll see far more Chinese markets, shops and restos than Italian ones. Go to Brooklyn for Italian instead (Juliana's Pizza in DUMBO, 1 subway stop from hotel). Walk 15min in any direction and you'll hit Soho, Nolita, Tribeca, East Village, Tenement Musuem. Can't beat this location. To go further afield, walk 2 blocks to Grand St subway station (lines B&D) or 3-4 blocks to Canal St station for trains running uptown, further downtown, and to Brooklyn (lines 6, J, N, Q, R, Z, 4).OVERALL:Exeptional value, I can't think of a time I've gotten more value per dollar spent. Wonderful hotel in a great jumping-off-point for your NYC adventures.

Well located, clean, and kind of fun, somehow, this place is a great option for NYC travelers. Our only complaint is that they sometimes rent out a bar or function room on one of the upper floors for parties and the noise can be extremely disturbing for many floor below.

I have stayed in NYC many times, but this was my first hotel in Chinatown. Wyndham is a chain and the Wyndham Garden hotels seem to be their “value for money-selection”.The Wyndham Garden Chinatown is situated next to Chinatown and Little Italy on the busy Bowery Street with the new art museum next to you. Ungrounded stations as well as public busses are nearby.The hotel itself is rather small but well functioning with a very nice and helpful staff. Rooms are small but clean with a good bed. We definitely missed a sitting group in the room, where bed or desk-table was only possibilities of sitting down. There is a (empty) fridge in room as well as coffee machine.Some rooms are with a balcony for which you pay extra. Don’t do- it is not worth the money as you cannot sit out there and it is shared with rooms next to you.Prices are fair but normally without breakfast. You can eat in the hotel restaurant or at numerous restaurants and bakeries’ nearby.Absolutely a good and fair alternative to the many hotels I NYC further up-town.

I stayed here for 1 night after my flight was cancelled due to snow in NY. I booked a balcony room but when I viewed it I then downgraded to a regular room. The balcony rooms seem to be on the lower floors with no view. My ‘basic’ room had superb views through floor to ceiling glass.The rooms are a reasonable size and the bathroom fittings and accessories are good quality. The room and hotel generally was very clean which is not always the case in NYC. The bar on the top floor is managed by a different company to the hotel. It offered lovely views and friendly bar staff. Although quiet mid-week I’m sure it could get very busy at weekends.Good price for a clean and new hotel with complimentary internet made this hotel a great choice.

I loved this hotel the first time I stayed here mid last year. This time, I booked a room with a balcony (was upgraded to this room last time). I arrived in my room on the 7th floor and the room was small, a queen bed and the balcony door was jammed shut but the snow, as it hadn't been cleared. Asked to be moved and was put downstairs on the 2nd floor, to a larger room with a King bed and again no access to the balcony. Kind of pointless charging extra for a balcony, if you can't access it, even in the winter. The room was freezing cold and we had to get additional heaters in the room. The rooms are lovely...good beds and desk area. The room was big, hence hard to heat. I suggest the best option are the balcony rooms on the 17th floor, which are smaller. heat better and also have baths and great views over Manhattan.The staff are a mixed bunch. The men are so unbelievably friendly and welcoming but some of the women behind the desk are just indifferent. The phone to call reception didn't work for the whole stay and I had to run down to complain about the cold. Internet is pretty good and water for $1 in the room is good value. The bathrooms are nicely equipped too. Even the small gym is well thought out.I am really disappointed the stay was not as good as last time, as I love the location and want this hotel to be great. It has so much potential but just didn't get it right this time. I may be looking elsewhere next time I come to New York.
The room is very tidy, clean and comfortable.The bed is comfortable and the cleaning is carried out daily.I recommend it

From the views, location, and service, this is an excellent place to stay! The management and front desk staff are very kind and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. I have stayed at this location several times now and will be staying there again soon!

We stayed here for our first visit to NY in Jan 2014. The room was a little smaller than anticipated but perfectly fine for our needs. The staff were always helpful and chatty and the room was kept spotlessly clean. The location is great - easy access to subways and walking distance to china town and soho areas. My only gripe was the layout of the shower - the design of which made it impossible not to get water all over the floor.Overall a great hotel. Would definitely recommend!!!

I recently stayed at this hotel for a wedding a block away. The accommodations were excellent, but the service from the lobby staff was "over the top"!! Three lovely ladies stand out especially; Nadia, Rushika and Janes. They couldn't be more helpful with everything from directions, to bandaids to securing a taxi. One night the weather was freezing cold and a taxi was nowhere in sight of the entrance to the hotel.
