One of these gals, I think it was Janes, unbelievable as it may sound…said the cabs are easier to get around the corner….then she disappeared and 10 minutes later she appears, stepping out of the cab that she personally hailed down from me around the block. I was blown away. I have stayed at a lot of fancy hotels and resorts, but have never seen such personal and extraordinary service. I thank you all for a very memorable stay. The hotel stay receives 5 stars because of the staff and their service.

The location is great!! Near amazing asian restaurants and the subway. Rooms are very clean but not so spacious (though its common in new york city). Great staff and room service. Definitely worth it.

Booked this after I read a review in the Sunday Times in the UK. $150 per night, asked for a high room with a view and got probably the best view in NY. Looking straight up the city with floor to ceiling windows across the whole room.Great staff, brilliant location to get into soho on foot or jump on the subway, easy to get across the river to JFK too.

We had a great stay at Wyndham Garden. The room was big, new, very clean and with a GREAT view of NY skyline, the bed and pillows were really comfortable, there was a coffee machine with complimentary coffee each morning. The reception staff were very polite and helpful. The location is...Chinatown, which is not perfect but one street across the hotel starts Little Italy and Soho which IS perfect!! Even more perfect is the value, I don't think you can find a best value-for-money hotel in NYC.

i usually only use hotels for very short stays, if you get my drift, but i got stuck in a snow storm and found availability here for a nightit was clean and the staff was nicewe ate at the bar where we got good service and had great sushi rollsthis place is perfect if you are asian or not

An extended business trip came up suddenly just before the holidays and I suffered sticker shock when I saw midtown rates, so I looked for other options. I am so glad I found this. Let’s start with location. Midtown it’s not, but Chinatown works great. Not only is the local food good, inexpensive, and plentiful, but you are only steps away from NY’s Little Italy. Neighborhoods such as The Lower East Side and SoHo are within a reasonable walking distance.Finding a cab has always been easy. There is a bus stop on the corner and the Grand Street station of the B and D lines is right around the corner. The D train can take you to the Barclay’s Center in Brooklyn nonstop. Either train can take you to Macy’s in midtown in three stops, Rockefeller Center in five. Other train stations are available a few blocks away.The staff is very well trained and exceptionally friendly and helpful. Although moderately priced for New York, this is a full service hotel, with several lounges, a restaurant and room service.Insiders tip: get a room with a bath tub and ask for the ‘Empire View’.

Staff was wonderful. Room was spacious for NYC and cleanest I have been in there. I have seen complaints about the bathroom but it's modern, clean, great water flow and piping hot water when required. So the shower has a glass wall so what, it's a hot shower in a clean bathroom. D/B Grand Street subway about a minute walk. R/Q a little further down Canal but still walking distance. Cleaning staff A+ Front Desk and Management A+, we were on third floor so can't comment on view but can comment on great room and very comfortable beds and pillows. Staff also arranged car service to Airport for us and it was right on time. Bar in the lobby is a nice touch and bartender was fantastic. For the price we paid and the service we received, cannot recommend higher and I am in NYC at least once a year. Best so far!!

Stayed here in Feb and it is a beautiful brand new hotel, great rates and really a fine location because you hop on the subway and wallah you are anywhere NYC.Great resturaunt in bottom floor (basement).Great bar on 1st floor (lobby).Rooms small but beautiful.The devils in the details and they get the details right.

Good location, clean rooms and great value for money. It's easy to walk to Nolita for trendy cafes or a bit further to the LES where everyone seems to go to drink and party. There was train station one block from the hotel but its the less frequent B line.Our room was big for a Manhattan hotel, especially at these prices. The hotel is new so all the fixtures were clean. The bathroom looks cool with a modern fit out - however there is no shower door and the bathroom flooded each time we used the bathroom. You get given all the toiletries you could need. It sounds a bit dumb but we really liked the coffee machine in the room. The windows are so high and big it was nice lying in bed watching it snow outside while drinking hot coffee.The staff were nice and they didn't have a whiff of attitude.If you are on a budget or don't want to spend all of your holiday money on accommodation I would definitely recommend the Wyndham Gardens Chinatown.

Everything about my stay was perfect, from making reservations, to the very nice room with a great view from the 16th floor, to the helpfulness of the staff while I was there, to the helpfulness of the staff after I'd departed—when they did me a favor by securing and emailing a receipt from the car company that took me to the airport, which I had forgot to get from the driver.
If you are a fan of China Town, this is a great location! Clean hotel, helpful staff and many great places to eat!
Great except bathroom in lobby dirty; shower in room spurts water all over floor; restaurant food overpriced. Awesome location and room for price.

Excellent stay, great views, helpful staff, clean rooms, quiet floor (8th). First room was right at the elevator which I try to avoid. Front desk changed it no problem to a room as far away from the elevator as possible. Wouls stay again if the price was right.

The location was great and all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful in every way. The rooms are tight but not unusual for nyc. The bathrooms are large and beautiful. Two blocks from little Italy and right at the corner of chinatown without being in the heart if it all, this was the perfect place for a family, business traveler, or young couple. My only complaint was that Sat night, I could hear the faint noise from what seemed to be a night club until 3am.

When travelling to Manhattan one of the biggest challenges is finding a hotel with great location and reasonable price ( compared to New York). We booked a room at the Wyndham Garden. Really great location, two minute walk form the major underground stations. Staff is very helpful and kind. We forgot something at the hotel and they were very helpful and understanding. Rooms are small but clean and pleasant.

My husband and I wanted a hotel room that was close to subway station. I am Chinese so it is an awesome location to eat Chinese food. We stopped at joe shanghai for the dumplings one night and we got our dim sum restaurant fix that you have to take an escalator up to the second floor where dining room is located. Both restaurants are a couple blocks from hotel. The subway is only 2 blocks away. I have to admit it smells when you get to street level, but you will live. I would also suggest to park your car at a garage one block away vs. paying more at hotel. We love visiting NYC and walking everywhere. We walked everywhere and usually walked to Central Park one way then walk back some of it black to hotel or hop onto subway. We had a beautiful view of the skyscrapers at night all lit up. The room and bathroom are small,but it is modern, clean, and has everything you would want including a little refrigerator.

Hotel is in a great location! Room was clean. Would have liked an exhaust fan in the bathroom and stronger water pressure in the shower. Staff were very professional and helpful. They stored our luggage after check-out. All in all the Wyndham was a winner! Would return if I needed a place to stay in that part of the city again.

We first stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown 1 year ago, while attending a trade show in the area. in Feb 2013 we had an excellent experience here - I believe it was newly opened. The staff were friendly, the hotel seemed well put together, and the rooms were impressive with floor to ceiling windows, and a nice design in each room.What a difference a year makes. We returned this week - Feb 2014, for the same trade show, and decided to play it safe by staying at the same hotel we thought was so great last year.So far, we've already had two opportunities to experience how bad this hotel has become, and we still have two nights left!After our first night here, we placed the DND sign on the door, so that we weren't disturbed early in the morning by housekeeping (we'd had a long drive from Ohio, through a snowstorm - we wanted to sleep in a little). When we left the hotel around 10am, we took the DND off the door, and assumed (as most people would) that housekeeping would come and clean our room by the time we returned later.This didn't happen. We returned to the same messy room we left. We called the front desk, and they said they would send someone up to make up the room - I asked if they could come in around 45 mins, since we would be going out again at that time - they told me to call back when we were leaving, and they would send someone then.We called back before we left. We spoke to someone else, who acted like it wasn't normal to clean a room in the evening - a different reaction to the first person we spoke to (45 minutes before). They said they would send someone though. 5 minutes later, a maintenance guy knocks on the door, and hands us a pile of sheets - as if we were supposed to make our own bed. We were confused - and said we wanted the room made up. He took the sheets back and said he'd come back - which didn't make sense - he was a maintenance guy (working on the elevator), not a room cleaner.On the way out, we spoke to the front desk. This time, they told us they "don't have anyone to clean rooms at night", and accused us of leaving our DND sign on the door all day. We told them we didn't. At this point, all 3 of the people at front desk disappeared into a back room to "check something". The one lady came back out, and rudely said "yeah, your room was on DND so we didn't clean it". They said something along the lines of "we only have the maintenance guy here, but we'll see what we can do". We just asked that they get the room cleaned, and we left. No-one should be spoken to in that way, when they're paying for a hotel room - not at any any price , or any place. What kind of hotel expects its guests to make their own bed?! What kind of hotel doesn't have at least one cleaner on hand to deal with a room?!I noticed that their checkout time is 12pm, so they MUST clean rooms after midday - and our DND sign was definitely off the door by 10 - 10:30am.Anyway, we came back a couple of hours later, and the room was made up - not sure if it was done by the maintenance guy, the front desk people, or what... but it was done.After an evening of being extremely frustrated - more by the way we were spoken to, and told that we were liars, rather than the fact that the room wasn't cleaned - we came back to our (finally) cleaned room, to hear thumping bass from music - coming from somewhere in the hotel.We assumed it was probably in a room just above us, or just below - and tried to go to sleep - hoping it would end soon. By 12am, we still hadn't slept, all we could hear was bass. When we put our head on the pillows, it was like the bass was literally vibrating through our pillows into our ears.We called the front desk to ask that they look in to the music - hoping that they could find which room it was and ask them to stop. They acted like they didn't know what it was, but they would have the security guy come up and check our floor.about 1am, the music was still going on - and we still hadn't slept. We called back, and this time the front desk told us that there was a party going on on the 18th floor (we were on the 9th floor), and it was someone's birthday and they were "celebrating" - but he would go up there and ask them to turn the music down. (How did the story switch from not knowing what it was, to a party on the 18th floor?! And how can we hear their music 9 floors down?).Anyway, the music never got quieter, despite the front desk telling us that they turned it down. Clearly nothing was going to happen to resolve this, so we just kept trying to sleep, and probably got to sleep close to 3-4am.That was when I read some other people's reviews on tripadvisor, and where we found out that the "City View" on the 18th floor, was actually some sort of night club, not owned by the hotel, and that they have no control over.Why the lying? Why act like you don't know what it is? I can't imagine that no one on any floor between 9 and 18 hadn't complained about the thumping bass vibrating through their expensive hotel room. I'd hate to be on one of the more "premium" rooms, closer to the 18th floor.So... as I said - we have 2 nights left - we're not happy with the hotel (after being extremely happy 1 year ago - which is a shame). We are going to speak to management this morning - but regardless, people should know about this ridiculous night club on the 18th floor, that clearly isn't sound-proofed appropriately.If you're going to open a venue in a hotel, FINE - but sound proof it properly! When you can hear the music 9 floors down, that clearly hasn't been done.Extremely disappointing that Wyndham would let this happen. Also extremely disappointed in the way Wyndham employees treated and spoke to us, and the fact that the don't have appropriate staff available around the clock. It's a hotel - not a 9-5 business.I look forward to the generic management response that I've seen on everyone else's post here. If management isn't helpful today, when we speak to them, I'll simply use my credit card dispute option, to claim that we didn't receive the service we paid for, and get our money back.

I was sent to NYC Chinatown on business and this hotel was initially selected because it was very near where I was going and meant I did not need an expensive car, or to take a lot of cabs. To my delight, it was a lovely newly renovated property. The room was smallish, but well appointed and efficient and perfectly fine for a week's stay. The subtle Asian theme was calm, soothing, and very comfortable. The associated restaurant, Elevate, was also a treat. The service there was impeccable and the food was excellent.

The hotel is clean, the rooms are a decent size for Manhattan, and the area isn't bad at all. What's lacking here is management: no one seems to be in charge. For instance, the desk clerks aren't on the same page: one will tell you that to get a cab to the airport you should phone the front desk ahead of time to let them secure a car; then, when you phone the front desk ahead of time, someone else will answer and tell you that the front desk doesn't arrange taxis. We stayed five nights and this sort of thing happened consistently.This sort of disorganization becomes a significant liability in extreme circumstances, as was illustrated one night when the fire alarms went off. A party was going on--either on the roof or the top floor--and it was attended by numerous people who were not guests at the hotel. Most of these people were very young, very loud, and very drunk, and my guess is that one of them thought it would be hilarious to pull the alarm. Anyway, it was around 1 a.m., and guests were pouring into the hallways, asking, "Is it real? Should we evacuate?" This was during the recent cold wave, so people were hesitant to rush outdoors into the 13 degree night. Incredibly, there were no employees to be seen or heard from: none in the halls, none at the desk, none directly outside the hotel. I have no idea where they disappeared to. It was a total fiasco.However, the worst was yet to come. Once the fire department had left, it was virtually impossible for guests to get back to their rooms. The non-guest goofballs from the party upstairs took over the one working elevator. I now became aware of three employees: two security personnel who kept fiddling with the alarm--which kept going off randomly--and a seeming manager who stood watching the mess as if it were someone else's problem. There was no organization: no one saying, "Guests on the first two or three floors, please use the stairs back to your rooms; guests on higher floors, line up at the elevator; goofballs from the party, step back." Once I complained to him, thirty minutes later, he began to take action, asking the party people to please turn loose of the elevator and allow paying guests of the hotel to get back to their rooms first. For the next two hours, the alarm kept going off every fifteen minutes or so, ringing for about a minute or two. There was no explanation from management, and no one answering the phone at the desk.This sort of thing isn't going to happen very often, I know, so I still rate the hotel a solid 3 because it has lots of merits. But God help you if you're staying there when management has to take action in unusual circumstances . . . because, at present, employees lack training.
It's roomier and cleaner with better service than other more expensive hotels I've stayed in in Manhattan. Highly recommended.
A very warm welcome in a very cold city. 7°F outside and then the windchill !! Helpfull friendly staff and comfortable room. - Thanks a lot.

This hotel is so well located.. It has 2 subway stations nearby - one is 2mins walk and the other might be 6-8mins away. You are in Chinatown, walking distance to soho,tribeca, east village,little italy. Shopping and eating are so easy with plenty of choices. The restaurant in evening serving deliiicious japanese food is highly recommended - our waiter Calvin, on the 2 occasions we ate there is excellent! He exceeded our expectations. We were there for 7days and were on 2nd floor. We were very afraid of noises but you hear very little, Not disturbed by traffic like other hotels we stayed in NY. Our room was very big with a massive share balcony (so dont go out on your underwear!). The toiletries are very good quality. The only cons are the breakfast: choices are limited, no fresh vegs and fruits, and the shower door: too much water running out. Would have been good if the hotel installed a sliding door. But thats minor issues, as there are plenty of coffee shop, bakery and other shops to go for breakfast. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and recommend that hotel. We'll be back there next time we're in NY :-)

This hotel was great - excellent location and great value for money - less than $200 per night in Manhattan is hard to find.... It's on the border of Little Italy so not right in the centre of Chinatown. Perfectly located for the best pizza in Manhattan - Lombardi's! The Metro stations are for several different lines are within easy walking distance. Had breakfast once which was OK for the price. although, as with any hotel breakfast, you're better off at an NYC cafe!The staff were friendly and courteous throughout the stay, and both the bar in the lobby and the 18th Floor lounge were great - happy hour cocktails especially :-)The best thing about the hotel is the view - amazing views up Bowery towards The Empire State and Chrysler, and also towards the Freedom tower from our corner room - loved waking up to that every morning...The room size was also pretty good for a Manhattan hotel, the bathroom was one of the larger ones we've had, if you're expecting Vegas size rooms don't go to NYC!Overall had a fab stay at this hotel over the New Year period and it will be top of the list for when we return :-)
It was ~10°f outside and the heat was broken in our room. The balcony door in our room was also wedged open all weekend. It was ridiculously cold.

It says Chinatown, but that shouldn't give you any second thoughts. I admit I was hesitant to book this property for my tour group, but took a chance and I'm so glad I did! I am a group travel planner and have booked over 16 small group trips to NYC. Most of my travelers are women on shopping, sightseeing and theater get a ways, so location and safety are a huge concern for me. 3 factors make this hotel a great option for individual or group travel. First, the LOCATION is not on a side street "in Chinatown", but near Little Italy on Bowery, one of the main streets running through the city. Yes, there are a few "Chinese shops" in the area, but the busy, crowded area you think of when hearing Chinatown, is several blocks away. Directly in front of the hotel is Hester Street, which in 4 short blocks leads you to Mulberry, the main street running through Little Italy. A safe, easy walk to the right on Mulberry, then left on Prince , leads you to SOHO, a great place for shopping and dining. Along the way you will pass numerous places for drinks, dinner or late night desserts. Behind the hotel is the Grand Street Subway Station, which is ideal for going anywhere else in the city. All the women said they felt safe going there. Location made it easy to catch a cab and hotel made other transportation arrangements to and from the airport for the ones flying in the group, less than I'd priced it myself. There is a lane in front of the hotel, easily blocked off for the tour bus to pull up and unload, very unusual for NY. Secondly, because many NYC hotels have impressive lobbies, but the rooms are old and musty, QUALITY was important to me. This Wyndam hotel is new, rooms are spacious, beds are unbelievably comfortable and furnishings are beautiful. The 'glass wall/windows lounge" upstairs was perfect for a romantic view with drinks and the conference room with glass wall/windows was equally impressive for our groups breakfast on arrival. Finally CUSTOMER SERVICE of the staff was a must, because satisfying over 50 women at one time is almost impossible. Lindsay, the Sales Director, was professional, easy to work with, and handled even the simplest details, making my group feel first class. The front desk staff was patient, courteous and even helped with luggage when needed. All the Managers on Duty I dealt with, welcomed my group like we were part of the movie crew filming there at the time making us feel just as important. I will not hesitant to book this hotel again for my groups and will be staying there myself when traveling alone to NY in the near future.
user_location: Rock Ridge, North Carolina, United States

review_body: We were very happy with our stay. It was absolutely beautiful and con=mfortable. The view from the bedrooms were absolutley amazing! Loved it...Loved it...Loved it and the price was great for NYC. Close to train for easy acces to other locations.

The hotel is new, clean, service is great, no problems whatsoever. The view from the room is great - I have never had such a view in NYC! But the room... It was the smallest room I have ever had! I have no idea how they took the picture you can see on the web:-))). Get a room on a higher floor. Also the room service - if you want your breakfast right, you must specify everything!

The hotel and staff were fine and we certainly enjoyed New York! The rooms were really clean and tidy and the top floor bar is great. However, the location is not great. Chinatown is very scruffy and unfriendly and is only saved by being next to Little Italy, which has much better restaurants.

This hotel is nice and new, in a great location, and I really like my room. Location: Right in China-town. A block from Little Italy. Two doors down from one pretty cool karaoke club! Walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge. Manhattan! My Room: Pretty good view. Also, it was spacious for NYC standards, new, clean, and I quite enjoyed the bathroom. The decor was all around nice in the room.The lobby was clean, quiet, and not very big like some NYC hotels. That's ok. The restaurant looked a little boring and was tiny.I wonder if anyone ever eats there.  Overall, good value, and I would absolutely stay here again. I sort of wanted to keep this hotel a secret, but ...surprise!

We feel like we lucked in to a moderately priced but excellent hotel with friendly staff in a location that had lots of interest for us, right in Chinatown, very near Little Italy, not far from SoHo, walking distance to Union Square, loads of great restaurants nearby, and two or more subway stops 2-6 blocks away. Plus leaving NYC by car was so easy - drive west down Canal St. (a block from the hotel), into the Holland Tunnel. Valet parking was easy as pie, and we had some kind of package that gave us free parking as well as a $25 discount, called a "gas credit." Breakfast was certainly adequate, and every staff person we interacted with was pleasant and helpful if we needed anything. The rooftop bar turned out to be too noisy for our taste, but the view looking north up Bowery, with the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building on the immediate horizon, was fantastic.

The hotel was clean and modern. We were near the subway station and able to visit most of city in 15 min. The best part of the hotel was the staff. When we arrived my wife was not feeling well and Ms. Castillo was so helpful and was able to get us checked in early. The staff goes above and beyond for their guests, this by far one of the best hotel experiences I have had. We had a wonderful trip and highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting the sights.

Nothing spectacular about this hotel, other than the price. But we get it, its NYC. Here's the problem though. There is a property called City View (actually a lease) that is a night club. It occupies the 18th floor. Unbeknownst to any guest, unless you stayed before and were gluttons for punishment and returned, City View stays open until 4:00am! I called down to the desk at 1:30 after the bass had been pulsing through my body a half an hour. That's when I found out about their closing time. They said but "often the music stops at 3:30, not 4. Thanks you idiot. He did offer to move our room though....at 2am? Really? So the next morning I spoke with the ladies at the front desk and they apologized, saying that "must have been tough to sleep through, but you know, we don't even know how late or how loud they'll be on any given weekend because they aren't owned by us". What a joke. They didn't comp our room and if they hadn't billed my American express card the day I booked it, two months ago, I would have cancelled the whole transaction. They did comp us 2 $10 continental breakfasts for our troubles and moved us to the 6th floor for our second night. You could still hear City View on that floor but at a much lower decibel thankfully. Very unprofessional by Wyndham. Too bad too because I have stayed at many of their other properties before. Not again though.

We got a great package price for the hotel through Expedia or Travelocity, which included parking and a $25 rebate for gas, but we'd go back even without those benefits. We loved the location -- great food of all types (Chinese, Vietnamese, Italian, and more) -- all within walking distance. Beautiful new hotel with amazing views of Manhattan. We were upgraded to the 15th floor and rooms on that floor have balconies looking out to the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was really quite reasonable for hotel fare -- the continental had choices and the staff was very agreeable. The valet parking was excellent and we were assured it was safe enough to leave a bag of odds and ends in the car, something we wouldn't ordinarily do. Only slight negatives for us: the lighting was a little low (and unflattering in the bathroom), no dressers (but that's OK for a short trip), and the music in the rooftop lounge was too loud for us middle-aged folks (but there were 2 other places to catch a nightcap in the hotel and the view from the rooftop was the same as in our room, so it didn't matter to us).
loved location, room and restaurants/bars. people were all very helpful and friendly when i asked advice or directions. would definantly go back and refer others. a great trip!
i love this property i feel like i am at home the staff is wonderfuli will staying there again in marchthank you
They do not have full shower doors, only half. Water gets everywhere always. Beautiful room otherwise. Very close to the trains. Great food everywhere.

The front desk staff members were exceptionally helpful and pleasant. The room was comfortable and the amenities provided were definitely a plus. If any of you happen to stop by the front desk, Katie is definitely the 'IT' lady to talk to!!

I selected this hotel on 3 things. Nice and not expensive ( low $200 ). Low cost of food ( $10-$20 ) in Little Italy and Chinatown at walking distance. Also, there are the usual fast foods which I used mainly for breakfast. And finally, the subway stations that I needed are no more than 3 blocks. First, I made my trip from JFK airport through Air-Train $6. Then took the J Train to Delancey Station $2.50. Three blocks away at Bowery-Hester intersection is the hotel. Then used the Grand Street Station one block away and the Canal Sreet Station 4 streets away for all my needs.

Clean and modern hotel! The staff was outstanding - always super friendly and helpful to us. Our room was on the 12th floor and we had an incredible view of NYC - one could see the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building. In my opinion the room size was perfectly fine; it was comfortable and definitely not too small for a couple. The bathroom was very beautiful as well. There is only thing that I can criticize, which is the shower experience (as others mentioned here before). There should be a full door- but since there is only 1/2 shower door, the floor gets really wet and it can be quite dangerous once you try to get out of the shower. Still, I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in NYC.
The hotel was fine very close to subway, nice staff very neat and clean. Nice small friendly bar in the lobby to the corner nice and private but small.

we stayed at the Wyndham Garden because we were getting married at Manhattan's city hall and the hotel is just a short taxi ride from it. The day we arrived, as we gotta out the plane, I started feeling dizzy and disoriented(probably dehydrated) we got there mid-morning and check in time was not until 3pm but the front desk people were absolutely charming and gave us a room immediately, while riding the elevator I started getting ill again and a gentleman (do not have his name) who works at the hotel help us got to the room and as I was told by my partner he stayed we us making sure we were ok, the hotel manager (Janice Hamza) came to the room also to assure my partner that the hotel could bring a Dr or make arrangements to go to a hospital. Fortunately I was better after a couple of hours but I have to appreciate that I have never felt as welcome to any hotel as I did at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown- (afterwords everybody kept asking me how I felt) . Very courteous staff, professional management, great location (quiet rooms and we were facing Chinatown) new clean and modern rooms, a great experience.

Wyndham Garden was perfect for our 4 night stay. Our son lives 2 blocks away and the subway is only 1 block away. Great location for walking to various sites too. Room was as good size, clean, with all the amenities. Staff was very helpful. But the best part, bar none, were the floor to ceiling windows in our room with a clear view of the Empire State & Chrysler Bldgs.Will stay there again.
Awesome hotel overall. Nothing bad about it. Friendly and helpful staff, great room, cool rooftop bar...etc.

The room was very small, but the view from our 15th floor balcony was incredible. The neighborhood is full of small Chinese bakeries where you can grab a great steamed bun in the morning. The location is off the beaten path for someone who's used to midtown, but the bus is right outside the hotel, and there are several subway lines within 3 blocks. The hotel is spotless, and the staff is wonderful. For the right price, I would stay again.
The lack of a shower door was a concern. Maybe better drainage would solve my concern. Everything else was great!

Never having stayed in Chinatown before I was a bit apprehensive, but my usual midtown hotels were sold out so I gave this a try. I am glad I did. The location is a short walk to the subway and cabs are plentiful. All staff members seem to be well trained on the art of customer satisfaction.

I booked my room in Oct two days before i am to check in, in Dec i am told that i will have to move rooms in the middle of my stay due to a video shoot. Now they tryed to make it right, but it just wasnt the same. I had chose a room with a sitting area and a balcony. Due to we had friends and family that was just going to want to hang out with us. I was made to feel like our money was not important. I would stay here again!!! Loved the location and the staff. I just would not ever plan something specail at this hotel again.

Staying at this hotel helped us enjoy our stay in Chinatown NYC. The front desk people were very helpful in their guidance of Manhattan. Our room had a view of the city skyline (Empire state building, Chrysler building, etc.) It was clean with a contemporary feel to the decorating.
The hotel in attractive, the staff is outstanding, and it's in walking distance of Soho, TriBeCa, And the East Village.

Stayed here the weekend before Christmas for about $125/night! Are you kidding? I expected to pay more than double that price! I felt better knowing that TripAdvisor ranked the place #41 in NYC..... and now I know why. Clean, fresh, stylish architecture and decorating in a super location near Soho, Little Italy, etc. The Chinatown location is a bustling, safe, interesting area. Would highly recommnend as a real value in NYC! Thanks much to Janice (and everyone on the staff) for being so welcoming and accomodating. We will certainly return!Andrew Julian

We have always enjoyed staying at this hotel. However, during our last stay, we were kept from sleeping because the hotel had rented its bar facilities on the 18th floor and a very loud party was going on. Apparently this is not an uncommon occurrence; we have also learned that the noise from such parties often travels down as far as the 9th floor. So, if you stay below the 9th floor, or if the hotel is not having a party the night you stay, you will probably enjoy this hotel. If not, you probably won't. I think this hotel needs to decide whether it wants to be a hotel or a party venue.

Cool new hotel in Chinatown! Clean and new and I hope they can maintain it. Our room is on 7th floor facing Bowery runs below. View of Empire State to the right and Freedom Tower to the left! Lovely non-private balcony. Bed very comfortable. Clean room. Very small - don't let pictures fool you. Super friendly staff.I can tell a lot of effort went into the design of the room, but it's a bit awkwardly arranged. Barely enough room for bed, small desk, and office chair. Bathroom generously sized but totally lacks counter space. Shower looks nice, but function is horrible. As others have stated, you have to put towels on the floor since glass partition is no where near adequate. Handheld shower wand is really a pain. You have to work to take a shower in this bathroom. Not relaxing. Had to run the cold water faucet to get hot water in shower. They went with cool mod bathrooms, but totally failed on functionality. Room is crammed, bathroom is big yet no counters and horrible shower. I have one more night to stay…nice but not so nice. Because of shower and cramped space I have "poor" rating to room despite great view and comfy bed.

First time in New York was made a memorable trip by this hotel. The room was clean and tidy, bathroom was bright and new towels given every day. Floor to ceiling windows and most amazing views of the skyline! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had issue with our bill which supposed to be paid by our travel agent, but the manager Janice handled everything and gave us free brunch. She was very apologetic and really sincere about helping us. Overall one I would highly recommend.

The first room they put us in was not the "with balcony" I had booked on hotels.com and was the size of a closet. I called the front desk and before long we were moved into a room with a balcony and a lot more space. We loved it! The location is very local which we really loved but might be overwhelming for some timid travelers. Our room was clean and very modern and the staff was friendly and helpful. One design flaw is the shower completely floods the bathroom floor. We also weren't crazy about the glass bathroom door (newlyweds!). All in all we loved this place and hope to return in the near future. I love NY! And the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown.

Cannot fault this hotel at all. The location is perfect, away from the tourist trap of mid-town. It was my first time in NY and I spent hours scouring the internet to try and find the best hotel. This is the best reasonably priced hotel I could find. The rooms are modern, spacious, cosy and immaculately clean. Housekeeping and all the hotel staff are extremely friendly and provide an excellent service. The hotel is ideally placed to explore down town, but within easy access to the rest of Manhattan and Brooklyn via the subway. We stayed on the 15th floor and it was definitely worth it - lying in bed looking over the skyline of mid town Manhattan is just idyllic.I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in NYC.

I loved the place! My room on the 16th floor had a great view but not the balcony I had booked. The personal in the lobby was very helpful and friendly, the hotel manager is a very kind and generous man, he gave us the permission to shoot some TV footage on the terrace and showed us around himself. Internet was quite fast for a hotel. All perfect for my business visit, but next time I come with my wife :-) Than I follow the advice of the hotel manager: The best room is one with a 180° view!

The bathroom shower is horrible, no door and very hard to adjust the warm water. And flooding all the time.overflow the water in the room of 310 and room 410. No shampoo ,bath wash and sandle. At last , the bed is too high.

I was referred to this hotel by my photography teacher . I usually stay in mid-town so was concerned about a modern, clean, quiet place to stay. Wyndham Garden Chinatown was perfect. I had a heart stopping view, quiet, warm room on the 11th floor. It would have been nice to have a bathrobe, a better coffeemaker and hair dyer, but otherwise the hotel was great. Staff was so friendly and set up my reservation personally as I came from the West Coast.  One drawback was loud music from the roof bar on Friday and Saturday night.

The other reviewers have said it all. Clean, updated rooms with a drop-dead gorgeous view. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and the price is right. I searched many other hotel websites but kept coming back to this rooms before I finally booked it. Located close to a metro. Don't hesitate in staying here.

The exterior/interior of this property is impeccably maintianed. The decor is clean contemporary. Staff was wonderful: engaging, efficient and dedicated to providing outstanding service.City View on 18 is a must for specialty cocktails/coffee/fabulous views. Also, Elevate restaurant is a little gem, offering an eclectic menu to suit most any guest.Look forward to visitng again when in New York.Judy/Business Traveler

Great hotel if you go to NYC for food + shopping. So close to all my favorite places to eat in chinatown, little italy, and around NYU. Walking distance to shops in SOHO. My new go to hotel for weekend trips to NYC.

On a recent weekend trip to NYC, my wife and I were looking for a hotel convenient to the sites in mid-town and downtown, but away from the commotion of Times Square. The Chinatown location was great, and provided a much more vibrant connection with the city. The hotel itself is new and really well kept. The rooms were decent size for a NYC hotel, and the amenities were plentiful. The only complaint was the doorless shower that really creates a mess in the bathroom. Would definitely recommend.

I was really impressed by this hotel. I was greeted by a charming lady called Kim who had me checked in very quickly. I had a room on the 10th floor with a splendid view of the Empire State building. The rooms are fairly spacious by New York standards and the beds very comfortable.What really stood out though is the customer service, the staff are very polite and considerate. The concierge Hamza was very helpful and found a charger for my Ipad. At some of the other bigger New York hotels you would simply get a grunt when asking for such things!Only gripe is their chauffeur service to the airport, mine was more than I thought. Make sure you agree up front a price which includes everything - tips and tolls! Get the hotel to agree it with the chauffeur.

As a woman traveling on my own I was a little concerned about staying in Chinatown. Usually I stay in Midtown for my weekend stays. I was glad to stay at the Wyndham in chinatown. It was one J train from JFK to my stop. It was 2 blocks or so to the hotel. The hotel was clean, quiet and a perfect location for us to go uptown or further downtown. Had a great time and would definitely stay again. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and the in-house restaurant had a good breakfast at a reasonable price.

From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked-out every employee were encountered was friendly and helpful. We checked in on Friday afternoon and were greeted by a smiling receptionist who was very helpful and confirmed that we had been allocated a room with a great view - she was right about that - we could see the Empire State building clearly from our floor to ceiling window (Room 907). The room was clean and had everything we needed, a fridge, safe, iron and ironing board along with the usual toiletries, coffee etc .....A few other reviews have mentioned the shower door - honestly the door could do with being a little wider but it is possible to shower without flooding the bathroom. The hotel is located in the heart of Chinatown and within a few minutes of Little Italy - a huge variety of restaurants are right on your doorstep. Shopping in So-Ho is also easily walkable as is the Brooklyn Bridge (approx. 15 mins). Upon check-out we were offered the option of leaving our luggage, when we explained we were heading to the airport we were offered the option of booking a town-car, when I explained we were going to get a cab we were then told to come back in if we were finding it difficult and that they would get us a car (the only reason we didn't take them up on the offer of a car was that we had been told the previous evening that they only take cash and we were running low on US funds). If we find ourselves in NYC again this hotel will definitely be top of the list if the prices stay as reasonable as they are currently.

Great new hotel, very nicely decorated. Good location with lots of food choices in Chinatown and Little Italy close by. Close to subway. Walking distance to Tenements museum. 20 minute walk to 9/11 Memorial site and shopping in Financial district. Would definitely stay there again.

I stayed here for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The first night I was given a room on the 4th floor which didn't have the best views. I wasn't bothered as I was going to spend my time out sightseeing anyway but Janice at the front desk without prompting offered to move me to a higher floor the next morning anyway which had stunning views of the manhattan skyline. All of the staff were equally helpful and friendly throughout. The room was a good sized double and in good condition, as was the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and I wasn't disturbed by noise overnight at all. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

We will stay here again anytime. The service was excellent, while the hotel was modern and very clean. And modestly priced for a king bed corner room with a view of Empire State Building. Truly an incredible value.Pretty nice view from the rooftop bar as well.

Like other reviews I can say the place is new, clean and located two blocks from the B/D subway line. This is a great line to get to directly to midtown Manhattan, and Rockefeller Center without needing to transfer. going to a Broadway show you can get off at 48th and Avenue of the Americas (6th avenue) and walk five minutes to most of the theaters. Around the hotel we felt we were in another country. Chinatown was all around us, there were always people around and we felt safe. This is a convenient location to the wonderful restaurants in Little Italy and only blocks away from the amazing Tenement Museum.Front desk staff may be the friendliest I have experienced throughout the country. If you are driving a car it will cost $43 per day to park with no in/out priviledges. The car is picked up by the parking garage and driven a few blocks away.Clean showers with excellent water pressure.

We chose the Wyndham Garden Inn for our first visit to New York following a recommendation on the Trip Advisor New York City Forum and we were not disappointed. We had a warm welcome from the front desk staff and didn’t even need to produce our booking paperwork as they were expecting us. The hotel is new and squeaky clean and our room was well equipped with a lovely bathroom. We found the 3rd floor a little noisy and on request we were moved to the 9th floor which had the most incredible views of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building from the floor to ceiling windows.The small bar in the corner of the lobby quickly became our pre-dinner meeting place for Happy Hour which lasted from 5-8pm every night. We also had dinner one evening in the Elevate restaurant which was very good, and very good value with a 50% discount offer. We loved the area and thoroughly enjoyed the hustle and bustle of Chinatown as well as the proximity to subway connections.On our last day we were not leaving until 2pm but the staff happily looked after our luggage while we enjoyed our last few hours in New York.

What a great place to stay for a weekend in the city! The hotel staff along with closeness to the subway station made it easy to travel throughout the city. The rooms were extremely modern and very comfortable. I definitely recommend this hotel for spending time in New York.

My friend and I were really looking forward to our 2 day trip to New York and had researched to make sure we got the best hotel that was wheelchair accessible. We were also celebrating my friends birthday. Unfortunately we were very disappointed. Firstly the lift that takes you from the ground floor to reception was not working, so my friend was unable to get into the lobby without help from the staff. We had requested a wheelchair room with 2 beds which had been confirmed over the phone but when we got there was told that they only do them with one bed and didn't seem too concerned about what we was told. The room we was given was small and barely big enough for 1 person let alone 2. Also if you was in a electric wheelchair you would not get over the step at each door. We was moved to a different room on the 2nd night and had our parking comped but I do not think is this good enough considering the stress myself and friend had to endure getting in and out of the hotel. Given the choice I would not stay back here again

Staff was super friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet and immaculately clean.The rooms are very adequately sized for New York lodgings. And the location, in the middle of Chinatown, is ideal for meandering and exploring. It's the best hotel stay I've ever had in New York. The only slight negative is that I'd have preferred the full shower doors rather than the half doors.

Wife and I came in for an overnight trip. Everything was great from start to finish. From when we dropped off the car in valet until we picked it up in valet. The staff was very helpful and friendly during our stay.
I highly recommend this hotel. Clean, friendly, great location for anything below Houston St. Great views!

The Wyndham garden Chinatown is a relatively small, modern hotel on the edge of Chinatown and little Italy. The hotel and decor is modern, sleek and clean. Friendly staff that greets you as you are coming and going. It offers free wifi which is much appreciated. A few quirks mainly centered on the bathroom -- shower has a half glass, not a curtain or door, so there is a good chance of soaking the bathroom floor, hardware in the shower is already rusting which is unattractive and cheap; shampoos, etc weren't replenished daily. But these items wouldn't prevent me from returning. The experience which left me with a bad final impression was being informed upon checkout that I owed 3 cents.... And Katie expected me to give it to her. I did, and when I commented that after settling a more than $1000 bill this seemed a bit petty, the response was that the bookkeeper requires the cash drawer to balance. Makes me wonder if the bookkeeper cares about returning customers....

We flew into New York from Toronto for a fun weekend for our Anniversary. We travel a lot and we were impressed and would come back again! The room, the views, the cleanliness, the staff, rooftop lounge, lower level restaurant...everything was great and amazing!!!!. We stayed on the 12th floor, corner room with floor to ceiling windows and we loved it, walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, subway and restaurants. We're booking here again!
Had a business meeting in Brooklyn first thing so this location was perfect.Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The room was as requested,clean, well appointed and quiet.

Stayed at the Wyndham with my now fiancé! We're from Vancouver and went to NYC to propose. We got there very early in the morning and they were able to check us in at 12PM. Our room was spacious with amazing views of the City and had a shared balcony. They even printed my broadway tickets since the printer wasn't working and allowed us to checkout late so we could relax before our flight!! The location is so close to Soho and Little Italy and the Subway which is less than a 10min walk. The price was very reasonable compared to other Hotels! Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

A new and welcome addition to the lower east side, the glass facade of the Wyndham stands out amongst Chinese shop fronts on the Bowery street corner. Everything was clean and new and the bed was extremely comfortable. Floor-to-ceiling windows gave the feeling of space, although the outlook wasn't anything special. There's a bar up the top of the hotel which seems fairly popular with some locals, based on the people going up and down in the lifts, but it wasn't a concern from a noise or riff raff perspective. Cafe on the lower level was ok but the service was atrocious. Cons: toilet leaked and it's quite a walk to the north end of Manhattan, but tribeca is just around the corner and it was certainly nice to escape the tourist Mecca of mid town. This hotel enables you to walk or subway to all of the sites, without the price tag.

I stayed here for a bachelor party last weekend. It was a wonderful hotel. You can not beat Value for Money in the area. My total cost for Fri / Sat night Halloween Weekend was ~$480 and the hotel definitely felt like it was worth more. The happy hour value at the bar was incredible, although the beer selection was small. The Room was well cleaned and sported amazing views and natural light. My only complaint (which is seeming to be a theme) is that the shower only has half a door. It sprays water EVERYWHERE no matter how hard you try. The only way to even reduce the bathroom floodage was to huddle in the corner under the shower head. Other than that, brilliant place (especially for the money) and will happily stay again.
the hotel was nice and clean. The staff was very polite. The only problem was the fire alarm going off at 2:30AM and not get turned off for along time.

We stayed here for 4 nights, best rate I could find on Manhattan in a hotel that was 3+ stars. Certainly worth it to stay here as the Subway station (Grand) is right around the corner and only 3 or 4 stops (express train) to Times Square. Downside is that the surrounding neighbourhood leaves a bit to be desired for me anyway. No NYC bagels or cheesecakes here, as it is right in the middle of Chinatown (it is in the name of the hotel after all). We ended up walking East a few blocks to the Lower East side, lots of good stuff over there or take the subway up 1 station to the Broadway area.Room - Very nice, floor to ceiling windows, bigger than some NYC rooms, but still small. Terrible shower design, it is impossible to have a shower without soaking the floor, something they will have to fix .Bar - Was alright, seemed a bit unprofessionalRestaurant - Went there for breakfast, thought it would be fancier than it was, only cost $15 for both of us so that was worth it. We ordered room service once too, good pricing again.

For the deal i got it was a good deal for the price. I was looking for a hotel near the main area of the lower east side close to the bars/restaurants and got this hotel. While this hotel is nice, clean, and has some bars/restaurants in the area. It was a little far off from main area of lower east side about a 10 min walk and in the hustle and bustle of chinatown and 5 min walk from little italy area.

We chose Wyndham Garden Chinatown hotel after researching on Tripadvisor and Expedia. Both agreed that it was an excellent hotel, and that was our experience too. First, the location. We originally wanted somewhere uptown, but decided to give Chinatown/Lower East Side a try. This turned out to be a good choice, as there are excellent subway connections in the area to all parts of Manhattan and beyond, the trains were quick and efficient. It is also in easy walking distance of SoHo, Manhattan Bridge, Little Italy, East Village, etc. It is located on a main road (Bowery) but we didn't find it to be particularly noisy. From our room we could barely hear the traffic below at all.From our room on the ninth floor we had a view northwards to the Empire State Building - a stunning view at any time of day. The room was smallish, but plenty big enough; comfortable, clean and attractive, with artwork maintaining the Chinese style. Sneaking a ride on the lift to the 19th floor revealed a rooftop terrace, with even more stunning views of the area, including southwards to the financial quarter, and south-east to Manhattan Bridge. I believe this terrace it to be turned into a rooftop bar of some sort, which would be fantastic.There's a bar on the ground floor which we used on the first day, and a diner on one of the lower floors which we used for some snacks on our last day. There's also a gym which we didn't get round to using.The staff were all extremely helpful, knowledgable and friendly. They seem to have everything under control, and never seemed too stressed or busy to help or provide information.Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who, like us, wanted to get to know New York. If/when we return to New York, we would certainly consider staying there again.

My wife and I spend 4 nights here last week, overall the hotel was great. The location was good for us, with a one block walk to the Subway (B, D lines) that could take us anywhere we wanted to go in Manhattan. Brooklyn is within walking distance, and we hiked across the Williamsburg bridge one day to spend a day in that area. I found the lack of a true grocery/convenience store in the area a small issue, it was a bit of a hike to find beer/pop/chips for the room.Room was really nice, comfortable bed. we didn't have a great view, being on the 3rd floor, we were looking across at (mostly rundown) Chinatown shops (I should note we booked through Priceline for ~$180/night and I know Priceline/Hotwire customers don't usually get the "choice" rooms). Everything was clean, but as has been mentioned here before the showers in the washroom have only a half door and water sprays out everywhere, housekeeping was great and gave us extra towels to deal with this.Staff was very friendly and polite throughout the stay, our only major issue came on the last day. When we arrived after a long drive, we opted for the valet parking ($43/night), even though I knew there was cheaper self-parking in the area. It seemed that the convenience of being able to leave it in someone else's hands would be worth a bit extra... and it was until it was time to leave and it took them over 2 hours to get our car ready for us. I know it's another company handling the valet service and not entirely the hotel's fault, but with a 9 hour drive home waiting for us, the difference between leaving at 10AM and leaving at noon was pretty significant.That experience and the bathrooms prevent me from giving the hotel a 5/5 review, but I would still recommend it and would stay here again.

I've been on the road for a couple of weeks now, Berlin, Chicago, New York and so far have not picked a dud hotel. The Wyndham Garden Chinatown in New York is no exception ... or maybe it is the exception? Really well equipped room on the seventh floor, with a stunning view up Bowery towards Midtown... Excellent breakfast in the restaurant in the cellar, friendly and helpful staff, and a great night's sleep in a really comfortable bed.If there's a downside, it's only a downside because of where my meetings were (in Midtown) and that's a bbit of a hike by taxi... I didn't have time to try otther methods of transport.Best bit? Value for money ... This hotel could show a few others a thing or two ... stay there!

The rooms were clean and very modern. Rooms have a nice view. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. They helped us with directions. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived . They put luggage in the room so we had it when we returned . They held it for us until later that night after we checked out.But you have to go to lobby to get ice.I highly recommend hotel.

First: Price. I was charged almost 300 USD a night. I know the hotel prices in NYC are crazy, but please... This hotel is waaaaay overpriced.Second: Location. It is true that it is at least in Manhattan, but the hotel surroundings are pretty depressing (ugly buildings, garbage on the streets, horrible smell, scary if you come back late at night). It is also true that it is close to SoHo (about 15mins walk, but not a nice walk at all). Third: Rooms. They are nice and clean with a weird balcony that you share with the whole floor. Fourth: If you are going to pay around 300 USD for staying in Manhattan, go somewhere else. Even if you have to pay a little bit more, go. Stay away of this area!

I stayed here with my fiancé for a nice night in the city. Unfortunately I was very Disappointed. First issue was when I called the hotel to let them know we would be a late check-in . They seemed to not understand and told me the party had not arrived yet. I explained to them again and they seemed to not quite understand, maybe they didn't understand English as well as I expected. We arrived to the hotel about 8 pm, and I asked about upgrades and they "upgraded" us to a tiny room with a balcony, which we were not told was shared by the entire floor. I go to open up the door to the balcony and the sliding lock basically falls off as I open the door and lands on the floor. The bulb by one side of the bed was out, so I went to the front desk with it and requested a new bulb. They assured me a new one would arrive shortly. It never did. We called down to request toothpaste since we forgot to bring it and that actually arrived about ten minutes later. When turning down the sheets I noticed yellowing and dirtiness around the pillow area, and hairs under the blankets. Not cool.  Then about 10 pm the party starts in the room next door. Great. Now I don't know why they would put us right next to this group of about 10 kids drinking and yelling and going in out of the door, slamming it, as well as the balcony door many times. At one point one of the people in that room actually tried 3 x to get into our room using their key, until I went to door and told him he had the wrong room. This went on until about 2 AM when finally I went downstairs to complain because the phone call I made earlier mentioning it made no difference. I woke up about 7 am and went out on the balcony which had a bunch of empty beer cans, balloons and vomit on the balcony. Checked out about 7:30 because it was just enough.

My husband and I stayed here for two nights and we absolutely loved it. Our room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. It was heaven after a day of walking around and coming back to this oasis with little Italy just steps away, where we enjoyed a very nice dinner! This hotel is a real gem and has very friendly and helpful employees working there!
Great service, clean room and privacy when needed. Nice restaurant, but would have liked a little more options for dinner.

This hotel is a real keeper. The rooms are clean, very modern and it is within walking distance of SOHO, NOHO and Little Italy. If you stay in NYC frequently, this is a better perspective of NYC than the touristy Times Square/midtown area. The staff are all extremely pleasant and can't do enough for you. One block from the subway, but we walked almost everywhere except to the museums. Walking across the Brooklyn Bridge as well as exploring unique shops such as Dominique Ansel Bakery and Rice to Rices are must dos.

I have stayed in this hotel on 3 occasions for multiple days each trip. The rooms are great with floor to ceiling windows looking North to the Empire State Building and beyond. The room decor is contemporary and the bed is very comfortable. The restaurant is remarkably good for a hotel restaurant, very tasty food. Overall the one thing that stands out is the professionalism and quality of the service at all levels from check-in to check out.

We stayed 2 nights in late October and had a wonderful time. The location is very convenient, with subway stations nearby. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The room was clean and well set up. I highly recommend this hotel.

I was recommended this hotel by a friend; my mom, sister and I stayed in one room and although it was a very "cozy" space, the room was very clean, new, and we had excellent service from the staff. The location couldn't have been better as it was a short walk down to the financial district and also going north; we felt very safe, even at night. Also, the food at the restaurant was amazing. A special thank you to Massy for all of his help and advice throughout our stay, especially with the subway!

I've been staying at this hotel almost weekly since mid-July. The rooms are great. The staff is courteous, helpful, and friendly. This has become my home away from home. The food in the restaurant is exceptional. Check it out when in NYC.

Stayed for 5 nights in mid-Sept 2013 for my first holiday in NYC. This hotel is in a convenient location, with subway stations within a short walk to reach either uptown (Grand St) or downtown (Bowery) in less than 15 minutes, making it a perfect base to explore the best of Manhattan. On my last evening, I walked across the Brooklyn Bridge from the hotel, and back again. Don't be put off by the surrounding streets -- it is Chinatown after all. As a relatively new property, the hotel is in very good condition -- everything worked in my room -- and nice and clean. The room was on the small side but comfortable enough for one or two people. All staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful, from reception to cleaners. Little Italy is just a couple of blocks away with a great range of restaurants. Reasonably priced breakfast is available from the restaurant downstairs. The best online rate I found was pretty pricey (A$297/night after taxes) but this was good for Manhattan. I would stay here again.

After staying at the Wyndham in Chelsea I needed to stay downtown and tried the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Good reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor were confirmed. I had a 16th floor room facing north and what a view. It had a full, unobstructed view from east to west of Midtown. The room was great for a sing occupant with a nice desk, a lounge chair and two nightstands. Plenty of desk-level outlets for today's connected professional--I had an iPad, iPhone, Blackberry and a laptop. The bathroom was fantastic and gave me some ideas when I renovate my own bathrooms in the future. A decent small gym with free weights and a handful of machines was in the basement with a cold watercooler, a choice of three overhead stations and a TV. Every interaction with the staff was pleasant and accommodating. Housekeeping inadvertently threw out a plastic bag that still had a case in it because, by my own fault, I had left it beside another obvious bag of garbage. However, when I asked her in the hallway to see if she still happened to have it, she was apologetic and went straight down to retrieve the entire floor's garbage and lugged it up the stairs so I could retrieve it. Very nice! I have to go back in a few days and I made sure my job's travel agent booked the same hotel.

Booked four nights on Hotwire. Very pleased with this hotel. Good location in Chinatown and two blocks from little Italy. The bed was very comfortable with European duvet. Cost over $225 per night, but all hotels in Manhattan are pricy. Really enjoyed our stay in New York city.
If you're looking to find a convenient, modern, and comfortable hotel in Chinatown and across from Brooklyn, look no further. Great price; extremely competitive, and close to public transportation.
This was a superb property! Rooms were spacious for NYC and clean. The staff was fantastic! A special shout out to Massy! This hotel has great prices and so close to subway and bus..perfect location.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days in October 2013 while visiting our son who lives in Little Italy.. The rooms are very clean and well decorated with great views of the city. It was a perfect location for us: close to the subway and many resturants. We even walked across the Williamsburg Bridge to Brooklyn. The hotel has a very polite staff, all you are looking for in a hotel.

Our stay, 9 - 12 September 2013, and 16 September 2013, in room 1102 was made memorable by the excellent housekeeper, Hermin.Not only was our room kept in tip top condition, she is a tip top person herself!We discovered this on meeting Hermin in the passage way, when we thanked her for doing an excellent job.Hermin's great attitude towards her job and life impressed us greatly.The reception staff were friendly and helpful, and remembered us, hopefully for the right reasons!Being a smaller hotel, the treatment we received was more personal.Well designed room made use of available space.More bathroom bench room would make life easier for more than one occupant.A small luggage holding room meant inconvenience, as we were allowed only one piece of luggage held, while away for two nights during our stay.Hotel is handy to Chinatown and Soho, so easy to get meals and discover shops.We would return to stay here!

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights over Columbus day weekend while visiting our son. I would not typically think of staying in Chinatown, but we wanted be close to my son's apartment and got a very reasonable rate for a holiday weekend, so went with it. What a pleasant surprise! We spent an entire day wandering around Chinatown,Little Italy and Greenwich Village, all just steps away from this hotel. If you enjoy walking and exploring neighborhoods, as we do, you could cover most of lower Manhattan completely on foot from this location. On the other hand, the subway is a 2 minute walk away, and we made it to our Broadway play in 30 minutes. There are a huge number of fascinating shops and delicious eateries right outside the door- most filled with locals, and not the typical tourist experience. The subway is a 2 minute walk, and we made it to Broadway to see a play in 30 minutes. Our room was sparkling clean (albeit small) and was stylishly decorated. We were on a higher level with a great view to the North. But the reason I was prompted to write this review was that EVERY staff interaction we had was fantastic. Everyone was so warm- and ready to take that extra step to make sure that our visit was great. It was so wonderful to stay in NYC and experience that kind of friendly customer service. My kudos to the management- you have a great team here!! We will be back. Some tips- there are inexpensive several relatively inexpensive parking garages one block away (we paid $60.00 for two days- a bargain for NYC.) Also check out Everest Coffee Shop in nearby Chatham Square for a local breakfast experience.

This hotel offers a whole lot of comfort. Decor is chic, eclectric, modern, very relaxing in a feng shai sort of way. Exception: Bathroom shower is only "partially enclosed".... water on floor everytime shower is used. I loved the drapes in the room! Simply gorgeous.Hotel located in Chinatown, near Bowery, So Ho, Chelsea & Tribeca. Very close to all points of interest -- Shopping, sightseeing, etc.Hotel has restaurant --- dinner was pleasant (good menu items, great service), breakfast not to good (poor, slow, service).Had a blast. would definetely stay here again.
hotel room and lobby excellent even better when figuring costs. Nice people very clean great views with floor to ceiling windows. No complaints. Really comfortable bed.
in its price level, this is one of the best NYC hotels. Quite rooms, modern, friendly service and in the midst of an exciting neighbourhood.

Stayed five nights at the hotel. Very friendly staff, perfectly located on the brink of China Town and Little Italy. Close to three different subway stations.And the view (I'm in room 908 right now) of the uptown skyline is wonderful.Secret tip: opposite on the other side of Bowery St, in number 76 (50 yards further down town than the hotel), 2nd floor is Spa Kimberly. It's a bit weird entrance but wonderful foot rub for only 25$/hour. I'll go again tomorrow.

Have never booked a hotel in Chinatown - but this location is superior! Took a morning run over Manhattan Bridge and back over Brooklyn Bridge Freedom Tower nearby as well as the stock exchange. Hotel was brand new with all ammenities. Staff knowledgeable and helpful. Will stay here again.

I had no part in the booking of this hotel, as my wife as a surprise birthday present did it. She was very nervous about making the booking, as I can be very particular about places where I stay! I like a place with good service, with staff that will go the extra mile. I like a spacious room that is reasonably priced. I like to be in a location where I can step out and walk around a lively area with lots of bars and good places to eat and I like to be not more than a 5 minute walk from transport links. I think you can see where I am going here, can't you? My wife did an excellent job booking this place. I almost didn't want to write this review as selfishly I don’t want this place to become too popular. We had to think long and hard to think if there was anything negative that we could say about this place. Here it is...There were not enough hooks for the towels in the bathroom! Call the police.

This hotel is fantastically located - very near 3 different subway stations, in Chinatown and very close to Little Italy, Lower East side and a manageable walk to Soho. There's loads of really cool bars and restaurants around the Elizabeth Street side, and we had a great traditional breakfast at Cup & Saucer not far too. The area is buzzy and lively at night, and also felt very safe. Some great bars we went to - Apotheke, Sel Rrose, Mulberry Project (wasn't bad), The Butchers Daughter, restaurants, included Peasant, Freemans, Little Rascal. The staff were really great and helpful, we stayed on the 7th floor which has a balcony all the way around (it's not your personal balcony). The rooms are clean, the hotel is new so it's very recently decorated. The bed was comfortable, bathroom was great. We didn't eat at the hotel or use the bar, but both looked great. To top it all, it's really comparatively cheap - I'd definitely recommend it! My one tiny gripe - and this is SO tiny which is surely a good sign - is that there weren't enough hooks in the bathroom to hang up towels! So, really not a bad gripe at all!

The location was just wanted. However, there was only one elevator to go to the workout room so, that was not convenient. Service was excellent. The layout of the room could have been a little better as the desk/chair were in the way of walking.

We recently enjoyed a weekend stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. The service was great with all staff being very helpful and polite. We did not eat at the restaurant there, but, we did talk to a couple who had commented that it was good. We had a room on the 8th floor that had a fantastic view. Our room was very clean and the bed was super comfortable. I will definitely stay there again!

We were staying in Chinatown for a wedding. Friends stayed at the Wyndham and other places in Chinatown and everyone who saw our room was blown away with how nice it was and the unbelievable view. This is NYC, so the room was not large, but well furnished and did not feel tight at all. My only recommendation would be to gussy up the bar downstairs a bit. We drank there despite it feeling somewhat seedy.
All staff were helpful and friendly. Clean and spacious room, which looked exactly like the pictures.

the bed & linens were really nice, above averagebathroom was very inconvenient - silly 1/2 shower door, adjustable shower head TOO high to adjust, NO hooks for towels, robes, etc., vanity (sink) light impossible to use for putting on make-upstaff was very nice & accomodating
The hotel and its staff are both topnotch. Out room has awesome views of uptown Manhattan and a staff of great spirit and willingness to help.
We had a room at 9th floor, great view. Service was good, room cleaning was done quite good. Coffee and Tea could be a little bit more but the rest was good. Fast Wifi, new room and friendly people.

I was on the 7th floor and had a terrific view looking north. One full glass wall with a door that opened made for a very pleasant bright spot. It was also very quiet and I got a terrific night's sleep both nights there. There only two tiny issues were that the hotel gave instructions for reusing towels, but then replaced them anyway (although I have encountered this irritation in many hotels), and the shower stall had no door (designed this way for a very nice bathroom, but not so functional), so water splashed out into the bathroom.

This hotel was pretty great. We were on the 16th floor and the view of the city was priceless! The staff was very nice. The location of the hotel is pretty good. It sets on the outside of china town... just one block from little Italy and a few blocks from trendy bars and restaurants in the lower east side. We took the red eye flight from CA and when we got to the hotel at 9am the staff recommended a breakfast cafe and told us to give them an hour and they would have our room ready. We came back after and hour and our room was ready.The unexpected early check in was a very nice added bonus to our trip. We were able to rest up and enjoy the city.

We were met immediately, flawless check in with assistance with luggage to our room. All of our questions were answered and when we needed a cab to Brooklyn for a Friday night show, the bellman secured one immediately and helped us into the cab and wished us a great time. The new room was magnificently decorated and the cleanest we have ever been in in NYC and we come to the city at least two times a year for shows. Even at hotels which were more expensive, the Wyndham Garden Chinatown surpassed any other hotel in the city. We had a balcony room which wrapped around 1/2 of the floor we were on giving magnificent views of Chinatown and all of the city. Breath-taking at night!

The room was small, but i is in Manhattan and that is expected. The views were great. It would be helpful to have a small concession at the hotel. While there are many restaurants in the area ther are not many stores selling items such as water, juice, snacks and newspapers. It would be very convenient if these items were sold at the hotel.

The hotel is new and very nice. The rooms might be a bit small for some, but in NY, all you need a hotel room is to shower and sleep. The room and bathroom were clean and nicely appointed. Water pressure, even on a high floor was great. They could use faster elevators, but part of that may be due to some construction they were doing on a lounge on the top floor. Decent happy hour prices at the bar downstairs.The Chinatown location is pretty cool. Lots of things w/in walking distance. The best thing about the hotel are the people. EVERYONE was very nice and had easy smiles. Meyin is AWESOME!! She was able to make rooms available for me and my companions during the UN General Assembly meetings, when it seemed impossible to get even 1 room, let alone 4, in NYC. This stay will make me look at the Wyndham brand for rooms for my future trips.

Great hotel. Expensive considering no brekkie included (with our booking) but reasonably priced brekkie available in restaurant. Great views of Empire State, lights at night, skyline. Ask for a high floor room. (For view and to reduce noise) Friendly staff, small bar in lobby. Clean room, great products in bathroom, modern hotel. 5 min walk to Subway.

I was visiting New York on business and this location was convenient to my business. But it was very convenient to dining, shopping etc. The property is clean and the staff is very friendly. I would stay there again.

We were fortunate to stay in room 1002 on the 10th floor of the hotel. The hotel is only 10mths old. Our corner room had floor to ceiling views across New York. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The bed was comfy. The staff were attentive and well informed. The reception staff were particularly helpful. All in all we spent a very comfortable 5 nights at the Wyndham Garden . Our thanks to everyone concerned.

The facilities were good and up to our expectations. Suggestion: a shower curtain would be useful to keep the bathroom dry after a shower.The location was great for us as we wanted to be in the downtown part of Manhattan during the latter part of our visit. We found some nice restaurants in Chinatown and Little Italy, and the location was very convenient to access the Financial District, 911 memorial etc.

You know when you find a secret you kind of want to keep for yourself...? But then you think it's too selfish so you share it anyway:) Well, this hotel is a diamond! Hubby and I stayed for 11 days and we loved it:)First: the service here is great. Helpful and polite staff everywhere.
