The hotel had upgraded our room from a regular queen to a corner room on 16th floor, and the view was jawdropping! The room was also spacious, had a large bathroom (with bathtube and a hairblower that actuallly worked,- not like the other ones that heng on walls in other hotels,) it was clean, the bed was good with one big double duvet, it had cofeemaker, fridge, safe++ (Sometimes the smal tings make one big plus.) Hubby used fitnessroom almost every morning and was satisfied with the equipment (nothing broken&good aircondition.)For an extra good night sleep: buy earplugs, because the road outside is busy, but that's NY.The location is downtown in Chinatown, you can walk 2 min. to Little Italy, and it's just about 15 min. walk away from the more "trendy" areas. Bring good shoes and you will be just fine walking home also at nightime, - always other people walking down Bowery too. (Don't bother to spend a lot of money on more expensive hotels in the more "trendy" areas.)I think, If you have always wanted to wake up in a NY state of mind, this IS the place to stay.Thumbs up to the staff who make this such a nice home away from home:) Thank you.

The room was nice, small but probably average for NYC. Room was clean, staff was very friendly. There is dining in the basement, had some good breakfast there, but it feels like your dining in a basement. Main floor/lobby bar was very nice, bartender Felix was great. One of two elevators was broken down for the last 4 days of our stay. Shower as noted in many reviews is a water-on -the-floor problem. Lower floors were very noisy from street traffic. We stayed on 9th floor so wasn't bad but friends on 3rd and 4th complained of loosing sleep. Location is not convenient, about $20 per cab ride to mid city or most typical tourist destinations. Nearby construction adds to problem. For a little more money it would be better to stay in mid-city for most tourists.
Great experience! Clean, brand new room, great service. Housekeeping staff very nice and accommodating

We stayed one night at this hotel and it was overall a very good experience. We had mainly two issues with the hotel. First, we paid $50 more to have a premium room on the 16th floor and the room was advertised as having a balcony, but there was no balcony. The room did have ceiling to floor windows and an excellent view of the Manhattan skyline, though the windows were a little dirty. We saw a balcony on the floor below that wrapped around the side of the building, but it was apparently a shared balcony for all rooms on that floor (which we wouldn't have liked so much). The windows did help keep the outside noise down though - there was no problem with noise from the street, most likely due to being so high up. But when we were settling down for the night we heard someone vacuuming on the floor above us, and moving furniture around. This went until around 11:40 p.m. From what I've read on here the 17th floor is used for various events, so it was probably the clean-up after a party. Other than these issues, the place was fine. The staff members were wonderful and the hotel appears to be well built. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. Bed was very comfy and bathroom was great. Beautiful lobby, and great location for those interested in touring around Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy. Restaurant suggestion if you like wonderful French food - Parigot - it's a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We highly recommend though that the management straighten out the website so that the rooms are more accurately represented. And that they try to ensure that the 17th floor is quiet by a certain point in the evening, perhaps by 10 or 11 at the latest.

If you forget the ridiculous prices of the hotels in New York, Windham Garden Hotel is a good choice. The situation closed the subway and to Little Italy and to Chinatown is big advantage at night when you are exhausted and you don't want to go far away for dinner. You have plenty of good and affordable restaurants near to the hotel. Staff is very helpful and give you any advice you may need. The rooms looking at the North have an extraordinary view of the Empire State Building.

I received a very warm welcome from Mr. Omar Bouchaar, who allowed me to check-in without any hassle whatsoever upon my early arrival at the hotel. Everyone else I encountered - from front office staff, Hamza, restaurant staff, Calvin, and many others - were extremely friendly and helpful. The convenient location and superb customer service at this hotel makes it easy to overlook minor inconveniences such as street noise (unavoidable in NYC) and the occasional delay at the hotel restaurant/cafe Elevate. The in-house restaurant may be experiencing some growing pains, but the kitchen staff is undoubtedly skilled. The food is very competently prepared and well priced. After a long day of meetings, shopping, or just walking around, the option of being able to dine in at a reasonable price is certainly welcome.The hotel is within 0-15 minutes walk to Chinatown, Soho, Lower East Side where shops and restaurants abound. Closest subway stop - maybe a three minute walk - is Grand St. (B, D Line), which can take you easily to and from NY Penn Station or the Port Authority Bus Terminal to connect to airport trains or buses. I would be more than happy to return.

We stayed 2 x nights in Wyndham Garden Chinatown after finding it on Hotwire.com as a secret hotel deal. Right in the heart of Chinatown on Bowery we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was - despite being so central and in such a busy neighbourhood. The location is actually fantastic: walking distance to Little Italy, Nolita, Soho and all the key downtown highlights. Although you won't spend much time in the hotel what with all the other attractions, it was actually the most spacious and well-appointed room we stayed in during two weeks in NYC. On top of that, the staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful

I stayed in a lovely room with a fabulous (floor to ceiling windows) view the entire length of the room uptown to the Empire State and Chrysler buildings. It was stunning during the day and night not least as there are very few tall buildings in this area.I lived in NYC for 2 years a long time ago and love to return and explore a new neighbourhood each time. Last time we stayed at the gansevoort hotel in Chelsea and while we loved that neighbourhood, I never felt comfortable at the hotel.This hotel felt like a glamorous apartment (a small one!) and we felt welcomed every time we met anyone from the hotel. My daughter was given very special treatment which she will never forget.We ate twice at the restaurant which was good and reasonably priced although there are many delicious options less than a block away. Try shanghai cuisine at full house!The subway is close by (you do need to brace yourself for the smells of a Chinatown market) and we got to Times Square in under 10 mins every time. We loved walking through little Italy to have breakfast at Balthazar in soho/nolita. I definitely recommend this hotel and special thanks to Omar for exceptional service and to Lindsay for showing us the fabulous rooftop bar that's opening soon.

A great stay in a very nice hotel. All the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful, the room was immaculate, as was the lobby and bar. In the heart (well, ish) of Chinatown, a stones throw from Little Italy (and Lombardi's :-)) and Katz's deli, it let us get a taste of Chinatown whilst being convienient for everywhere else. Superb Wi-Fi connection, comfy bed, and an adequate size TV, not huge and not small, got the right balance there. My only two very slight niggles were slightly inadequate lighting for anything other than a cosy ambience, and the shower. A half screen walk in sounds good until you end up mopping a gallon of water off the bathroom floor. A sliding full door would have been better. I could gripe at the price as well, but having looked at other hotels, you gotta take it on the chin and say, Hey, it's New York baby. I'm leaving the "Value" at Average but only because it's not "Very Good". The view from the 11th floor is superb, quintescential Manhattan skyline with the Empire State and Chrysler buildings and everything in between. All in all a delightful stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

This hotel is situated in Chinatown, but just a block or two away from Little Italy. The service was great, but the rooms, even though nice and clean, was very small. The view from our room was great, but you will not spend too much time in your hotel room, so I guess it doesn't matter. Short distance to subway station, and walking distance to SoHo and shopping area. The hotel has a gym that is nice. Take your breakfast elsewhere though!

Stayed for a one-night business trip. Nearby was a fair at Little Italy where I enjoyed a delicious slice of pizza while walking around the famous streets. Hotel was clean with a friendly staff that volunteered information about the area.

Sent, though well intentioned, beyond terrible. couldn't have asked for more comfortable accommodation in this part of town; close to the subway, charming staff, and a restaurant with surprisingly good food - - great food, in fact - - does the decor is upscale bus station and the service is

A friend suggested Wyndham Chinatown to us saying it was a new hotel and just happened to be in the same neighborhood in which he lived. He couldn't have been more right. The location was perfect for what we needed. Close to the subway and all the great little neighborhoods that are New York. Great restaurants were right around the corner and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. i would recommend this clean and friendly hotel in an up and coming happening place for anyone visiting NY for the first time or if you have been there many times before.

I would not recommend this hotel because it is very noisy. In addition, the surrounding is inappropriate for a wyndham. Otherwise, it is very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Nice room with a beautiful view.

Stayed in this hotel for 8 nights during May and this was a perfect place to stay for the final leg of our USA trip.As everyone who has traveled to NY knows, accommodation is pricey but for value for money, location and service, this is definitely the place to stay. We arrived quite late at about 11pm but check-in was a breeze and the staff (shout out to John Chen) was extremely helpful. As we had been on a plane for 6 hours and barely eaten anything, John advised us where all the favorite local eateries were directed us on the map to its location. It was extremely helpful for us as this was our first time in NY. The room itself was small, but that's NY for you. Although small, it was nicely furnished and clean. If possible, ask for the higher level rooms. The hotel also has a decent gym for those who wish to exercise off all those burgers that they eat.Location for this hotel was also convenient. Situated about a 3min walk from the nearest metro, 5 min walk to Chinatown and Little Italy, and plenty of eateries in between.Overall, Fantastic Prices and a Fantastic stay. Highly recommended!

New and neat, not a bad price and CLEAN. A block from Little Italy and the Manhattan Bridge, not the best location but not the worst. If every hotel was like this one, it would be a good thing. I also liked the ceiling to floor windows with good views.

I almost hate to reveal to the world what a gem this place is! It was a very good price for a very nice Manhattan Hotel. It is right on the edge of Chinatown, Little Italy and within walking distance of SOHO. The room was quite nice. The manager and front desk personnel and concierge were all superbly nice and accommodating. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I had a much better experience here than at some of the hotels near the Broadway shows.

This hotel has fantastic views of The Empire State from the upper floor rooms. We had a balcony so there is a door to open for fresh air and to hear all the hustle and bustle below , but you cant sit outside on it. The rooms are small but adequate, but not enough drawer space for clothes. Its a modern smart hotel that sits in a rather run down but authentic part of China Town. It is in a very good location for travelling uptown and downtown with the bus stop right outside which gets you everywhere and is exceptionally efficient for travelling all over Manhatten or the subway is a 10 min walk away. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance in China Town, Little Italy all The Bowery area. The breakfast is served in the basement which is dark and gloomy with staff who try hard but are unprofessional and disorganised. The fresh fruit is great but many items on the menu were always unavailable. For 5 mornings we had to have toast made with cheap bread as there was not even any bagels available. The rest of the hotel runs smoothly and highly professional but down in the basement its bizarre. This hotel is a great place to stay in for value and location, and we would not hesitate to book it again if we ever return to NY.

I liked the modern aesthetic of the hotel rooms. It was in walking distance of many great neighborhoods like Chinatown, Soho, Little Italy, and Nolita. There's free wifi and 2 free bottles of water included in the stay which is nice. The service was great - everyone was very friendly. The only thing wrong with the hotel was its AC system. The temperature got cold, but the dehumidifier didn't really work. So I had some clammy nights, which isn't the greatest feeling. I realized this was an issue in the whole hotel - not just my room. Granted it was hot when I visited, but it seemed more like something was wrong with the AC than due to the weather. Except for that one blip, I really enjoyed the hotel.

Stayed for 2 nights, it was a nice place, clean except for the shower drain. The rooms are small but not to small for 2. The shower is a problem due to the fact there is no door and the water gets on the floor. The staff was very nice and helpful. I had a problem with the restaurant, we were with another couple and they put our bill together and we asked them to split it and ended up getting charged more, but the waitress was very nice. I would stay here again.

Hotel exceeded expectations. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Reasonably priced breakfast menu and overall just a good experience all the way around. Short walk to Little Italy for dinner, very easy.
Very nice brand new hotel, gorgeous views of the city. Very clean. Nice, friendly staff. Great value. Location is a couple blocks from subway station and very close to little italy.

When we drove into NYC and into chinatown I was rather worried about the area, and then I saw the Wyndham hotel and relaxed rather. What a fantastic hotel, there were four of us and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay.Initially we were placed on the fifth floor but my husband asked if there were any rooms available higher up, so we moved to the ninth floor and what a difference. We had wonderful views of uptown Manhattan, and also of the financial district, which made such a difference.The room was extremely clean, as was the rest of the hotel, it wasn't huge but contained everything we needed. The room itself had 2 floor to ceilng full width windows and the bathroom window was floor to ceiling , what a brilliant feature ! My husband and I found the bed uncomfortable, my husband asked if they could make it more comfortable and the next two nights were much better. My husband found that the aircon did not cool the room sufficiently, however maintenance tried to sort it and it did get cooler (I was shivering), plus the fact hubby wasn't 100% which could have been the reason.The staff were excellent and worked hard to sort things out and make the stay enjoyable. The position of the hotel is fantastic as Chinatown is fun and interesting, but its only a short walk to Little Italy, and there is a subway station around the corner. There is a bus which goes uptown which is useful as well.The reason this does not get five stars is its restaurant and bar, which we have learnt is a franchise. Breakfast, we ordered oatmeal and coffee, was a complete let down and we were not offered a top up for the coffee. The oatmeal was tasteless. There are plenty of restaurants/cafes around so the rest of our stay we went out. My son and husband had a few problems at the bar as well, however my husband spoke to Omar and after that there were no problems.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and when I return to NYC I know where I will be staying. Next time I will not use the restaurant and bar. Thank you very much to Omar and staff for making our stay very special.

I stayed 2 nights and enjoyed completely. The room was new and clean and the location is great to explore the city. The stuff was very well informed and helpful with recommendations. I would come back definitely.

We stayed here for almost a week in March 2013.Having previously stayed in different areas of Manhattan island, we were keen to try out a new area and the Wyndham Garden was well reviewed and in a good location.Pros - Location is fantastic in Chinatown, 5 minute walk to the subway station, 10 minute walk to Soho and lower Broadway shopping area. Plenty of restaurants and mini-marts nearby. The views from our room (top floor) were fantastic - snow over NYC, the Chrysler building and Empire State Building. The room was very clean. Reception staff were very friendly and unpretentious, and check-in was easy. We were 'upgraded' rooms, HOWEVER, we had booked a balcony room and were 'upgraded' to a room one floor up but that had no balcony! We couldn't be bothered requesting another change so stayed there. Cons - Rooms a on the small side (normal for NYC), so difficult to move around with 2 large suitcases in the room. Additionally, the bathroom doors are almost transparent (looking straight through to the toilet), so if you don't like being able to see your partner on the toilet then this is worth knowing! Our biggest issue here however was the parties that were hosted on the top floor (the very top floor of the building, above the uppermost floor of guest rooms). It seems that this space is rented out for functions/events, so you end up sharing the lifts with many non-hotel guests who are heading up to the parties, and from our room, it was VERY noisy. Having planned an early night in one night, we were surrounded by the sound of thumping bass in our room and when we phoned reception to enquire about the noise, they just apologised and said it would be done by midnight. There was no change to the volume or timing of the end of the function, as I guess they aren't able to do so when somebody has paid to use the space. Furthermore, reception staff did not offer us a room change, and didn't tell us that there would be another function held the following night!!! So, same problem 2 nights running, which I felt was poorly managed.Overall - probably a good experience, marred by the events of the Friday and Saturday night while staying near the top floor. If I was to stay there again, I would definitely book a floor a few levels down from there to be safe, and confirm before booking RE function noise.

This is a very new and modern hotel. The view of Manhattan is great. It's close to the subway and lots of really good food in Chinatown, Little Italy and Lower East Side. We stayed on the 10th floor, which didn't have an ice machine - we had to call the front desk or get some from the bar on the first floor, but that wasn't a big deal. I would recommend it to others.

This hotel really is wonderful and the staff couldn't make you feel more welcome - even offering to lend straighteners as mine didn't work in the US! The staff couldn't do enough for you and this came across so genuine which made it such a relaxing place to stay. The room was cleaned daily perfectly and was so nice and modern. Ignore the reviews that say the rooms are small, for NYC they are more than big enough. The surrouding area isn't fantastic but has two nearby subway stations on different lines and certainly doesn't feel unsafe - perhaps just a bit dirty. This certainly isn't reflected within the Hotel as it's interior is immaculate. The Hotel Bar is fantastic with Happy Hour 5 - 8 it is the best place to get drinks before you head out for the night. Once again, fantastic service from friendly bar staff. I would 100% recommend this hotel for any kind of stay whether it be leisure or business along with any length of time. I wish this Hotel the best of success in the future and thank you for such a pleasant and stress-free stay.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The airline had lost our baggage for 4 days and the hotel offered us all the essential things we needed to make our stay more comfortable.

Fantastic!!!! China Town was mad but ace, this hotel is an oasis in a busy hot city staff were polite and helpful. Please do take time to eat in the restaurant it's excellent. Can't fault anything thank you for a delightful stay.

Hotel was located conveniently for The Capitale where we were attending a wedding but generally the area is not very nice at all. Staff were very good and the hotel was clean. Very pricey for the size of room you get. We enjoyed our stay as it was convenient to where we wanted to be.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel...staff and generally everything was fine.Just two things which were not satisfactory :1. the ceiling in our room started to leak - perhaps from the air conditioning unit - we were in the middle of wedding celebrations so did not report it but the maid did but nothing was done about it. We checked out two days later and nothing was mentioned at the time either - we did check out very early in the morning.2. I reported a loss of a white cardigan which I discovered once I had returned to the UK - but have not heard anything at all. As I did not wear it on my trip at all, it must have been left in the bedroom but no one has found it - very strange.I would very much like to recover this item as it is part of a set and I cannot replace it.

The Hotel in every respect is excellent. But just don't use the TAXI service provided by the Hotel,they overcharge ($96 to go to the Airport, Yellow Cab costs a fraction just do your Homework). If we used a Yellow Cab service, this Hotel was excellent in every sense of the word. Good staff, very clean and excellent service. What more do you need ?

We stayed here for two nights over Labor Day weekend. We arrived at the hotel mid-morning after an overnight flight and were extremely happy that our room was ready upon check-in! The staff at the front desk were friendly and efficient. Our housekeeper greeted us both mornings and wished us a good day when we left for the day. The room was clean, TV good with several channels, super compact with a shared balcony, had good lighting (I'm a stickler for reading lights on both sides of the bed), a small fridge, coffee maker with coffee, tea, and water. As others have noted, the lack of full shower glass makes a mess on the floor. The first morning I had a water pressure issue but my husband adjusted the shower head and that helped the problem.We ordered room service one morning. The food came quickly, was hot, simple diner type food, but definitely a good value.The location is great with lots of restaurants and much to do, being close to Chinatown and Little Italy. The subway station that was close by was not working during the time we were there so we had to walk quite a way in the heat, which was not so great.Would I stay at this hotel again? Yes! The staff were all welcoming and professional. The room was comfortable--tiny--but comfortable.

Hi -Loved the fact that you are within walking distance of Little Italy and more. Endless shops, diners, cafes, restaurants that were all delish! I didn't experience food at the hotel since there were so many walking options but the hotel was so clean and attractive. Our room was spacious, called for extra sheets for pullout bed and the staff was there in minutes. The staff welcomed us each time we came back from somewhere and was ever so helpful with transportation, extended checkout time, business center for printer/computer. Felt safe, secure and taken care of. Oh, and floor to ceiling walls in our room? Incredible!

We stayed for four nights and could not fault the hotel. All the staff were attentive and courteous particularly Hamza. It is in a great location to explore Chinatown, Soho and Little Italy. We would happily stay there again when in New York.

A decent hotel but you'd expect a bit more for a new hotel. Our room was reasonably clean, the tv was good and the air con was great but the shower had absolutely no pressure which was disappointing. Still overall good. Go for a 15th floor room if possible - the shared balcony is nice and the rooms are bigger.The food in the hotel... I had breakfast there on the first morning of our stay and it was unequivocally horrid. Service was non existant too so we never ate there again. Good options reasonably nearby though, my favourite being Russ and Daughters. The bar was also a little strange - very open and in the lobby so again that didnt appeal for a drink and we avoided it.Service at reception was good- always friendly. Price wise the value is good compared to other hotels (although New York hotels in general are very expensive conpared to other major international cities)Overall, Chinatown is really not the place to stay for a tourist, but if you do want to stay there, this is a decent hotel for sure.
Very nice and clean hotel, open only 9 months. My only complaint was they don't have full shower doors and the water got all over the floor even with the shower head pointed at toward wall.

An oasis in NYC Chinatown. Every Chinese restaurant big or small, inexpensive or very high end, all within walking distance. Hotel is highly maintained. Workers are courteous and helpful. I got a corner room which had a 270 degree view. The only drawback is the shower without door. This makes the water runs weak and slow, and you are unable to take a bah after an exhausting, hot summer day of touring the Manhattan area. For this I only gave 4 stars.

The rooms were small but who needs much space on vacation? The bathrooms were spacious, the bed comfortable, and the coffee strong. The elevators were fast, and we were able to move rooms easily to be a bit higher off the street. Amazingly, the noise wasn't an issue for sleeping. Be careful to put all shades down (including the bathroom!). We didn't try the restuarant, but diners seemed pleased. The hustle and bustle of Chinatown can be a bit much, but an easy cab/subway/walk and you're in SoHo or Little Italy.

My wife and I stayed at the Wyndham Chinatown last June 2013. The hotel is 5 minutes away from a Grant St. Subway Station, lines B-D, where you can easily head north and get to the Rockafeller Center or Bryant Park or south to Wall Street or Ground Zero by changing lines at the B-way/Lafayette Station. The room was small but very neat and clean with a great panoramic view of NY. However, please keep in mind that you are in the heart of Chinatown and across Little Italy meaning during the day the area is pretty busy and crowed and you find a wide variety of everything. The price for the room was very attractive and competitive comparing with what is available in NY.

I stayed 4 nights at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown hotel at the end of August, and the view from my room was one of the highlights of my visit. (And my visit was lots of fun!) Floor-to-ceiling windows, a view of the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, and other landmarks...doesn't get much better than this.The staff was very friendly and helpful, allowing me to check in early after my red-eye flight, arranging a rollaway bed, giving me a room with a great view as I had requested, storing my luggage until it was time to depart for the airport.The room itself was reasonable-sized for New York, with a comfy bed and the usual amenities, including a refrigerator and free Wi-Fi. And did I mention the view??The Chinatown location was convenient to several subway stations that serve different lines, making it easy to get anywhere in New York City. And I loved the bustling neighborhood -- had breakfast every day at a Chinese bakery around the corner.I would love to stay here again on my next trip, and would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel was very good value and we liked the location in Chinatown/Little Italy as very convenient - we walked to 3 different subway stops near the hotel and easily walked to South Street Seaport from the hotel.

I cannot say enough about this great little hotel and it's fabulous staff. I planned a surprise visit for my husband's birthday and the staff helped me select a beautiful room with an amazing view. They also somehow placed flowers and wine in the room while we were checking in. Because the location is perfect for those of us who love downtown we walked, and ate our way through the East Village, Lower East Side, Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho - and took a Circle Line tour - all in three days. Kim and her staff were so fabulous about providing us with band aids for our battered feet and answering our endless questions, Tom was incredibly gracious in preparing my surprise and Omar made us feel so at home. The hotel is exquisitely beautiful. Some people say small - let's remember - this IS Chinatown. This will be one of my favorite memories. Thank you to the entire staff at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.

The location was convenient, which is what brought me to this location. The room was rather cramped. The bathroom, I found rather annoying. There was one hook near the shower, the only place I could hang my toiletry bag. That left me no were to hang my bath towel or any hand towel, forget about my clothes after my shower. The open shower door, seemed rather weird because water would get onto the floor. I would of liked a little more room to place my stuff in the room other than the one luggage rack.

To many travellers, staying at Chinatown might not be as pleasing as staying at midtown. However I would strongly recommend considering Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Here are the reasons:1) It is really close to the subway, and reaching any tourist spots is not a problem. NYC is not some place where you can just walk around without transportation. Get yourself a metro pass and stay close to the subway!2) Contrast to all those expensive midtown dining places, you can save $$ by eating in Chinatown and little Italy. There are great bakery shops, supermarkets, and restaurants offering special cuisines. Yummy and cheap! If you really want some expensive experience, you can try having brunch or desserts in SOHO, which is within walking distance from the hotel.3)Regardless of how the area looks, the hotel is modern, clean, and brand new. Staying at a brand new 3.5 hotel is much more comfortable than staying at some out-of-date 5 stars (both physically and financially).4) The hotel staff are welcoming and helpful. Here I must thank Massy, who worked at the front desk the day I checked out. My cousin said she would pick up my mom and me at the hotel and drive us to Penn Station, but she didn't show up on time. Massy generously offered his cell phone for me to contact her to avoid roaming. After knowing we decided to go to Penn Station directly, he kindly pointed out the closest subway station and told us the quickest way to get there.I am satisfied with the room size. It is not big, but fits 2 people comfortably. Road construction was annoying, but that was not the hotel's fault. Plus, NYC is having summer constructions everywhere.However I do want to point out two things for further improvement:-Ours was a three-day stay. We are fine with not replacing bed sheets, but we want our bathroom floor to be cleaned everyday. You know, mom and I, two women = long hair...-Giving out 2 bottles of water upon arrival is awesome. But what about the next day and the day after? The weather was so hot and we were really thirsty. Thank God the supermarket in Chinatown was nearby.

The Deluxe Queen Room with balcony does not give you a balcony. As the hotel is quite new the rooms are however modern and clean but traffic noise can be a problem if you are on a low level floor as I was.

This was a quick overnight stay so we could have dinner in Little Italy. The hotel was very clean and the service was excellent. We stayed on a higher floor so the traffic noise did not bother us as others stated below. It was a very small room so I don't believe I could stay there more than 1 or 2 nights. Not much counter space in the bath and not much room to hang towels. Though within walking distance to Little Italy I'm not a big fan of the Chinatown location.
This hotel was awesome! Awesome bed, awesome room, awesome food, awesome service... AND awesome view!!!

Convenient to Chinatown, lower east side, soho and little Italy. Everything works in this brand new hotel. Hazma and desk staff are terrific. Highly recommended. Chinatown location is a little on the edge, but so very convenient to many different neighborhoods. Can walk most everywhere.

We found this hotel as a "secret deal" on a travel website, and I could not be more impressed with my stay. This hotel is located in a fantastic area with easy walking distance to many attractions. There are also 3 subway stations within 1/4 mile of the hotel which we found effective and easy to use during our stay. The hotel staff was VERY friendly and even upgraded us to a corner room due to it being my birthday. The rooms are set up very efficiently and maximize all space. There are BEAUTIFUL views of the city, a very clean hotel room, and friendly staff to make the stay comfortable. The hotel also has its own bar and its own restaurant which we tried out during our stay. They were VERY affordable and delicious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would absolutely come back for another stay.

First time visiting NYC. found this place on line, and were so happy with the results. Reasonably priced and close enough to everything to walk, get the tube, or taxi. Awesome rooms, very clean and neat, too. The decor was extremely modern and it had all the amenities There was a spectacular view of the Empire State and the Chrysler Building. Also couple of blocks away from Soho, Little Italy and 1 block from subway. The staff was friendly specially Janice always smiling , willing to help, very funny and lovely I never met such a wonderful hotel staff like her. Thanks also to Hamza the young man very friendly ,kind and helpful. This hotel is lucky to have these two awesome guys. On our next visit to New York we will never stay anywhere but here. Highly recommended.

The staff more than made up for the fact the that the location was't the greatest. The hotel itself was very clean and well kept. We were greeted the moment we stepped on property and was given excellent service from entire staff. Great food recommendations and directions beautiful decor and surprising large bathroom. Room was bright and comfortable. The front desk and doorman made you fell important and readily gave you excellent service. I highly recommend this hotel

We just returned from an overnight to NYC and stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. The rooms were large for a NYC hotel, very clean, quiet, and comfortable! The staff was amazing and Omar, the general manager, was very helpful and courteous. Location was great! Plan to stay there again on our next trip.
Excellent value for the price. From check in to check out this was a great experience. Would definitely stay here again.

It is in chinatown, so convenient to walk in chinatown, little italy, soho, century 21, east village. Still new and clean. Ask for the highest room you can get. They gave us 10th floor and we could still hear street construction all night long. Showers are very messy bc not covered completely and water gets all over the bathroom floor. There is a mini fridge, but no ice machine.

We had a really memorable week's stay in the Wyndham Garden Chinatown (19th Aug - 26th Aug 2013). Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. It was evident that they wanted you to enjoy your stay and were incredibly attentive in a subtle way and helpful at all times. We had two queen rooms for 4 of us - we asked for a good view as it was our first visit to New York and were upgraded to rooms with a balcony which had a spectacular view! Our rooms were on the 7th floor - incredibly clean, spacious and the balcony was brilliant. Room 702 was fantastic as it had a double aspect balcony! Breakfast was lovely, especially with the friendly and obliging Carol. The front of house were equally as friendly, including Massey, Kim and Hamza who were particularly attentive to our needs. We found the location great as it allowed you to experience "real life" New York, walking distance from Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho and was close to Grand St and Canal St subways. We would highly recommend this beautiful hotel and will definitely be staying here again! We can't wait to come back hopefully in the not too distant future.

Rooms on top floors with terras have excellent views over the city. Nice to wake up en go to sleep with Mantattan on your feet. Nice large windows on the whole side of the room but.... It is very strange that a hotel with a modern funky exterior has such a boring interior. (probably same style in all Wyndham hotels.)
Excellent hotel with a great location. Extremely modern. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the "new" shower. Without a door or a shower curtain, water goes everywhere.

We went to NY for my nieces wedding. She was married at Battery Gardens Restaurant. My whole family stayed at the W. I went to visit them at the W on Washington Street and hated it there. We loved staying at the Wyndham Garden hotel, chinatown. This is a great location for dining. Located at the edge of chinatown, soho, and 1 block from little Italy. Easy to walk. Neighborhood looks dingy but everyone said it was safe and that was our experience. The hotel is new and well appointed, although room is small and only accommodates 2 people. It comes with minifridge, ironing board, iron, desk, hair dryer and free internet with our Whydham rewards number. Bed is Queen, no king beds, and no bathtubs. Very little space to walk around bed. The flat screen tv had cable. Everything worked well in the room. There is a small fitness room in the basement and a restaurant, although we preferred to eat out. Great for shopping if you want to walk 1/2 mile (about 6-8 blocks.) It is very noise outside the hotel, but our room was quiet with a nice view. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. There were no ice machines, so we had to get ice from the lobby restaurant. That was the only drawback of the whole trip, but I heard they were getting ice machines soon. The whole hotel is non-smoking. The rooms also come with AC. The shower had good water pressure.

A clean, comfortable and well-organised hotel in a busy and lively area. But don't let the location deter you...it might be a new and perhaps alien environment for some visitors, but it is safe, interesting and has good travel links to the rest of Manhattan. And, if you are prepared to walk, there are numerous good restaurants and places of interest within ten to fifteen minutes.The hotel is new and a pleasure to stay in. Our ninth floor room, which gave us an excellent view of the Empire State Building further uptown, was compact but well-equipped with a very comfortable bed and effective air-conditioning.A couple of suggestions : more clothes storage space for longer stays and more hanging space in the bathroom for towels and clothes.But, overall, a very enjoyable stay in a modern, friendly and well-run hotel.

I would not normally stay in this end of Manhattan but my daughter just moved to Chinatown and I wanted to be very close by her apartment so we tried a new hotel. The rooms are clean and modern and large enough. The lobby is rather small but the size of that is not important to me. The staff was very pleasant. We ordered some wine by the glass at the hotel bar before dinner and it was only $5 and very good also. I'm used to hotels overcharging for things like that. I think they reduce the rates before dinner, because later in the evening it was more expensive, but fair. The room rate was reasonable. Valet overnight parking was $53 which was more typical for NY but if you make the effort there are garages around I saw later when walking and that might be better. There was a small hole in my car's bumper the next day and I didn't notice until I was 2 hours away. However, I cannot say if the hotel parking attendant did it or someone else hit my car while parked. Just park it yourself.

Three stars because it is a three star hotel. The location is pretty horrible, and honking and screaming from the street can be heard at all hours. We could not get a wink of peaceful sleep. The subway wasn't that close, but there were plenty of foot rubbing shops, fake purse vendors, and traditional Chinese herb stores nearby. The staff was friendly, though they lost our laundry for a while and that was unpleasant. Also, the balcony you get is shared with everyone else at the hotel and was littered with used styrofoam coffee cups. I wouldn't stay here again. Not with comparably priced hotels right down Canal Street that are quieter for the same price.

We stayed here for 2 nights and found the service to be really helpful and good. This was my 4th trip to NY. It's a brand new hotel that looks great. We had a room with a balcony with great views of the city. The room was a good size, very clean and nicely furnished. The bathroom shower was huge. They don't have anywhere to hang towels though and should be addressed. The air con blew quite strong on one side of the bed (room 702) and was a little cold even when the room temp was good (it was on the slowest speed). The bed was and cushions were very comfortable. We had a balcony but oddly they're not sectioned off to your room so you can technically walk around to the rooms next to you, not a major issue though.The wifi was good, 1Mbps. We didn't find it easy to park next to the hotel to drop our bags though but it is NY so what can you do. The hotel did help as much as they could when we arrived. They sent a porter down as soon as we arrived while I waited at my car.The restaurant downstairs looked good even though we didn't eat there.There's 2 subway stations nearby and loads of shops and restaurants on your doorstep.We would definitely stay here again.

We checked into the Wyndham Garden Chinatown apprehensive about what we might find as we booked this at the last minute. Were we pleasantly surprised. A brand new hotel just 9 months old, courteous staff, immaculate rooms and great service. We booked two rooms for 8 of us including a two year old. The staff were very helpful when some of us checked in early. The rooms were a bit small but large by New York standards. Parking is a hassle but once you are there you can cab it everywhere. Great to get to a lot of downtown. Would definitely recommend to others.

The room was clean, and the hotel was clean. The staff was nice. The room had a double bed, and space for a cot. The bathroom had a shower and not a tub. It was small, without any extra space. For Manhattan, it was still on the small side, but clean. The towels were average.

I never write reviews but after staying at the WGC in Chinatown NYC twice since they've opened in the fall of 2012, and dealing with such a wonderful staff, I felt compelled to tell everyone what a great hotel WGC is. I stayed there for the Chinese New Year celebration in February and most recently 2 weeks ago. The hotel is extremely clean and in a great spot; off of Canal so away from the madness but still close in proximity to Little Italy, SoHo, and thick of Chinatown. The rooms are fair for Manhattan and there are neat amenities such as a pretty nice gym. The thing that put me over the top to write this review is the amazing staff; always SO nice and just a very professional crew...you can tell they really value their clients and want you to return. On both occasions, I have had the great pleasure to deal with Janice and Hamza who always have a smile and are willing to make your stay a pleasant one. Through reservations, I have dealt with Meyin, who is God-sent in how she is speedy in her replies and ensures you have all concerns answered to the point she gives you 3 phone numbers to contact HER if there are any issues. For example, we intended to stay at WGC in the fall of 2012 right after Hurricane Sandy; however, due to the City's damage, it was postponed. Meyin ensured we were able to seamlessly transfer to another Wyndham property and followed up with handling a subsequent stay in February. I've stayed in NYC MANY times and have seen some decent hotels and some not so great; for me, WGC is probably our favorite for the value and location but most importantly, people like Janice, Meyin and Hamza ensure I will return each time.

My friend & I stayed here for 2 nights and Janice was very nice upon check in. Our room was on the 16th floor so we had excellent views of Chinatown and upper Manhattan. The room was very nice, clean and managed. The only big inconvenience we experienced was the lack of ice machines on none of the hotel floors. The in room book stated our nearest ice machine was on floor 15 but it was removed. I later found out they had all been removed and that we needed to walk to the lobby bar for ice. Being on a vacation we often made drinks in our room so this ice issue was very inconvenient. I wish we were told this upon check in. We also ate at the outdoor patio restaurant called Elevate. They offered discounted food & it was very delicious. Upon check out we left our bags to do some souvenir shopping & Cameron was also very nice. They staff seems very happy to work here.

The staff was amazing and the hotel was really clean! The staff recommended great local places to eat and they were very accommodating on directions for us tourists to New York. I would definitely stay here again and I want to thank them for making my stay an incredible one!

My husband and I stayed at the hotel only for 1 night, but we wish we could stay longer. The hotel is modern, like new, clean. We enjoyed the bed which was soft and very comfortable. The hotel is in Chinatown area. We arrived at around 12am, but we still got to have a very nice food at a Chinese restaurant close to the hotel. The service was good and the staff was helpful. You need to use bus or subway to get to the main attractions. The price was reasonable, cheaper than staying closer to Times Square.

My wife and I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. We originally had a balcony room on the second floor. We asked for a balcony room on a higher floor for the views. Without hesitation we got a balcony room on the seventh floor. What a view of the city surrounding the hotel! Conveniently located to the subway for easy access to anywhere in the city. Prime location for Canal Street Chinatown and Little Italy. Hotel was extra clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Glass front floor to ceiling windows give you an exceptional view. If staying during the warmer months of the year then I would recommend a balcony room. My wife and I look forward to another weekend getaway at the Wyndham Garden hotel again.
I hated that the shower had a window to the room and you can see the shadow of the person taking a shower. Also queen beds are too small for two people.

Was a really nice hotel to stay in. Really the only negative I can come up with would be the windows aren't soundproof. I stayed on the 8th floor and could easily hear the traffic downstairs, unfortunately there were roadworks one night and the jackhammer was easily heard, enough for me to get up and take a look.

I booked a stay at Wyndham based on reviews and the price. There are some major pros and cons to consider when deciding whether the relatively low cost (for Manhattan) is worth the stay, and while I had a pleasant stay I probably wouldn't return. On one hand the hotel is brand new so it's clean and not at all run down. The room I stayed in was a decent size (for NYC), and the staff was friendly. The hotel is a quick walk to the D train, Chinatown and little Italy, and if you don't mind walking a little further you can get over to SOHO for some shopping, the R train at Canal, and to a Whole Foods and great restaurants north at Houston. It's also a super-quick walk to some amazing views from the Manhattan Bridge, which is the edgier and less tourist friendly cousin of the Brooklyn Bridge.On the other hand the hotel is located right in Chinatown and while it's a short-trek to nicer parts of town the immediate area is very sketchy, especially after dark. I imagine that for those not from a big city the distinct smells of Chinatown, the insane crowds, and the filthy run-down neighborhood in the vicinity would make them very uncomfortable. On top of that traffic in this part of town is true chaos and even from the 9th floor it was way too loud on a few nights. Overall this hotel close to the subway is sparkly and clean for a great value, but the immediate neighborhood is a bit of a downer and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who would be travelling alone or uncomfortable in a rough neighborhood.
Located in Chinatown, stores/markets and Chinese restaurants all around you, $15 with a cab to Times Square, cheap hotel with high standards, and a beautiful view of the city.

We were very satisfied with our 3 day stay at the Wyndham Chinatown. Special thanks for taking note of our request of a room high up with good view - we got a north facing room on the 11th floor with a fantastic view over the city including the Empire state and a view all the way up Bowery street.Staff were helpful, room was clean - the only negative was that the shower wall was too short, so water went over the bathroom floor, but really not a huge deal.

I stayed in 4th floor with windows facing the street. I could not get much sleep because of the traffic noise from the street. It was my bad luck that there was a public construction work for the 2 nights I stayed right across the street. I felt like I had the front row seat (bed) in the street. Windows need to be sound-proof! Don't expect a lot of services from the front desk. Service staffs who clean and fix were more friendly. If you bring your own car you pay extra $43 per day or per entry. That means you can't take it out unless you want pay for the extra day on the same day.

Just spent a week in this hotel. Clean, new hotel in a great location! When I read the less favorable reviews of the hotel, they mostly mentioned being disappointed in the staff and service, but I can't imagine why! There were 5 of us staying there for a week and we all found everyone so pleasant and helpful!! Our room was really nice, really quiet, and the view was spectacular (11th floor!). My main complaint would be the same as many other have stated: the shower door situation is very strange. It is impossible to keep the water in the shower. My second issue was the lack of places to hang towels in the bathroom, making it hard to do the eco-friendly practice of using towels for more than one day. However, since we usually had to use towels to sop up the water from the shower, this wasn't as big of a deal as it could have been. Still, there were spaces where they could have put a bar or hook to hang hand and bath towels in the bathroom. The only other thing, and it is minor, is that I found it kid of odd that I had to go all the way to the lobby bar to get ice. Overall, this was a very positive experience!
We stayed in this hotel for a couple of days. It's very good in terms of location and nice staff. We liked it very much! Definitely will be back.
Good place for a short stay. Clean and quiet. Parking is valet with no in and out privileges and took a while to get when leaving

Our check in was exceptional. We had a great gentleman who was respectful and accommodating. On our last couple of days here we decided that we wanting to stay here during our Christmas vacation also and decided to ask the lady at the front desk about reserving a room during that time. We were brushed off quickly and was given a card and was told to check the website on a later date. Now, I would understand if the lobby was busy and that was why she was rude with us but there was no one, just her and I. Also, why do I need to check the website when I'm already here in the hotel? I understand my Christmas vacation is 5 months from now but I was able to reserved my current room here, in February(6 months prior) over the phone. We did not like her level of professionalism towards us nor towards other guests that we witness while entering in and out of the lobby. The hotel was great. Majority of the staff that we encounter were courteous but a few of the staff were rude and unprofessional.

If you need a Chinatown hotel, this is probably it. Front desk staff is very friendly and accommodating. We reserved one of the two suites as we had guests over for drinks, etc. The room is reasonably sized, not large. It is too bad they did not put the largest rooms on the top floors to get the best views, but this one was at least on the side with a view of the Empire State building. Bed was comfortable although the bedroom itself is very small and it is almost impossible to get into one side of the bed as it is SO close to the wall. This bed would not work for two large people. Also the bathroom door is frosted glass (not a lot of privacy) and swings into the room.All-in-all a good stay.

Great location near two subway stations and center of Chinatown. Friendly staff. Organization of room and cleanliness was very impressive. We really enjoyed our stay and will stay there again and again whenever we come to NYC

Stayed in NYC many times and this hotel by far has been the best. It is newer so hopefully they can keep the cleanliness and service top notch. The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean and quiet. The only thing could not locate fan in the bathroom and it got steamy from the shower.

I have always stayed in the times square area hotels. Never again, the desk clerks were all fabulous, friendly, and so helpful. The quietness of the room allowed for a peaceful escape from the noisy city streets. Key elements in the tastefully decorated room made you feel very comfortable. I visited in the middle of a heat wave and the room was wonderfully cool and airy. There are restaurants in the area to make any 'foodie' think they were in paradise. I am disabled and sometimes find it difficult to travel, but I was greeted with a ground level elevator which was so nice after traveling all day. Just outside this Wyndham lies a compendium of discoveries that awe,astound,surprise, and delight-----the desk clerks will always smile and give you a thrilling sense of hope for whether you are searching out flea markets or taking in a broadway play! My stay at this Wyndham altered my perception of what a NYC experience should be! Can not wait to return to visit in January to this awe-inspiring palette of friends at the Chinatown Wyndham.

My girlfriend and I made our annual trip to NYC.We like to change hotels up to suit the neighborhood we want to stay in.This trip - The Lower East Side.We highly recommend the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.The location, value and staff were terrific!Make sure to say hi to our new friend Massy at the front desk - very helpful and kind!JK

The staff were very helpful. However, the room was so small we were bumping into each other. Definitely not for 4 people in a room, 2 at the most. Shower has only half door so you step into a wet floor when you get out of shower. Location was convenient for doing a back to back tours from Chinatown .

I was with my wife & 1 year old & could not have had a better time! The rooms are clean & with some modern flair. Bed was very comfortable & we had a shared balcony for some scenery (great look at the Empire State Building)! The staff was what you look for when you are traveling, they were the nicest & so accommodating! One of the receptionist, Massey, even lent us his personal umbrella. The best was, my left her wedding band in the room after we checked out & they found it for us. We are so grateful for their honesty, I don't know it would be like to lose something like that, lucky for my wife (she would've never heard the end of it from me)! I would not only highly recommend this hotel but will return here for our next visit to NYC!! Can't say enough about the GREAT STAFF!!!!
The Wyndham hotel in Chinatown is really beautiful and close to Soho, Wall Street and little Italy. The rooms have floor to ceilings that were my favorite thing about the hotel.

We had a great experience at this hotel. It's one of the newer hotels in the area and within walking distance to SOHO, Chinatown, Little Italy, Wall Street, etc. The rooms are small but nicely done and have beautiful views of the city from floor to ceiling windows. It was quiet, and the staff were friendly and helpful when it came to suggestions for food or sight seeing. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone wanting a nice place to stay in this area of the city.

I found this hotel at a great rate, $169/nt. The low price made me look further into it, as most low-priced hotels in NYC are cheap for reasons I don't like lol. But this was definitely a steal of a deal. The hotel was nice and modern. Staff was very pleasant, and a pleasure to deal with. They held our bags while we went to park the car in Brooklyn (free, easy parking). Complimentary drink coupons upon our arrival was a generous gesture. A few things stuck out to me from my two night stay here with my wife...-The hallways & elevator didn't have air conditioning. On the hottest days of July, this kinda took me by surprise. No biggie though...just odd.-No ice machines! One of the first things we normally do is get ice for the room. Each floor appears to have an area where an ice machine SHOULD go, but there are no machines. Cost saving measure? Perhaps. Inconvenient, for sure. But luckily, the staff is responsive to requests. A simple call, and staff will bring you ice. (They get it from the restaurant downstairs. I think you can go down there and get it yourself as well). Odd.-The bathroom shower. Hmmm...its designed beautifully. But there is a disconnect between form & function here. There is half of a glass door, that allows for the shower to splash all over the bathroom floor. Yeah, they give you plenty of towels for the floor. but...uhhh...its beautifully awkward. Those "odd" things don't take away from our experience though. It was a great hotel. We have stayed in plenty of hotels in NYC. This is a perfect hotel for couples. The hotel is modern, clean, reasonably prices with excellent staff. I would recommend staying here.

Fun hip hotel in the heart of Chinatown. Great bar and clean contemporary rooms. The service however was less than stellar. Make sure you ask for a high floor as it is a high traffic area with lots of night time noise.

This was my second time at this hotel--the first time I stayed in February and, most recently, in July. It is a new hotel, modernly furnished, with well-appointed rooms, modern bathroom, and lots of natural light. The staff is very helpful and professional. It is very well priced and it has become one of my favorite hotels in the city. The location is excellent as well--an easy subway ride to the financial district or 15 min walk to Soho and LES. Two things I think you should keep in mind, particularly if you are planning to visit in July or August:--There is a road construction going on right in front of the hotel. Since this is New York, the actual work is being performed each weekday night before 10pm and 4am to minimize impact on traffic. Imagine listening to drilling, banging and other noise while you are trying to sleep! The construction lasted during my entire 9 day stay (except on Sat and Sun), and based on the info posted at the construction site, it is supposed to go through late August. Needless to say, my sleep suffered greatly. --The AC in rooms is very loud, which I found very surprising for such a new hotel. To be honest, though, the AC loudness did drown some of the construction noise, so in this situation I guess it was not necessarily a negative. All in all, I think this is a great hotel and I plan to return, provided that the street construction is finished by my next trip in September. In the meantime, I would recommend that the reception staff becomes more knowledgable and is able to provide more info about the construction to guests who ask about it ( when we originally inquired about the construction, the staff was very apologetic, but said that they did not have any info about when the construction would end, although this info is actually posted at the site).

The housekeeping and front desk staff were very nice but the bathrooms were ridiculous! The "ultra modern" look is such a non-green choice. The shower enclosure had a glass panel in lieu of a shower curtainhat is supposed to make the bathroom look larger I guess. But the wall it abutted to was not straight (or the glass wasn't straight) so every shower results in a soaking wet large bath towel. A bath mat towel was provided but that was needed to mop up the flood from the two foot wide expanse where a shower curtain would have been had there been one. And since the spash zone extended all the way to the sink, yet another towel was nbecessary to mop up the water from the tile floor to avoid a potential slip and fall incident. Because there are NO TOWEL RACKS all the towels get to be picked up by housekeeping and washed DAILY. Seriously, who thought this design was a good idea?The restaurant is incredibly overpriced. I went down for dinner one night and was the only patron. I couldn't understand the waitress who told me the beer had "poo poo" on top. I figured out from the hand signals that she meant they had to tap another "keg" for the draft beer. But "poo poo"? Then because I was the only person in the place, three, THREE, wait staff assembled in the resaurant and stared at me as I ate. Because I was too hungry and tired, instead of leaving, I just stared back till they left.

Love the Chinatown location. Great for lower Manhattan & access to Brooklyn.Staff were outstanding and very helpful (at all hours, I might add). Helped me out with printing, food recommendations, large items, checked bags. Just great.Bar is lame. Go out for fun and entertainment.A/C worked fine (during heatwave), but room always felt a little damp.Very stylish, but "French" shower is poorly designed and floods the B/R floor due to inadequate splash guard.Housekeeping staff are excellent.
The hotel was new and had a fresh feeling to it. The internet service provided was slow and I had a problem emailing from the server.
Nice, clean, and affordable in Chinatown which is an easy walk to the East Village, the Lower East Side and Little Italy

We stayed for two nights at the end of May. It was perfect. Beautiful views from the 15th floor, very nice and helpful staff, good location to get around (we walked the Brooklyn bridge our first night) all at a really good price for NYC. I did a lot of research and it paid off!I ended up calling to make the reservation because the website was acting up and got a significant discount off the price I was going to pay online.Restaurant was pretty good too.Only note is that the balconies are across the whole floor so are not private (there was never anyone else out there). I'd also suggest that they put a few chairs out so you could sit and enjoy the view.Would absolutely stay again!
overall great experience. clean.quiet.near my job. good size room for one person.food was great. excellent service.
The room was quite small but it was ok. It is close to the subway if you didn't drive to the hotel. It cost $43 per day to park with no in/out privileges.
Room was very nice and clean, tho small. Bed was very comfortable. Had a beautiful view of the city from the 15th floor balcony. wow! Staff was wonderful!

New, clean, attractive, comfortable room size, good shower, and the summer rates for NYC were good. Even had a few nice amenities for NYC: fitness center with eliptical, treadmill and weights; complementary bottle of water; restaurant with reasonable prices (didn't try the food however); good size ironing board and iron in each room; friendly, helpful workers; and an attractive bar area. Only negatives: couldn't regulate the temperature or fan speed in the air conditioner (it was cool enough, probably a bit too cool for my taste and whatever I did wouldn't adjust the temperature); and needs a towel rack in the bathroom (only 2 small hooks for towels). Would definitely stay here again!

Clean and neat. Good location being close to but not inside China Town. Staff are polite and responsive. Room smaller than expected but acceptable. The curtain should be thicker as it is too thin to block the morning sun. Gym is reasonably equipped and computers and printer in the lobby are free for guest use.

We could not have been more pleased with the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. The location offered perfect access to multiple landmarks in NYC. The staff was courteous, kind, informational, and exceptionally helpful. The room was amazing. The view from the balcony was amazing as well, and I would recommend a stay on the 7th floor to access the balcony. We were simply amazed and would return here in a heartbeat.
Clean, comfortable and convenient. The staff were very friendly, the location perfect. Would stay here again!

We stayed here for 3 nights from 10th June. On check inn we were upgraded to a suite which was lovely. Location was great for walking to China Town and Little Italy and only few blocks from 2 subway stations for rest of Manhattan. Nice lobby bar and the barman (Felix) looked after us superbly. Even helping me with an improvised cigar cutter for cigars I'd bought for me and my Dad and carried 7000 miles from Dubai!Hotel wifi was really good signal in both rooms and lobby area. Only recommendation would be some additional towel rails in the bathroom as I couldn't find a good place to hang it.

Exceptional property and people. This property is in Chinatown and there is easy access to public transportation. We would certainly stay at this property again and have told our friends of our experience.

Spent one night on a Sunday. We had a corner room with HUGE windows overlooking the Bowery. The check-in process was smooth though it is a pain to haul up our luggage a small set of stairs before the lobby. The room was clean and spacious. Quick walk to Chinatown, Nolita and SoHo.

We stayed in Wyndham Garden Chinatown for 6 nights in late June 2013. We really enjoyed our stay and warmly recommend the hotel to all travellers. There is absolutely no need to stay near Times Square, even if you are a first-time visitor like we were. There are very good subway connections from three subway stations near the hotel. Very convenient if you are landing in JFK, as there is a direct subway (J/Z) from the AirTrain station to Bowery, so no need to take a taxi. We used this both coming from and going to the airport.I had originally booked a Premium Queen Balcony room, but as a courtesy we were upgraded to an Executive Queen Balcony (thank you Vanessa!). The room was lovely and the view absolutely magnificent! Our room was situated on the 15th floor (room 1505) and whilst not very spacey, we had no problems staying there and had ample room for our suitcases as well. The bathroom was perfectly fine, it was one of those rooms with a bathtub and a shower curtain, so we did not experience the problem with water all over the floor, which seems to be the case in the bathrooms with walk-in showers. Even the bathroom had a floor-to-ceiling window, so we could have a bath and see Empire State Building while bathing. How cool is that!The bed was fine, as was the refrigerator, which we used to keep juice etc. cool. There is a small coffee machine in the room, so we had breakfast in the room a couple of times. There are really cheap and tasty Chinese bakeries nearby, so just go and get some warm buns, croissants etc. in the morning. Most were priced 1-1.75 USD, so you can get a breakfast for a few dollars. We never tried the hotel’s breakfast, as it was not included in our room price.Someone commented on the loud airconditioning in an earlier review. We found it to be true at least in our room, so much so that I had to use ear plugs during the first night; after that I got used to the noise and slept well. We did not hear any traffic noise from the streets with the exception of an occasional siren. I would prefer having a separate reading lamp on both sides of the bed; now there was one only on one side, but this was not a major issue. The room tended to get quite humid despite the airconditioning, even so that books that I had bought started to curl their pages due to humidity.Two things that I think the hotel could improve: get the ice machines installed, please! The hotel has been ready since last November, and still there is only an empty place in the hallway where the ice machine should be. Yes, I know you can go downstairs and ask for ice from the bartender, but we never bothered; besides, nobody mans the bar during the daytime. Another thing: please get some chairs and tables on the balcony! We so much enjoyed sitting on the balcony, watching the incredible view and having a drink, but we felt a bit uncomfortable having to sit on the balcony floor on towels and pillows taken from the room. I would really have expected the balconies to have furniture by now. Please note that the balconies are not really private, i.e. you can walk along the whole balcony, passing another rooms. This did not bother us. One thing that we thought was a bit odd: one of the windows of our bathroom was broken (it was so when we arrived), the outer glass of the double glazing was totally gone, only a few glass shards remained on the balcony floor. During our stay nobody picked the shards away, neither were any attempts made to replace the broken window. As the windows have double glazing and the inner one was still intact, this didn’t bother us much, but I just hope that they get it fixed before the weather turns colder.All staff members that we met were really nice and friendly, always saying hello when we passed the reception. If you travel with your pets, note that this hotel accepts pets, as we saw at least three dogs in the hotel during our stay; again, this did not bother us. Our room and the whole hotel was immaculately clean.We would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again and will recommend it to our friends.

Great location and New facilities make for a pleasant stay.The location is 5 blocks or walking distance to the City Clerks Marriage office.We came to New York on our 23rd anniversary to get a real marriage license and the staff was so helpful and friendly, made our stay extra special. The airline had lost our luggage and we were stressed but the staff make us feel at home and made sure every need was met. I highly recommend this Wyndam

The plusses: Very friendly, accomodating staff. Good service. Well kept property; seems quite new. Stylish decor. Surprisingly quiet for the busy surroundings.Minuses:Disfunctional bathroom - insufficient shower enclosure, so it floods with every shower; no bathroom fan, so the room was overly humid all the time; no towel racks (even though there was a "notice" asking us to hang our towels on racks if we didn't want them laundered daily to save energy). Only a duvet as bedcover, so either too warm with it or too cool without. Could have used an extra chair besides the desk chair. Internet was spotty, and we kept having to log in; it didn't remember us.Also, to comment on the location. We didn't choose it - we were part of a wedding group. But, there's not much "infrastucture" near the hotel other than Chinatown - no delis, sundry shops, etc. Perfect if you want immersion in Chinatown; less so if that's not your goal.
I loved the service. The location was a good surprise to me. What I liked the least was that the shower has no door. Sorry my poor English.

A really great option for a New York stay. We were just looking for something comfortable at a reasonable price but got so much more! A new, clean, stylish hotel with excellent staff. I nearly fell over when we walked into our room the first night to see magnificent views all the way up to the Empire State building. The windows are floor to ceiling. We were high up and on a corner, even the bathroom has floor to ceiling windows. My husband had slight vertigo at first!The location is excellent, right in Chinatown but only 2 blocks from Little Italy. We walked all over New York from there but the subway is nearby and taxis are a dime a dozen at the front door and not expensive. We didn't try the restaurant but this is New York, you can get food anywhere, anytime!I will definitely stay here again.

We have been remiss in not writing this review earlier to let people know what a pleasurable experience we had from March 9th through March 13 2013. We took our granddaughter to NYC as part of her high school graduation present.We will always remember the view through the "virtual" glass wall of our room looking out over Chinatown and Manhattan in general. The night views were amazing.The location was great. Access to the subway was nearby and restaurants nearby were plentiful.Most of all, we want to commend two staff (John Chen & Nazim Tabti). John and Nazim were courteous, helpful and ALWAYS smiling. They added even more value and friendly faces to provide assistance and information about NYC during our stay. They are the best!

Booked in for three but left after two. Service fine, location decent. Room itself was ok I suppose, but the bed was uncomfortable. Aircon was VERY noisy. Over-bath shower with shower curtain felt a bit low-rent. Nice views of the city as promised, but only a communal walk-around balcony with no seating and a tired-looking faux-asphalt mat on the floor for company. From there we saw the room next door had a smashed exterior glass panel. Vibe-free lobby. Not terrible, but expected more the the money - and sure enough found more elsewhere.
Everything was as it should. Speedy, courteous service at the check-in counter, clean comfortable room. No hassles.
user_location: Washington Dc, District Of Columbia, Usa

review_body: I could not be happier with this hotel. The staff was attentive and were always available, the rooms were clean and the view from our balcony was exceptional. We stayed there six days and five nights, and my wife and I have both stated we will only stay there again on our next visit to NYC. Just a block away from the subway, we were able to get anywhere we wanted without any issues.

Clean, modern room with a magnificent view over manhattan. Close to Little Italy, in the middle of china town, the Wyndham Garden is in an excellent position close to restaurants and shops of lower Manhattan and close to the underground and bus stops to take you to the Art Galleries, Museums and the Theatre district. A room on a high floor is great for the best view.The hotel is very good value for the price in New York. My only negative is that the rooms are very small and you can hear noisy neighbours.
Very clean (New) hotel. The staff is very friendly but the restaurant was over priced (thus very few diners). Make sure you find the subway stop 1 block over vs. the Canal Street.

My husband and I stayed two nights at this hotel. Nice décor, fantastic king size bed, convenient to the subway and pricing well below mid- and up-town hotels. There was a room safe and an empty fridge -- a real plus for Chinatown, which has excellent, inexpensive small groceries. Kim, the desk manager, was especially helpful, and left a lovely small box of nuts and chocolate when she found out it was my husband's birthday. We had a problem with the A/C that was fixed in short order. There is street noise, but nothing a decent pair of earplugs won't fix. I would definitely stay here again!
A comfort place to live:Clean,friendly,everything was good. And most importantly,we got a low Price!
Location is good, rooms good too, but the shower needs a better door, the water all over when talking the shower. One reception is kind of lazy, doesn't provide any info if you ask.
I wasn't expecting the view at all so that was quite a nice surprise. One of the best stays I've had.

Having travelled to NY on business and pleasure countless times over the years, and stayed at virtually every major hotel brand, this hotel was a welcome change. Wyndham Garden Chinatown offers a first class product in comfort, cleanliness and service at a very competitive price. Location is convenient to many tourist sites in the lower portion of Manhattan, but we felt like we were in Tapei or China when we walked around the immediate hotel environs. No Bagels or Starbucks around here. Hard to believe your in New York, or even the US.We loved the floor to ceiling walls/windows with their great views. Room and bath are modern and nicely designed, albeit a bit small. Nevertheless we were very comfortable and enjoyed our stay. Definitely would stay here again.

The service and cleanliness of this hotel is excellent. It is a short walk to several subway stations. The view of midtown from my room on the 8th floor was amazing. My only real negative comment is that I found the hotel restaurant to be not so good. I had breakfast there twice and both times, I would rate it below average. Since the hotel is in the middle of Chinatown, the only other options nearby are Chinese food or fast food. I didn't mind this, but it may not be for everyone.

Property is close to Little Italy, Soho, and south of NYU. hotel is less than a year old. Our room was pretty small, but clean and decorated in the typical hip style. Not a heck of a lot of storage, but that's to be expected in Manhattan. The room rates were reasonable. Love the floor-to-ceiling windows, which made up for the small room, and made even made it feel bigger. Courteous staff, including the housekeeping staff. Even though our room was directly across from the elevator, it was really quiet. I would totally stay here again.
We had a wonderful stay in New York City. The staff was very helpful when we needed directions to a sight. They helped us with information on the use of the subway and taxi availability.

We booked our visit on line and our experience started with a reasonably priced three night rate. The location was on the corner of Bowery and Hester. 3 blocks from Little Italy and right in the middle of Chinatown just a around the corner from the Grand Subway stop.Our room on the 8th floor had a wall of windows looking north with a great view towards Mid-Town. A very large bathroom including room for two in the shower. The entire Hotel was clean and nicely decorated.
