The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful when asked.We walked to Battery park and to Washington square so the location is great. This is not Time Square and that is a very good thing.

This hotel is still relatively new and is very clean with great shower and very comfortable bed. I liked the location near Chinatown, Little Italy as well as some cool bars on the lower east side. Staff were great and very helpful. could not find any fault.

The service was excellent, the staff helpful, and the location convenient. It was very handy to many good restaurants and to the subway for exploring further afield. The TV was wall mounted, freeing up desk space, but oddly it was oriented for viewing from the bed rather than the sofa. The bed was comfortable, with nice linens. The sofabed was convenient but not particularly comfortable - comfortable sofabed is an oxymoron. We will likely stay here next time we are in town.
The only thing which was a bit uncomfortable was that the shower only had one door; and therefore water would spray onto the floor.

We were very keen to stay in Manhattan and Wyndham suited our location and budget needs. Room rate is not cheap / low but it is very competitive given that its in New York! The room is small but again its New York .. even in the compact space, the room was full of all amenities like coffee machine and sufficient number of charginf points and a locker safe .. lots of hangers .. iron board and iron etc.The bathroom also has a glass wall .. and there will be some light that will come from the bathroom door whole night, because the curtain inside is a sheet and not a heavy curtain.Rooms on higher floors are better because of the view.I was not very impressed by the surrounding area .. Chinatown .. but the hotel stands in the middle of Chinatown as a new posh glass building! Otherwise the immediate area around is crowded and not so up-market.Subway stations are nearby .. well connected.House-keeping was undertaken everyday .. only disappointment was that the house keeping person did not refresh the toiletries every day.. i am not comfortable asking for these things. bed was clean and comfortable and the bathroom neatly done.Overall a great place for NY tourism.

Great hotel, $200 at night, small modern rooms. I was there two nights, they have a restaurant in the basement that is very good.. I will go back for sure, i travel to New York often and i stayed in many hotel, this is on the top 5 of my list..

Having spent over a week at the Ames Hotel, Boston, which was the worst hotel I have ever stayed, bar a hotel in Maputo :), this place has it sussed.Good check-in, lovely room, though a tad small, with a balcony and view over mid-town (i was upgraded, so i do wonder if the standard rooms are smaller, which would be a prob).Coffee & Tea in the room and perfectly adequate bathroom. Bed slightly smaller for US standards, though probably because room a bit small. No minibar, which wasn't an issue and complimentary water.Staff friendly, though asked to extend check-out and got quite a stern "no".A tiny bar downstairs and restaurant in basement. Breakfast wasn't included but for $10, for a continental breakfast, seemed reasonable.Gym quite good and actually is useable.All in all a good stay and would return.

I couldn't recommend this place more if you're going to stay in New York City, I stayed for three nights in June 2013 and had a fantastic experience. I booked in advance, and if you stay for three days or more there is a discount available. On arrival I was upgraded to a suite and what a room, even with a view of the Empire State building. If I had to suggest a fault, I would say that I wish breakfast was included in the package, but there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance as well. The area the hotel is situated in is a little run down but it is right in the middle of China town and this was a great place to explore. Do check this hotel out, you will be impressed by the place itself and the service that you receive. I'll be definitely heading back to this one.
This hotel is a shiny star in Chinatown of NYC. Great city skyline views (just take rooms on 6th+ floor) and location (5 minutes walk to Grand St and Bowery St of NYC subway).

Stayed here for six nights in June 2013. On many previous trips to NYC I have always stayed in the touristy Times Square area, in hotels often overpriced and overated due to their locationStaying in Chinatown was a refreshing change. No, there is not a Duane Reed or an Irish bar on every corner but some quality (and very cheap) eateries and a really "different" neghbourhood. Walking out of the lobby I often thought I was in Hong Kong, not New York! Only a short walk to Grand Street subway with great connections to the rest of the city.Very reasonable rates, very pleasant staff and generally a very comfortable hotel, fitted out to most modern specifications. Super view from the floor to ceiling window in my 10th floor roomBreakfast not fantastic and rather expensive but plenty of "to go" options nearby ranging from a Chinese bakery to Dunkin Donuts.Will I stay again? If I can be sure I want to be away from the touristy Times square area yes, and certainly if the rates remain as competetive as they were for this stay.

The location was great as it provided much opportunity for shopping and dining. It was also very close to the subway stations with the D train at walking distance (1 block) allowing an individual to park their car and travel the boroughs with ease. The outer appearance and lobby presented acceptable. The room decor and updated contemporary bathroom was a nice touch; however the space was small and cramped. My wife and I were unable to unpack our suite cases for the 4 night stay b/c of insufficient closet and draw space. We decided not to order room services because there was no space to conformably have a meal. The photos on the website were quite deceiving as they appear to present luxurious and spacious rooms with a balcony. Nice room for 1 person but not for a couple. My wife and I will not return.
An elegant and totally unpretentious hotel just a short walk from Chinatown.Clean with a very accommodating staff.

I booked this last minute through a third party discount web-site because the price was right. The room was a good size for NYC standards. It was super clean, the staff were great, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. I knew I wasn't going to be spending any time in my room, so I didn't mind the location. I really wanted to give this property a 3 star because of the location, but I absolutely cannot fault a great hotel, for just a so-so location. I used to live in NYC, so I knew what I was getting into, but for the average tourist, who plans to do the "homogeneous" NYC vacation, it might not be the best fit. It's in the heart of Chinatown. And when I needed a Duane Reade, which in any other part of the city, you can't cross a street without running into one, there was none to be found. On the plus side, it was only a block and a half to the subway (B,D), which will get you (with transfers) to anywhere you need to go in Manhattan (or Brooklyn) and taxis are easily flagged.

A new hotel with very good service and views from room - you can see Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and many others if you have room above 5th floor. Ours was at 10th floor and glass wall created exciting feelings when we looked down ;)Our room was not really big but provided enough space for me and my wife. This hotel is located in just 5 minutes walk from Grand St and Bowery NYC subway stations, but your walk will take through quite "smelly" neighbourhood so be prepared.A lot of affordable Chinese venues are located near-by. Also, Little Italy is just 5-10 minutes walk away from the hotel, but pricing there is a bit expensive.

A modern hotel set within walking distance of Soho, little Italy, East village and of course Chinatown. Excellent view of uptown along Bowery St. Clean and comfortable. Front desk staff were excellent, helpful. Wifi was free and fast.

Couldn't complain about this place. We loved it. Convenient to Chinatown and all the great restaurants and unique environment. New Hotel, friendly staff, clean environment, responsive staff, reasonably priced. Will stay here again.
great views, comfy beds, good amenities, all in the heart of China Town, a stone's throw from trendy SoHo.

The hotel is very new and has a clean feel to it. Our room was smaller, but very nice. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay there again. We booked via Expedia last minute and paid $150 including taxes.

The room was clean and comfortable. Nice decor. Awesome views of the Empire State Building and upper manhattan from the floor to ceiling windows. Except, really serious design flaw; you couldn't see the view unless you were sitting at the miniature desk or walking into the the hotel room. The bed could've been facing the window and the amazing view. But it wasn't. While lying in bed, you could hardly see anything at all. A shameless missed opportunity. The smoked glass in the bathroom made it seem more open but if you had to use it at night the light would pour into the room. Also the toilet was so loud, that I didn't flush during the night because it woke my husband up. Gross but better than the alternative. hopefully you're not traveling with light sleepers. Nowhere to hang towels in the bathroom while showering. But my biggest gripe was the ac was impossible to operate. The room was either freezing or hot as hell. Couldn't change the temp to anything but 'more cold'. We called down a few times, was told someone would come up. No one ever did. Finally we called down again and were told the ac is set by the hotel and it can't be changed from the room. What? First off, why have the ac panel in my room then if all I can do is look at it. Talk about a tease! Second... an additional, What?! I've never been to a hotel where I couldn't set the temp of the room. That was the worst part of the stay because it was freezing when the air was on so we'd turn it off. But within minutes it was so hot, we'd have to turn it on again. This went on the whole night. Because its NY we were out during the day but I certainly wouldn't stay here again specifically because of that. Hotels are supposed to be comfortable. This hotel would've gotten 4 or 5 stars if the ac worked. Seems like that would be a no-brainier. Too bad.

This is a very nice hotel. Very clean, new and affordable. It was a short subway ride to all attractions. Good Chinese breakfast bakery "to go" was close. The beds were great, I slept well and no outside noise kept us up. Close to "Little Italy" and good italian food. Nice Place.

After staying near Times Square at the Wellington on business (very disappointing), I was hesitant to try a similarly priced hotel in Chinatown. However, when I arrived I could not have been more pleasantly surprised.The lobby was very clean, well-lit, and inviting. The drinks and sushi rolls were very affordable ($3 beers when I arrived). The room had an extremely comfortable bed and modern decor with a great floor to ceiling window to look out at the street below.

Staff and room were great, but the room was incredibly noisy. The glass windows were beautiful, but didn't block the noisy street below (I was on the 5th floor). I won't be staying here again solely due to the noise. Too bad because it's a beautiful hotel.

Well, where to begin with the Wyndham Garden Chinatown? One word, fantastic!The hotel was the first hotel my wife and I visited on our honeymoon and we were blown away. For a hotel of this standard it was very fairly priced too. Location wise I believe it is perfect. It's located on the lower west side and within a short walk of the Brooklyn bridge, Williamburg Bridge, Boats to liberty island/Staten Island/Ellis Island, the Tenement Museum and the financial district. It's only a short walk to Katz' Deli too...YUM!The hotel is almost brand new and you can tell. Evening is modern and in immaculate condition. The rooms for Manhattan are actually of a decent size and the beds are extremely comfortable. The rooms as you would expect contain all the amenities you need and more!The views were particularly spectacular as we were given a room that overlooked the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building. Noise wise we barely heard any of the street traffic and didn't have a single bad night's sleep!The staff were also really helpful and after we mentioned we were on our honeymoon we found a nice little gesture left for us upon our return to our room later in the day.If we come back to New York we would have no hesitation of staying here again. Lovely place!

Excellent brand new hotel with top service at a very reasonable price. The standard is comparable to far more expensive alternatives in NYC. Close to subway, Canal Street and lots of restaurants in Chinatown and Little Italy.

The hotel has a great location just a coupole of blocks and you are in the core of Chniatown and Little Italy. Grand Metro and Canal are both within a short walk. Rooms whilst a little small are excellent with very comfortable beds. The staff are extremely helpful and attentive, special thanks to Felix at the bar and Ahcene on Conciege for all their help and advice. Great value for a Manhattan hotel and we would def. stay again! Thanks guys...

I enjoyed my stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown on the 11th through the 13th of June. The staff was excellent and the rooms were spotless. The wall to ceiling windows were nice. Bathrooms are well-maintained amd modern, and there is also wifi, a small gym, and a free business center . Good location in Chinatown close to 4 subway stations (the first a block east of Grand and Bowery [B & D trains], another two [J, Z & 6 trains] on Canal and Lafayette 4-5 blocks west of Bowery, as well as another J-Z stop 2 blocks east Bowery on Delancy). The close proximity to the J-train stops are important since they transfer to JFK's airtrain at the Stuphin Ave/Archer Blvd/JFK Airport stop.The price was good when compared to most Midtown Hotels. Also walking distance to the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridge entrances.Located in an ethinic communty with lots of good places to eat. (Try the chicken, beef, and shrimp plate [$7.50] at Tasty Hand-Pulled Nooddles on Doyers St. 3-4 blocks south on Bowery. DELICIOUS.) Also close to Little Italy. An overall solid location. I would defintely stay here again, without a doubt.

Stayed 2 nites at hotel. The best service people i've encountered in a long time. From the moment I arrived to the time I left, they were great. Rooms small but clean, new, well kept, comfortable beds,. Location great for the part of the city that I needed to be. Taxi access great as well. Priced right.Booked with the hotel itself and got a better price.Will highly recommend this hotel.

Our stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was brilliant. We were on the 12th floor with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. There was a thunderstorm one night and we just sat in the comfort of our room watching the lightning travel across the skyline.Our room was clean and very comfortable and plenty big enough for the two of us, with everything we needed to enjoy our 5 night stay (TV, free WiFi, coffee machine). Providing a perfect place to chill out at the end of a long day exploring New York.All of the staff at the hotel were fantastic! They were really friendly and helpful when answering our (many) questions, advising on how to get to places and recommending places to eat. It was great on the day of our departure, to be able to check out and leave our bags with the desk so we could go out and make the most of our last day before returning to pick our bags up to go for our flight.We had the continental breakfast included in our room and this was a great way to start out day, giving us just enough to explore the city until it was time for lunch.The location of the hotel was my only concern when booking as I'd not stayed that far downtown before but really didn't need to worry. The subway is really close and easy to use when you want to go uptown and you can easily walk to Little Italy, SoHo etc. It was really nice to stay in Chinatown as it's not 'the norm' when visiting New York and has it's own special atmosphere which added to the whole experience.
good and big rooms. very clean.they had construction in the street below all night. we were on the 11th flour and it was very noisy.staff was very helping and nice.free internet.

I booked here as the other hotels in Manhattan had crazy prices. This is a new hotel (open Nov 23, 2013). Rooms are very nice and big (compared with the Manahttan standards). Price reasonable. The only bad thing is that you need about 15 USD for a taxi to go to downtown.

I stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights purely based on reviews that I had read on Tripadvisor; as has been my experience in the past if you read enough reviews you tend to not to be disappointed. The reason that I stayed at Wyndham Garden, Chinatown was because it was relatively new in a downtown Manhatten and the price was reasonable. Chinatown would not be my preferred location in the future, however it is only a 10 minute walk to places like SOHO or the lower East End. It was my first visit to NYC and I managed to find my way to the hotel on the Subway direct from JKF without having to swap lines. Possibly the only disappointing aspect of my stay was the breakfast and the Chinese restaurant staff who struggled with understanding English which seemed a bit strange seeing as it is NYC.
The staff really goes out of their way to help you. The rooms were small but clean and efficient. Can't beat the location.

Chinatown location is good for Tribeca and SoHo touring. Bathrooms have opaque glass walls and door - not great for privacy from anyone you are sharing the room with. Nice rooms, some with a shared balcony, some with great views of uptown. Nice, helpful staff. Would stay again.

We stayed week in this new and clean hotel. Service was friendly, queen-bed room is small, but functional and 10th floor gave great view to uptown over the rooftops of Chinatown. Traffic keeps noise, but there's nothing you can do. Restaurant surpriced us with the quality of the food. Breakfast was also good for European taste (no waffles or pancakes, so beware Americans). For this price, we recommended it also for turists, even when the hotel is very businesslike. Surroundings are interesting and facinating. Lots and lots authentic Chinese restaurants, and short walk to restaurants at Little Italy. If you are here, visit the Tenament museum. With metro, it is easy to access other Manhattan and Brooklyn.
excellent location (subway nearby), cleanliness and kindness of stuff,very nice room, enjoyable stay

I was able to get a discounted rate through my work. The hotel is located as it says in its name in NYC Chinatown. It is less than a minutes walk to Grand St. stn on the D line. It is also less than a 5 min stroll to Little Italy (Mulberry Street). The Hotel itself is a fairly recently constructed property. We were in room 403 and we loved the room. If I had to nitpick and complain about something it could be that the shower stall door doesn't close all the way. But hey, that's just me trying to find something to complain about. There is free wifi available and also two computers to use down in the lobby. The lobby has a bar that is not to pricey for Manhattan I think. The Staff are just amazing. Hamza, Katie, John and others whose names I cannot remember (sorry) made the stay that much more enjoyable. My next trip back to NYC, This would be my first and probably only choice for us to stay.

The hotel is in a great off the beaten path location. The staff is first class. The hotel is new and could use some fixes. The bathroom is large but not convenient enough without a vanity. The shower could als use some improvement, very modern but causes too much water on floor. My wife also found the AC annoying because the air blew directly onto the bed, It also took a long time for a taxi to stop there. Don't get me wrong. We enjoyed the experience. Just wish to offer constructive criticism.

Probably my 10th time here on business. It's the whole package that keeps me coming back. Great people - especially Kim and Vanessa at the front desk. Great location. 3 minute ez walk to a subway line that can take me anywhere in Manhattan with a maximum of one connection. Hotel is about a year old and is kept in immaculate condition. Rooms are spotless and so are the public areas. They keep their prices reasonable and the Wyndham rewards program is pretty generous. Twelve average stays get me a free room. It's in Chinatown and a block away from Little Italy. All the great Italian restaurants are within a 10 minute walk.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown this past May 2013. I was visiting New York with my parents for my sister's NYU graduation. You can imagine how expensive the hotels were for the last week of May (also happened to be Memorial Day Weekend) as all families descend into this small and incredibly city to attend the festivities. We went with this hotel given how close it was to my sister's apartment and NYU. After some extensive research, I found this new hotel and rates that were within reason, especially for a brand new hotel in NYC. I booked a two double beds room with limited view for a 4-night stay in late January.When we arrived at the hotel, there was a minor confusion on their system but the check-in person was about to clear it up for me. We were checked into Room 410. When we walked in, the room looked smaller than I had anticipated in comparison to the rooms at the Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca nearby. I wish the rooms were bigger as staying in such a room for 4 nights can be too cramped for 3 adults. Also, my parents drove me mad so the size of the room really didn't help as I wanted nothing but space. However, the room was super clean and modern especially the bathroom. The bathroom had a big sink counter with a sleek, floor-to-ceiling tiled shower with a glass partition. My only complaint is that this glass partition didn't do much as water got everywhere when I showered. On the first night, the floor was almost flooded after my dad showered.In terms of hotel service, the staff were superb! Every time we had a question or concern, they addressed immediately and followed up to see if there was anything else that they could do. I have to give them an A+ on this as I have never experience such wonderful service at a hotel. My parents even acknowledged this and they are rarely do. On one late afternoon we stayed in when it started pouring outside with isolated thunderstorms. When the storm got stronger, we were having trouble getting any television reception. We called front desk and they sent their engineer immediately to check. The engineer stopped by our room to let us know that the storm was interfering with their satellite dish but our reception should be back on it.In terms of the location, the hotel is located in the heart of Chinatown (not the best location) as the neighborhood was a bit rundown. In sum, I had a wonderful stay at Wyndham. I would considering staying here again. Thank you Wyndham Chinatown!

If you want to locate yourself on the Lower East Side (Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown) this should be your pick; wonderful staff, clean modern rooms with comfortable beds, easy access to great neighborhood restaurants and subway to uptown; we booked the 15th floor (#1501) with incredible views of the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges, Wall Street and on up to the Empire State Bldg.- breathtaking at night with a glass of wine on the large terrace- are you kidding me at this price point for NYC? Forget Times Square and experience the real NY at an outstanding property.

We stayed here for one night in May 2013, but we wished we would have stayed there the whole time we were in New York. Wyndham Gardens Chinatown is affordable, clean, has a serviceminded and helpful staff (we could not yet check in, because we were early, but they said 'leave your bags, we'll bring them to your room') and the rooms on the higher-up floors (our room was on the 11th) have terrific views of the city, because the windows stretch from floor to ceiling. Next time we are in NYC we will definitely be staying here again! The only downside was perhaps that there was no choice of pillows (every person has his or her own preference when it comes to that), but perhaps there is, and we just did not know about this option.

My husband and I stayed the week before Memorial Day for five days. We got a balcony room on the 15th floor, was very clean and plenty of room by NY standards. We were on the corner and had a great view of the empire state bldg. and had privacy. We had sum balcony door issues when we checked in and again 2 days later but both times were fixed promptly. The shower has no door, but come on use sum common sense make sure the bottom part is in the tub, done! The staff here are nothing but helpful, courteous and gracious. Go to the bar at happy hour $5.00 sushi, apps and drinks 5-7 ask bar tender to fix you a jalepeno margarita! Sooo good! Will stay here again when we come back.
the hotel is great! nice and clean. but the room is a bit small. and i booked a room for 2 adult, however they gave us a room with 1 queen size bed. other than this, the hotel is prefect!

The place stands out in Chinatown and it is only a few streets away to the famous restaurants of little Italy. The location is perfect and just a few steps away from the subway lines. The hotel is brand new, but the one thing I really like is the high speed elevator. This is quite helpful at checkout. Shoutout to Katie who is very helpful. The bathroom is modern (some might have issues like splash in the shower) with adequate water pressure. Overall a very good hotel.

I had a free night through my wyndham rewards program and the staff gave me a very nice room. Everyone was very helpful. The location was ideal for me. I could walk to Soho, the lower east side, the bowery, etc. Great fun!

I wanted to try a new location in NYC to see what it was like staying in Chinatown/ Little Italy/ Lower East Side. The hotel is bright and very well-maintained. I was upgraded to a room on a high floor with balcony which gave a gorgeous view of Manhattan and the neighbourhood. The room was modern with neutral but Asian-inspired decor, with a very comfortable bed, an excellent, well-lit desk, good internet, a large (for New York) bathroom with a tub/shower combination and a window, and all the other things you could want in a room -- ironing board, iron, safe, luggage stand, and temperature control. The aircon/heater provided a bit of white noise but this was manageable. The hotel lobby is clean and bright and the staff seemed genuinely concerned and eager to help with any questions that I had. The location of the hotel has its pros and cons. For walking in the neighbourhood and environs, it's great. For travelling by subway, the hotel is a bit less convenient as it's a bit of a haul to the Canal Street subway stops and the ones closer are not that convenient. Taxis are very plentiful, however, and any taxi driver can easily find their way back to Chinatown. The quality-price ratio is very good at this property. I stayed at another hotel during the rest of my stay in New York in a different neighbourhood, but found myself thinking about the Wyndham Garden Chinatown and that astonishing view from my huge floor to ceiling window. I may well return.

Stayed on 16th floor with amazing views of Manhatten. Room was bijou but fine for I night. Room was very hot when we arrived but cooled down by the time we came back at night. Long wait at breakfast which was slightly chaotic and we seemed to pay a lot to upgrade to a cooked breakfast which was later added to our credit card after we had checked out. Would stay again but only for a couple of nights max. Staff were very friendly.

After reading comments on Tripadvisor we decided to book this hotel. We loved the hotel! The rooms are very clean and the size of the room is for New York standards very good. The hotel is very new, and it shows. Everything works as intended. Also the staff was very helpful. Special thanks go out to Janice and Ahcene. Although we had endless questions for them, they were always there to help us or provideduis with great tips. The location of the hotel in the middle of Chinatown is also great, with great restaurants on every corner of the street and a subway around the corner, making it a good starting point to explore New York.The only small disappointment was the balcony, which is not really a balcony, but rather a roof where all guests in rooms on the second floor can walk on. If i knew, i would have asked for a room on a higher floor with better views. But I would definitely recommend this hotel with a fair price for a good room in a good location!

it was graduation week and everything in nyc was twice the price.I lucked out aftr an exhautive search and bidding 15 times on priceline and found this new hotel in $200 price range, and when I called their main toll free#, I got it for less than it was online and one more day too that was not available online.They gave me a room at check in on a higher floor as requested.Location in chinatown was good,few blocks to subway, &little italy for wonderful ferrara bakery in the morning.View is fantastic, and although we were in front of elevator, did not hear a sound.only complaint/why do so many hotels have these 1/2 glass for shower doors.The floor always gets wet.Staff very friendly and bar offered $5 happy hour drinks and $1oysters.Wish we could have checked that out.Free Internet!!

Whilst chaotic Chinatown is not my preferred scene in NYC I do not regret choosing this hotel whilst visiting the Big Apple. Rooms are spacious (for Manhattan) and well appointed, the staff very helpful and the ratio quality : price very good. It's a great no thrills option.

Do not make reservation on the toll-free #. Made the reservation 2 months in advance when I arrived with my sister to check-in we were informed that my reservation was for only 1 queen bed. Front desk clerk was somewhat argumentive & I explained to her how I repeatedly asked the representative if I was reserving 2 queen beds & she assured me "yes. I was charged for each day I used the roll away bed. I found that the couple next to me had the same problem that I did. hmmmmm. I don't think that the hotel has rooms with double queen beds.

Spent one night at this hotel on a trip. Everything on the interior is new and well thought out for a small space. The shower didn't have a door which was kind of annoying as the bathroom floor was always wet. It was easy to walk to a lot of places from this location. The staff was very friendly and would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I wanted to stay in NYC for one night. We didn't want to pay Uptown prices nor be in the hustle of Times Square. We were greeted by a friendly doorman, a quick check in and off to our 2nd floor room. A bit disappointed on the "balcony" it was more like a roof top with no chairs but overall very pleased. The room was clean, modern although not overly big, but this is NYC where space is a premium. We paid $ 260 which was a little high but again it's NYC. Staff very friendly. Would stay there again, no hassles. Drinks at the bar were $12 each!!!!

Chose this hotel based on price and Tripadvisor reviews. We were staying for 6 nights in NY and didn't feel we had to pay the extra to be in Times Square. The nearby subway made getting around manhatten easy and there were lots of taxi's constantly passing on the main road out the front of the hotel.The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was recently refurbished and although small it didn't feel cramped. Our room was opposite the lift which I though might be a problem but we didn't hear any noise.The only downside was that I could smell cigarette smoke on a few occasions in the room. It must filter through the air conditioning from other rooms as we asked for a non smoking room. I even woke up at 6am one morning smelling cigarettes which was very unpleasant. Aside from that I would recommend this hotel.

This is a fine place, with good folks who are willing to help if you need it. They go the extra mile. Checked reviews on many hotels in New York, and chose this one based on the number of positive ones. Saw the negatives other folks pointed out, but figured they must be picky. Room was small, but not that small. Shower could make the tile floor wet, I guess, but tuck the curtain in and there is no problem. View from the room is fantastic. Saw the rats on Hester coming from the construction site next door. They were amusing. Walked the neighborhood streets at night, and had no problems. There are plenty of other folks out there, too. Little Italy, LES and even the East Village and Alphabet City aren't that far either. The M15 bus is right there to run you all the way up Second Avenue if you don't want to walk the few blocks to the subway. All in all, a great place to stay. I hope they can maintain the quality. We can't wait to go back.

I spent a whole week at this hotel during my last business trip to NY. It was a wonderful place to retreat to after a long day at the office. The room was super clean, quiet and comfortable with a great view. The staff really go out of their way to make you feel at home. Its clear that they are not just "doing their job" but genuinely are caring people. Be sure to check out the Happy Hour menu. I ate many dinners from that selection of sushi, oysters and gyoza for a very reasonable price. I liked it so much that I am trying to organize a corporate account for my organization.
Room was very clean, staff were incredibly accommodating and polite. A great area to stay in if you want to be in Chinatown and near SoHo and LES.

Good hotel in the heart of Chinatown. for a very affordable fare.Relatively new, the Wyndham Garden as unusual big rooms for NYC standards, which makes the stay in NYC very confortable.The location of the hotel allowed us to enjoy Lower Manhatan (Soho, Tribeca, Greenwich village, Chelsea and East village) without hurting our legs too much.

Room is new enough. housekeeping was clean. The front desk gave us wrong info about buying tickets at TKTS. we wasted a trip down early tickets at TKTS. we wasted a trip down early in the morning when they only started selling them at 3pm. We were charged extra money for a car service that the hotel called for us. About service that the hotel called for us. About $13 more that the hotel called for us. About $13 more than a yellow cab.

Stayed here for two nights after we landed in New York after a cruise. Had read good reviews, and it was quite a bit cheaper than staying around Times Square area. Reviews were correct the staff at this hotel are the BEST. Very friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable with free wifi. New York was awesome and would definitely want to go back, and if I do, then I would stay at the Wyndham for sure.
Excellent staff - the service was really great. Location is very good and the hotel is lovely. I'd really recommend it (especially as I booked it via priceline at a fraction of the cost!)

The hotel is brand new and it shows. Everything works, everything is shiny and new. The location is pretty good, near a couple of subway lines.The views were incredible. Our room was high up, so you could see for miles.Considering that this hotel cost the same as shady hotels in the same area, I was very happy with the stay.

This was the only reasonably priced hotel I could find for a recent overnight trip. The hotel is new, and really nicely designed, staff and check in were pleasant and easy.I was upgraded and had a really nice room, very wide, with windows on 2 sides, a bit eery if very cool. Comfortable bed, all amenities, bottle of water a nice touch. Bathroom very compact but well designed, nice little products with fun names.Everything was well thought out - pity it's a bit out of the way for me for where I need to be usually but good to keep in mind for a tourist visit.

This is a fantastic, well located business hotel with everything you'd want while working hard (and playing late) in the city. The staff really makes your stay they are prompt in assistance and helpful in every need. Their warm attitude is infectious and not only do you get a comfortable, spacious, well - appointed room with incredible views (yes 10th floor!!!) you are at ease and smiling your whole stay. I couldn't be happier with the stay and am beyond impressed at the well run team!

We only stayed here one night as we were en-route somewhere else (Brooklyn, sadly) and I was really disappointed we weren't able to stay longer. If we were to come back, we will definitely stay here - great value for money. The rooms are a good size, clean, good amenities, and floor to ceiling windows with an a-m-a-z-i-n-g view of Manhattan. We were on the 6th/7th floor and were absolutely delighted. The hotel is in a great location - only a 5 minute walk from the subway.The only downside is the breakfast. I did mention this to the Manager - who is a lovely, friendly guy - who told me the catering is outsourced (not hard to tell!). Don't waste your precious holiday time down there as the breakfast is definitely not worth $10! I see from the reviews that things haven't changed much - although I think someone mentioned continental breakfast for $10 (when we were there, the breakfast included in the room rate was $10 (for non-guests) and was terrible and the rest were $15 (i.e. $5 surcharge for guests) so maybe the prices have been reduced). Just awful! I have since discovered that breakfast in NY hotels is not usually included.Will definitely come back if we get the opportunity. Thank you to all the staff for making our little stay so comfortable. By far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.

My husband and I are just back from spending 7 nights at this hotel. At a really good price we weren't sure what to expect but having read many reviews knew that the hotel couldn't be bad. Our room was on the 7th floor directly opposite the lift, being a very light sleeper this worried me at first..until we opened our room door and saw the spectacular view of the Empire State building all lit up. The room was a really good size and had a nice big bathroom, it was the perfect size for a week in NY. I needn't have worried about noise as we were up high enough that there was no noise from the street and i never heard any noise at all from the lift or other people. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and dealt with all of our questions quickly. There's a subway station around the corner which is great for those who don't fancy walking too much but we were happy to walk everywhere so only used this a few times, and there are lots of restaurants in teh area so plenty to choose from.All in all it was a great hotel, I would defiantely stay here again and would highly recommend this to other travellers.

Perfect hotel in many ways. 12th floor, floor to ceiling window, magnificent view. Clean. Comfy bed. Water, tea and coffee in the room. Only issue - no shelf in bathroom on which to put make-up, tooth brush, etc.

I stayed three nights at this hotel in April 2013, soon after its opening. Every other hotel on Manhattan seemed to be charging upwards of $300 per night for the weekend I wanted, so I was relieved to get a good deal at Wyndham at around $200 per night (pretty much the cheapest room downtown with its own bathroom that I could find). For some reason I didn't like the first room they gave me opposite the elevators (I was wary of elevator noise, and the room felt like it had bad feng shui); I asked if other rooms were available and they promptly moved me to a large room away from the elevators facing Bowery. Everything about the room was great – comfy bed, spacious desk, nice bathroom and I loved people watching through the floor-to-ceiling window onto Bowery – except for the street noise. But hey, it's New York, and it's Chinatown, no less – so what could I expect? Pros: Staff were very friendly and accommodating – everyone from the doorman and reception staff to the cleaning staff were lovely. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Decent coffee making facilities in-room (Wolfgang Puck pods get the thumbs-up). For tourists, the location near Soho and the Lower East Side is fantastic. Good cheap eats in Chinatown (try Nam Son or Congee Village). Cons: Noisy Bowery and stanky Chinatown... it's a love-hate relationship.All in all, I would stay here again, especially if they continue to offer such great rates.

Recently stayed here and the value was great. Payed about $175.00 and this is a clean and descent place.Next to Chinatown and little Italy it is a good walking distance to good and cheap restaurants that will not break your budget.
Clean, everything I needed in room, lots of restaurants within walking distance, polite and helpful staff, gorgeous view if you're on the upper floors.

Staying at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was a great pleasure and we will definitely be back. The room we got was great with a fantastic view over the Uptown skyline. It wasn’t huge, but well planned to accommodate two people, tidy, very clean and comfortable. Yes, maybe the shower could have used an extra door for the water not to spill out on the floor, but nothing we couldn’t manage. Extra plus for the free wifi and the terrace that we made good use of (note however, it is shared with all the rooms on that same floor).Staff was friendly and helpful, the only thing I could possibly complain about is our noisy neighbors and that the bar really reeked of alcohol on a few occasions. Not the best first impression when walking into a lobby, but nothing that bothered us much as we didn’t spend any time there.Hotel is located close to SoHo, Greenwich Village, Lower East Side, easy to catch a cab on Bowery or simply take one of the nearby subways. Very quiet during nights. Food tip: if you are looking for fantastic Mexican food, you have to walk merely three blocks from the hotel. On this small street in Chinatown, Doyers street you will find hidden gem Pulqueria. Not the easiest place to find, it’s one of those secret NYC treasures, but once you do you are in for a treat (FYI, right next door is Apotheke, a bar where you’ll need a password to get in). All and all, great hotel, we will be back and can without hesitation recommend anyone to stay here.

I stayed at this hotel recently for a business trip and was thoroughly pleased with the whole experience. The rooms were clean and spacious enough - nice modern bathrooms, and incredible sweeping views of midtown Manhattan. If your work is in downtown, Soho or the East Villages the location is perfect - blocks from Lower East Side, Little Italy, etc. As worried as I am about the potential for rate increases and sell-outs, I highly recommend this hotel.

Just back from a weeks research trip. We stayed on the top floor, essential for peace and quiet. Incredible views! Hotel was very clean with really comfortable beds and everything you could need (hair dryer, iron, fresh coffee etc.) very friendly reception, always happy to hail cabs for you. Not so friendly breakfast staff (so rude!) but nice fresh breakfasts (avoid the weird porridge stuff) the bar was fun in the evenings, $1 oysters and good sushi on week nights. Lovely friendly chatty barman too. I will need to come to NY again soon and will definitely stay here. So great to be able to walk to Soho for a meal and to walk to Brooklyn Bridge and The Financial District. Location couldn't be better. We would really recommend this hotel.
Very Clean room. Friendly Staff. Close to Little Italy, Lower East side, Sohol. Convenient to Subway lines and great restaurants. Bright rooms.

We have always stayed north of Chinatown, so we decided to branch out and explore. The neighborhood was full of life, friendly and still very Chinese which was fun. The hotel is new, clean, nicely appointed and an oasis amidst the activity of Chinatown. While there is no "free" breakfast, the $10 continental is well worth the cost...fresh juice, fruit, toast, oatmeal...all freshly made and not instant. It was a pleasure to get away from the sweet sticky breakfasts you have elsewhere. The view of the city from the 15th floor was fantastic, with windows and doors that open and fresh air. We will return if the prices remain in their current range.
Very congenial staff, excellent views from upper floors, room was fine (housekeeping a bit slow, but responsive), and interesting location made this a positive experience.

Stayed 1 night in early April. Clean room, decent sized for Manhattan, wonderful view from the floor to ceiling windows, comfortable bed, very friendly and helpful staff. Shower will spray a bit of water on the bathroom floor because of its design, but it's not as big a deal as others have mentioned. Will stay here again!

Excellent hotel. A bit pricey but the view of uptown was worth it! The staff--from the concierge to housekeeping--were very friendly and helpful. Great location, great view of the city from our room. Overall, a great experience!

I booked a room at this hotel through Hotwire. I paid $109 + taxes for a Sunday night stay. For the price it's a fantastic place to stay. It's new. The rooms are larger than the ones at the Doubletree (Financial District), and clean. The neighborhood is a bit iffy, though, especially at night.

What a nice hotel. The rooms are small but are modern. My room had a balcony with a view over looking Manhattan. The hotel has a fabulous bar . the sushi is fabulous and they have a happy hour during the week where some of my coligues joined me after work. The location is great close to Soho, Financial District and of course Chinatown.

Minimally staffed. They close restaurant early and then for breakfast have many options and only really offer Continental. housekeeping opened door without knocking startled me.They don't keep track of issues and resolve them quickly between shifts - you have to start all over again.

Was in NYC with my wife to visit family.The 1st day we arrived, my wife had a fall on the street and needed medical attention. Once we arrived back to the hotel later that day, we found the staff to be most attentive and caring and kind. We got all the help possible and the service throughout the week was excellent. They asked about her daily and made sure we had anything we needed. At the end of the trip our flight was cancelled going home. The staff quickly made sure we could extended our stay and stay in the same room as to not have to move rooms. They did nothing but try to make our trip memorable and enjoyable. Thanks to all the staff for doing a really great job!!! We would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to stay in Manhattan. The location was great too.

The staff was extremely helpful and friendly during my stay. The room was the perfect size - small like most NYC hotels with all of the amenities you need. The rooms had a lot of electrical outlets, which is very convenient given cell phones, cameras, computers, etc. to be charged. The free wireless internet was fast. My booking details said there would be a bathtub in my room, but there wasn't. My booking also said there was parking - There is valet offered for $43 a day, which is very reasonable given the cost of parking in NYC. The shower was a little weird - only had half a glass wall rather than a full door and some of the water sprayed onto the floor from the shower. The hotel is located in Chinatown and a few blocks from Little Italy. The nearest subway to Midtown was only 2 blocks away. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed in the hotel for a week in April 2013 (Scotland week in New York - what do you mean you haven't heard of it??) and was very impressed. Good rate considering you are a few subway stops from everything you'd want to see in New York, and being right on the border between Little Italy and Chinatown, you know you're going to eat well.Staff in hotel were extremely helpful, and our room was quite simply exceptional. Ask for a room on 10th floor or above, to enjoy a stunning view of Empire State Building and the rest of the skyline. Glass from floor to ceiling. Stunning - and I don't even like heights!Breakfast was a bit disappointing, but hey, you're in New York - why are you eating at your hotel?

Stayed here 6 nights, great value and large room for NY. Location is close to multiple subways but you know you're on Chinatown! Staff excellent, very friendly and helpful. Hotel looks and feels brand new, glad we stayed here and would definitely recommend

This was our 4th trip to New York and our first time staying in Chinatown, let alone the Wyndham Garden, and I would gladly stay again and recommend it to anyone. The location was PERFECT!! In the heart of Chinatown with easy access to taxis and trains and walking distance to Little Italy, SOHO, East / West Villages. We even walked over the Brooklyn Bridge from there and would say this is a MUST do! AND there was a Popeye's Fried Chicken around the corner!The hotel itself was perfect for our needs. We were in the standard queen room and felt that the space was adequate for 2 adults with luggage and lots of NYC shopping! We made good use of the in-room fridge and the bathroom was very modern and well-appointed, including the shower which did spit excess water onto the bathroom floor, but its water on a tiled floor that can easily be wiped up with the more than generous amount of towels provided, so you just deal with it and move on with your day! The front desk staff were always eager and willing to help or simply smile and acknowledge you as you walked past. John Chen was excellent and provided a great recommendation for dim sum 3 blocks away! TASTY!! The housekeeper as well did a great job and refreshed our room consistently and I felt that personal touch...example: some hotels pile on pillows and coverlets, etc. on the bed, which is fine, but as a guest to have a housekeeper that notices all that excess bedding is on the floor each morning and rather than just doing the bed as usual per the manual, leaves the excess off and folds it nicely on the chair in the corner is WONDERFUL! Way to anticipate my needs.I am a travel agent and I have access to multiple hotel chains in NYC but would gladly stay here again. I will also book my clients to stay here with confidence knowing that they will have an NYC experience that exceeds their expectations!Thanks You Wyndham Garden Chinatown! I will be back!

It was a pleasant surprise to stay at the Garden Chinatown.The hotel appears newly renovated and is very clean. The rooms are not very large but for NY standards very ok and quite functional. Hotel staff was very nice, extremely polite and always happy to help. Location was good as directly in Chinatown. Subway is a reasonable 10 min walk away and there are plenty of asian restaurants nearby. Some of these are actually authentic while others are tourist traps.Bottom line:If going for pleasure, I would stay at the Garden Chinatown again as I was overall very happy and recommend to stay at this hotel without hesitation.

We booked this hotel for our recent trip to New York after doing a lot of research and looking at other reviews. The room was very clean and was of a good size although the bed could have been a little bit bigger for my personal liking. The view was absolutely amazing, overlooking Chinatown towards the Empire State. Nice bathroom, lovely hot shower with good pressure (it did spray out of the cubicle sometimes though) and nice products (I could have done with some disposable slippers though). Staff really friendly and polite. Would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

Great place. Staff is very friendly and accommodating, top notch location - just a block to Little Italy and in China Town. The hotel is barely a year old and everything is in top notch shape. Very clean - spotless would not be an exaggeration. I've stayed here for business about 6 times in the past 8 weeks.

The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - from the concierge to check in to room service to the janitor, it was clear the focus was making the guest comfortable. The room was brand new & spotless.

They lived up to the reviews. Everything you need and then some. Room was a little small but efficient. Views were great. Only complaint... Complimentary water first day only... Come on... You can afford a bottle a day!

The hotel is new, room is very clean, sevice staff are friendly. However, the location , in the middle of Chinatown, convenient for dining but not much entertainment like time squre especially after 7pm.

All in all the hotel was great. Staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Room was clean, bed comfy and quiet. The shower enclosure was inadequate, water got all over the floor and the neighborhood has on off putting odor, but the value, location, friendly bartender easily make up for that. I only breakfasted at the hotel and thought the downstairs dining area could use some sprucing up. Would definitely return and suggest this hotel to friends.

Very modern, nice and clean hotel offering a nice view from rooms in upper levels. The staff is very friendly. Rooms are very clean. You can easily walk to SOHO and do shopping on Broadway or visit China town.

We live nearby and brought our family (2 adults, 2 young children) to the Wyndham Garden Chinatown twice while some work was being done on our apartment. We chose it because the "queen suite" could accommodate our whole family for less than the price of two rooms at any other hotel within walking distance of our son's school.First the good: Our "queen suite" (room 607 the first stay; 606 the second stay) was reasonably spacious by Manhattan standards and very clean. There is a mini-fridge you can actually use (not a minibar), reliable free wifi, and the room and bathroom had a nice modern design (we looked at some of the same fixtures when we renovated our apartment). The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and tried hard to be helpful. I also think the location is very good for anybody with business in Chinatown and excellent for tourists who are looking for a more interesting place to stay than the typical tourist mega-hotels in Midtown (walkable to many interesting neighborhoods, and good subway access to the rest of the city). But there are some significant drawbacks to this property. The hotel is very new. I believe it opened in November 2012. But it appears to have been cheaply built. Our first room had some water stains on the ceiling near the windows, indicating there had probably been a leak at some point. Our room on the second visit had a desk lamp that barely put out any light, a semi-broken temperature control in the shower, and a sink that filled faster than it could drain.There were also a number of bizarre design decisions. The "suite" is a big square room with a full wall of floor-to-ceiling windows and an L shaped wall that divides the room into three areas.The L wall runs parallel to the windows and turns into the room to create a bed area. The bed area was barely larger than the bed itself and completely walled off from the windows, but the bed was comfortable.Between the wall and the windows, there is a mostly wasted space where they've put an upholstered chair (that I can't imagine anybody ever uses) and a desk. The desk thoughtfully has open electrical outlets at desk level for plugging in computers and phone chargers, but lacks a phone. In both suites I had to unplug the phone from the bedside nightstand and plug it into the desk (which at least has a jack) to make phone calls while working at the desk. But at least local calls were free, and the hotel's free wifi worked well with my computer.The rest of the room is a living area. There is an incredibly uncomfortable (for sitting or sleeping) pullout couch. Unlike most hotels with pullout couches, the mattress comes bare and you have to request sheets. And the pullout is very small--not even close to the length of a regular bed. It was fine for our 5 year old, but I would NOT recommend it for a full grown adult. There's also a very high marble table with barstool-like seating that looked cool and was okay for eating meals, but precarious for our 2 year old.The mini-fridge is enclosed in a cabinet that has no ventilation, so unless you leave the cabinet open, the fridge is engaged in a Sisyphean battle against its own heat production.The bathroom has a nice aesthetic, but doesn't have a bathtub (shower only, with weak water pressure and the aforementioned semi-broken control in one of our two rooms), has very little counter space (although there are shelves below the sink) and nowhere to hang wet towels, and has a translucent door that allows people in the room to see the silhouette of someone sitting on the toilet.The wall of windows had an intresting view from our 6th floor rooms and had effective privacy and blackout curtains, but none of the windows open. Given the hotel's location a block from the entrance to the Manhattan Bridge, that's not necessarily a bad thing (the air outside is likely worse than the hotel's recirculated air, and the windows are very well soundproofed against the sometimes cacophonous traffic), but for some people the lack of open-able windows can be a deal breaker.The hotel's service was okay, but not great. It took three calls on our second visit to get sheets for the pullout couch. But they're very friendly, keep the place very clean, and provide nice freebies like a crib for the 2 year old.All in all, I'd consider returning if the price is right, but would only recommend it to folks who need a cheap suite in the area or who want a reasonably priced modern hotel in a fun neighborhood and don't mind the quirky details.

This newly opened hotel is in an ideal location for those who like great restaurants and walks in interesting residential areas. Located in Chinatown, and close to Little Italy and Greenwich Village, it's hard to beat. The rooms are contemporary, clean and offer full views wilh floor to ceiling windows. Some drawbacks include the half-wall for the shower being inadequate for keeping the water off of the bathroom floor, the mattress for the pull-out bed will leave you in agony, and our corner room did little to contain the noise from the traffic outside making sleeping difficult. I would recommend asking for a room that doesn't face The Bowery (even though your view might not be as nice). The staff is freindly and helpful. Overall a nice stay, but I must say that I like the Wyndham's Tryp hotel near Madison Square Garden a little better.

Spent 6 nights here in April 2013. It's the perfect combination of small and personal, yet full service, comfortable and well kept. We loved the location; it was convenient to the subway and landmarks including the Brooklyn Bridge and the 911 Memorial. We also enjoyed exploring Chinatown and Little Italy.Every staff member was friendly and helpful, and we felt very safe knowing that everyone who entered the hotel would be observed in the small but comfortable lobby. The bar is cozy and Felix was friendly and helpful. Spending time there every night was the perfect way to wind down after our long days, as well as plan out what we wanted to do the next day.It's hard to find something to complain about, but there's always room for improvement so here goes: we only had one trash can; it would have been nice to have one in the room and one in the bathroom. There were no towel racks in the otherwise awesome bathroom which made it hard to reuse the towels since there was nowhere to hang them. But the view from our room was so awesome we didn't care.Many thanks to the fantastic staff for making our stay so comfortable and fun. We definitely plan to stay here when we return to NYC....

Exceptional experience overall. Service was treat, particularly Janice. We arrived about 9am want ending to leaving out luggage there prior to checking in, but we were told that our room was ready and we could check in 7 hours early. We were so thankful after the cross country red eye flight. Janice was friendly, helpful and seemed to genuinely care and was interested in the customer. Late the following night, she followed up on our conversation. I'm not easily impressed, but she impressed me. Stunning view and extremely comfortable bed. The walk in shower was a little small for such a shower, but other than that it was a great room for the price.

Nice new and clean hotel. Nice view. Grand metro station one block away, but Canal street metro a Little more far away. Not so far from Soho shopping and some nice, small restaurants, but if you prefer higher buildings and more Manhattan feeling and don´t like Chinatown, this isn´t a right place to stay because there is Chinatown overall were there used to be Little Italy, etc. Poor Continental breakfast in the basement. Lobby Staff very helpfull. Roof terrace was not open. Ask for higher floor and you´ll get a room with a view towards Empire State Building.

The staff are outstandingly helpful, could not have been better, absolutely top marks. The rooms were excellent, we had two, parents and kids, and the bathrooms are fine too, everything was spotless. Rooms are not massive but certainly more than adequate and extremely comfortable (do you go to NYC to hang out in your room?). I thought I had booked a twin room for our girls but did the father thing and failed, the hotel staff fixed us up with a rollaway immediately and didn't charge, this type of helpfulness continued throughout. I travel a lot on business and am super organised when I do, on holiday I just lose it, I managed to drop my wallet when leaving the hotel for the airport, the hotel reached the car hire company and through them me before we got to the airport, we had my wallet back within 2 days of getting back to the UK. I saw one or two comments re breakfast in some reviews here, sure it is a basic continental in the room rate but with a $10 credit meaning only $5 to upgrade to some very good cooked options that is no big deal even on a budget. Location is great, transport access easy, all the downtown sights in easy walking if you are fit, Katzs deli just far enough away to make you feel almost virtuous as you eat a vast sandwich. Some very good Asian options, we had a great Malaysian meal at Nyonya and a decent Szechuan at the Famous Szechuan, Vinces Clam Bar did some good simple Italian dishes and Lombardis Pizza is well worth queuing for. In short I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, the fact that it is rated three stars shows that this is no measure of quality.

The hotel is lovely, we had a great (quiet) room on the ninth floor with a beautiful view of the city (looking north towards the Empire State building). I loved the free wifi and continental breakfast - but the most amazing thing about this hotel was the friendliness and helpfulness of every staff member we met. Whether we needed help getting a taxi or with our luggage there was always someone there. The Chinatown and Little Italy restaurants nearby (discovered "juicy dumplings") were terrific. Mulberry Street is very close. Subways connecting everywhere were also close.Only negative is the shower - hard to adjust temperature and spray. But that was minor.

The view of Midtown was stunning! The room was small but clean and beautiful. Bathroom products were great! Staff was friendly. I think the staff could be more knowledgeable of the area restaurants and subway stations. Overall a great experience for a short weekend stay in the city!

A wonderful eperience. Spotless and stylish hotel with perfect location, filling and tasteful breakfast. Friendly staff (special thanks to John who served us during our arrival) And above all, value for money! This would definitely we our choice if we return to new York!

Although our room was a bit small, overall it was great. I do have to say though that the location in Chinatown is slightly less to be desired. The cable TV was ok although it lacked children friendly channels as getting anything from Disney Channel costed money. The rooms were new but small for a family of 4.
Great spot, especially because my son lives nearby. Chinatown, Little Italy, and the historic lower east side give it a lot of character. Very comfortable, courteous and helpful staff.

Hotel is brand new. Sparkling clean everywhere, from public spaces to the guestroom. Very modern and functional furniture and equipment. There is a floor to ceiling window with amazing views of midtown Manhattan (hotel is facing north). Good size room for NYC standards. Extremely helpful and professional staff, was quick to address a couple of questions and requests. Internet is complimentary -- rather rare for high end hotels, and worked really well. There is valet parking, but local garages may be less expensive. Street parking should be fine, subject to street cleaning regulations. Hotel is in chinatown, which can be a little rough and quite far from standard tourist attractions, but is perfect location if you have business in downtown or intend to explore lower east. Short walk to subway station.

I love the Chinatown and Little Italy part of New York and was and this Wyndam was the perfect location to enjoy all of the benefits of the area with excellent service, clean rooms, and friendly staff. I would definitely stay there again.
For our first Visit in NY we where in Wyndham Garden Hotel in Chinatown. New comfortable Hotel. Very good value and quality for your Money. Enjoy it:-)

We split our stay into 7 nights in Midtown and 3 nights at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown just to experience another part of NYC. I booked directly through the Wyndham website and the hotel was the perfect base for those 3 days....there are subway stations close-by.The only complaint we had was that after being dropped off on the other side of the road by an unhelpful taxi driver...we then wheeled our suitcases across the busy road to the hotel....and lifted them up the stairs without help, despite staff being able to clearly see our situation. We checked in early.....unfortunately our room was not ready...but that was fine...staff took our luggage and we went to have lunch and explore.The room (on the 15th floor) was a reasonable size.....everything was very clean....there was minimal street noise.....however the bed was a bit firm for our liking. The view from the floor to ceiling windows in the room back towards Midtown was amazing....photos couldn't do it justice!Also have to add that Matt at the Elevate Bar was awesome.....his recommendations were generally on the money.....other than the Almond Cookie icecream from the Chinatown Icecream Factory....so very wrong!!

Our two night stay in the 16th floor corner room included exceptional views from the floor to ceiling windows. The room was nicely furnished with a comfortable queen sized bed that faced toward the view, conveniently located night tables with appropriate lighting, a spacious wardrobe with safe, and a generous workspace with a comfortable office chair. Everything was exceptionally clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, and know the area well. Our choice to stay at the Wyndham Garden was a good one as we were provided excellent value and a level of comfort that exceeded our expectations.

Stayed here for 5 nights in April 2013 on holiday from UK (travel agent www.topdrawerholidays.co.uk). This hotel offers fantastic value for New York - it is very new so has been designed from the start as a hotel, not an old building where hotel rooms have to be squeezed in. So rooms are I think bigger than average for NYC, plus with floor to ceiling and wall to wall glass they are fantastically bright. We had a fairly standard room relatively low down on the 6th floor but could still see the buildings of Wall St and No 1 World Trade Centre to our left and Empire State Building to our right! Views from higher floors must be amazing. As other reviewers have said the hotel staff are really friendly and helpful, the free wifi worked with no problems at all, and the breakfast (which we had included in the room rate), was perfectly pleasant - some tasty little pastried and fresh fruit and tea/coffee. No its not large but there are so many other great places to eat in new York you don't want to fill up at breakfast and miss out! Hotel is also right in the heart of Chinatown and Little Italy which are great areas, only 10min walk to Soho and West Broadway, only about 20-30 minute walk to Greenwich Village and only a couple of minutes from the subway to get anywhere else. Definitely recommend this hotel.

This is a new hotel at a very convenient location. The room was emmaculate, the service was excellent, and the staff was very friendly and knowldgeable. The hotel does not have a pool or spa, but that did not matter to me. I throughly enjoyed my experience there and will now make this my hotel of choice in New York City. D. Powers

Stayed here for 5 days this past weekend. Greeted warmly by Vanesssa who proceeded to place us in a room with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. Room was a bit small but not unlike other establishments in NYC (as this was our 15th visit to this great city, we've seen all sorts and sizes of rooms and this one was great). Two issues: 1) the open concept shower, while nice to look at, does not function well. Too much water finds its way to the floor and you almost have to tilt the showerhead towards the wall to avoid a massive puddle. 2) the coffee maker was wonky from the start and ended up breaking on the last day. Other than these two minimal issues, the hotel and service was excellent. Room was very clean and employees always greeted you with a smile. Hotel is close to the B-D Subway lines (Grand St), a few blocks from the N-Q-R & 6 lines (Canal St) and a short walk to Little Italy (try Ferrara's if you've never...amazing). Neighbourhood is bustling in the daytime but almost dead at night (sharp contrast). No issues with safety (never had a problem with any part of NYC and we've stayed in many different areas including Harlem). We would stay here again if the price was right.

We booked online and very happy with our choice. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We had a 9th floor room with a sensational night view of Empire State Building and New York lights. Room was not overly big but good size by New York standards. A central location in Chinatown, short stroll to Little Italy and subway. Great value.
Great hotel and staff. All my needs were met. The view from my room was spectular. I would definitely stay there again!!!
Loved much about the hotel. Staff was wonderfully helpful, and rooms very clean (with minor exceptions). Would surely recommend for anyone looking to stay in this area of Manhattan.

My stay at Whyndham Garden in Chinatown was fantastic. From the moment I walked in I was welcomed by the most friendly staff and a warm atmosphere. The lobby is contemporary and sleek with white marble floor and stunning LeCarbusier furniture . The bar makes exotic drinks from fresh ingredients righ in front of you. The rooms are contemporary with a beautiful view of Manhattan. However, what impressed me the most is how friendly and helpful the staff was. Special thanks to the manager, Omar Bouchaar, for making my stay comfortable and enjoyable. I will definitely stay at this hotel during my future trips to NYC.

This is a clean and comfortable hotel, with very courteous service, in Chinatown. The room is efficient, with a hyper-modern bathroom, refrigerator (no microwave, but they will warm up food for you downstairs in the restaurant), HDTV, small safe--in other words, just about everything you would need. Complimentary bottled water and nuts, too (high-quality nuts at that). The room and white lobby all remind me of a superior Taiwanese hotel.The location is important, because it will be ideal for some visitors, but not others. When they say the hotel is in Chinatown, they mean it. Hester St. is one block north of Canal St., the heart of Chinatown, and Little Italy is just a couple of blocks west. (Little Italy is no more than about two blocks these days, but the restaurants that have survived are all pretty good.) So it's a vibrant and interesting neighborhood, with lots of delicious restaurants nearby, but if your business is elsewhere in the city, this wouldn't be the best location for you.If I have one small complaint, it's that a single unisex bathroom seems to serve the entire lobby, and the toilet seat is already wobbling.
From everyone at the front desk to Felix the bartender and everyone I encountered who works here: Friendliness and hospitality EXCEPTIONAL!

Arrived home (Singapore) yesterday morning. Just recovered from jet lag. This was our first visit to NY can't say enough about the brilliant time we all have had. Hotel was perfectly placed for all of the sights of Manhattan. hotel was well presented, bedroom was cleaned to a high standard every day. My wife and I selected Wyndham Garden Chinatown based on TripAdvisor reviews as well as a great hotels.com price offer. We were not disappointed!!The service throughout our stay was attentive, efficient and friendly!! Room was small but had everything you need. Clean and stylish. Check in staff polite and helpful. Bar staff efficient and fine. Special thanks to lovely Janice and the guy always with her on duty I don’t remember his name they are exceptional. The hotel is right in the heart of Chinatown. It's also an easy walk to Little Italy, The Brooklyn Bridge, the East Village and SOHO. Plus, there are two subway stations within a couple of blocks, which makes getting around to the rest of Manhattan very easy.Thanks to everyone at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for making our visit so special.

Had to change hotels halfway through the tip due to logistics and finances. Even though it was more affordable than the previous hotel the room, despite being a little smaller, was just as nice if not nicer. I particularly appreciated the floor-to-ceiling windows with a great view, the walk-in shower (the only problem being the lack of a complete door and/or floor drain in the main section of the bathroom, making a wet bathroom floor a distinct possibility unless you are extremely careful) and the very cozy bed. The only additions I would like to see as far as the accommodations are concerned would be a pool and hot tub, full glass sliding doors on the showers and ice machines on every other level (currently one must go to the bar and hassle the poor bartender for ice)... Short of this I can't think of any suggestions. The lobby is very contemporary and the bar is quite sylish, with Kubrick-inspired seating (no milk-girl statues, it's classy) and even the bar/lobby restroom has style, with a cool, backlit blue "fountain" style faucet. The room was clean and comfortable. The location is pretty optimal for explorers, being located in bustling Chinatown not far from Canal St. and very close to the Grand St. subway station.My experience with the staff was nothing short of fantastic. Everyone from the bartender to housekeeping should be commended, but perhaps especially Ahcene and the rest of the front desk/lobby employees. My travel companion had a flight get cancelled and we encountered all manner of difficulties in dealing with this, and they not only stored our luggage in the office for nearly a full day while we dealt with this but gave me personal use of a micro USB cable to charge my phone for emergency use and allowed me to stay in the lobby for hours using their computers to print maps and communicate with others to resolve this. All this on the day we were departing, AFTER we had already checked out.All in all, I cannot recommend the Wyndham Garden Chinatown enough. But while the room, location, view, bar and lobby were all very nice, the outstanding service from the staff is to be commended above all else. My special thanks again to Ahcene and the front-desk/lobby staff. The next time I am in Manhattan, I will definitely be checking to see if a room is available here.

Our room high up at the front of the hotel offered a Western panorama of the city. The downtown location is near Soho, and Nolita. You step out of this sleek, modern, boutique hotel into a foreign country of Chinese shops, the lighting district, the Bowery Mission and restaurant supply stores. The rooms are comfortable,and well designed. The bathroom is almost as large. The service is polite and professional. This is a great place to explore lower Manhattan.

I stayed in this hotel four nights. We had a queen Deluxe room and boy, it was really deluxe. Finally a comfortable bed, with great linen... the corner room, with outer walls completely in glass, featured also a small living area. Great view, even if the 5th floor was a little noisy - the hotel is on the corner of two busy streets, so there's a lot of cars honking etc. etc. We were extremely satisfied by the room, and the two flaws we could find have been already written by other reviewers: 1) the lack of a door on the shower, which means that you cannot take a shower without getting water all over the floor (the water was properly hot every time, though) and 2) the continental breakfast that was part of our rate. This breakfast consists of a bowl of oatmeal + two slices of toasted bread OR three pastries PLUS a bowl of mixed fruit + orange juice + tea or coffee. The real problem here is the three pastries. They seemed stuff baked the day before. Did not seem fresh at all. The pieces of croissants were re-heated, so they were kind of dried out, and the other pastries were oily and tasted a bit stale. I think that, being such a nice hotel (I chose this hotel in Manhattan after having carefully read through the reviews of nearly 100 other places!), this is an annoying flaw. At least in Europe, breakfast is very often part of the roomrate, so it was odd to be treated a little rudely every time we presented the breakfast coupons. Apart from this minor flaw, I cannot praise enough the staff. Everybody was incredibly friendly and ready to help us out. I will suggest this place to friends and I hope to stay here again, even considering these minor nuisances.

My room (806) was comfortable,clean and quiet. The only surprise was the $12 glass of wine at the bar downstairs. Luckily, I found a bar restaurant up on Christie where a glass of wine was $6-sam quality.

I have stayed here twice since they opened, and in different rooms each time. The staff is awesome, the rooms are perfect, clean and very quiet / pretty soundproof, and the hotel is secure. These is one MAJOR flaw that I really wish they would address, in both rooms when I took a shower the water was luke-warm at best. The stays were months apart, so I think this might be a money saving thing by design, but they need it fixed. I can't take cold showers :-(

Stayed at this hotel in February and can say that it was one of my more pleasant hotel stays in NYC. Hotel is very clean and rooms, though a little small, are very well designed.
