Floor to ceiling windows and walk-in shower were nice. The surprise was the food & bar. Very good quality for a reasonable price. The subway is within walking distance. Staff and service was excellent. The one difficult thing is trying to get a taxi during rush hour. Ask the bellman to call a local car service for you if you need to go to the airport or Brooklyn. Overall, the hotel is a great value!!

My seven year old son and I just stayed here for three nights. I was very impressed from the moment we walked in the door. Our welcome was very warm and the service very efficient. Omar and all of the hotel associates we encountered were kind and respectful. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate, the room (and the view!) was beautiful, the bed comfortable, the location convenient. I could not be happier with my choice of lodging for this trip trip and hope to have the opportunity to stay here again. A sincere thank you to all that helped make our trip a success.

I stayed at this hotel by booking last minute on Priceline. I wasn't sure about staying at a hotel in Chinatown but my fears left instantly when I arrived at the hotel. It is a new building located on Bowery. The hotel staff was very friendly and personable. I was upgraded to the seventh floor with a view and adjoining balcony which was a pleasant surprise. The room looks great and comfortable. This is definitely the hotel to stay at if you want to explore the Chinatown, SoHo, Lower East Side and Little Italy areas.

We stayed 3 nights at this hotel in early April. I had been stalking the hotel's reviews for several weeks prior, and they were nearly all glowing. And while this is a nice hotel, it does have a couple of flaws. First, the good/great of the hotel - the staff is friendly & helpful; the decor is very attractive; the room was exceptionally clean; the fitness room was very user-friendly; and the hotel is located 2 easy blocks from the subway (this was a huge plus for us). Minor flaws: the hotel has no ice machines, even though they are advertised in the hotel's info book; the free breakfast that was advertised when we booked the hotel is no longer offered; and by far the biggest flaw - the bathroom. The bathroom/shower is very physically attractive, but it is the most impractical bathroom I have ever used. The shower has no door, which I thought would be no big deal, but my husband and I both soaked the floor every time we showered, no matter how hard we tried not to. The worst part of no door, though, was that the shower was FREEZING. The water was never "hot," only warm, which would have been okay had there been a shower door. But without a door to trap the steam/heat, the shower was freezing cold. It was not fun taking a shower. Not having a shower door to trap the steam also meant that when we got out of the shower, everything in the bathroom was covered in condensation (there was no fan to vent the steam, which I wouldn't have used even if there was one, because that would have only made the shower even colder). I couldn't store my makeup or other supplies in the bathroom because they were soaked after showering if I did. This was a pain. The other negative of the attractive bathroom was that the back wall was frosted glass, which meant that I couldn't shower early in the morning or late at night without waking my husband and daughter, because the light and sound carried right through the wall.I'm sure the minor flaws we experienced will be fixed, and they are greatly outweighed by the positives of the hotel. However, my husband said that because of the shower situation, he wouldn't stay at this hotel again. Too many other choices in NYC. However, if they could fix the shower situation, I would definitely come back, based on the hotel's staff, cleanliness, and proximity to a subway stop.

We visit NYC annually and most often we stay in the Upper Manhattan , this is the first time we venture to the Lower East Side and it turns out to be a good choice! The location is great: A metro station is less than 100 meters away, lots of very good and inexpensive Chinese and Vietnamese restaurants. The hotel itself is very new and in immaculate condition., its staff are very friendly and helpful. Should I have something to complain: The room is not spacious that's why they equip with only one chair. Of course, you would not mind if you travel all by yourself! And one more very tiny thing please! our room has no bath and not enough hooks for used towels. Again, if you are not environmental friendly then you can throw it on floor! Any way, overall this hotel is worth our money and we definitely recommend it to our friends .

I spent hours researching NYC hotels, hoping to find one that was centrally located, safe for a business woman alone, priced right, with good reviews, and up to my standards for cleanliness and style. The Wyndham Garden Chinatown exceeded ALL my expectations. The hidden surprise: world-class service. I arrived at check-in haggard and stressed, having drudged in from the airport by bus and train with suitcases. The director of rooms, Omar Bouchaar, greeted me warmly. I said, somewhat coyly, "So, you're going to 'wow' me, right?" Omar's reaction sealed my impression of the hotel. With a twinkle in his eye and a friendly smile, he seemed genuinely intrigued by the challenge---and he rose to it. After a few minutes on his computer, Omar confided: "We ARE going to 'wow' you. I've moved you to my FAVORITE room with a view." On the 15th floor, I enjoyed a panoramic view of the Brooklyn Bridge, City Hall and the Empire State Building. The room was the perfect size for NYC, comfortable, nicely appointed and boasted a closet and desk (thank God). Not least important, it was immaculate. The hotel's exercise room had a handful of treadmills and machines, perfect for my needs, as well.Omar embodies fine hospitality, and his service is a big part of why I'll book here on my upcoming trips. He even picked up on my needs for 'hydration' and had extra water bottles sent up to my room. The rest of the staff was graciously accommodating, routing directions to all my business meetings by train and fetching taxis when needed. Special note to my fellow yogis: Check out the nearby Yoga High studio, just two blocks away on Forsyth and Grant. Fantastic instruction; another gem. In short: For a traveler who enjoys the diversity and a mix of bustling streets and quaint side streets, the Wyndham's location is ideal. Wind through Chinatown for trinkets and a taste of being in another world. Hop to Little Italy for cafe dining. Skip over to Soho for trendy restaurants and shopping. Loved it.Thank you, Omar, for going the extra mile. Consider me 'wowed.' :)

despite having a room on the second floor, the room was very quiet, we could sleep as long as we want, we were not annoyed by the noise from the street. room service was perfect. the hotel is well located, 2 metro stations are 2 blocks away, and you can even walk to lower manhattan (9/11 memorial, Brooklynn brigde, century 21). the best surprise was the hotel restaurant, they have exquisite rolls! overall we had a very good experience and we'll come again if we come back to NYC
Very good，stuffs are very friendly，room are very clean，location is very good，very convenient to everywhere!

Rather than stay in Mid-town as usual we opted to stay on the Lower East Side and had a ball. The Wyndam Garden Chinatown is a gem of a hotel; new, clean, well-appointed and reasonably priced. The room was smallish as you would expect but immaculate. There is a small bar with happy hour and a restaurant on-site.The staff was most helpful, especially Hamaz (?) who guided us to some excellent restaurants in Chinatown and Little Italy. From this hotel you can easily walk and explore Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, and the Brooklyn Bridge. We also discovered the Tenement Museum only a few blocks away. With a taxi or subway you can quickly access alot of other NYC sites in Lower Manhattan.

Very nice stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. The room was compact (but not tiny) and functional and very clean. There is a refrigerator included which is nice for fruit from the stalls and leftovers from all the great restaurants in the neighborhood. Two two-drawer nightstands and a narrow armoire for hanging clothes provided adequate storage. The bathroom is spacious, but as others have pointed out the water from the shower is strangely attracted to the floor and needs to be soaked up with the very nice towels provided. There is also no hook/rod in the bathroom to hang the towel near the shower. Be prepared for the frosted glass wall that separates the bathroom from the bedroom --you do get a shadow show when someone is using the facilities and the bedroom lights are dimmed. The view from the room is spectacular -- we were on the 12th floor and were greeted by a panorama that included the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. Watching the rain move down the island was especially fun. Definitely ask for a higher room -- lower floors look straight into the building across the street which might make those floor to ceiling windows a disadvantage. The staff from housekeeping to the front desk to the bartenders and maintenance people were all extraordinarily friendly and accommodating. Would definitely return
This hotel was in a perfect location, great space, great views, friendly staff and close to great restaurants. I would recommend this highly for anyone staying in Manhattan.

We visit NYC about 4 times per year and usually stay in mid-town/times square. Wanting to stay near the Lower East Side, we chose the Wyndham Chinatown.I loved the location on the edge of Chinatown/Little Italy and close to the action of the LES. The price was good as well.As my title says, the place is brand new, so the rooms are immaculate. I was also very happy with their lobby bar. Its a far cry from a usual lobby bar: the bartenders are hip, witty, and good mixers, the snacks are great, and Happy Hour prices had me floored. CHEAP drinks and Cheap snacks (dollar clams or oysters and more).I was disappointed to discover their happy hour is only weekdays, not weekends.My only complaint is the size of the rooms; they're very small. They bumped my brother to a penthouse room (his balcony door would not lock), but it was no bigger than our standard queen size room. Theres very little room to navigate around the bed. Theres also only one chair in the room (can't fit much more anyway), so if you're 2 couples travelling and decide to hang in the room before heading out, 3 have to sit on the bed, one in the chair and perhaps rotate.But hey, its Manhatten, right?I'd recommend this place for its location on the lower east side, for its 'newness' (cleanliness), for its weekday happy hours, and for the price. Just be prepared for a small room and it'll be an excellent choice.

The facility is fairly new...only open for a few months. The hotel looks nice from outside and inside, very modern and updated. As a matter of fact, it looks too new compared to the surrounding buildings. Staff was friendly and the room was comfortable. Awkward shower! Attractive design, but not functional as it has no door (only a glass wall that covers half the entrance). The hotel ownership will need to do something about it because after you take a shower there is a puddle of water outside the shower. There is no bathtub (not sure if they have it as optional in other rooms), but I honestly don't mind it. Something I really cared about is cleanliness and so far, they are doing a good job. Overall, I enjoyed the stay and this was the best option I was able to find.

Hotel was spot on, very good service, good restaurant, bit noisy on the crossroads junction but everywhere in New York is noisy! Location was great for Chinatown and the Financial area/Ground Zero. Chinatown is a bit of a dump, but this is not the fault of the Hotel. Couldn't fault the Hotel or its staff. I would stay thee again.

Great location. Near subway, chinatown, little Italy. You can also walk a few blocks more to Soho and Washington Square. We did. Drawback: traffic noise. Very clean. Approx $30 to $35 taxi ride from LGA.
The room was beautifully appointed, and very clean. The staff were very helpful, and quite pleasant!

To start, I managed to book this hotel for 4 nights in December during their grand-opening sale. I don't think I would've stayed here had it not been for the sale as the regular rates are far too expensive for my pockets. Nevertheless, it is New York, so if you have the money, this is an excellent stay in the heart of Chinatown. The hotel is brand spanking new. You can tell they pay attention to details and keep everything super clean. The staff was very friendly, especially on our last day when we we're waiting to get a cab to the airport. One of the female receptionists took her time to hail us a cab AND help carry our bags, which totally wasn't necessary for a female to do. Our room was very clean and spacious. We stayed in a room that had a king room and a pull-out sofa bed. Besides these two colums that were on both sides of the bed, the room was easy to move around in and felt very comforting. I dont remember the street noise being much of a problem at night, but then again, maybe I'm just a heavy sleeper. The area is very safe. It may not look great outside like say the upper east side or midtown manhattan, but Chinatown and the SoHo area are perfectly safe areas to be in. In fact, you're about a 10 minute walk away from what I consider being the best pizza in NY (Lombardi's on Spring & Mott). You're a short 5 minute walk away from different subway stations that can take you anywhere you'd like to go which is a huge plus for me when traveling to NY. The free continental breakfast menu when I stayed in December was very limited and not the best tasting (you either chose between plain flavored yogurt, which is very strong, or very bland tasting oatmeal), but it is free so I still ate there every morning as it was acceptable. I don't know if they have changed the menu since, but this by no means should be a deal breaker as the hotel was excellent in all other aspects.
Everything about this hotel was exceptional including the room service dinner which was superb! There's a special amenity of a balcony on the seventh floor.
Two words. Stay here!!! Fab staff, fab location. Lovely room, though small, it's design is efficient.

This is the second time I stayed here. Love the location! Did not care for the service. I had requested ahead for twin bed room, but was given a gueen bed; I was told that even though they have the rooms available, it considered to be an upgrade and I had to pay an extra unreasonable amount of money. Also I had to prove to them that I had booked the two breakfast included room with this very unpleasant staff. No customer should be treated this way. As much as I like the location, I do not like to start my vacation this way. After all, the room is not cheap!

I ended up here because all of my normal hotels were booked or $450 (spring break). Not particularly convenient location for my business meetings, but new and at a good rate. If you are wanting to visit or stay near Chinatown, you are right in it. Very good service. Small but nice bar with good happy-hour and good bartender (Matt). Room is well laid out for its size (small, but almost all rooms in NYC will be small). It was quiet at night. Bathroom has no countertops or anywhere really to put your toiletries (shaving cream, curling irons, etc.). There also is very little storage space, so it might be a problem if you're hoping to stay more than a few nights. The knob on one of the cabinets was broken - I took it to the front desk, had a couple of drinks, went to my room and it was repaired. The open shower is a mess - after my shower the bathroom floor was covered in water. If this were more convenient to my business meetings I would probably stay again despite the bathroom issues. There was no complimentary breakfast, and the restaurant is not a bargain. For the price point you can do a whole lot worse (I have). It's new and clean with above average service.

I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. In order to make this a useful review, I thought I would break it down into what I loved, what others might not like but I didn't mind, and the few things I thought could be improved. First, what we loved: our view was amazing. We were on the 10th floor and north side of the building, and we had a spectacular view of midtown Manhattan, including the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. It was particularly lovely and romantic at night. We also loved how beautifully the room was decorated and the bed was very comfortable. Finally, Chinatown was a great location if you love a truly authentic New York neighborhood that is a real Chinatown still, not a touristy embalmed version. It's also really convenient to the B and D train and fairly convenient to the 6 and the N and the R.What others might have minded but we didn't: I noticed when I looked at previous reviews that some people thought the rooms were small. While our room was a bit on the small side, I think that's a function of New York hotel rooms and they've done a great job making it much nicer by including a full wall of windows (see above re view). Also, I lived in New York a while ago and so am used to the dirty and crowded streets that you find in neighborhoods like Chinatown. If you are new to New York or to city travel in general, you might find the location a little TOO authentic. Finally, if you are concerned about being able to easily get everywhere in the city, including Central Park or other far uptown places, this hotel may not be as well situated for that. We wanted to hang downtown so this location was perfect.Some suggested improvements: the shower was really strange--it had no door so water got all over the bathroom floor no matter how much you adjusted the head. I think they could put in a better shower head to avoid this problem. Also, the front desk staff was very nice but not very knowledgeable about the area. When we asked about a breakfast place, they could not recommend a specific restaurant and sent us to Grand Street because "there are lots of breakfast places along there"--which there weren't when we got there. Overall, I thought this was a very good hotel that could be great if the staff updated their knowledge of the area more.

Brand new hotel in a great location near major roads and subway stops. Rooms are well designed and nicely decorated. Staff is friendly and helpful. Still some kinks in the restaurant but overall a really nice place.

We had a great stay here. We were on our honeymoon so would have been nice to be properly upgraded but for the price, you cannot complain. Breakfast was good. Rooms were very clean and maintained well. Even the coffee from the coffee machine in room was lovely!One thing that would have improved our stay is the wifi. The connection was terrible, it would be really good extremely late at night when you guess no one else is on. For a hotel I would have thought they would cater better for wifi ESP in NYC. Tourists always want to get on to check stuff Will definitely recommend this place!

Requested a quite room. Instead was given a room on 12th floor with disco music BLASTING AT OVER 100 DECIBELS emanating from the 17th floor until midnight and one o'clock in the morning. Reason : "disco is a third party and therefore I, the paying guest must not sleep ". You should draw your own conclusions.

This hotel is relatively new and very nice. Good furnishings and I encountered no hiccups. The front desk staff were excellent and extremely helpful. The only reservation I have is that although the food in the restaurant was excellent, the service was a bit slow for a group of about 15.

After a great search, we found this hotel that revealed for itself a great surprise. Amazing location for a good price in NYC. With two subway stations nearby, from there we was able to know all city. The hotel is located in the limits of soho, chinatown and little italy, what permit to live all the vibrating life in the neighborhoods. Great staff. small but very nice rooms. We will come back for sure.

My partner and I spend a great deal of time visiting NYC. We usually stay in Midtown or the Upper West Side. However, we decided to explore a different area of Manhattan this trip and selected the Wyndham Garden Chinatown based on TripAdvisor reviews as well as a great hotels.com price offer. We were not disappointed!!The service throughout our stay was attentive, efficient and friendly!! Our room was very comfortable and well appointed. I especially loved the shower with stone floor. The room was a typical size for NYC, but the hotel uses the small space well for furniture placement.The hotel is right in the heart of Chinatown. So, there's a plethora sights, sounds and culture. It's also an easy walk to Little Italy, The Brooklyn Bridge, the East Village and SOHO. Plus, there are two subway stations within a couple of blocks, which makes getting around to the rest of Manhattan very easy.I highly recommend this hotel!!

For people who like chinatown ambiance, it's perfect. Nice modern room, ours had a great view (but apparently not the case for all kinds of room, ours was a Deluxe Queen Room)Nice small bathroom with italian shower.

This is a newer hotel. The location is ideal if you like a bit of flavor to your experience. Chinatown is filled with cultural flavor and typifies some of the ethnic neighborhoods in NYC. There is great food and shopping options. It is close ( a train stop or 2) away from other happening spots in Manhattan. The train is right around the corner. You cant get lost. There are always lots of people around in case you are the scary type or not familiar with the big city. The hotel is nice. The rooms are a little small but comfortable. Amenities are upscale enough. The staff is great. Hamzi is the best. Get to know him. He knows EVERYTHING. He is friendly and always helpful to get you where you want to go. Raj is super professional. He will go out of his way to accommodate you and with a smile. Nadia is friendly and can also get you where you need to go. There is restaurant on-site. It seemed busy and the bar was always busy as well. This hotel has a hip feel to it without being loud and overrun with youngsters or hipsters. It puts you in a New York state of mind.

Excellent location in Chinatown. Got the 7th floor so we had a balcony with an excellent view of the street. Room was clean, beautiful and comfortable. The shower was an open one so it was cold and water pressure was low. The staff was very nice and helpful with luggage and directing us toward best subway stop.
A great hotel in a great location. Super convenient to all of lower manhattan. Staff are super helpful. Will stay here again.

We loved this place, Be sure to stay on the top floors for an outstanding view, New, clean hotel. Great location with access to subways , shopping, resteraunts and parks. The breakfast is not so great, but everything else makes up for it

This hotel was great for our family gathering to attend my son's wedding. The hotel is new, nicely done, very friendly, helpful staff, and very clean. While the regular rooms are small, tho not as small as some NYC hotels, the suites had plenty of space. Everyone enjoyed Chinatown and Little Italy and we were close enough to St. Teresa's church where the wedding took place. Very satisfied with our stay.

Good location -close to Little Italy, SoHo, and of course, Chinatown. Not far from subway. Plenty of restaurants to choose from in the neighborhood. The hotel was modern and the rooms/beds very comfortable. Even had a small fridge. Great bedding and nice bathroom. The staff were very helpful, I would definitely stay here again as long as I had a decent room rate.
There aren't enough good words to say about this hotel! Clean, friendly, helpful staff bent over backwards to make our one night stay fantastic.

We stayed 4 days in NYC and were really pleased by choosing this hotel. The staff was really friendly and helpful. The manager makes every effort to make our stay even better. I definitely will be staying in this hotel in my next visit to big apple and highly recommend this hotel.

Front desk staff was very friendly. I appreciated their help getting a cab to the airport. The sharp modern lobby set a nice upbeat tone. Rooms were comfortable, though small (probably about typical size for NYC). Easy to walk around Chinatown and Little Italy from this location.

Staff is very nice. The hotel is really clean and organized.It's also easy to go everywhere in new York because it's near subway.But I don't like the bathroom because its design makes all the bathroom wet.Overall, it's good hotel with good price.

I stayed here for 13 nights from Feb 24 to Mar 9. Hotel was good and peaceful; everything was perfect except the $50 charge which they made at the check-in time. I was being told that the amount has been kept as a security and will be refunded back after the check-out date. However, I have not received any refunds till now (10 days has already gone).

My wife and I just returned from a nine day stay at this hotel. We are seasoned travelers who are particular about our accommodations and who are very familiar with New York City. This is a really great property from which to base your journeys in New York. We found the staff to be very helpful, extremely pleasant, and very accommodating. The property itself was clean and new, always a plus, and offered very good value. The room (we stayed in a king), though small, was extremely functional and, to our pleasant surprise, not a problem for our nine day stay. The view from our room (out of ceiling to floor windows) was nothing less than spectacular. The location is perfect since there is easy walking access the a number of subway lines, and there are too many great value and excellent food restaurants just out the revolving hotel door to even count. We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next visit to New York.

My hotel tastes run the gamut, but when staying in a city like NYC, I make sure to stay at a reputable brand with good reviews. The Wyndham Garden did not disappoint. We have a beautiful penthouse corner room with sweeping views of NYC. From our room we could see the Manhattan Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower, Union Square, and the Empire State Building. It had a balcony that ran the length of our floor, but we were the only people who were ever on it. The room was small, but it's NYC, you're paying for the location and the view. The location could not have been better. Very very close to Subways and very easy to hail a cab. Canal street is a 2 minute walk, Little Italy a 5 minute walk, and SoHo a 10 minute walk. You truly cannot beat it. We were lucky enough to be in town for Chinese New Year and got caught up in the festivities daily. It was such a treat. The staff at the hotel was incredible. They remembered us by name at the front desk with each passing. We even rode the elevator with one of the guest services members who asked about our stay, and if I had any suggestions. All I can say is this hotel truly exceeded my expectations and I cannot wait to come back for another trip.

While this hotel is certainly "no frills," it's modern, clean, and in a great location. The staff is super friendly, as well. We were able to walk to most of our destinations, and the subway is only about a 5 minute walk away. We decided to park overnight at a lot right around the corner, but the hotel valet is $43/night for a car, which seemed reasonable. We paid $30 for up to 24 hours within a two minute walk of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again!

We stayed for three nights recently and I was glad I chose this hotel for our stay. Although not in Midtown where most of the touristy sights are, the Wyndham Garden Chinatown is perfect for the price (booked through Travelocity). It's almost a brand-new hotel, so the rooms and amenities are nice and fresh. Very friendly staff, and a good bar in the lobby for drinks.

Great value for money in an unbeatable location. Super friendly and helpful staff who will try to do everything in their power to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Small but clean and modern rooms. The comfy bed and double-glazed windows made for a sound night's sleep despite the fact that it was the weekend.
Hotel upscale for neighborhood but great location in Chinatown on the edge of Little Italy! Subway a short block away. Definitely would stay here again.

We stayed in this hotel with our Family on their first trip to New York. Really great hotel in a very good location. If you want Chinese food or Italian food then it's perfect. You really get the feeling you are in China and then just a few blocks and you are on the main strip on New York. Hotel is clean and has very modern rooms. The hotel Bar is a great place to chill with beer or Cocktail and happy hour is a bonus!!!!. Great Sushi also. . .

Arrived very early Monday morning and the staff immediately checked us into an available room. This was great as we could freshen up for our first day in NYC. Stayed until end of day Friday. The room was spotless and very comfortable. The subway is only 1 block away which made getting around town very easy. Although my room was on the 5th floor and the view was not the best, a short elevator ride to the roof and the view is incredible.The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would be more than happy to return here and would recommend the hotel to family and friends.

Booked hotel through Agoda and paid about USD560 for 3 nights. Journeyed to hotel by Airtrain andSubway from JFK. Alighted at Bowery station. Hotel is about 3 blocks south of the station. No problem finding it. Check in was smooth. Requested for high floor room with a view. Given one that was in the upper half of the building but faced Bowery Road, so no view of the north and Empire State Building. Also requested for late check out on because our flight was in the evening. Check out extended to 1pm, which was quite good enough for us. Room itself was comfortable. Cable TV available. Bed was comfortable. No issue with that. Wifi was good. Had no problems with that either. Previous comments about toilet are true, The screen for the shower area was too narrow, and there was a less than 1cm raised barrier that prevented water from getting out of the shower area into the toilet. Despite utmost care and using lower water pressure during shower, water escaped out into the toilet area. The basin was on its own below the mirror. There was no space to put toiletries and make up stuff, which had to be placed on the top of the cistern of the toilet bowl. A set of toiletries was provided by housekeeping seem slow and reluctant to replenish the toiletries, even when our shower gel and shampoo etc was less than half filled. Having said all this, the toilet and shower was fitted with branded stuff. By the way, housekeeping also did not top up coffee and tea sachets. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. No problem holding our luggage after check out too. Breakfast was included in the deal and it was adequate. Choosing the standard continental with choice of pastry or oats and toasts means no added charges other than tip for waiter/waitress. Also came with coffee. Order anything else means pay the difference plus tax and tip.I find that the best feature of the hotel was its location. It was right next to one end of the Manhattan Bridge, with the Forsyth St market right below it. Can get cheap fruits there from the road side stalls. Many restaurants nearby in Chinatown and Little Italy, all within walking distance. The more useful subway station is Canal Street which is 10 to 15 minute away.

This is the late review of stay in the end of November early December 2012. We stayed for 5 night. The hotel is new and efficient. 1. The rooms are perfectly functional with big windows.. Our room had a great view on lower Manhattan. 2. Everything is squeaky clean, Most importantly no bugs (no small feat in NYC hotel). 3. Staff is friendly, helpful and attentive. 4. At the time price-wise it was a steal at $145. . 5. Location is near perfect for lower Manhattan - the subways stops are 5 min (B,D) ,10 min (j,Z), 12 min (N,Q) and 15 min (F)respectively. Plenty of good food options around - some tourist traps some not. Little Italy is 5 min walk (if you are into it),, great Jewish deli's of Lower ES ( I particularly recommend Katz) at 15 min away, etc.6. If you are into South Asian fruits (rambutan, longan, lychee, mangosteen, etc). then added bonus are Chineese/Vietnamese groceries 3 min away. The only drawback I can think of it breakfast. Not that it is bad - it is perfectly adequate continental breakfast, it is just slow. It takes hours to serve. Overall I highly recommend this hotel.

The staff was very friendly and proficient. The rooms were immaculate and modern with good views. It is a new hotel. Queen bed was very comfortable. We got a great price of $161 base on a weekday-less for the weekend. The bar is small but friendly with an awesome bartender (Victor) and a loyal local crowd. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant but word is that the sushi is good. The subway is a 2 short block walk- very convenient. The negatives (and they weren't enough to bring it down in rating): 1. We weren't given the free breakfast that other guests were given because we made reservations through a 3rd party rather than the hotel itself (Hotels.com). Can't complain too much, I guess, since we got a good rate and there is a good breakfast cafe a short walk away (see Yelp). We did eat breakfast one morning in the hotel and the prices were high- $10 bowl of oatmeal, $15 for 3 eggs. 2. The bathroom has no towel racks- it has a little hook but it is insufficient. We wanted to be "green" and save our towels but since we couldn't get them to dry on a rack, we ended up piling them on the floor to be washed and got new ones every day- wasteful. 3. I could never really figure out the shower fixture and I couldn't get the water warm enough to my liking. There's only a little half glass wall and the water tends to escape to the bathroom floor. 4. The a/c was a little loud. Not rattly loud but sort of like loud "white noise." We would definitely stay here again- kudos to all the staff for making this such a high quality place to stay when visiting NYC.
Beautiful decor and loved the large floor to ceiling windows. I stayed on the 8th floor and had a great view. I'd stay there again. The water temperature for the shower did not get warm enough.

This new hotel made my daughter's inaugural trip to NYC extra special. The room was excellent, the staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable, the location was terrific. Really have nothing negative to say about this place. Had a great experience.

On our trip to NY I made the mistake of booking the Wyndham garden in Newark, NJ. When I arrived at the Wyndham in Chinatown they were just as surprised as I was to figure this out. All the rooms were booked so my gf and I had no place to stay unless we wanted to take a cab back and forth to Jersey (easily $70 cab ride). Luckily Vanessa at the front desk helped us out and was able to find a room for us. The staff was very nice and made sure we were well taken care of. The guy at the front desk even waited out in the blizzard to catch us a cab while we were warm inside whenever we wanted to leave to the city. The hotel and staff were an all around excellent experience and if it wasn't for them our NY trip could have been ruined.

My wife and I spent the weekend at the wyndham Garden this past weekend. We enjoyed our stay very much. Our room was spotless and very comfortable with a great view of uptown manhatten through floor to ceiling windows. Bathroom is very bright with frosted glass door, glass wall and open glass shower. The staff was polite and very helpfull with all our needs. Great little bar in the lobby. Happy hour M-F 5-8 1/2 price drinks and apps.If you need to park use the hotel . Do NOT use "Quick park" on Bowery st. For some reason they concider 11:00 am friday to 11:30am sunday 72 hours. (rip off!)

Staff was friendly, patient and very accommodating and eager to please. The rooms were very clean, spacious (for NY) and very comfortable. It was quiet and in an awesome location of walking distance to Chinatown (obviously) SoHo, TriBeCa, and Little Italy. Free WiFi and an excellent complimentary continental breakfast of fruit, oatmeal and some breads. (Just make sure to ask the front desk for your voucher)I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.Great price, location and service.
The smelled like cigarettes and the shower only had a little piece of glass so water went onto the floor . Overall stay was great!

By now you know that this is the best deal in the Chinatown, Little Italy, and the East Village area. Clean and friendly atmosphere. I'll hit on some minor details that you should take into account in order to make your visit a super experience. CHECK IN: When you arrive try parking in the very front of the hotel. You most likely will need to go in and let the front desk know you will valet the car. Approximate wait will be 10 minutes or so since they have to contact the garage. The cost is $55.00+ a day with no in and out service available. You may wish to park on the next street, Crystie Street garage. The cost is $30.00 a day or $15.00 for a half day. This way you can go in and out. An inexpensive option for a NYC garage. ROOMS: Very clean, on the small side, but adequate. Storage space is at a premium. Just one side bed end table. Request a shower tub with a curtain if you wish to avoid a little water on the floor from the glass door showers. BAR: Happy hour at the friendly small bar is just super. Other times they are pricey. BREAKFAST: Forget the free breakfast, add a couple of dollars to your $10.00 voucher and get the 3 egg platter or Grand Marnier infused french toast. That's it, I just wanted to point out that these minor details are the only things you may wish to take into consideration. You will have such an all around pleasant time at The Wyndham Gardens Chinatown and surrounding neighborhood, that I can just about guarantee it. Enjoy!

Only (slight) complaint about a very satisfying stay at a great price (thanks to travelzoo) : heating/air system quite noisy especially since the rooms are well-sound proofed from outside noise and a fire alarm that went off mid-afternoon, was notified as being checked over the PA system, but never cancelled meant a schlepp down many flights of stairs for naught...Great "happy hour" snacks ($1 oysters!) at the bar and good hearty breakfast in the morning.Will definitely return if we can get that same spectacular view at an unbeatable price!

Stayed here at the end of February for our anniversary and couldnt have been happier - we got a great deal with a fabulous view from one of the upper floor rooms of uptown Manhatten. There are plenty of cheap Chinese eateries nearby and its not far to walk to the Lower East Side and Little Italy. We could even walk to Greenwich Village and the Financial District and Brooklyn Bridge in less than 30 minutes. Plenty of subway options on the doorstep for Midtown and Uptown aswell. The staff were very welcoming and friendly as others have said. Only negative things I would mentions were: free Breakfast is a little spartan and the oatmeal was pretty ordinary (although we only ate it once while we were there). They havent got any ice machines yet (its still a pretty new hotel), but you can get some from the friendly barman though. The shower only had enough glass to cover half the entrance, so quite a lot of water got on the floor which seemed like an odd design choice! If you can get away with it, try and go up to the top floor which has an amazing 360 view of upper and lower manhatten, but is yet to be built by the looks of it (I cant understand why they dont have a rooftop bar already - it would be a big drawcard). It can be a bit noisy outside with sirens and horns, but its New York, so its hard to find somewhere thats not like that anyway! Ear plugs worked for me in the end.

Gotta tell you the windows and view from my room was the best. the staff was excellent and helpfull. lobby was clean. really everything was really good. Room was small but you could not really tell as the floor to cealing windows just opened it up. I will be back.

The hotel is all glass and has great views of UPTOWN. This is located in heart of China Town and we switched to a hotel Uptown after the 1st day and wish we had stayed at the Wyndam Garden Chinatown. Continental Breakfast is (FREE) included but full breakfast is available for around $10. Staff is obviously happy and wanting the hotel to be a success. Nearby NYC icons are the Pizza Casa cooking school, the foot heaven massage parlor (excellent), the new REI New York, Ground Zero. Il Mulinos (Italian) and Katz Deli and Canal street.

our car needs a complete engine cradle replacement. called hotel and expedia, asked for a cancellation or hotel credit or transfer reservation to the following night. they absolutely refused to even consider the total amount, would not discuss credit of any amount whatsover. they would not consider transferring reservation to the following evening. i will never book with a wyndham hotel again.

We got a great price on a 3rd floor, corner King room that included a living area with a sofa. Room was spotless and spacious. As others have mentioned, the shower looks great, but water got everywhere, despite careful usage. Free wifi in the room and lobby was a huge plus. Front desk and housekeeping were friendly and helpful. Location is great for walking through LES, East Village, and SoHo. The closest subway station is on Grand, but you can access other lines easily on Canal and Bowery. If you've already done the midtown-touristy stuff before, this location is a great (and affordable) base for seeing other parts of the city.

I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown in NYC for 3 nights starting February 7, 2013. Let me just start by saying that all the great reviews of this hotel are spot on. Check-in was quick and easy. The reception staff was very friendly and efficient. The hotel is very new and so shows little signs of wear and tear. It is located in Manhattan's Chinatown (but also very close to Little Italy) at the corner of Bowery and Hester. For me it was very enjoyable to be in an ethnic neighborhood like Chinatown because it emphasizes the melting pot that is New York City. The neighborhood is full of the sights, sounds and smells that characterize the Chinese community in this great metropolis. I felt safe coming and going at all times and am really glad I chose to stay here as opposed to Times Square or a more touristy part of the city.The hotel is close to a couple subway lines (less than 10 min. walk) so getting anywhere in NYC should be no problem. That said, I was able to walk from the hotel to SOHO, the Village, and the financial district. So if you don't have problems walking and want to really take in Manhattan and its neighborhoods, the hotel's location won't present a problem. And, of course, the the subway is nearby for going further afield.The hotel's physical characteristics put it squarely in a 4+-star category. It is a modern high-rise building of approximately 20 floors. I was fortunate enough to be given a standard room on the 16th floor with a view facing uptown. Although the room was not huge, it did not feel small because of the floor-to-ceiling window that comprised an entire wall of the room. (Even the bathroom had a small floor-to-ceiling window with a view!) I could look out the window toward the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings while lying on the bed. There was probably less than 3 feet of space between the foot of the bed and the window, but the spectacular view created a great effect, especially at night.All the furnishings in the room were top notch and everything functioned perfectly. The furniture and bedding were done in a contemporary dark brown and beige. The bathroom was of a nice size, with a bathtub/shower combination and high-quality fixtures and toiletries. Water pressure and temperature were great.My rate included a daily continental breakfast. This is not a breakfast buffet but rather it is something you order from the restaurant menu and is served at your table. I was given a voucher for each day that had a value of $10 and was enough to cover the cost of the continental breakfast selection, which consisted of a generous bowl of oatmeal, a small bowl of fruits, one slice of toast, and coffee or juice. It is possible to order additional items from the menu at an extra cost. I will mention that the staff at the Elevate restaurant, where breakfast is served, is extremely polite and courteous!The hotel's public spaces are not very big. There is a small bar area and lobby area, as well as the Elevate restaurant, which is on the lower level. I must say, however, that the hotel very efficiently and tastefully makes use of the space it has, being intended more for the business traveler than for someone traveling with the family on vacation.All in all I am very glad I chose the Wyndham Garden Chinatown and would not hesitate to stay there again. The special rate was very reasonable for NYC and the room and view were fantastic!

My husband and I stayed there during the Chinese New Year Festival weekend. Thanks to other reviewers we requested a corner room and were rewarded with a great view of the city on the 11th floor. The room was small, enough room for two people. We had a handicap room so the bathroom shower was exposed and the floor did get wet but I didn't mind too much. I think it'd be awkward to share the room with someone other than a spouse/significant other - the bathroom door is made of glass though frosted and sounds do come through. The service from hotel staff was great. I would not recommend getting the free breakfast downstairs. I had steelcut oatmeal and it tasted pretty gross. The service was also slow and lacking. There are so many yummy Chinese restaurants and even Doughnut Plant nearby where you can grab great, cheap food. Overall, it was great and affordable place to stay. Easy to get uptown and other neighborhoods within walking distance. I was happy with my stay there and would definitely come back.

We booked a hotel thru Hotwire at a great discounted rate, and was really happily surprised when we arrived the hotel. The hotel is located in a new and modern building between Grand St. and Canal St. subway stations, and trains that takes you to central Manhattan in minutes. The hotel also offers a cocked to order breakfast in their basement restaurant, and they gave us free vouchers worth 10 dollars each pr day. Basically we had great breakfast for 5 dollars! Another plus is the high speed free unlimited wifi. Rooms are clean and with floor to roof windows with the views of the New York skyline and Chinatown. For the price we paid this hotel is the best travel bargain I ever found on Manhattan.

We loved our stay in NY, the hotel was just as it was advertised on line. Omar was especially helpful when we first arrived. Would highly recommend to all staying here, easy access to everything. Also Vee who worked in the bar was very accomodating, helping us with places to eat, drink etc. Hope we will be able to come back one day!.

I really enjoyed my stay at The Wyndham Garden Chinatown and found that they offer a level of customer service that exceeds the other hotels in NY I have stayed at. The staff is friendly and accomodating which can be rare in New York City. I arrived early and they were able to give me an early check-in, which is priceless to anyone who takes an overnight flight. The room was spotless, had a large bathroom, and a great view looking uptown. The location of this hotel is very convenient as well. A couple of blocks north is the East Village, a couple of blocks west is Little Italy, and lower Manhattan is walkable too. Otherwise, there are a few subways nearby if you need to go further. Do take advantage of some of the great restaurants in the area- lots to offer!Overall, I will definitely stay there again. It is great value and service for the price, in a city that so often has ridiculously priced rooms and inattentive staff.

We had a wonderful stay at the hotel and we were blessed with an excellent view of the city with a very comfortable bed and a cozy room. On top of all of that, the staff were very helpful and most importantly, very friendly and courteous. A great find in New York City and we would definately stay there again.

Stayed on 15th flr with corner room. Wrap around balcony. Straight ahead was Empire State Building and Chrysler Building. Other side had the Freedom Tower. Incredible. The bar in the main lounge area was great. Fabulous happy hour (3) with excellent oysters, clams and other tasty treats. We are frequent visitors to the City, but this was our first visit to the China Town and Little Italy area. Absoutely awesome to visit a new area. The staff is professional and bar personnel were extremely friendly. Rooms are immaculate. I just did not prefer glass bathroom door.

Great value, views and service. Only negatives were that the vacant lot next store is infested with rats which ran out on the street and the shower controls didn't work properly. Didn't raise either issue with staff.

On a trip to visit our newest grandson (and his parents), we stayed in Chinatown. They live less than a mile from the hotel. Ask for an upper room. We stayed on the eighth floor in a corner room - queen deluxe? - (#802) and had views that included the Chrysler building, the Empire State building, and the new Freedom Tower. With floor to ceiling glass windows, a frosted glass door to the bathroom, (yes, floor to ceiling windows there are as well - AND a full-width pull-down shade), what could have seemed like a small space felt bright and open. Just one chair. Nice queen bed. The room was quiet and very comfortable.

I Was in NYC for 1 nignht a really quick trip , I use hot wire without knowing what will be my hotel just based on rating. when I arrived great services, really polite and nice people, the bedroom are nice too for the price range compare to the $300 in NYC

We absolutely LOVED our stay at the Wyndham Chinatown. The hotel is brand new, the staff was so pleasant and the room was a great size! It's definitely still new, there were a few minor kinks to work out, but it was worth it. We also got a great rate as it is new, not sure if that rate will still apply…..but it was perfect for bar hopping in the area and had great middle of the night chinese food! YUM!

I was heading over to NY and looked in to several of the more upscale hotels forgetting it was Fashion Week which meant room prices soared to $380 for a standard room. After looking up Wyndham Garden here on Tripadvisor, I found rooms for $199 which is rare to find in Manhattan unless your staying at a budget hotel.The hotel itself is in mint condition, has only been open for 3-4 months. Room standards were excellent with whatever you needed. I usually have to call the front desk to get an ironing board and clothes iron but that was already in place. The only dissapointment was the complementary "continental breakfast" which was 4 tiny pieces of bread and a very sad bowl of fruit.The location is perfect if you want to stay downtown, 5 min walk to Soho, 2 min to Little Italy and you are in the heart of Chinatown which is perfect if you like asian food as much as me.All in all, a very good hotel that I would recommend to anyone heading to NYC.

I want to marry my room! Seriously. It was made of awesome. It seems like nearly half the room was floor to ceiling windows for an incredible view over the city. Altho I did get to wondering if anyone could see in as well as I could see out. Everyone we had contact with was terrific. The front desk staff and the bartender were especially fun and nice to talk to. We felt very welcome at all times. The neighborhood is safe and there are lots of great restaurants very near by. The only thing I'd have to say is I felt the plastic seats in the bar area were on the flimsy side, but somehow we managed. And I'm not sure how the bathroom floor ended up soaked after my shower even tho I made sure the shower curtain was in place. But those are small complaints compared to an overall great stay
A new hotel near China Town, Little Italy and Soho! Hotel's staff are friendly and room is clean and comfortable. Very near to sub-way station.
Great location; comfortable room; beautiful bathroom; good service. Complimentary breakfast but selection is very limited. Would stay again if the price is right.

I arrived in NYC late one night from Boston and found that the room I had booked with Airbnb had a catfish host. Feeling unsafe at the Airbnb location and with horrible customer service from Airbnb, I was very pleased when Kim at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown treated me with kindness and respect and helped me out of a bad situation. She gave me a good rate on a room for the night and was very pleasant. She had a beautiful smile and put me at ease. When I arrived in my room, I was taken aback by the gorgeous view of the city through a floor-to-ceiling window. The room was pristine and the accommodations were outstanding. The bed was extremely comfortable, too. Upon check-out, I had the pleasure of speaking with Massy who was also very kind. The whole experience was truly delightful. I highly recommend the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.

The hotel was new, so the rooms and facilities were clean but there were some things that were a bit "off." The shower set-up resulted in water being spilled onto the bathroom floor resulting in a big mess. The airconditioning and heater system was too loud. I had to turn it off every night, so I could sleep. The breakfast was poor quality and the servers were some-what rude. The bright spot was that the hotel staff was friendly and professional. The location is useful if you want to stay near Chinatown or Soho. Overall, it was an okay stay but not fantastic.

If you are a tourist, pick a Midtown hotel and hang out in Time Square with the rest of your ilk.On the other hand, if you are a traveler (you know who you are), this is a fantastic choice for Manhattan. This is probably not the best hotel location-wise for the first time NYC visitor, but it is a wonderful choice for the seasoned Big Apple traveler. The hotel must be nearly new -- the rooms are spotless and modern with a nice flat screen TV, strong (and free) wireless Internet service and a hip little bar in the lobby.I really liked the location in the heart of Chinatown. The neighborhood is really interesting and vibrant. There are a few really great, cheap Chinese restaurants nearby, as you can imagine. Little Italy is a few blocks away. I also walked to the East Village and had a great meal.Subways are close, though not right next to the hotel. The nearest line is a few blocks away. The noise from the busy street could be a problem for some. We had a room on the 6th floor and the street noise was evident, but it didn't bother me much. If you think it will bother you, ask for a higher floor, which will give you even better views of the Chrysler Building, by the way.The staff was friendly and very helpful.The ONLY reason I did not give this a five star rating was a party that was happening next door on the last night of my three-night stay (a "guys" weekend in Manhattan with my 16-year-old son). Though it is not the hotel's fault that some idiots decided to use their room as a party location, the reaction to the fest could have been handled better. I called down once at 1:45 a.m. to complain about the noise. I had to call down again at 4 a.m. Needless to say, I didn't get much sleep that night. When I gently explained to the staff that I wasn't happy about the party when I checked out, they comped my breakfast.Yes, breakfast is included and as others have said, it is not much, but you can use the $10 value toward credit for the much, much better options on the menu, most of which are $15. I had the three-egg breakfast and it was excellent.I really like this hotel and will definitely stay here again, despite one sleepless night.
Staff did a great job. They were very helpful. They were extremely welcoming and made the whole family feel special.

Great hotel concerning location. Breakfast wasn't anything to write home about, but hey, it was free and that's not easy to find in Manhattan. The staff was friendly, but when I was forced to pay extra for a room with a balconey (since Expedia ran out of standard rooms) I was not pleased to learn that the door to the balconey was broken and the staff did not offer to upgrade me. Not sure whether this is an Expedia issue, or a Wyndham issue. Either way, not cool.

I've lived in New York City for almost 6 years now. Recently, I needed to find a last-minute hotel with my girlfriend for a mid-week stay and decided on the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for its proximity to work. I have to say, the experience was a delight! Nadia and Janice took our reservation without hesitation and put us in a room that re-defined "room with a view". The sight lines of midtown are breathtaking and the amenities top-notch. Woke up rested and ready to go. Will not hesitate to book again!

We were after a downtown location near subways but also good for walking around and soaking up some of Manhattan's vibrancy. This hotel was perfect for that. The rooms were spotless and newly furnished. We had a hhandicapped access room and can't judge space in other rooms. But ours was certainly roomy. And we also landed a room with a big, shared balcony featuring views to the north and west. The two bars onsite looked inviting but we didn't hit them. Ditto the basement restaurant, save for our breakfasts. We'd definitely return if the prices and discounts stay where they are.

The view from our very nice designed brand-new room in the 12th floor was extraordinary, more than we've expected, but your friendly staff was the real "icing on the cake".We got a warm welcome at our arrival after a long and exhausting flight. Especially I want to point out Hamza and Janice who made us feel like friends from the very beginning of our stay.The room was nice, the bed comfortable for two persons. free wifi, refridgerator and safe in room. location directly in chinatown, with subwaystations not far away. cleaning personal was very polite and commited. Breakfast routine could be improved but it was ok. i think your breakfast-staff only needs more experience (the restaurant manager was very polite and professional).we met your doorman massy only on our last day, but he seems to be a really nice guy. Summing up, very nice hotel with a superb location with an outstanding staff. i will recommend it to my friends and family.

Not a good place for a car. Valet parking only aaround $55. No other apparent choice for parking. Room quite small, even though I was in the Executive Suite (?). Remodeling of existing building had to conform with room size. Location is excellent, but again, no parking. Staff seem sharp, and guide you to a seamless stay

I recently stayed at the Wydham Garden in Chinatown with my mom, my mother-in-law and my sis-in-law. We had an amazing time, and the hotel, its staff and the location were a huge part of it. Granted, we are all related, but the rooms were spacious enough that we did not mind sharing our (2) queen-sized beds (we had two separate rooms.) Initially my mom and I were given a corner room on the 16th floor that was super tiny, but after addressing the size issue with the front desk, they gave us a bigger room on the other side of our accompanying party. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was super chic (I love the sink's wall-mounted faucet!) We had no issue, as others have mentioned, with the shower leaking on the floor. Maybe they didn't put the liner inside the tub??? My only complaint with the room is that we were in a room with a balcony that had no access to the balcony. Stinks, but it was February and snowing, so we really didn't miss out on the outdoor experience. The views from the upper-level rooms are amazing! The breakfast was excellent! We all opted to upgrade our continental breakfast to something more substantial. It was great to have that option. For an extra $5 you can have a hearty, egg breakfast with bacon and potatoes. Omelets, frittatas... Table service was very attentive, too.The hotel bar was a lot of fun. We met up with my husband's brother and his brother's wife for dinner in Little Italy. After dinner we all decided to have a drink at the hotel bar. The service was impeccable and the drinks were great. The feature that really sets this hotel apart from its competition is its staff. Everyone who works here really has a sense of ownership in the company. It feels more like a boutique hotel than a "branded" hotel. Hamza, the manager, went above and beyond to ensure we felt welcome in his "home". He, personally, made sure we knew exactly where we were going before we walked out the door. He mapped out our subway directions impeccably, such that we had full confidence in our adventures. I will definitely stay at the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown the next time I head in to the city. I can't recommend it highly enough!

Positives: Hotel is nestledin the back of old Chinatown, within a few hundred feet from the Manhattan bridge and Canal street. Close to shops, restaurants and public transportation. Staff were very friendly and interested in providing good service.Negatives: No onsite parking. Parking rates high.In spite of that its a very clean hotel and the price offered was good. Would return for another stay.

For experienced NYC visitors, I wanted the best extended stay spot with the easiest access to friends and fun neighborhoods. This was the by far the best deal and exceeded expectations.We had a week planned with no kid so were actually going to spend some time in the hotel. This place was great in terms of space, cleanliness and working amenities. It was great to have a fully functional gym and our room was decent sized. I originally looked at all these trendy spots in trendy deal sites. When it got down to it, the reviews were crappy (models don't like to clean) and the prices were on par with standard hotel deals. I started looking directly at chains and we landed a great deal here that would have been a no-brainer if we ever used the free parking and free breakfast!The facility is months old, everything works. The management and staff are very nice and helpful. Lastly on location, it is central to LES, Little Italy, Village and all the downtown areas. Subways are super close to go uptown. We did not want to stay anywhere near Times Sq or the midtown hotels so it was great for us. Would go back in a second.

PROSClean modern hotelGood locationCONSCustomer service stinks. Wyndham Garden local hotel staff lack customer service. Huge disconnects across Wyndham Garden local hotel staff, Wyndham Central Reservations, and Wyndham Customer Care.I booked a one night stay using a Travelzoo special 125/night. There was an error in the arrival date which required me to wait in the hotel lobby over two hours for a resolution, 45 minutes in the morning, then 90 minutes in the afternoon. Each employee wanted to blame another person and not try to actually fix the problem. They even said that "Wyndham made this error." Wait, aren't you Wyndham?!?! They kept trying to separate themselves from the mistake and not be accountable for it. Though I had booked a 2-double bed room, we four adults were crammed into a single bed room with pullout couch. We were not compensated for the downgraded room, and we were not compensated for the 2+ hour wait it took them to resolve the issue. Oh wait, we got a free breakfast, which amounted to a bowl of oatmeal and coffee. After I had already checked out, a local hotel staff employee emailed me to offer discounted rates, free upgrades or complimentary meals or drinks at a future visit. Too little too late. I will never stay at a Wyndham again. Details below.On Feb 14, I emailed Reservations@wyndham.com, "May I request a higher floor room for this Sat night 2/16?" I received an email from Lyrita at Internet.CustomerService@wyn.com stating, "I contacted Janice at the hotel and she did note on your reservation you request for a higher floor."On Feb 16, I arrived to the hotel early at 11am to check in my luggage. John informed me that I had changed my reservation from Feb 16 to Feb 14 and was a no-show. I did not change my arrival date. It seems that Lyrita at Central Reservations or Janice at the local hotel made an error and changed my arrival date when I simply requested a higher floor. John personally promised me that everything would be sorted out by 3pm check-in time. I returned at 4:30pm, John was gone, and I discovered that the issue was still not resolved. I was told that I needed to call Wyndham Customer Care for a new hotel assignment since Wyndham Garden was fully booked. By 6pm, another employee Janice finally checked me into Wyndham Garden because she was not able to get through to Wyndham Customer Care. We were not compensated for the downgraded room, and we were not compensated for the 2+ hour wait it took them to resolve the issue. The overall customer experience was a zero out of five.

We live in Queens but wanted a quick getaway from daily life, so we spent two nights here. Our experience was excellent--great room, amazing view (16th floor) and helpful staff. Everything was clean and modern, and dinner and breakfast were very good. We'd definitely do it all again!

When i got to New York i was so tired from my flight from LA, The staff must have noticed this and were pleasent as could be! My check in was painless and quick and the view from my room was just amazing! Clean room and nice for the price.

We stayed overnight for Valentines weekend.The location was the furthest downtown we have stayed. We were 3 minutes away from Little Italy and Canal St.The hotel is a few months old, it had tasteful decor and was very clean.Our room was the largest we have had in Manhattan for many years. We had a nice living room area.Also a nice view of Bowery Street and the action.The bathroom was clean and trendy with ample towels. The shower was nice.The city never slows down, so we did hear traffic noise throughout the night.The bed was a comfortable King Size and we had a nice rest.The front desk staff,Hamza and Janice were very friendly and incredibly helpful to satisfy any needs.The gym was super with 2 great treadmills and other equipment.I did not get the continental breakfast but it looked decent.I parked 4 blocks away because it was 25% cheaper than the valet service.I would definitively recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay downtown.The price, service and cleanliness are at a higher level than many NYC hotels.

Great Staff, New Hotel, Clean, the right price.. We couldn't have asked for more. We took a red-eye flight and were extremely exhausted when we arrived at the hotel. Therefore, we were ecstatic and relieved when Vanessa at the front desk got us an early check in.. A little sleep and NYC was at our fingertips with the subway just a short walk away.. All of the staff was helpful and extremely gracious. I believe Halza was the bell hop and he was always greeting us with a smile and trying to help us in any way possible. The restaurants food was great for breakfast but lunch was a little interesting.. Adding a little asian flare to a club chicken sandwich??? Not necessary. Should have probably went with the sushi.. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and highly recommend this hotel..

This location is stunning: 5 minutes walk to Nolita and amazing shops and restaurants. Staff was great and rooms were perfect size and well equipped. Even the breakfast was lovely... Warm pastries + fruit and coffee until 11:00!! Yay, finally a hotel that understands not everyone gets up at the crack of dawn.

Firstly, you get what you pay for. Guaranteed low price from travel sites means a room on a low floor, right across from the elevator. Wake-up call did not work, missed my first appointment. Bathroom is chic, but not thought out well when it comes to functionality. Shower leaks onto the floor, tiles were already loose and the property is barely 4 months old. Towels are under the sink, practically on the floor. Unless you are a gymnast in your early 20s, your lower back will thank you when you book elsewhere. Breakfast was overpriced and "blah", even when they give you credit for your free continental breakfast coupon. The automated concierge featured over-priced theater tickets and airport shuttles. You can find much better deals on your own. I found the whole experience cold and impersonal. Id you do decide to book your airport transportation via this method, make sure you do so more than 24 hours ahead of time otherwise you are out of luck.

Excellent Hotel. Just for being brand new deserves one more star. In NYC a totally new hotel is a real plus. What is available is many rebuilt hotels which is a complete different situation mainly in what concerns availability of efficient WIFI. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and competent. It is located in the China Town / Lolita area very close to the subway which provides easy access to the rest of Manhattan. It is next door to Little Italy and Soho where many trendy and well known restaurants/cafes are also located.

Good value for money. Our room was spacious with great decor.Lobby was nice and service was welcoming. But location was ok not in Manhattan. We had to pay for parking which was not acceptable. But overall it was a great stay

We stayed here for our anniversary and had a great time. It was quiet and well put together.I did not care for the shower design. When taking a shower the water runs out of the shower and onto the tile in the bathroom.

I am a New Yorker, temporarily living in New Jersey, and needed a place close to Delancey Street to crash after a big birthday party (no drinking and driving here!) This was the perfect choice.It is a brand-new hotel, so everything was pristine. The lobby was nice and bright, the concierge was smiling and welcoming. The continental breakfast was sufficient, 3 pastries and a bowl of fruit. I had the queen suite for $229, and it was a god value.The negatives: 1.No king-size beds. My husband is 6'5" and a queen is simply too small for him to get a good night's sleep.2.There is no hook in the bathroom to hang your towel. The only hook is where the robes are hanging, and that's as far away from the shower stall as you can get. Bad planning for something so simple.3.Auto wake up service didn't work.4.No ice makers on the floor. You have to go to the bar in the lobby (if they're open).5.$54/day for valet parking. This should be posted somewhere on the website (if it is, I didn't see it).6.When I called the hotel to ask about king-sized beds, they automatically transferred me to Central Reservations, where I spoke with a person who didn't have a clue about the hotel & took forever to get anything done. I was on the phone at least 1/2 hour trying make a reservation. I finally got him to disclose that he was in the Philippines! When he went to process the reservation, he received an "error", and wanted to start all over. I gave up and went online. Never again, never again, never again...I would have given 4-stars if I hadn't had such a bad experience on the telephone. Kinda ruined my day.

Great value for your money! Brand new hotel, spacious rooms for NYC standards! Breakfast could be better for 10 usd, I always upgraded for something else paying an extra 5usd... The only con is the location. I like chinatown for a day visit, not as my main hub in manhattan!

I travel to NYC alot for business and pleasure and stay all over Manhattan. On this occasion the booking was made by my colleague so I was a bit anxious when she told me where we were staying the only plus was I love downtown but…. Bowery!!?? I wasn’t too sure…. even on a recent stay at the James I felt it was a bit too downtown…..I can now say location was great, what a wonderful atmosphere and close to great bars, restaurants and one of a kind shopping, it is very easy to get about with plenty of taxis buzzing about who stop....... unlike trying to hail in midtown!The hotel is spotless and very comfortable with no noise problems. Shower temp and power was excellent and towels were great quality. Beds were very comfortable and a great night sleep was had!The most special part of our stay and a very important reason why I have booked my next stay there and will continue to return when staying in NYC are the staff. They are a credit to the hotel. It is very hard to find a hotel with staff like they have…. Amazing! Nothing was too much trouble and every request was fulfilled quickly…. v refreshing in NYC. I am now ashamed to say that I was not expecting much from this hotel before I arrived. I was very wrong it is one of the best I have stayed at in NYC.I have a half work, half pleasure trip to NYC next month for 12 nights and I have booked to stay again with my husband, mother and baby. That is a first for me to return to the same hotel!! After my good reports we are all very excited about our stay and trip to NYC. Well done Wyndham Chinatown for a job very well done. Since my stay I have recommended this hotel to everyone I know travelling to NYC ☺

The building is practically new and immaculate. The bathrooms, in particular, are well designed. It was only $140 including a continental breakfast. My room was on the 6th floor and faced the street (Bowery), but the street noise was minimal and I couldn't hear anything from the other rooms at all. The room was somewhat small with a queen bed. It would be fine for 1 or 2 people.

I was lucky enough to stay here for a weekend at the beginning of February. Check-in..... this was a bit of a pain, however that was nothing to do with the staff, it was to do with the company I work for making some booking errors. Staff helped as much as they could, and to compensate they upgraded my room to a suite on the 6th floor. They didn't have to do that, but I think they realised I was pretty miffed at the problems that my office had created.Room..... well I was in a suite, and it was lovely. A great size, floor to ceiling windows, separate sitting area and office space, as well as a table and high stools to look out on the view, which admittedly wasn't fantastic, but the bustling streets below were great for people watching! The only negative thing about the room was the very loud air-con. Even on the lowest fan setting it was still very noisy and I did turn it off overnight. FREE WIFI was a great plus!Food.... I ordered room service on my first night and the food was delicious, even it if was a bit of a wait (about 40 minutes), but it was worth it. There was a breakfast included in the price for the stay, but it was a very limited menu, predominantly continental style and not very filling, but there are loads of places around the hotel where a cheap and filling breakfast can be had.Location.... I love Chinatown, so close to trendy stores, great bars and eateries, as well as sight seeing must-do's like 9/11 memorial, Wall Street and Little Italy, great location. You are only ever a short walk or cab ride from everywhere really.I really do recommend this hotel, and apart from the breakfast, it was spot on and I would definitely stay here again!

I travel to NY regularly for business and I've stayed at multiple hotels in the city. Wyndham Garden Chinatown is the best hotel experience of them all, by far. The hotel is brand new, the staff are all excellent, (I had interactions with everyone from front desk, to bartender, to restaurant manager and servers, concierge, and housekeeping). The room was fantastic, even better with the high floor and view I requested. I told all my friends in the city to send their friends/family there when they visit, and I will be back everytime I am in NYC.The only MINOR issues I found are with the shower - while aesthetically very nice, the glass wall/partition thing doesnt extend far enough out to prevent water from spraying on the floor, and where the partition joins the wall tiling it is not sealed with caulk, so water leaks out there as well. In addition, there are no towel hooks or anything else to hang your towel on within reach of the shower.Other than that, everything was phenomenal and I look forward to staying again.

I reserved this hotel through Expedia, at first I was hesitant about it, read a lot of good review about it&the fact that it was right with my budget helped me make up my mind. Im so happy I did book the hotel, what a charming, clean and beautifully decorated rooms, bathrooms and lobby.I truly was surprised since the rate was low I did not expect to find such superb and clean room!! I am a OCD and I inspected everything even under the duster on the bottom of the bed and everywhere in the room was just perfectly clean, the bathroom is so beautiful and has such a Zen feeling. We were there only one night since I was treating my son to Mumford and Sons concert along with couple days in NYC. for his 16th Birthday. When we arrived at the hotel We were greeted by Kim Sparks and she was very professional and at the same time friendly and courteous, She answered all my questions and recommended where to go to eat, an excellent choice, she also gave us directions as how to get to the concert site. After the concert when we returned to our room We found a gift box of nuts and chocolate in the room that was left along with a card addressed to my son for his Birthday from His Wyndham Family and Vanessa, Kim Sparks and Roshuka! Thank you ladies for making my son feel so special! We wish we could have stayed there longer but had to return to Los Angeles, I want to thank the hotel staff for what amazing job they're doing and again thank you Vanessa, Kim and Roshuka . We will definitely return to stay there and I will recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York City... You truly have a Hotel with a Heart in NYC...:)

This hotel was booked for a group of us by our client, so we weren't sure what to expect. However, we were pleasantly surprised - the hotel is very new and modern, the staff was extremely friendly and professional and the rooms were very sizeable (ask for a corner suite - mine was 503). The food for room service was delicious, as was the food as the restaurant downstairs. Also, Chinatown is right between SoHo and Lower East Side, so great restaurants/shopping were a 5-10 minute walk away. The only downside is that the hotel is on a busy intersection, so you can hear trucks, traffic and lots of honking throughout the night. However, you might be better off if you request a room higher up, like on the 15th floor. The rates were extremely reasonable ($130 for weekdays, $160 for weekends). All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here the next time I'm in NYC.
