The draw of this hotel was that the price was significantly less than comparable hotels in the Wall St./WTC area. It was a bargain, and highly recommended. I would stay again.Pros: New construction opened in late 2012. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. The rooms and public areas are clean and modern. An example - by my early morning departure, the front steps and sidewalk had already been scrubbed – you could have eaten directly off the steps. The lighting in the room was excellent. The pillows weren’t the rigid foam block style. And there is an actual, working thermostat on the wall. The street noise (from the 11th floor) was significantly less than hotels in midtown NYC. No noise from adjacent rooms. The work desk is large, with lots of power receptacles and an ergonomic chair.Cons: My room was small, with a double bed; but there was an ok amount of space around the bed, desk and entry. OK for one, probably two, with a couple of pieces of luggage. The breakfast restaurant is in the basement – low ceiling and no windows. The included breakfast is Spartan – but you get what you pay for. Given the location, taxis are somewhat minimal, especially at rush hours. The subways are four to six blocks away.

We were on the 15th floor in a corner queen-bed room. Both the view and the price were outstanding, not to mention the proximity to the Chinatown, Little Italy, Alphabet City and the 4,5,6 uptown trains. Just an awesome stay all around.

I stayed in two hotels in Manhattan. The first I stayed in was in mid-town which is obviously a great location and I paid exactly the same amount as I did for this hotel per night but it was crap compared to it. The Wyndham honestly came close to a 5 star... at least in terms of the room. It was an amazing room with a tv, fridge, super comfy bed, insanely clean and a really nice big bathroom with a walk-in shower etc! The aircon/heating was really good and then to top it off the staff were by far the friendliest people I met in hotels. Sure the location is a bit further away than you might like but to be honest Manhattan isn't that big and I walked everywhere anyway and a cab to like Times Square for example was only $10 and you'd have to pay a whole lot more than that per night for the same class of hotel in mid-town. Statue of Liberty port and Ground Zero Memorial are super close to this hotel too!But yeah I'd say stay here purely for the luxury value! You really get your money's worth! Nothing bad to say about it to be honest and I'm pretty fussy!

This brand new gleaming hotel stands out in every positive way! From the lobby to the restaurant to the guest rooms, everything is handsome, elegant, clean, neat, comfortable, stylish, wonderful! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is a full meal with drinks - not the typical continental breakfast. The floor-to-ceiling windows in the lobby and the rooms provide brightness and great views! The beds were so comfortable! The hotel is an easy walk to the subway, bus lines, and visitor attractions like the World Trade Center. And to top it all off -- the prices were incredibly reasonable -- the best value we could find! Room Tip: Corner rooms have two-sided floor-to-ceiling windows. Amazing, "million dollar" views!

I would like to say that I have very much enjoyed my stay @ Wyndham Garden Chinatown. I would like to address the employees that made huge difference in making this stay memorable and would allow me to become a repeat customer to this great hotel in NYC. Kim: She went well out of her way to make our stay enjoyable and stress free. Let me tell you that I had ordered a few packages from an online retailer that stated the packages should arrive on the given days we had stayed at the hotel. However, the carrier that was used scanned the product at the wrong time making me believe it was already delivered at the Hotel. Kim noticed that I called to check on this item. She said it did not arrive and I was worried that it was just left without any communication. Kim went out of her way and called the carried to assure them that nothing was left @ Front Desk. The carrier reiterated that the package was dropped as per last communication. Kim then opened an escalation ticket with the carrier to have this properly investigated. During our time there we did run into minor problems with boiler room heat and toilette water (discolored). All this was taken care of by Kim through her resources. Kim is a great asset to this company and I hope to meet more people in the service/hospitality industry with similar traits to her. Nadia: She is a very pleasant woman that was eager to help out by any means while we had this issue with the packages. She was always willing to help out when we had any issues with our stay and was very pleasant to speak to. Massy: He is a very comforting man to speak to you about NYC. He gave us proper and safe directions to our destinations and advised us of our options while travelling throughout the day and the night. He is very knowledgeable about the surroundings of NYC. We enjoyed our talks on the daily basis and was always looking for him before each day when we depart from the hotel and return. Janice: We mostly saw Janice in our evening hours of the Hotel. She was very accomodating with all of our requests and was sympathetic to our incident with the packages that were suppose to receive. She said that Kim is on it and I am sure everythinig will be resolved shortly. I do recall that on our last nigth I wanted to get hot chocolate and she spoke to the lower café to see if they would serve it but unfortunately they didn't. She recommended that there was a Dunkin Donut nearby and it will have Hot Chocolate. Due to the time frame of 11pm , I had walked over to find it was closed. I thanked Janice for letting me know all the available options. She complimented on my Wife's ring and that showed a sense of care. Its these little things that help make a trip go over the top. "The Kid": Sorry, I forgot your name. He was very eager to help out and I provided him with some good advice about school. I told him that having a second language which he did, opens alot of doors for him to propser. I wished him good luck in his studies. John: I didn't meet you and I am very greatful that you allowed us to stay in Room "1202". It was a beautiful view and my wife enjoyed it very much. Cafeteria: The staff was prompt, structured and offered our options with a great smile on their face. Eventhough, it was free contintental breakfast with our package we never felt second rated when ordering. I would like say "Thank You" to all of the staff @ Wyndham Garden Chinatown for an enjoyable stay. We would be glad to come back to your place. It was unfortunate thought that the prices I got for the hotel stay were through a 3rd party vendor. Although, I went through a 3rd party, you had never made me feel that way. I highly recommend this Hotel to all of you that want the best of both worlds while staying in NYC. Also, the rooms do have an electronic Safe and a mini-fridge. The value that I got was : Free Wifi + Free Continental Breakfast + Free Smiles

I stayed here for one night in January. Everything was perfect-from the easy check in to the perfect location to the beautiful room. I have been telling everyone how great the hotel is. I love the small relaxing bar in the back of the lobby and the views from the floor to ceiling windows in the room were unbelievable. The value was excellent too. As long as the prices stay reasonable I will stay here everytime I come to New York City!

This brand new gleaming hotel stands out in every positive way! From the lobby to the restaurant to the guest rooms, everything is handsome, elegant, clean, neat, comfortable, stylish, wonderful! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is a full meal with drinks - not the typical continental breakfast. The floor-to-ceiling windows in the lobby and the rooms provide brightness and great views! The beds were so comfortable! The hotel is an easy walk to the subway, bus lines, and visitor attractions like the World Trade Center. And to top it all off -- the prices were incredibly reasonable -- the best value we could find!

My husband & I just got back from our overnight stay at Wyndham Garden Chinatown & were extremely pleased! We went for a overnight to NYC to celebrate his birthday :) When we arrived we were pleasantly greeted by Hamza. Hamza went out of his way to make sure that our car was parked safely and that we had everything we needed to make our stay perfect. The staff was all very friendly. The hotel was immaculate and the views were spectacular! We checked in & out with ease... The complimentary breakfast at Elevante restaurant was good too!! We will definitely be back!!!

I have been travelling my whole life and have been all over the world. I currently travel about 4 days per week for business. The Wyndham in Chinatown offered me the best service I have ever had. I am not going to share all of the details, simply because I don't want people to take advantage of their staff, but I will say that they went well above and beyond for me. I was dissatisfied with the shower in my room. The shower is beautifully done, but when I bathed, water got everywhere (the floor had about 1 inch of standing water on it all around when I was done). I mentioned this to management, who stated they were aware of the design flaw and are more than happy to dry the floor. Then they offered to change my room, which I graciously accepted. Shortly after moving rooms the staff arrived at my door with a box of chocolates and a personal apology card. This was a nice, personal touch that made a huge impression on me. This was just the beginning of their extraordinary hospitality. The staff remembered my name and face and greeted me like a friend every morning when I left for work. This hotel is not my go to place when in NYC for business and I would recommend this to anyone. Also, the area is great (I am a young woman travelling alone) and had no problem walking in Chinatown alone at night. It also has great access to all subway lines. In addition to great service, the hotel is clean, modern and comfortable. It is not overly expensive and is definitely worth every penny.Thank you to the Wyndham Chinatown. You guys made my day.

Stayed here last night, and I have to say this is one of the best places I've ever stayed at in New York. I asked for a room with a great view and they delivered! Beautiful view of the uptown skyline, very rare without paying lots of $$$$$. Location was perfect, a 2 minute walk to the nearest subway and 5 minute ride to the village. Friendly staff, very clean room, quiet at night. I would definitely stay here again!

We spent 2 nights here at the end of December for a girls NYC trip. Beautiful new hotel in heart of Chinatown, a couple of blocks from Little Italy and subway. Room was immaculate, comfortable and quiet. Staff was friendly and helpful. We felt completely safe and secure at all times. The morning breakfast was delicious and the voucher could be used toward other menu items. All in all, a wonderful stay and excellent value. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to others. Thanks very much.

First time in New York was made a memorable trip by this hotel. Booked this as it was closest hotel to our friends hotel who had already booked but would stay ago. Stones throw from Little Italy and soho. I recommend brink keys for the burgers! The room was clean, tidy and spacious compared to our friends hotel around the corner. Bathroom was bright and new towels given everyday. Floor to ceiling windows and on New Years Eve there were the most amazing views of the skyline! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The staff behind the bar were fab, cheery and helped me try a lovely pink vodka! Breakfast is included but its basic but an added bonus apparently in an NYC hotel

What an excellent hotel. A great value!We were on the 16th floor and had a great view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler.The room was super clean and the staff were super nice.My daughter lives in Brooklyn and it was about a 15 min subway ride to her place.We loved the location...it's so close to our favorite places and subways.My daughter and I share the same birthday and had a wonderful time!Can't say enough about the staff.....they were the best!Looking forward to my next visit!Thank you for a wonderful birthday celebration that will be hard to top!

Very impressive. Room was comfortable and bright. Able to use Kindle and computer wireless. Arrived before check in time but staff was able to accommodate anyway. Only complaint is lack of in and out parking privileges.

This hotel got it all - fabulous views of Midtown and Downtown through floor to ceiling windows, free wifi,huge rooms (for New York), even a balcony on the 15th floor and some of the nicest staff you're going to meet at a hotel. The lovely Vanessa checked me in, and every other person I contacted was courteous and friendly without being cloying, too. The view was one of the best I've had anywhere - I could see the Empire State and Chrysler from my bed. Very minor quibbles: the shower wasn't as hot as I would have like, but was perfectly acceptable. The (free!) breakfast as others have said was a little on the sparse side (then again, you can't really mess up porridge). And the Chinatown location could deter some people (though it's really close to the subway stations, it's not the location you want if you're a first timer and want to experience Midtown). For me, the location between Lower East Side and Chinatown and close to East Village was great.

We stayed in a room in the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is well located near to 3 subway stations (from 5 to 10 minutes walking). It is in the middle of Chinatown and just a few steps from Little Italy, making it very easy to find somewhere to dine. The hotel was very new and the room was nice and spacious. I only regret not having insisted more on the floor, as we were on the 4th and couldn't enjoy the great sights some people have commented.The staff was very helpful and we were asking questions for maybe 10 minutes, they never lost their smile and patience. The thing we didn't like too much was the breakfast. It is not that it was bad, but it was a bit too scarce for the price it was supposed to be. However, we also have to be thankful that they let us have the breakfast even though we arrived after 11am.If we go back to NY, we would probably chose Wyndham Garden Chinatown again, it's convenient and has a good value for money. :)

I stayed here for 3 Nights in January 2013 and this was my best NYC hotel experience so far. It's located on the edges of Chinatown and Little Italy and very close to Soho shopping. I chose this hotel because my favorite neighborhoods in NY are the Lower East Side, East Village and Soho. If you need to go uptown, you can easily take the Green 6 line on Canal Street (no transfers required if you don't walking a few blocks). I stayed on the 15th floor and had a wonderful view. The size of the rooms was good compared to other NY hotels I've stayed at. The staff always had a smile on their face and were very friendly, one them tried to convince me to move to NY when I mentioned how I loved the city and was a bit sad bout going back home.I would definitely stay here again.

I LOVE Chinatown, and have stayed at a Chinatown hotel before. Wyndham exceeded our expectations, and I was very happy to bring my family to stay in Chinatown once again. So clean, and very friendly staff, and located by several metro lines. We arrived at 10am and they had our room ready, and we were able to leave our bags until our 9pm flight. Breakfast isn't so great, at least not the complimentary one. However the restaurant is very nice, sleek and clean. Bedrooms aren't too big, but they sure are clean, as are the bathrooms. We felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night, and so much culture every step! Definitely recommend this hotel.

I loved the staff and the hotel. The room was small but clean and had a great view and comfy bed. The free breakfast however was a joke. I got some dry toast, old soggy fruit and a bowl of something that was supposed to be oatmeal. I was very disappointed considering everything else was top notch. Also we were supposed to get WIFI in the rooms. Mine was not working and I called the front desk. They were going to call the service providers but I never heard from anyone. I ended up using my personal hotspot on my phone to log into work.

This is a nice hotel for all those who want to explore the lower manhattan that includes chinatown, little italy, soho, world trade centers etc. Every room has floor to ceiling glass that gives you amazing views of downtown manhattan. Breakfast is included which is good. Look out for some offers and you could end up staying at this place for just under $150 per night like i did just a week ago.Hotel staff was excellent in attending to our needs.

Wow. Just wow. This hotel is incredible. A sparkling gem in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Chinatown. Our whole experience was maybe one of the best I've had at a hotel. We got to the hotel early and Vanessa at the front desk let us check in early AND hooked us up with a fabulous corner room on the 8th floor with views of the Chrysler Tower and Freedom Tower. The room was small, but very clean. Our shower did not have a door on it, which I found to be annoying because water was getting all over the floor, but hey, whatever. I've recommended this hotel to anyone who has been to the city before and wants to stay downtown. It's definitely not for newbies to the city or anyone faint of heart -- it's in Chinatown, but we love that whole area so not a problem here. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit to the city.

I really didn't know what to expect when booking my trip at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown, but I was definitely blown away. From the moment I walked into the lobby I was greeted by the friendly reservationists. They were welcoming and down to earth. I was very nervous that the pictures on the website and tripadvisor would be far better than what I would receive upon my arrival, but as I entered the room I immediately said to myself "this is exactly what I was looking for". My goodness the view is breathtaking. I could see not only manhattan but also part of long island city crystal clear from the room. I absolutely loved the cleanliness, the bathroom, and oh man the bed , the bed, the bed. The floor to ceiling windows really make the room. Now on the downside the entrance onto the balcony was locked, so I was unable to enjoy my room even more, but that definitely will not stop me from returning to the Wyndham. I really cant think of anything else to say other than my trip was amazing. I definitely recommend staying at the Wyndham and will definitely be returning soon.

I had an excellent experience staying here during a holiday weekend getaway. The room was small but new, well decorated, and clean, with a large window for a pretty typical NY street view. The location was great, steps from delicious Chinatown, Soho, close to the subway, walking distance to much of lower Manhattan. Bed was on the slightly firm side and just right for my taste. Room was quiet at night.Minor gripes: 1. We were away from the room from 11 am - 3 pm during the day, and housekeeping had not shown up to clean the room when we returned. 2. Breakfast service was slow, with several groups of guests waiting in the dining room to redeem the complimentary breakfast. We chose not to stay for breakfast and you won't want to either, with so much good food nearby.Overall an excellent experience.

this exactly what i was looking fr service a clean room and a nice view.this hotel is close to barclays center one stop away, restaurants in little italy steps away and the best value that i get in this hotel

This hotel opened just a few months before our trip so everything was new as one would expect. The layout and design was pleasant. The bar and restaurant were both convenient and well staffed. Being in the middle of Chinatown restaurants were all around but the surprise was that it was two blocks from Mulberry St. Better known as "Little Italy". It was between the Subway stop and the hotel and a great place to stop at the end of a day for coffee and cake. I had a balcony view to the north and the midtown night scape, It was beautiful. The staff was always helpful and the price was great ! I will stay here again.

This is a new hotel, and the decorations and the amenities reflected that. The staff was friendly, and the location was convenient (right off Manhattan Bridge, Chinatown and Little Italy). The room was large for Manhattan, and the ceiling to floor window/wall offered great views. We also got complimentary WiFi and continental breakfast.My only main gripe was the shower design. It was not a tub, and had no door (only half of the shower area was separated by glass). This seemed to be a common design for a lot of new hotels, and it is a terrible design. There was also no ice machine, and I had to get the ice from the bar (seemed like there was space allocated for the machines, but they have not been put in).Overall, this is a nice hotel in a convenient location to really experience the different sides of New York, and we had an enjoyable experience.

Here is what's cool about it.[1] It's NEW. New rooms, free wifi on ALL floors, new rugs, showers, lobby, etc.[2] service: excellent[3] location: i think it's BETTER than those Times Square centrally located hotels. Why you may ask? Look at the NYC subway system. Except for possibly EWR, both JFK and LGA have easier transfers than getting on the Red-1,2,3.[4] location: it's in Chinatown!! Food is AWESOME and CHEAP! I'm talking Vanessa's Dumplings, for $1 you get 4 dumplings, or the dim sum? or Great NY Noodle House which virtually doesn't close??I'd go back again! It's also walking distance to Little Italy, so you can get your gelato cravings as well. Closest train station is Grand St. =)very safe. feel free to walk around at night. all tourists do. =P

My husband and I just got back from NYC. We stayed at Wyndham after seeing special thru Travel Zoo. Really nice new hotel and loved the floor to ceiling windows. This really made the room seem much bigger. Had breakfast in hotel. Voucher good for continental breakfast or $10 off another breakfast. This was a great way to start the day. Also saw their restaurant on Restaurant.com. . Close to both China Town and Little Italy. Very close to B-D subway line that goes right to Times Square.

Have stayed all over NYC. Depending on your purpose each area is different in relation to how good your hotel is. We have stayed at "The Hudson" ....very hip...not so comfortable but very cool. Location to Central Park can't be beat. Mid Town..."The Maritime" is our favorite...SUPER comfy beds and a good, off the beaten track location. Go a bit south and with a hefty budget..."The Bowery" is the ultimate! This time we stayed further south..."The Wyndham Garden Chinatown" is really the best deal going. The staff was so courteous and attentive that it was pretty much unbelievable. The view from our room (1605)....FAB!!! So if you are coming to NYC to see all there is to see....stay near Times Square for it's central location. If you want to feel like a rich local then stay around Central Park. If you want comfort and don't mind public transportation or reasonably priced dinners (Little Italy)....Stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for it's great service, fabulous views (we stayed in one night just to watch Pay Per View and keep the curtains open for the NYC View! This is my new Fav and the Taxi to LGA is quick and inexpensive as opposed to the other hotels I mentioned. I will be returning no matter what the purpose of my trip!Thank you to the manager Omar and the Staff of the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for a wonderful stay!!

I can't say enough great things about this hotel: the warm, friendly, helpful staff (Omar, Tom, Nadia, Massy, and others whose names I may not spell correctly, sorry); the spotless room, comfortable bed, great bathroom, and awesome views of Manhattan, especially at night. This was my second stay there and the breakfast has definitely improved a lot. This will now be the only hotel I choose when I come to New York.

Stayed for four nights and couldn't wait to leave.Management are very poor, dealt with front office manager who immediately flicked me to the guest services manager.Who is very condescending and rude ! Looking after guests does not appear to be the right job for them.Was supposed to be in a high floor room but was given a tiny room on 2nd floor that was extremely small and hot.Refused to move me as they were supposedly sold out! People continued to check in all weekend, so obviously that was not true.Free breakfast is a joke, minimal offerings and of bad quality.Area is not good, stinks from the surrounding Chinatown vendors.Housekeeping was good.On checking out was told I would receive better room if I booked with the hotel and paid a higher rate ???Never again!

Since this hotel is brand new, the room was in perfect condition. The deco is simple, tasteful and modern. The location is perfect since it puts me in the middle of Chinatown and I can eat at all my favorite places. I took the Lucky Star bus from Boston to NYC. The bus stop is in the same block as the hotel so I felt completely safe wandering the few steps to the hotel despite the midnight arrival time.Here are some negative factors we encounter. I would mention them in case they help other travelers: 1) When I booked the room, I saw that rollaway bed is available. But when I checked in, I was told that cannot be done in a room with two double beds. Would have been nice if the website clearly mentions that. 2) This hotel charges more for a room with two beds but only give you two vouchers for the continental breakfast. That is a rather odd practice and inconvenient for a family of 4. We gave the restaurant a try. It was way over-priced and the food was below average. Considering the Chinatown location, if the hotel doesn't provide you with enough vouchers, you're better off eating elsewhere.3) The hotel directory suggests there is an ice machine on the 3rd & 5th floor but the hotel is so new; the ice machines have not even been installed. I saw an opening that is not sound proof in the narrow hallway. I hope that's not where the ice machine would go since that would be too noisy. But then again, the hallway is so narrow; I can't see where one would put an ice machine without the noise.4) The bathtub is designed with a very short splash glass, no shower curtain. When you take a shower, the entire bathroom gets quite wet. Remember not to bring your dry clothes in. I also wonder if the hotel could keep mildew from developing on the bathroom tiles since it gets surprisingly wet in there.5) The hotel is located on 93 Bowery Street. One night, I asked the front desk if I should go left or right if I want to head toward 70 Bowery, the two guys at the front desk didn't know. I was surprised. The front desk staff should really know the neighborhood better. Mgmt please give them a map and train them to assist tourist.6) If you are afraid of rats, you will want to use the Bowery Street entrance and avoid taking Christie Street at night. Since we arrived in Chinatown at midnight and took the shortest path from Lucky Star bus stop to the hotel, it means we took Christie Street. At night, NYC has some of the largest rats roaming around. With all the garbage piled on Christie Street, we saw rats as large as a small dog running around. In fact, my kids thought they were cats at first.All in all, the rate at this hotel is reasonable for now, especially for single rooms. I question the double rate since it doesn't provide enough breakfast voucher for a max of 4 participants. I would stay here again if the rate is right because of its location. But next time, I would know its shortcomings and make my decision accordingly.

Great stay, great value. Stayed here for 3 nights on business. I was greeted warmly when I checked in and the staff was extremely professional though out the stay. The room was small but designed efficiently. Everything was new and clean. The hotel is easily accessible from the subway system,

We often go to NYC, and most of the time we stay at the BW Bowery Handbee, one block north of this hotel. We found an irresistible deal on Priceline and decided to take a chance. Very glad we did! The hotel is brand new, and the views of the Manhattan skyline(thanks to the floor to ceiling windows) are a sight to see. Make sure to ask for a room above the 6th floor to be able to enjoy it. The staff were very kind and accomodating.The only gripes are the silly design of the shower(may look nice, but not practical) and the continental breakfast @ Elevate, which ironically, is in the basement! We stayed 3 nights and will definately go back for more.

My trip was fabulous, i was lucky to be in this hotel... staff great you with your name escort you to your beautiful and clean room. you'll have a very good view on the 12th floor Empire state building WOW.

Noticed a stay 3 save 30% offer on this hotels Trip Advisor page.Went to book three rooms, but the system would not allow me to.Called hotel and advised this and was told the offer does not apply to New York City property, when I advised that there is an advertisement on Trip Advisor from Wyndham Garden Chinatown for this offer, I was politely told it was a mistake, they would look into it and then they hung up before I could provide call back details.Very disappointing.

I absolutely loved this hotel. I have stayed at Wyndham properties before, but this one was the best. When I checked in the young lady that greeted me, her name was Vanessa, she was wonderful. Very professional yet kind and ver helpful. Se was quite knowledgable about the area and what it has to offer. I also must make mention of the young lady that helped me book this trip, her name is Katie or Katey. Not too sure how it is spelled. I have already booked my next stay at this location for Chinese New Year 2013. Gung hay fat choy

The staff are the key in this hotel, great experience. The rooms are very clean, my room was ready for me to check in at 7am I left my bags and took advantage of the city I will recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be on the city and far from the Times Square area, who wants a great value. I will comeback and stay here matter of fact this is gonna be my hotel

This is an ok hotel. clean and convieniently located in Chinatown, but I will not recommend this hotel to my friends and I'll not come back here in my future visit to nyc for the following reasons.First, there is only a half door for the shower, and there are no drains in the bathroom. Every time after you take a shower, the bathroom floors will be filled with water and you can't use the bathroom again without getting your feet wet. I called the front desk and was told that it is the same with all guestrooms. I booked a standard room, so I'm not sure whether there will be a tub or at least a shower curtain in their superior rooms.Second, don't expect too much out of their continental breakfast. I got one piece of dry toast, a bowl of yogurt, a cup of fruit and one small cup of OJ using my breakfast coupon($11 if you pay out of pocket). The waitress said I have to pay if I want another cup of OJ. In addition, they are supposed to give me four breakfast coupons for two days of stay, I only got three. When I asked the front desk, a guy named John told me that he definitely gave me four, and he said he called the dinning room, they said three of us ate four breakfast! How ridiculous! One breakfast coupon is no big deal, what it matters is how they treat their customers.

Excellent hotel and had an amazing stay. I was a little skeptical before booking due to the fact that the hotel was located in Chinatown and was concerned about safety. Don't be however as the area was great overall and had many cheap places to eat and shop. The room was extremely clean and quite spacious by New York City standards. At special thanks goes out to Janice and Ahcene in the front desk who were extremely helpful. We ordered a suit online from Macy's however UPS screwed up (should have known better) and the parcel before we checked out. Nevertheless, the front desk staff were incredibly helpful in ensuring that our parcel arrived safetly. Highly recomendded hotel.

My girlfriend and I found out about this hotel through Travelzoo, where they were offering a deal. At first we were a little reluctant to stay in Chinatown because it's not as close to the touristy spots and whatnot, but we are glad that we did. The hotel is in a great location, with public transportation only a short block away that can take you to Midtown, Rockefeller Center, etc. The hotel is right in the heart of Chinatown, so you can explore this neighborhood for shops and restaurants. The area is safe, and we never felt unsafe walking around at night.The hotel itself was very clean and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help us (they lent us an umbrella when it was raining, the housekeeper folded our clothes, we were able to print tickets for free, they gave a free toothbrush and toothpaste when we forgot it, etc.). We did not stay here for business, but this would be a good place to do so, because the desk was very spacious and they offer free wifi. Also, although we were on a low floor, the floor to ceiling windows were great and offered a nice view of the city. The electronic safe in the room was pretty sweet too. The bathroom was kind of small but was adequate. We would have liked a little more counterspace by the sink, but it's not a big deal.We had the free continental breakfast, which was in the hotel's restaurant, once and it wasn't that great. The yogurt and muffin were kind of weird, so we'd recommend you just get the toast and fruit. Or just find one of the many bakeries or restaurants located in the city for breakfast/brunch. A subpar continental breakfast is not really something to complain about... you can't expect a five-course spread for free!Overall, it's a great hotel, and we'd definitely come back!

I was looking for an economical hotel near businesses in the financial district and decided to give Wyndham Garden a try...I'm so glad did. The hotel's staff were courteous and helpful, the hotel was immaculately kept, and room was well appointed, clean, comfortable; all this contributed to making Wyndham Garden an ideal headquarters for my business in the City. The hotel comes complete, with bar, restaurant, and fitness room; WiFi is also available and worked flawlessly. Morning breakfast was tasty and filling, as well as was sushi for dinner; portions were just enough to be filling and provide much needed energy for my busy schedule.Wyndham Garden is ideally located near Chinatown and Little Italy; touring each community and experiencing their eclectic sights, sounds, and aromas made for good times during off-hours. The hotel is located quite close to the B-D, J-Z, 6, and N-Q lines; alternatively also within moderate walking distance to City Hall.

This hotel is great find in Chinatown NY. This hotel is close to public transportation and within walking distance to some great chinese cuisine. Soho is not far.The staff was courteous, efficient and overall kind and nice. They were very accomodation in getting me some documents that i needed printed at no extra cost.The Breakfast (which was included) was great.The room is modern, Clean and quiet.

I stayed 3 nights on business and loved this hotel! Wonderful room, excellent service, great breakfast, wonderful staff and beautiful view. Located in Chinatown but a block from Little Italy. Agreat location (Canal & Bowery, just off the Manhattan Bridge) with two subway stations within a short walk. Clean, fresh and I would be back! Comfy beds and tasteful decor.

I have to give the hotel a very good rating, however, I do not appreciate being treated like I'm stupid. The night we checked in the pretty young gal said, "oh, we just ran out of queen beds." So i said, "oh does that mean we get a King bed" which is what I thought we paid for. She then said, "i'll put you on 15" and I said, "is that a better room?" She said, "its a higher floor, better views." I did not realize a higher floor meant my husband and I would be stuck in the worlds smallest full sized bed. Seriously, its a good thing we're not the tallest people. What bugs me is she looked me right in the eye and did not answer my question regarding the bed. Did she think we wouldn't notice the tiny bed? Its just poor business to lie to your customers. And by not answering my question, yes, she lied...The hotel itself is in a great location for urban travelers. We were going to a concert at the Barclay Center so the location was ideal. It was one subway stop from the the hotel to the concert. Also it was only 3 subway stops from Amtrak to the hotel. I'd say its a five minute walk to the subway from the hotel. Be prepared its mobbed on the sidewalks regardless of the time of day.Also, you are right in the middle of Chinatown, a short walk to the Village and the Lower East Side. Oh and Little Italy, but that is such a turnoff thanks to the desperate restaurant employees trying to get you to eat in their restaurants. The free WIFI is a great bonus. However, the 'free breakfast' is laughable. First of all, its not free, its worked into your price for the room. But as others noted, its not serve yourself but a sit down restaurant where your breakfast coupon really only covers the Continental breakfast yet they give you a menu to choose from. So what happens is if you order something other than the continental breakfast you have to pay the difference. That being said, if i'm paying additional for my breakfast I'll go elsewhere it was average at best...I'd rather my $10 back please. Overall its a nice hotel, very clean and new...

We just returned from a week in NYC. Our original plans were to stay in NJ and ride PATH, but Sandy wrecked the station and we had to 'punt'. We came across a new property in Chinatown, a block from Little Italy. AWESOME location (Canal & Bowery, just off the Manhattan Bridge) with two subway stations within a short walk. We arrived late (weather delays at Newark) and the staff greeted us with a very warm welcome at 1:30 AM! The hotel had arranged a car service at the airport that WAITED for our delayed flight. How wonderful it was to have a ride waiting after a long day of airport lounging & weather jitters.First off, the hospitality at the hotel was infectious. From the GM to housekeeping to front desk, everyone working there acted like it was their house and we were their guests. I don't think that's the norm in big cities. Our room (1502) was breathtaking. 15th floor, corner-room with glass walls on two sides. Front view was the Empire State Building and the Crysler Building. Side view was the Freedom Tower at the WTC site. The rooms were very nice...not huge, but certainly not small. Also VERY clean, but the hotel is only a few months old. I am betting the property stays clean and attractive for years to come. The room rate was very reasonable and did include a breakfast voucher that covered the Continental breakfast or could be applied to another choice. (REMEMBER to tip your wait crew based on the voucher totals, not your balance due.) All of the staff feels an 'ownership' for the property. They all want your visit at their place to be the best ever. Wow, that is refreshing.The security at the hotel was very visible, yet I didn't see an obvious need for it. We walked to restaurants in the neighborhoods regularly at late hours and never had an issue. Doesn't mean we would never have trouble, just didn't during the week we were there.In all, the best thing I can remember is the dedicated staff that really did make you feel at home. The hotel was fantastic, spotless and new, but even if it wasn't, the warm, friendly employees would make up the shortfall. Special thanks to James at the front, the concierge and to Tom the GM. Those are only a few of the folks that made our vacation one of the most memorable trips we've ever been on. We WILL return and WILL stay at this property - NO DOUBT!

I highly recommend the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. This is a new hotel, expectedly clean and fresh looking, but also features thoughtful design. The rooms are small, however they don’t feel cramped thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows and reasonably-sized bathroom. We slept great - despite its bustling Chinatown surroundings, the room was very quiet with a comfy bed. The staff were eager to please and helped point us in the right direction for our touring. We also loved the location. The two subway lines going to upper east and upper west are within a 5-10 minute walk. We had two fantastic meals just steps away in lower east side.

Waited 20 minutes for cold toast and a coffee refill.....don't bother with the restaurant. Free Continental breakfast is not self serve....super slow service.hotel itself is very nice...rooms were very nice clean...check in staff very nice....
user_location: Glens Falls, New York, United States

review_body: This hotel is the best hidden gem in Chinatown. We arrived early and they let us check in right away. Vanessa upgraded us to a room that gave us a wide view of the city. Great view. The concierge staff has been wonderful with advice on where to go, when to go and not to go. The best advice was to get the express pass for the Empire State Building. People had waited in line for six hours to get to the top of the Empire State Building and we did not have to wait, they take you to the front of all of the line. This hotel is must stay. We will be back.

The bellboy is so helpful. He braced the rain, trying to get us a SUV cab to another hotel on a Friday night. We could like to thank him for his great help. The front desk is also helpful and the room is very clean. The breakfast is great too. Our stay with the hotel is enjoyable and memorable.

I favor Wyndham when I travel, but the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown is the best hotel in Manhattan in an overall sense. I was one of the first to stay at this new hotel, and I have spent over 20 nights over the past 2 months.Price: The price is right! I stayed for $185 a night. Best bang for the buck in all of Manhattan. Service: The staff is amazingly pleasant. From Janice and Kim at the front desk, to Jennifer and Danna hosting the bar area. Friendly and prompt to every request and need. Location: For business and pleasure, you have access to all of NYC! I have been working in Brooklyn, Staten Island and Manhattan. The hotel is perfectly located. Having access to Chinatown and Little Italy has been nice. Walking to Soho to shop. Perfect. Rooms: Rooms are new, full of comfort, relaxing incredible HUGE views of uptown and downtown with full (wall to wall, ceiling to floor) windows.

We stayed in this lovely hotel 6 nights. It is located near the subway station and this is very helpful for sightseeing in the city. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Thanks a lot to the Front Office staff. Best regardsEgemen & Yuliya Yurek

This could not have been a better choice for a trip to NYC. The location is in great for quick ventures uptown or downtown. The hotel its self is of course in china town and is a block away from little Italy part of NY. Never did we feel un-safe coming back late at night and the food in China town and surrounding area was really good. As for the hotel: Breakfast every morning was a delight. We had vouchers which can be used towards another meal of your liking. The Egg benedicts was really good! The rooms are small but is made up for with the views and how well kept and comfortable it is. The shower is great being a walk-in and the maid service was really on spot with a paper every morning and the whole room made nice. Even the phone charger was coiled every day! As for the staff from the moment we arrived (early by the way) until we left everyone made it a wonderful experience. I could not get over how outgoing and nice the staff was. Always asking if we had a good day and what we did. Special thanks to Nadia, Kim, and Messy (SP). Truly a great hotel and would go back in a heartbeat!

Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The muppets next door used the fire hydrant as a hanger and flooded our room and we were quickly moved and ended up in a nicer room. The location is great, the price was great and despite the other reviews really enjoyed breakfast each morning.

Terrific new hotel right in a great downtown location...right on the cusp of Lower East Side, SoHo, Chinatown, etc. Very clean, well-maintained hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a hip place to stay in the city. Excellent value for this type of service.

The rooms are comfortable. The staff is well trained and nice. The only improvement I would recommend (as other reviews have already mentioned) is the quality of the breakfast. For example, the muffin was dry and not tasty. Overall, a great hotel find in New York!

A brand new hotel a stone's throw from the Manhattan Bridge at the end of Canal with lots of good things about it. Brand new, great architecture, super nice rooms with a BIG desk and small refrigerator great showers and a nice restaurant and bar. The staff are very friendly and the hotel seems to be well managed.

Ok, so this is part of a chain, but I've never stayed in one before and I'm extremely impressed with what I got. So, we're in Chinatown, which I personally like culturally-speaking..feel pretty safe there too at any time of day. The hotel is extremely good value at just over $200 per night including continental breakfast. Here are some of the things that I found on arrival:1. Iron in the room with a loose (non-attached) ironing board (= hra)2. Lots of sockets around the bed3. GREAT view4. Very clean and plenty of space5. Complimentary still and sparkling waterI had a very comfortable night's sleep; I got in late and front desk was able to give me a small tube of toothpaste = nice.In the morning, I had a very good shower..one of those showers with just the right force from the nozzle and easy to work the dial temperature-wise. Lovely. I also saw that the height between the floor and the bath is very small (I'd say 9"), which means that it isn't in any way dangerous to step in and out; found that impressive. I had a shave in a sink which was very cleverly designed - it is noticeably deep, which means that you can't really splash the water. Small details these are, but for a regular traveller, they stand out.Unfortunately, for me, I tried to cap off my stay with the breakfast in the cellar. Oh dear. No jasmine tea in the middle of Chinatown is forgivable, but the eggs were v v greasy and over-cooked; small amounts of tasteless ham and warm soft toast. I don't usually eat breakfast in the hotel, but I was so surprised by the quality of everything else, that I took the chance. Mistake.But otherwise, Wyndham Gardens, take a bow...

I recently stayed the this hotel on a business trip. Initially I was concerned that they would not meet expectations. How wrong could i have been, from check in to departure I couldn't fault the team. The rooms are well designed and spacious. The large bathroom with roomy walk in shower was fantastic. Only one small issue (its me just being picky), there was no shelf to put toiletries and other things on. Breakfast was good and enough to get me through until lunch. I will most definitely be back, in fact this hotel is where I will favour on each visit to NYC. Overall one I would highly recommend.

Found Wyndham Garden Chinatown on Priceline, good deal for a wonderful, bright, clean room with a wall of floor-to-ceiling windows. The free breakfast is a work in progress, with slow (but earnest and polite) service. All staff were helpful, pleasant, and enthusiastic. Lobby is bright, all-glass. Rooms are comfy and efficient, wonderful linens, contemporary walk-in shower.

Bottom line: if the price remains competitive, this is an amazing find as long as you don't need to stay near a specific location. Best room I ever stayed in at Manhattan for less than 270 dollars. Brand new and friendly. There was no breakfast as the hotel just reopened but I'm sure they will add it. Extremely recommended.I'm an international traveler that spends a week out of my home country each month for customer meetings and conferences. An hour before my flight from Salt Lake City to JFK I still didn't know if I'll have meetings in NYC or NJ so I kept waiting and then booked in the very last minute. I was quite surprised to see that the prices for 3 starred hotels anywhere in Manhatten were all in the high 300s and every hotel I picked was fully booked, including anything in NJ except the airports. After twenty minutes I came to the conclusion that all of the reasonably priced and starred hotels in both Manhattan and Newark area had zero vacancies, perhaps because of the recent Hurricane Sandy, and at some point I came across this hotel in Chinatown. It was 269 dollars which was about 100 to 150 lower than anything else that I saw, plus it was the first hotel out of two dozens I checked that was actually available. Bookings.com said seven people are viewing the room right now and I decided to chance it.I got there at midnight. Chinatown is a dark place at nights but the hotel was glowing with light and inviting. The staff welcomed me and the checking process was extremely fast. I was told that my room is brand new and in fact I will be the first guest ever in it. Since there was no breakfast the clerk said she'll deduct 20 dollars from my fee which I found to extremely nice.I went to the room on the eleventh floor and my jaw dropped as soon as I entered. It was beautiful. A huge bathroom, sparkling clean and nicely decorated; a lovely king side bed; amazing night skyline from a wide window, plasma TV, compact closet, well designed division between bath area and the bedroom using smoked glass and wooden tiles, powerful air conditioning and a useful desk with lots of electricity plugs for the iDevice challenged. Overall it was pretty amazing and I felt lucky.Summary: just take it.
